mfsWOhmj_LMCD2g4MPbFeA.text: I really wanted to like this place, but it just didn't wow me.  It was ok.  I would come here again if I was on the east side of town, but it certainly isn't a place I would shout about from the top of a mountain (kudos if you got the Ron Burgundy reference).  I came here with a party of 10 at 8:00 on a Saturday night.  They were able to seat us within 10 minutes, which pleasantly surprised me.  The servers were very attentive and friendly.  Their promptness was a definite plus for me.  Now let's talk sushi.  I got the all you can eat, which is only $23.95 and basically pays for itself if you order two rolls.  Nice price, and the AYCE includes appetizers and desserts, which was also surprising to me.  However, if you do not get the AYCE, you will be very dismayed by some of the a la carte selections and pricing.  For example, seaweed salad is $4.00, but it comes in a bowl about the size of a soy sauce holder.  Also, mochi ice cream is $3.00 for two tiny pieces!  For nigiri sushi, I sampled red snapper, scallop, and halibut.  Red snapper is usually my most favorite because there is usually a citrusy sauce they put on it, but alas, this red snapper was bone dry...and a little too warm for my  liking.  In fact, I felt like all of the nigiri could have been a little cooler.  For rolls, I tried the caterpillar, double salmon, deep fried mussels, and son of the beach.  I was a little disappointed with the rolls because the caterpillar and double salmon were extremely dry, and the deep fried mussels and son of the beach were way overly sauced.  There is no middle ground at Yama.  However, another plus to this place is that you can order half rolls to try and see if you will like them.  Like I said...it was OK and I would give them a try again.

_fIQZpoRGYCJ6nZl5zw21w.text: I wanted to see if all the reviews about this place were correct.. They didn't do this place justice. It was the best sushi I've had in a long time. I went for the unlimited sushi and I couldn't stop eating. It wasn't after 32 rolls that my stomach said no more and I decided to tap out

QpfoXS9e7grHq2uOzQZGNw.text: Good: The Sushi comes out amazingly fast. It comes out too fast. The baked rolls come out  in a normal amount of time, and they're baked! The No Name Roll was my favorite but there were many excellent choices. I am tempted to take off a point because the Harry Potter roll was the worst roll I had (still good!) and damn it show some respect to the Boy who Lived! Great Service.  Bad: This place is a shoebox and it's popular so you're going to wait. Also my party discovered that if you take down 15 rolls between three people the waitresses are going to talk about it. Which is probably healthy shame. Also this place gave me diabetes, but I think I am partially to blame. Also we were close enough to the table next to us to feed each other.  The Bizarre: Mounds of Sushi, Seafood Salad, Ice Cream: and I'm not full. What the hell is going on here?  Will return.

6TWHyRrX9E3_qHoDuRrBgQ.text: Food was good but service was horrible. AYCE sushi for party of 5.  Took 15 mins for our for our first order and then found out they were out of both hamachi and salmon kama (one of the reasons we chose thus place) - then it was constant follow up on nearly everything ordered - they even forgot to bring wasabe and ginger when we finally had 3 rolls on the table... took an additional 5 mins to finally get those basic sushi essentials delivered - after asking. Additionally,  never once a smile from our two sour puss waitresses who seemed unhappy to work here... created significant stress for what should have been an enjoyable experience for my daughter's birthday... completely opposite from the great service we received at island sushi last week...  anyway, upon leaving, after paying the bill and explaining to our waitress why I only left her a $10 tip on a $125 bill, I spoke with the manager - who really seemed disinterested in hearing my opinion.  Bottom line : i won't be back and cannot in good conscience recommend to others...  wow, I'm all worked up again after reliving the experience so I'm downgrading from 2 stars to 1.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_qA1WZzrpgfWW8JMZrc-Xg.text: I've tried so many sushi places here in town and this one has been by far the most superb one! Poaw the sushi dude is amazing!!! I'm a regular there so I never have to order anything. Plus they have hamachi Kama which most places only have salmon Kama if they have Kama. The house always treats me to a large sake! Super friendly service and fresh food!!!! Love love love this place!!!!!!

YEiXhSSrA9MFkVQGjtMFWw.text: Third time here and enjoyed it for the third time. Their miso soup is very tasty, their tempura shrimp is excellent, and all the sushi rolls I've tried are excellent. A very good deal for the money.

qIBpB0iVEJKMPbjpFttWkQ.text: Five stars is not enough. This is my favorite sushi place ever. But word of advice go early cause they r always packed. I wish I could eat here everyday

nOcMP2td40Ep7xEPCMW4kg.text: My favorite sushi place, love the atmosphere. The set up is kinda cosy but the tables are arranged in a way where you are able to move around and not feel so claustrophobic. It's always busy but the wait isn't so bad.  I love the variety, the apps, and the dessert. Sorry not do specific.  The wait staff are friendly too. The alcohol choices are good, I'm classic, so I stick to the standard warm sake. Sorry no pics, go there and take some.

VIlX6xz_I9fNx4skrMEd8Q.text: Never have been a fan of AYCE but this place changed my mind!  The choices of specialty rolls are amazing!    I went with a group of three people, and with a few beers and three AYCE sushis, our bill was only around 85 bucks.  And that even includes any and all appetizers, salads, typical rolls, specialty rolls AND dessert!  I was floored.  The quality of the food and the service were spot on as well.  I had heard there is sometimes a long wait, but our group was seated right away at 6:45pm on a Saturday night, that's pretty good.  If you go later than this, expect a long wait.  But I can confirm,  it's totally worth it.  Recommended rolls:  No Name was the BOMB, Yama Crunch was super tasty...they were by far my favorites.  I also enjoyed the Harry Potter and the Happy Ending.  The Firecracker was OK.  You can even order half rolls which I love!  Allows you to try so many things.  The seafood salad was fresh and lots of spice!  Edamame and tempura were as you would expect them to be, but nothing spectacular.  For dessert, try the mochi ice cream...soo good!  Chocolate and mango were my faves.  Mmmm, craving sushi now.

MviW-sf3l4D-l2xc-p7Biw.text: The price here was $23 for all you can eat sushi, which is a great deal...compared to sushimon which is nearly $30 for dinner. The selection is decent, but the fish is not as fresh and the rice is large and not really "sushi" rice. However, I did enjoy the seafood salad, which is a large bowl of sashimi limit one per person. The sushi chef Jun was very friendly.  The only reason I rate it a 3 star is for the stingy service. I was working on my last 4 piece order when I asked for the check. The server refused to return my credit card until I finish all 4 pieces due to the "left over surcharge policy".

73JynaytuV4zpChKraOpFA.text: This is the best AYCE joint I've eaten at.  Fish quality may not be up to par with the best sushi places in town, but as far as AYCE goes, this place can't be beat.    Nigiri is delicious.  Good quality fish, nice cuts, and perfect rice.  Also, love their rolls: Harry Potter, No Name, most everything on the menu for that matter!  Only downside to this spot is that they do not accept reservations.  I've waited as long as an hour at peak times to get seated, which would be ridiculous if this weren't so good.

q-wCeWWRKCXWPNvVJUxQjQ.text: The best Sushi Restaurant I've been to yet all the way around. The staff, quality of food and service are top notch! I've tried many different All-You-Can-Eat Sushi Bars and so far I have not been able to find another that's remotely comparable!

gUVL4YxVL01YztnTAkF34w.text: Yamaaaaaa is the best buffet in Vegas. Better than Wynn, Bellagio, better than anything on the stripppp!  Every time I'm in Vegas (which mind you was A LOT), I go out of my way to find this little restaurant off of Flamingo. It's a spot for locals, not tourists, but I don't care. Amazing AYCE sushi at a reasonable price? Count me in!   I live in LA and nothing even begins to come close in terms of quality and price. This place is legit. I hate waiting in lines but I'm willing to wait an hour and a half/two hours for a table.   Sushi does take a while to make, so order appetizers to keep you busy. I carb load here before every Vegas Marathon and it does not disappoint.   I took my friend here for the first time and he almost wept by how great it was (and I know it wasn't from the wasabi!).

hwWbhfLMbKbkGo-ojuJ2gQ.text: This is our favorite sushi place close to home. We make a trip at least once a month, if not more. The price is great for all you can eat. For the two of us it came out to about $53 for two people. I know it's a little less for lunch.  The service is great. Even at their very busiest, we were still attended quite regularly. Our glasses are never empty! The only downer to this place might be how cramped it can be. This is not the place to be if you are trying to have a private conversation with someone no matter how low you try to speak! lol! Also, be careful of the slippery floors! While walking in to our table or leaving there was many a day when my feet slid! I didn't know this place doubled as a skating rink! lol! It is quite crowded during peak meal times so we try to go when it is off-peak.   The food is fantastic! The presentation is very nice. The tables are small so we try and order about two or three dishes at a time. Usually when one comes out we can chow down on it while waiting for the others to come to free up some space. The restaurant isn't so fancily decorated, but who cares, I came for the food! A big plus is being able to order half rolls. You know what that means? You can try a lot more of the great sushi! I must have been born a bear in a past life because I cannot get enough of the salmon! A must-have for the bf is the Palm Job. It is so delish! It has spicy crab in a soy paper wrap. I don't like spicy foods, however, I do steal a bite or two of this!

w_rQrp09IA5xOXGV07lVig.text: This place is my favorite place to go to for AYCE sushi, $23 now that's a deal!   This restaurant is a bit small and there's always a wait but it's worth it. I would recommend to order the seafood salad, it's a good portion too not like other sushi restaurants. You can also order half rolls which is a plus and you can order as much mochi as you want but their mochis are a bit hard so u have to wait a while for it to soften up.   This place is definitely more bang for your buck so try this place out :)

Av1utRaZn2Lb6UO4ez7zug.text: My favorite AYCE sushi in Vegas! My brother and i Yelped a close one from my Aunt's and stumbled upon this one. Their sushi/sashimi are always fresh. They make really decent ones and i'm always stuffed after. I'm almost always here whenever i'm in Vegas.

wSY6_WWQYwT6ml49qPxQ7w.text: Yama is the best place to go for All You Can Eat sushi in Vegas!  Don't let the fact that it's located off the Strip, pretty much in the ghetto scare you away.  Once inside, you too will become a fan!    When they say all you can eat, they fucking mean it!  Anything, and I mean anything (as many as you want) can be ordered.  Any of their combo rolls, specialty rolls, individual sushi, appetizers, dessert...let me repeat myself everything on the menu is fair game.  You've got to try the green mussels and soft shell crab.  They don't give you a shitload of rice with tiny pieces of fish like most AYCE.  It also doesn't fall apart or look like something some illegal Mexican rolled.  These Japanese sushi chefs (a rare find for Vegas) are making each item a work of (edible) art.   I've actually ordered so much food (on several occasions) that I thought I would get kicked out of the place.  I've made the mistake of checking off too many items when I first sit down that midway through my meal, I pray that no more is coming.  Whenever I've taken friends here, I put in the first order and they are shocked at how many items arrive on our table.  They too can't believe that we aren't eventually cut off or asked to leave.  There's no dead fish smell when you walk in the door which is a sign that one should turn around and seek their sushi elsewhere.  You can go down the street and eat at Hamada where you will pay much more and get much less.  That place is a tourist trap in a prime location where Yama is a local's joint.  What's funny (or sad really) is I'm back up in Seattle now...where we get a lot of fresh seafood.  I still haven't found a sushi joint that can compare to Yama.  It's pretty ironic that I've eaten better sushi in the desert than I have up here on the west coast.  Whenever Morimoto comes to Vegas, I take him here and he is pleased.  :)

b0qKKYEWNQ9nj_KIl0-22A.text: This place is very small and cramped but LOVE the food and the all you can eat sushi. I've been here more than a dozen times and have never been disappointed. Service is great and so is the food. If you are looking for great sushi and not ambience, this place is perfect.

qMxBwA4SSd6_bPR3Zy6HVw.text: Love this place. Great variety of sushi and sashimi rolls, prices are very reasonable. They also have all you can eat for $25 so you can try a variety of things. The names of the rolls are humorous, they have the traditional sushi and sashimi but they also provide you with a great variety of specialty and custom made rolls.  Food is always fresh and quickly delivered,  however service could be a bit friendlier and more personable.

4Sq1bN-qIvJXlBPnoZ6uOQ.text: I don't understand how anyone can give a bad review of this place. I guess when folks are in Vegas they expect showgirls and lavish luxury.  Well what this place lacks in luxurious frivolity,  it more than makes up for in fast service, awesome food, and great prices (23.95 for all you can eat sushi)...I'll absolutely be back!!!

AxFOc5ADb2ETsB8HPQqcKQ.text: Yelp... And "Yelpers", you didn't let me down on this suggestion.  As we were watching the show at Fremont Street (ok, kinda cheesy, but I had a Vegas newbie with me), we decided on sushi for dinner.  Many many places on and off the strip to choose from, but we were hungry! Love Nobu and all, but we wanted to do some serious eating.  Read the reviews, so we chose Yama.  Close enough to both the "Strip" AND downtown Plenty of parking  Crowded, but we were seated right away "All you can eat" is pretty simple: $20.?? for lunch, $23.?? for dinner Make sure you eat everything (no leaving rice from the nigiri), and no leftovers, and this will be truly all-u-can-eat! Fresh tasting assorted rolls, nigiri, noodles... All were excellent! Our favorite was the Spicy Sexy Roll. Soooo spicy AND flavorful!  Awesome named rolls, awesome service, and incredibly tasty sushi.  I am still amazed at the quality.  My new go to place in Vegas.  Thanks Yama!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Sexy with a rainbow on the side. Oh ya!

00iPO0g3nQkyOCo_KJzynw.text: Tbh I was really disappointed. I usually go to Sakana across the street but decided to switch it up. I had some nigiri to start off which was not terrible but not overly remarkable. The Harry Potter roll was great but the volcano roll was terrible. The roll itself was eh but the baked fish on top was what killed it for me. There was more baked salmon on top than there was roll and it was dry. Somehow I are enough of it to not be charged for uneaten food and has some chocolate ice cream which was pretty good. So I guess just stay away from the baked rolls and you'll have an average sushi place.

EWfP-b2r-K8wZDgy5v9W5w.text: This is twice I been here and the service always on point. I don't know wait at all and asked me if want the bar or table, said Table. They sat me in in the middle of room but at least I had room for the plates I order. It's always the Hawaiian Roll, cucumber salad, Gyoza (steam), asparagus tuna roll and nigiri: Garlic Tuna, White tuna and Tuna plus once in a while House Salad. Great price for AYCE at $23.95 for dinner.

1KHEWtrQCyAZo9tf8ORaCA.text: Good place to eat All-You-Can-Eat. Very cheap as well. Service is alright but let me tell you. The sushi is amazing.

g0bTu39ypJDDRA4u1_ASqQ.text: Boy, oh boy. Newly renovated, same service, same menu, and still delish.  Decided to hit up Yama Sushi with my co-workers cause we found out that they've renovated it.   Post renovation: - there's an actual waiting area - decor flows well throughout the restaurant - new menu design - more elbow room  I never order rolls. I usually eat off other people's rolls. I'm all for appetizers and nigiris. There is one dish that you must have when you're at Yama. Seafood Salad either mild or spicy. It used to come as a bigger portion but it has gotten smaller. Probably because it's part of AYCE?  Just like my previous review, they don't take reservations. But when I got there, there was no wait. This was a Saturday afternoon at 2 p.m.  Yama never disappoints me.

PA5hnTuAS2nNj1Q5dQwnTQ.text: Love love love this place.  I go here every chance I get with my daughter for a mother daughter lunch date.  The staff is super friendly and the food is completely awesome and irresistible.

sqp_HmVgnX1P9O-A5cP0uQ.text: If I could rate 0 I would, service sucks big time! How many times our waiter passed by not even acknowledging if we wanted to order anything else. Waiter has a bad attitude, filipino looking chick, I ask if they had a particular item another location had and straight look at me and said "no" like   I was stupid or something. We only got 1 refill of water. Food wait was tooo long! We order a "spicy ahi" the fish tasted spoiled! I've had better grade A tuna at other AYCE

UBLzlgsvRVEyeDHXKAVT0w.text: Love this place!!! Full menu lunch for only $22.00 ALL YOU CAN EAT! No restrictions. I can finally enjoy sushi without worrying about breaking the bank. This place is always busy and they get your order our fast. Staff is always friendly and did I mention FRESH best describes the fish. No Nigiri limit and the Son of the Beach is in my opinion a must try.  Enjoy

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eel Nigiri! YUM!
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nigiri!
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bxYz7eofGK7sp9aq3dj73A.text: Very sad day. I've been coming to Yama for years and it has always been my favorite sushi place in Vegas. However, today I went in for lunch, placed 9 orders between my girlfriend and I and every single order came to us incorrect. Half rolls came in whole size, whole rolls came in half, creamy salad came spicy, 3 orders came as 2, and some orders never even came. Not only that but the 2 parties next to us at the bar also got nearly every order delivered incorrectly.

kFxJrYJkEazQK5xVtU-CFA.text: Looking for a place to eat sushi? Tired of always going to Sushi Mon? Well, here is your next pick; Yama Sushi. This place will give you all you can eat... AND THEN some.  All you can eat: Lunch (11 A.M. - 3 P.M.) - $20.95 Dinner (3 P.M. - 11 P.M.) - $23.95  What I've noticed is that the menu items priced individually, are actually overpriced by 2-3x per dish. For example, A garlic tuna would normally cost about $2.75 here in Hawaii while they are charging $5.50. By looking at the individual item prices, you may basically be forced into getting All You Can Eat to get the best bang for your buck.  So now that you have been convinced to get the All You Can Eat, what exactly do you WANT to eat? These are my top 5. 1. Seafood Salad 2. Soft Shell Crab 3. Ikura 4. Eel (unagi) 5. Deep Fried Mussel  I suggest you AVOID the uni. As our uni was probably very old (to the point it was brown instead of orange). The texture was also described as "rubbery" by our fellow uni expert. Then, when I decided to try one, it had absolutely no flavor, just rice and stale nori.  The service was good, but the speed was horrible. Food was coming out of order and not to the individual people who ordered it. We left before a few of our dishes even made it to our table (which we ordered an hour ago). It seems that the kitchen is rather very disorganized or just tremendously slow. It is very possible that you will eat until you are full, then you get bombarded by plates you ordered last year. Buyer BEWARE!  There are a lot of good things on this menu. The fish, considering it needed to cross a desert to get here, is not bad. Would I come again? Maybe, but not likely.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old uni

HnnxA6ZjOXILY7YSlQ5SEw.text: Overall pretty mediocre. Whoever says this is the best AYCE sushi in Vegas is either ignorant to what decent sushi is, or just eats basic ass rolls with basic ingredients. I went here super hungry after not eating all day until 5pm and still everything was mediocre. Their seaweed they used to make their nigiri was super soggy and chewy as soon as it hit our table.   Ikura was really salty and fishy aka not fresh Hamachi was not fresh, had a sour aftertaste to it Uni was low quality and had that ocean animal dookie aftertaste to it. Amaebi had a shitload of overpowering sauce on it, hiding the mediocre flavor. Tuna poki had way too much sauce on it. The best thing I ate here was the shrimp tempura and the hamachi kama.  My first time EVER not ordering two rounds of nigiri because I was so disappointed in the quality. For 2 more bucks you can get MUCH higher quality ayce sushi at Sushi Goyemon or Sushi twister.. Sushi twister on Boulder Hwy is still the best in my opinion and worth the drive.

dxks0370Merw0LShB982uQ.text: This place is amazing .  There's always fast customer service and the food is amazing from a variety of everything . The vibes there are dope because the servers have a cool vibe so the restaraunt mood is very comfortable . I would say it's one of the top sushi restaurants in Las Vegas . If you stop by make sure to get the mango Mochi ice cream for dessert before you head out it's .

JJjiMr_a3JyhOQZcnBDlSg.text: I would rather go to somewhere else. The poke tuna salad was really sour, too much sauce and portion is good for 2  to 3 people. So I ended up wasting half of it. No miso soup no kimchi no kimchi fried rice no jabchae. And the ice cream wasn't that delicious.

ts-26KGaB1JbhX_8W5m26A.text: Great AYCE sushi place that is close to the Strip. Yama has great selection of rolls, nigiri, hand rolls, specialty rolls, side dishes, you name it!  The price really can't be beat; only $23.95 for dinner and $20.95 for lunch! That's right folks, pretty sweet deal alert here!  Came here on a Friday evening around 630PM and the wait was.. horrible. Really bad. We ended up waiting about 50 minutes for a table for 3. Just be prepared.. really prepared. If you have a big party, they do take reservations so call in advance! The restaurant is very small and cramped but once you sit down, just sit back and prepare your stomachs.   The names of the specialty rolls are super full and suggestive. Some of our favorite rolls of the night included Sun on the Beach, Who's Your Daddy, Happy Endings and well, you get it. Very amusing names and there are just soooo many different rolls to choose from. TIP: You can get half rolls if you and your table just want to try a roll and see how you like it! Nigiri was also tasty and each order comes with 2 pieces.   The sides are also plentiful and delicious. I really enjoyed the agedashi tofu and the tempura was really fresh and crispy! Our table also shared the BBQ ribs (kalbi) and gyoza which were good as well.   Dessert was a choice of ice cream (green tea, red bean, etc) and mochi ice cream (vanilla, strawberry, mango and chocolate)!  All in all, great meal for a wonderful price. Everything was good quality and seriously, the price can't be beat for Vegas AYCE sushi!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special Yobo Roll
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

neCGbAM-bBKozmj4vjXaNw.text: Food was descent, sushi is not as fresh as the business claims it out to be. The rice was too sticky and it seemed as if they had the food sitting out for a while.  Freshness: out of a ten rating I'll have to give it a maybe 4/ the rice was not the business and the fish felt tough.  Service: they are friendly, fast and they make sure that you have everything that you need.  Overall rating I'm going to give it a 3  *Visiting Vegas for the weekend*

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

srkHt6zlpNIJh24N_Y0yCQ.text: Sat at the bar, it was very busy on a Sunday night. "Evil Man" was our sushi chef.  Let's start with the nigiri I ordered Tako, Masago and Masago with Quail egg. The Rice to fish ratio was okay. The Tako was wet and I'm not used to that so I wasn't a fan. But that's not a big deal. I then ordered my old usual favorite ( used to come here all the time but hadn't been back in a long time because I moved far away) the Yama Crunch roll, it isn't as good as I remembered but that's because my taste had changed over time it was too sweet for me but still yummy. I also ordered the DAM!! Harry which was DELICIOUS! So delicious I forgot to take a picture of it. I also ordered the man whore which was really good!! Perfect balance of sweet and hot.  I highly recommend those rolls.  My friend loves the Harry Potter roll and ordered two of them when we were there.  The service was fast even though it was packed! Never had empty water or tea. Ever.   Love this place and I highly recommend it. Just make sure you go earlier than you plan on eating on a Sunday night it was a 30 min wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yama crunch! It&#39;s sweet and crunchy.
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The man whore! Awesome!

IXv0MGAdnP2hQf1fS6Okjg.text: Food is OK.  They do not have silverware they give you the cheapest of cheap plastic ware

it6WHvKqdPTR5DM8GDnAfg.text: I am a big fan of sushi, and this has to be my favorite sushi place of all time. In terms of quality, it is beat by places like Morimoto or the other high end sushi restaurants. However, the value (with their all you can eat system) is unparalleled. Just remember that they won't let you "cheat" the system. Finish your roll before ordering another, eat everything on the plate, and eat what YOU order, don't share everything amount he table. It seems strict, but given the quality and value it's the only way they can still make a profit on this system. Also, for those of you worried about sanitation, I am a student at the Culinary Institute of America, and I've been thoroughly trained on proper food handling and storage. Based on what I've seen, they have impeccable safe food handling. And the fish is definitely quality (if Morimoto is an A+, and gas station is an F, I'd give this a B+

T_K-nQt5SJLdtw-w5ZI7cg.text: This is mainly for the service because I love the sushi but the family and I went out for lunch at yama and it wasn't really busy but we got sat in the little side glass room and we got our drink order and the first orders of our food and it was great then after that maybe 10  15  min went by and no one came by to see how everything was or to refill our drinks or anything oh yea but they did walk by and acted like we weren't there so me and my wife being in the same industry we sat there for another 10 minutes an this time I actually timed it and finally I got irritated and went up to the cashier and still kindly asked for a manager but the lady insisted on trying to fix it but after waiting almost 45vminwe just wanted to go oh yea they gave us 2 pink yama mugs I guess that's there way of trying to fix things and still gave us our 72 dollar check like I said I'm in the same industry and I hate complaining and doing things like this but this is more for the  business and the management just to let u know and we probably won't return to that location

Cedd7wstC2B0yODwTxaxEg.text: So so good !! Good service . At times it can be busy but it's worth the wait!!  Try the seafood salad and sun of a beach.. and there are so many others too... so delicious yum yum

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum yum this is the best place ever!!  Try the seafood salad!! And sun of a beach!!  And so many others!!

SI1OQvGtdBGMRgzIbSAKnA.text: I love the AYCE sushi here.  The rolls are amazing and the portion size is perfect. You can actually order half the roll if you don't feel like eating the whole roll.   (I do recommend if you order rolls that require to be baked do it early so you won't have to wait as long).   My favorite special rolls: Strip tease and Superman.   They also have it so you can order just the rolls only if you want to just get your fix of sushi.  Definitely coming back.

DV14mAhHghN76oLJqD5nXw.text: At a loss at how this place is possibly one of the highest rated sushi restaurants in Vegas.    Let me first say that service was prompt, we were seated quickly at the bar, and I generally liked the sushi chef for his attentiveness.  The only thing that we enjoyed was the sashimi salad recommended by the chef.  The presentation was a train wreck, but the flavors were spot on and had a great amount of spice and kick to it.  Edamame was decent too.  Now for the rest of the night...  Our miso soups tasted...odd.  The tofu took on a rancid taste and the texture melted in your mouth (not in a good way).  Nigiri after nigiri seemed very dried out and no amount of soy sauce could lather up the texture.  Honestly, I've had better raw fish at conveyor belt sushi restaurants.  The chef recommended two different sushi rolls with one of them being the no name roll.  Anything that was put in the roll was completely overpowered with a sauce that looked and tasted like creamy tostitos salsa.  A very disappointing dish that is supposedly a favorite there that was also recommended by the chef.  We finished with mochi which was nothing that really stood out to me.    I don't see the hype and it's astounding to me they are as popular as they are.

Fb91biH6cHVEyCgvJiD29Q.text: Yama Sushi is my favorite all you can eat sushi place. I have been going to this place for years! The staff is great and the service is fast! My favorite here is their seafood salad and strip tease.

8mOV02L6dffUNahNCOqolA.text: I loved it!! Love the names of the sushi rolls and plates!! One of the best sushis I've had in a while!! Certainly coming back here when we are in Vegas!! Sushi came out pretty fast! We had a wet dream, who's your daddy, and fire crackers which are jalapenos filled with cream cheese and lobster... && we also had a man whore they were all pretty good, but the Wet dream was just a perfect combination. So delicious... Oh water tastes like toilet water lol

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Those are the fire cracker jalapeños stuffed with lobster and cream cheese
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wet dream!! Shrimp on top nice and fresh! And filled with goodies inside! I love cream cheese and this plate here just was perfect

h_kY2wKodxSdYuV2cFEJ3Q.text: Awesome... wait time for your order at AYCE is less than a minute. Very fresh and innovative rolls.

cZP3pWZ7TjaVehjP4dXGVw.text: The best thing about this place? UNLIMITED UNI. I would be happy about that even if the uni was bad.  Luckily, for sea urchin lovers, the uni is NOT bad.  It is mediocre, maybe even a little better than mediocre. YAY!  But really. That's the only good thing.   First and foremost, I am very considerate when it comes to any kind of AYCE restaurants.  I lower my standards and appreciate the fact that I get to stuff myself 'til I loathe myself. Especially at a low lunch price for $21! What. Uni, too? WHAT.  SERVICE Eh. Friendly at first but that started to dwindle as they were obviously getting annoyed of us.  We had a party of 8, so why is it bad that we start with 40-50 pieces of sushi?  Yeah, I read your rules.  (BTW you have to order with your server; they do not have a sushi list. Inconvenient, especially for AYCE) And if you're going to put in our order a little at a time "for" us, then at least let us know. Jeeeeez.   FISH QUALITY Not there. Period. The tuna was almost brown. What da... Oh and the sushi rice? So bland. Fish to rice ratio? Idk but more rice than fish for sure.   Actually, I did like another thing. The menu has a huge variety and you even get free dessert (1 per person) But no green tea mochi ice cream? Weird.  This place isn't bad if you really want to just get sushi-wasted; just don't come with a big group, expecting good food.

50SzrVEjRimd6CeGTtC0cw.text: $20 lunch & $24 dinner for AYCE sushi, best deal around!  If you're in Vegas and feel like veering off the strip for some good food, stop by Yama.  You'll find a variety of specialty rolls (dragon rolls, salmon rolls, etc) to choose from along with a good selection of nigiri sushi.  Order anything off the menu, but be sure to finish it or else you'll be charged a la carte for each order left unfinished.  Make room for the ice cream or mocha at the end also!  Tips: Everyone in the group must purchase AYCE in order to get the deal. Order a little at a time (you'll see this on the menu). You can share with the group if you're all getting AYCE. Rice is super filling, so is cream cheese!

Bzh6kNmKmhP9qacSB84XZw.text: Came here once with two other people, and it was good.  Came here this week with a party of 7 and it was horrible. Waitress was rude and hardly came to check on us. She kept bringing us the wrong food. She kept asking if my five year old daughter was going to eat sushi buffet and I said no, then she just walked away. I had to ASK for a kids menu. She would ask what we wanted to eat from way across the table.. and say "I can't hear you.." That's because you're really far away girl! She was so rude, I won't go back ever, there's a lot of sushi buffets in Vegas--trust me you can get better service. We weren't told this but the gratuity was already added on. Forgot to mention the rolls use a lot of rice...

2dxzyBzAjDg_gI8gEx3-XQ.text: My cousin took me here when I visited in Vegas. We had so much fun. It was such amazing food. They were fast, friendly, and cheap (the best part)!!

hROen14_sqsKEPtiLoIznQ.text: Have to give them 5 stars! Awesome food and great service. Amazing find!   They have some fantastic rolls - No name, Sun of beach, and the spicy Ellen roll were my favorites.   The green mussel was great and ended up too full to try the seafood salad which everyone raves about.

im-FwrfNuYwbWykm1x48wg.text: I love this restaurant, BEST SUSHI in town. Let me tell you I cannot eat sushi. If it's from Yama sushi then NO PROBLEM. Very fresh, casual, and great customer service.

gW0EMoHDaEanUd7839YemQ.text: Wow, a surprise.  I was flying from Orlando to San Jose, with a layover in Las Vegas. I get to Las Vegas, only to find out I had a 3 hour flight delay.  It was about 8:00pm, so not much available in the airport, and I was hungry for sushi.  Looked it up on Yelp, and found Yama Sushi. Grabbed a cab, and off I went.  Wasn't terribly impressed with the location when I got out, but I was committed. I went in, and it was like a locals party going on.  There were only about 3 spots open at the bar, so I grabbed one. Everyone in the place seemed to be a local, and they were extremely friendly, giving their ideas about what was best.  It isn't really clear when you first look at the menu, but it is all-you-can-eat for $23 (with a 2 hour time limit). However, they aren't like most all-you-can-eat sushi joints...here, each roll is hand made to your specs.  There were 8 guys behind the bar, and they were working at light-speed.  The food was great, beer was cold, and you definitely don't leave hungry. I didn't have a single thing that evening that wasn't excellent.  I will definitely be back.  Spencer

tiOvciEIki69272-lVWW1w.text: This is the best all you can eat sushi I have ever had. The price was great and the sushi is high quality. Loved it here!

Kh2eOua6joP9DyPNkb-tmg.text: Best sushi place in Vegas...Hands down!!!! I've tried a few places in the vegas area, but nothing even comes close to the greatness served here...aside from the tight eating area, and large crowd of people waiting for tables, because of the small location, the food served here and the service is well worth every minute!!!

fYoz2uceGF69jChrWrAh_Q.text: Sadly because of heartless actions I will not return.  I ordered AYCE, had an new item to me soft shell crab, I had a mild reaction had to use the restroom, it was unavailable.  Told them I had to use the restroom had 2 items out, placed a $10 tip for a just in case for 33.00 roughly.  Went to find a restroom, the next ones were being used.  I found a restroom at Albertson.  Went back still not feeling well.  Received a phone  call from my wife, having a health crisis.  I handed them a 20 then left 53.00 for lunch.

RuMV5Ahz0TMyvLa1hzzKtg.text: Was looking for sushi place and my cousins recommended me this place. Was busy so to think a good place to eat sushi. Staff was nice but I didn't see any Japanese chef..so I had my second thought but yet we ended up there bc according to my cousins, they have good sushi . I ordered 2 kinds of rolls. As I was reading the menu it says there " there's an extra charge if there's left over"... Was excited bc I can eat sushi again yay...but to my dismay, the rice was mushy...I tried my second order of sushi, the rice still taste the same...rice was mushy ....so I told my friend who was with me that they don't know how to make sushi..Thought they have a good sushi since just move here from Hawaii...

8Qly7YJRejmKkoobzEga6A.text: THE best place for sushi in Las Vegas. This is the only place me and my boyfriend go. Their all you can eat is AMAZING! Staff is great and it's always very clean.

5H-Q2sNs8WhtV8vVojmsnQ.text: Terrible. I have no idea why they r so overrated. They will serve previously opened bottles of soju - be careful and watch them open the bottle in front of u if u still decide to visit here even after many of us have warned U.

W_plBXUOth1Uy7CIxWplfA.text: Love the place I gave it 4 stars because you have long waits. but besides that the food is great and the chefs are supers nice...

orPfhJFEpMIweA8zt0YC8w.text: This normally never happens when I go to a sushi bar and give a bad review but it happened this time. If you live in las vegas or an in state disregard this because it just might be your normal but I'm from California San Diego and this sushi just doesn't meet the standards. I couldn't even tell u what is wrong other then the fact that the sushi didn't taste right. It was oddly sweet and fishy which I just didn't like. No matter then roll if it had actually fish in or on it would always taste like that. I'm sad to say I have to give this place 2 stars for quality of food.

i4_dQFyg43Hrc-uhuzX5WA.text: If you have a large appetite, the AYCE option is definitely worth it, as long as you plan well and not wasting food. This is the most generous AYCE sushi place that I've ever experienced. You can order anything on the menu, including all the specialty sushi, appetizers, and dessert. We arrived at the restaurant right at the time of the opening for brunch. It is so popular that the dining room just got filled up quickly, and a long line was formed. The service was very fast and friendly. We first ordered 4 specialty full sushi, 2 specialty single order sushi and the soft shelled crab. We should have ordered half order since the full order sushi filled us up pretty quickly. There are almost 10 pieces per order. We then ordered sweet shrimp (very interesting half tempura shrimp head and raw seasoned tail), seafood salad (which is full of various fish and vegetables) and another uni sushi (my wife liked it). They are all flavorful and tasty! By this time, we filled up our stomach, and saved some room for mochi mango dessert - very delicious and not too sweet. Altogether the meal would have been almost $80's, but we paid about half of it (excluding tips). I'll make sure to revisit on my next trip to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu Page 2
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu Page 1
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby One More Time

jvK6ebvGfxVIvaqNfZDJeg.text: I usually come here several times a month and even though there is usually a long wait to be seated, the food is worth it. The service here is usually great but this time around we had a really rude waitress who kept arguing with us about what we wanted to order, even though we all got the all you can eat special.   Every other time I have been here, every  one has been very friendly and the chefs sometimes even whip up their own specials right in front of you so you can try something different that is not on the menu. One of my favorite rolls in the no name. For the longest time, they didn't even have it on the menu and it was a "special order" off the menu item but since it became so popular, I guess they decided to add it.   For the price, the all you can eat is definitely worth it. Just wish they had a punch card like some of the other all you can eat sushi places.

aHO18_37NNFBfIp1avVN4A.text: Yeah, Yama Sushi truly deserves the four stars. Other than not having special fish like super white tuna (which is served at Sushi Mon), Yama Sushi has pretty some exotic fish that you might fancy. I do especially enjoy the quaint atmosphere and the super nice service from Stella.   If you are on the eastside, then go ahead, give Yama Sushi a try. I know I will come back for sure.

DU2O1wObAVQxyco3zNGCYg.text: WE CRAVE YAMA!!! I am actually so hung up on Yama that I am tempted to drive from California to Vegas just to get my fix. I can't find anywhere else like it since moving back from Japan almost two years ago. We visit my in-laws in Vegas and every time we do, we have to have sushi from Yama.   Where do I start, the food is fresh, the staff is prompt and the menu is exciting and hilariously perverted!! It can get a little crowded, but a crowd won't hold me back from getting my Yama grub on!!!   Me love Yama long time!

8VQBPdsnUe8QN29vQDeXDw.text: So I have been here before but now as Yama sushi has become so popular and big the sushi has 2x more rice than before and less fish, also the service has dropped to something impermissible, on too of the fact that they recently got a B- Health Inspection rating for 16 violations most of them being the fish not being kept at proper temperatures. Go somewhere else, or just make sure you get good service.

n5V-t7NMzWEMl90fF_jQWA.text: I called to check the wait time the lady who answered said there was no line and no wait time.. she also wouldn't take my name... 10 minutes late I show up and there is a 40 minute wait time ... I told her she told me there was no wait time just ten minutes prior and the guy who was behind me said "she told us the same thing" thanks for wasting our time and messing up our sushi date. At least be honest !

qItnZKxH8Lpfur-2j0a59g.text: This was my first time to Yama Susi and I must say I'm now hooked on this place. The names of the sushi was a funny to say the least "Manwhore" for instance it was soooooo amazing. The staff was funny and coloful just like the menu and the place was clean always a plus in my book. If you want sushi at a good price and wonderful in taste give Yama a try.!

t1pSZeRXl7yG9UMAIIVCMA.text: Headed here after staying at the M resort. Was really hungry after gambling and some drinks. This place has so much to chose from on the ayce option. Didn't know you ca order half rolls.. Until half way into eating. To maximize trying more rolls ask for 1/2 rolls. The unagi hand roll was delish. We tried the uni for first time... And probably last time too. It's not something I'd get again. But service was quick and servers were attentive to get us more food. Too bad they ran out of hamachi Kama... Due to a mayweather fight the day fight they ran OUT!??  Next time they should prepare more food in advance if they know they might run out. But overall good food service and full tummy! :)

UkmDVA36A4Z1qoyh7bkvSQ.text: When I think of Sushi Buffet, it never occurs to me its a nice one.  It just brings memories of Fuji's in Davis, Sushi Pier in Reno, etc.  This is nothing new in looks, but they do put up a good reputation and offers more things with certain limits to the customers.   It's a small stretch on the take of sushi restaurants, but its good to know that this exists here.  Otherwise, I'd say its skippable, especially if you're not a sushi fan.    The fish here isn't the freshest, but which AYCEs are I dare ask.  They do offer scallops, big clams, mussels, uni, ikura, and other stuff where other AYCEs may not, which is a highlight, but don't expect the fresh kind for either.  Out of our uni stash, which you're only allowed to have one order per person, 2 looked so suspect it was impossible to imagine eating it.  Other than that, the pieces were tiny with maybe 2-3 slabs of uni on each nigiri piece.    What I liked about the place was our server which was so helpful in pacing us and also making sure we got our orders into the kitchen/bar like the Uni and several others.  We were definitely on a mission , and she was ready to assist.    However, with the rice rules like so many other places (Reno) its hard to enjoy when all you really want is straight sashimi.  And for $21 its not bad for lunch here.  It's a bit away from the strip, but close enough where its a $15 cab ride vs god knows how long to get to Sushi Mon.    But would I ever come back...Probably not.

7C3fzL3W_aOyehQh9iXyOA.text: The white tuna was really good while the spicy seafood salad, hamachi and salmon were stringy... :-(  Service was prompt but waitresses were cold and impatient. Was def not worth 20% tip but we re on vacay so wth...  Lunch Total for 2 tax and tips included was $55   Prolly will try another ayce sushi instead next time when we want such.  9/14-13 Was here yesterday and decided to try Umiya today... And I'm soooo glad I did!  Umiya is by far sooooo much better than Yama!  Seating is way more comfy.  Decor is nicer.  Food is  def better.  And service is much much much much better! Yama should really step up to their game or its goodbye Yama real soon.

mkR3UfVoOLHWCTRoU-3PLQ.text: I find the the art of making sushi rolls is lost of the chefs that work here.  The first example is the how overcooked the rice is.  It's like going to an Italian place and it not being al dente.  It's inexcusable.  Maybe management should at least get one good Japanese sushis chefs to run the Mexican worker line of sushi chefs, because it seems they can make what looks like sushi but can't deliver on the essential elements that separates sushi from just being rice, fish and seaweed.   Their all you could eat deal would be fantastic if you felt like eating the sushi.  Yuck!   Many of the reviewers must be from Las Vegas and have no idea what fresh fish or good sushi is supposed to be. Fail!   Everyone was nice and friendly or i would have rated this place a 1 star.

pW1YAn03J0C-5Ybvtj6rrA.text: THE PLACE IN VEGAS FOR AYCE SUSHI!  I've tried many AYCE sushi places throughout the years and this place is the best!  We come here often and have been doing more so ever since we moved here.  Let me start by saying I'm not a die hard sashimi eater and I love the generic, americanized sushi rolls...meaning, I like the fusion rolls, fried, with spicy mayo and sweet sauce; so this place is perfect for me.  First of all, there a tremendous selection of high quality rolls, that beats other places. My friend and I tried to figure out what makes this place so good, and we think it's a combination of the fresh fish and the different sauces and the way the chefs prepare the rolls.    Order what you can eat, because they will charge you for excess!  Rolls not to miss are the Sun of the Beach, No Name, and Wet Dream!  Sun of the Beach is one of the best rolls I've ever had!   The seafood salad is big and plentiful and the yellowtail collar is awesome!  Those two dishes alone would cost you over $20 at any sushi joint.  There is a roll not currently on the menu and they named it after the manager.  It combines a sort of salsa sauce and has a little kick to it!  If you get it, you won't be disappointed.  Top it off with your favorite mochi for dessert and I've yet not left that place feeling like I need to be rolled out!    I Love Yama Sushi!

u7T6ZSm7mv4BRCy1L4_dUQ.text: Amazing sushi!! The seating can be a little tight, but the service and the food is well worth it. The all you can eat sushi is about $20. Just order about 2-3 rolls and you already have your money's worth.

fpbJztTqO6LtvNZiA-dsjw.text: My best friend and I were hungry, and before going back to LA we wanted something yummy. This restaurant isn't bad, but I have had some better sushi before. They had quite a few different types of rolls but a lot of it had cream cheese, or fried something which was a bit too heavy for me. One thing that I would not suggest ordering would be the UNI, it wasn't that fresh... Other than that, the food was good, the service was good. :] ENJOY!

BsL8a6KW040P2EkkrMDG9Q.text: This place is amazing sometimes there is a wait for the food since it's always so packed but def worth the wait!!!

bHJiNWP9GIo0I1zqaAPHTA.text: Oh, Yama. Where do I even begin. Every time I am in Vegas, I absolutely HAVE to eat here. It's that good. I realize that being from Texas, it's not exactly a sushi mecca, nor do I claim to be an expert by any means, however, Yama deserves a solid 4 stars from me for everything from their sushi to their service. First things first, you're almost guaranteed a wait when you go here. Note that I've only gone for dinner, not lunch, so I can't comment on that. I'd suggest venturing to the questionable yet ever so fun Dottie's next door, where you can play slots/video poker until your table is ready, and the hostesses will actually come and find you there. Awesome. Speaking of table, I've never sat at one. I've always opted for the sushi bar. If you can, head to the bar in the new addition over on the right. Trust.  After sitting down, order the AYCE. Because why would you do it any other way. The AYCE includes all of their rolls, specialty rolls, hand rolls, sushi, etc, PLUS, the seafood salad that you absolutely must try. Get it spicy. And thank me later. I think my favorite rolls are the Wet Dream and No Name. I also love getting the white tuna, when they have it, and you have to end your meal with some mochi.  Love Yama. Love everything about it. Definitely give it a shot if you're in Vegas. You'll be happy you did!

Y0AIBDhlaQafVGLADiwdew.text: This place was great! We went around 3 pm and it was 23.95 for ayce sushi. The service was absolutely amazing and the servers always came by to ask if we wanted order more etc.

G_hqhhMYsuUuxuQly__xRQ.text: Gross & ouch for my mouth. While eating there was something that kept poking the inside of my mouth. I wanted to throw up the food.   There were fish bones inside the sushi roll and when I had asked one of the workers they said it was normal and that you can eat it. The sushi is so gross here and doesn't taste fresh at all.   Service needs to be worked on tremendously also. We had sat down BEFORE these 3 other men but however when we wanted to order she said she'll be back. Next thing we know she was taking the other people's order and then left and never came back for our order. Someone else had to take it. When she had came back to our table she was showing much attitude and didn't seem to want to tend to us at all.  Will never be coming back.

TmCXMErbqVc01pN8yCFZ8w.text: Always wanted to try all you can eat sushi.  But my fear was the same sushi taste and not enough variety.  Omg how I was wrong.  They have delicious appetizers and sushi and best of all... THE SEA FOOD SALAD WITH FRESH AVOCADO. Put your fears aside, try it for yourself.  It's worth it at least 1 time for you.  I would go everyday if I could.  Appetizers: Tempura Shrimp  Gyoza  Sesame Chicken and beef Fried mussels Sushi:  #7, #24, #16 and SEAFOOD SALAD!!

Niruo5FXZ0DtlnFOqVH1YA.text: Came here with a group of 7 and got the AYCE! I must say that while they were packed, the speed was impeccable. Everything I ordered was phenomenal!

Y72DKDfcYDJNABDedZ-SNw.text: i hadn't been here in 6 years maybe 7. The service and quality have gone down so bad. i can't believe i just spent $30 for dinner at this joint.  never again!

VYL9pElXLLQxexG3uNcaeg.text: Checked out Yama during our recent venture after my cousin recommended it.  We arrived for an early dinner and the place was packed, that had to be a good sign, right?  The resto was very cramped and we we're seated at a table for two with another table for two to my left, and one to my right, with just a makeshift border between us; way too close for comfort.  Basically, the sushi they offer is heavily dressed with sauces, flakes, and whatnot, not to mention the sushi rice was terribly heavy, that's where they make their money with the AYCE.  The staff also seemed very hurried and short, but to their credit, we got our orders very quick.  Sorry, can't say we'll be back, and that's the last time I'll trust my one cousin's recommendation! LOL!  #YamaNope

LCKwKsoBR8M5QHhX4TC4PQ.text: You'll get your money's worth if you get "All you can eat" which I believe is valued at $24.   First and second round- I usually start off with Miso soup, spicy seafood salad (a must try!!!! The sauce is amazing ) ........ basically......I order most of the appetizers because there's so many good different kinds that NEEDS to be tried.   Third round - I finally order sushi rolls, but I always tell them to do HALF rolls so that I can try a variety of rolls without having to stuff myself and worry that I would have to pay an additional fee if there's any left over.   By now my stomach is 85% full   Fourth round- Desserts!!! Which I usually get mochi ice cream and green tea ice cream.   Overall, my favorite sushi place when in Las Vegas  The taste is phenomenal, service is up to par, and nice ambiance.  ** located in Spring Mountain center somewhere near Lee's Sandwich, the only thing I dislike is finding parking during peak hours.

fOfNbwtxR1RnPEBAhG_gPw.text: Awesome food! I like to try all the different Sushis in town and I will definitely cone back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome All You can eat Sushi! Affordable price and nice staff. Big variety in the menu and a poke-stop inside. Best for pokehunters!

9S7lWu3gPpjoJkOIU4k5yw.text: I had heard so many good things but this place was so disappointing. I ordered Vegas Style, Jackpot Roll, I love Salmon roll, and 007 (all half rolls to try)didn't like anything. The salmon nigiri was the only thing I liked. The yellowtail nigiri was warm. Went home and the food made me sick!  On top of all that the waitress was very busy and hardly came over, it took over 45 minutes to get my sons California roll out. She was rude and acted like we were bothering her, so they didn't make up for anything with good service.(but added gratuity to our bill anyways since we were a party of 7).  I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Xq4Jnyc3NdZYWiFYx7gQEw.text: GMonkey love me some AYCE SUSHI to get several cooked items.   Step 1:  Order everything with red heart. You're only allowed one order per person.  Step 2:  Finish what you order or be charged extra for waste.   GMonkey do:  HAMACHI KAMA-broiled perfectly, best part of fish SALMON KAMA- ditto UNI- creamy in your mouth SWEET SHRIMP- sweet raw, fried head GIANT CLAM- little giants SOFT SHELL CRAB- battered & fried SABA SHIOYAKI- grilled just right SALMON NIGIRI- old reliable PALM JOB Handroll- spicy SSC, scallop wrapped in soy paper, crunch  Seated quickly, service was superb. Never passed my table without being checked on. Though I intended on sushi, everything was cooked perfectly. Sketchy dark parking lot with beggars wandering all night between parked cars. Be aware. GMonkey shall return. In daylight.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half cut Caterpillar
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi Kama a little overdone
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

FXvMfij1BzixybZC_qJ0qA.text: Quality of food no longer there? Staffs and chef are still nice and pleasant, But the freshness of fish and artisan workmanship no longer at this places, Too many AYCE SUSHI TO COMPARE TO IN VEGAS , this one is off my list

7whKhz2QvDBnIWXKtg1YhA.text: Good sushis Ayce. I loved the son on the beach roll. Huge portions for appetizers like big bowl of salad or 5 gyozas instead of 2 usually. I was surprised they offered a full softshell crab as appetizer. It was good overall but not my favorite in Vegas. I love yellowtail and I thought the fish quality was ok but not as good as I could have find elsewhere for nigiri. The chopsticks are bad quality wood. We had a small table for 2. Waiters were nice but seems like rushing a little. 4stars but with little improvement can deserve a 5

B2Eu8Bpp6z-m5vdfbRP3ig.text: Went here for the AYCE dinner and it was good. Wish there were more dessert and appetizer options but there was a plethora of sushi rolls.

2xJNikXYZ5146fs0egGa1A.text: Great sushi place that we found out about by a friend who lives in Vegas. We did the all you can eat dinner for $23 a person. Although it's a bit off the beaten path if you're staying on the strip, it's worth the $10 Lyft ride. The seating was quick upon our arrival and after ordering the food delivery was prompt. It's nestled in what appears to be a slightly older strip mall, but the service and food are excellent. The food seemed fresh and lived up to what we expected. Although it may not have the pizazz of places on the strip, it made up for it with an all you can eat option and also was half the cost of restaurants at the Cosmo or Cesar's Palace.

y0zzjiu6UaAd9n45MuNEcQ.text: What a little gem. It looks like not much on the outside, but most best sushi places don't. It's quite a surprise when you walk in the door. Atmosphere is wonderful, service is great and food is amazing. They have an all you can eat menu which will knock your socks off. $20.95 for adults $12.95 for kids 3-6 Located about a mile off the strip to the left of a CVS on Maryland.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H1bUmOUCX3bbezXThP8jZg.text: ....ive tried to give this place a chance.. I use to go here regularly in the early 2000s.. it was decent then...however the past few years they have been getting worse... this last time I need to write a review..... 1st the fish was awful!! And I don't mean Like one item was bad. no, everything I had was horrid! Except for a eel/avocado roll( but that's not sushi!) ... let me go futher... the fish was to the point that I had to send stuff back.. and I've done that less than a handful of times in life! ....one plate of tuna came out with spotted fish!! A plate of salmon came out with 2 gray pieces!! It was crazy!!! ....Now here is where it gets good!!!.... the checks come.... they had a 40%auto grad added onto the check!!! ... now i like many am horrible about never looking and just tossing a card down and tipping on top.... if one of my party didn't notice they would have got it... I wonder how many people pay a 40%auto grad!!! .... to be fair the service was good... but not 40% on a horrible meal good!! ..... I will NEVER be back! ... but I wish you all the best luck.

ok69GhlU2U8CjR_RcEon-A.text: I came here with 6 of my friends for all-you-can-eat sushi (dinner), which is ~$24/person. It was such a great deal, and I'm pretty sure we all ate more than $24 worth of food each. Our servers were very friendly and fast; we kept placing orders and they kept bringing the food.   I ordered so much nigiri, sashimi, seaweed salad, and miso soup. All of the fish tasted fresh and the nigiri did not have too much rice, unlike other all-you-can-eat places I've been to. I also ordered a roll but I didn't like it very much because it was covered in mayo. In fact, most of the rolls at our table were covered with sauce, so I don't recommend wasting time and stomach space on the sushi rolls.  Definitely try to order two or three things at a time rather than ordering a bunch of food you think you can finish at once because they WILL charge you for unfinished food.  If I'm ever in Vegas again, I will definitely be stopping by Yama Sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. so good

9HR_g7ZZ2-xryJc95Hgwlw.text: The best AYCE sushi place in Vegas. I love yama sushi. They have 3 locations. They are really fast when you are seated with getting your food and their quality of food is very good! I love how many options they have! The wait maybe long but it is definitely worth it.

YXg_mB1STBdvgCQ7P-4D3A.text: The food was delicious until I saw a baby roach crawl next to my dates plate! You guy need an exterminator ASAP!

lutNj42M4c9os5XdGpbnbA.text: We ate here many times since it's so close to home. Everytime we dine here, fish was always fresh. Food overall is delicious, from side dishes, sushi, nigiri, to dessert. The Salmon Kama is a must order for us. We celebrated many occasions here and brought many out of town friends and families,  and they like the food here. If you have little kids and prefer not to do the AYCE for them, this place have food for the little ones also, just ask for the other menu that have bentos or bowls.

oiQrS0gU_ZlhzsoYvZzBmg.text: This was really nice $25 dollar all sushi that you can eat ,it is not bad prices , the sushi is fresh you can see when they are preparing it for you .

u_se88mAw4-457RBRUH9SQ.text: Our go to sushi place in Las Vegas Nevada .. fresh quality fish, all you can eat (if you like) or a la cart. Must try this sushi

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy

kGtj09v933vtvGx6x9GYCQ.text: Nourishment is incredible. It's a little off the strip and costs are TOTALLY sensible. The spot is somewhat packed in the passageway. Administration was fine notwithstanding my extensive gathering. I don't prescribe the prepared sushi, as two or three my companions requested them and didn't care for them. The beverage choice is constrained.

p-mnuV9gycVQHTLdgQr7xQ.text: We come from Cali and let me tell you best sushi spot so far, we need one in Los Angeles

C8uG0CrCeKXz4nDGITg0bQ.text: I've been coming here since 2002. Yama is one of my faves and a "must stop" every time I'm in Vegas. Tonight I my sushi chef was Prince. He was friendly and dropped a lil chef special on me.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HaDN4fRLWQL5AaDcwE356w.text: Our Kirin draft literally tasted like rotten milk. The kids teriyaki chicken had hair in it. The rolls are tiny and not very good. Ordered edame, never got it. Baked green muscles are very skimpy. Very disappointing.

ATOhFyojlWKVoU-x5iAWyQ.text: best place for all you can eat aushi.  been here a few times.  don't forget to order the Camacho kama

yLA122XqgoyFxLiEKm3RtQ.text: My husband and I love this place. Great sushi! My husband goes to UNLV so sometimes we stop In for a nice lunch date. We always do the all you can eat.

SxAUGFSeYzVifsIkSVZpsw.text: I decided to come in here on a whim after getting my pedicure done at 4 your nails next door. The reviews do not lie this place is delicious. My favorite roll was the son of the beach roll, I also tried the strip tease roll which was also good but I preferred the son. I also sampled the tuna and salmon nigiri which was also good but not the best nigiri I've tried in town, it just wasn't as smooth as butter as some others I've had. Tasty, though. My first food order did take some time to come out (They started getting busy after I showed up at open!) The price for the AYCE is fair. I would definitely recommend anyone try this place!

6xoLuxrZG1M9SpvyQvgUuQ.text: The idea of All You Can Eat Sushi had me a little skeptical. If you are a sushi lover this place is worth checking out. Don't let the exterior fool you. What it lacks in fancy decor it makes up for in service and quality food.

u5WPbcQudZIfL-Txx9p0pQ.text: Hands down, best value for AYCE sushi, sashimi, and all Japanese themed eats. Great, fresh quality seafood and amazing selections - not just rolls. I LOVE that they have hamachi kama on the menu - not every place does; and they don't skimp on the fixings.   When in town, a must stop - satisfies the cravings and hits the food coma spot!  Go!!!

8mjEg-yQ-060gqKTvoSl7w.text: I haven't been to Yama in years so today I decided to have my post workout meal here. I was excited for the "sun of the beach" roll. While I was waiting for my food I felt something land on my head. At first, I thought someone threw something at me but it was a COCKROACH! From the ceiling to my head onto my table. I was so disgusted. Other customers saw it too and were regretting dining here. Manager was apologetic but didn't do anything for me. If I was in his shoes..I would've comped the meal.  It's been so long since I've dined here and this is what I been missing?!? No thanks. Never again.

I6ZwEEAo0wNdsTSMHAsp5A.text: What I like about Yama: They serve full-size appetizers when you do AYCE (6 gyoza, 4 shrimp tempura, etc.) while most other places in town do half size appetizers. Not a huge plus because you can always get multiple orders of most appetizers. On the flip side, I also like that there's a half size options for most rolls so you can try a lot of things. There was ONE server out of 5 we interacted with who was friendly and attentive. She was great! Price for AYCE is great (I think $21 for lunch and $23 for dinner).  What I dislike about Yama: The other four of the 5 servers who were rude, disregarded items we ordered, requests for water, napkins, menus, etc. Each request was met with either no acknowledgment, or a fake quick smile before the server would take off and never bring what we asked for. The sushi chefs are apparently amateurs because none of the rolls were cut anywhere close to evenly. One piece could be 0.5" thick while another in the same roll was 1.5" thick. The rice they used for sushi rolls was really mushy to where on the side of a roll, it didn't even look like grains of rice - just a smooth white surface. Rolls were hard to chew and swallow because they were really, really not enjoyable to eat. Flavor was good, but texture is also so important to sushi!   If you're in the mood for AYCE, I recommend a few places far above Yama in quality and experience - JJANGA, Sakana, Umiya, and Kaizen (on Deer Springs; the one on Paradise isn't AYCE).

VCB4Kc5A_4B8XuBknf5MgQ.text: Probably the best sushi I've ever had, have been here so many time for events like birthdays or date nights. Weather I go with just my wife or with family it's always a good experience, love the ice cream at the end also.

GqXSrKub7FTxOOipP53SNQ.text: Came here for lunch and was greeted right away by the somewhat friendly host! This place has been here since my colleges days and still striving.  The sushi chefs never disappoint. Only reason for the 4 stars is the cashier made me feel very uncomfortable with her off putting stares, not followed by a smile or a hello. Customer service 101. I thought maybe it was me however, she remained the cold, distance offensive cashier my entire stay!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Harry Potter roll, and LOBO roll. Both made to perfect! Every time I go to this place, they never fail me.
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Harry Potter

Mw5PqEBS6KpiTqNOnv3CxA.text: Great place always great service. Sushi is fresh. Never rushed. They always keep my drink full. They are always smiling. They bring your sushi so fast. You can order half rolls too. Great place.

fGc7ny9Wo80IJfitnLVSZQ.text: Really exciting.  Ordered a whole load of different sushi.  I like it here that rice is small n not too vinegary n sugary.  I think we ordered 5 rolls and about 50 hand held pieces, sesame chicken, bbq ribs and ice cream among 3 people.  Not bad for $20.95 pp (dinner is $3 more).  Albacore was pretty good.  White tuna was ok.  I liked rainbow roll.  Pretty good.  But eels were just meh.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

70u3msima1Oi3RqHyBA_rw.text: I'm sad to report this place has gone downhill since the last time I came here. The quality of the food was questionable.  My friend and I could both tell the fish was either old or it had been frozen then defrosted based on the texture. The flavor was lacking and the shrimp tempura was sopping with grease. Apparently, they can't get the soda right anymore either as it was mostly flat.   As for the service?  It's now the worst I've ever experienced at a sushi establishment.  We had to wait too long for refills on drinks, between orders and then were given a wrong order. When this was pointed out, the server said, "Oh, the chef must've gotten confused between #29 and #19," then proceeded to ask us if we wanted it anyway." Seriously? My friend and I asked what was going on to explain the drop in food quality and found out there's been a change of ownership sometime in the last few months.   We left unsatisfied, aggravated and worst of all, experiencing food poisoning symptoms a few hours later.  I have now filed a complaint with the health department. I hope they get their act together soon and stop putting public health at risk. You can't disrespect your clientele like this and expect them to return.  This pair of once loyal customers will not.

nfjExE85RHaNQ94yCK9IrQ.text: Been to this place a few times and although there is always a wait it is one of the best sushi places I've been to in the city. The staff is always friendly.

YGV8-oymMtBPGVyPmS9E0A.text: Really good food affordable place really nice staff will recommend this to anybody came here with the family really liked it

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4GlT8piumvQ2hqXUSGVHJw.text: Great deal of generous all you can eat. Very good sushi. Great variety of rolls, fish, meat, vegetables and more and more including desserts. VERY GOOD SERVICE ! Thank you Isha! A small place with great delight. Reasonable prices. Our best evening in Vegas!

JNl3yR-CZBvUUXtGDfzGGQ.text: Fantastic AYCE sushi. We sat at the bar and seemingly immediately received our orders. Any roll is great, but the sashimi (which I don't believe is on the menu) is phenomenal. It is also worth saving a tiny bit of room for the mango mochi afterwards.

SB4EwZsDBIPrfQQuW4LVew.text: Truly the best Las Vegas, this place rocks my world. Tell me one other place you can get all you can eat top grade sushi for like 30 bucks. All you can eat very good high-end sushi Yum. Be ready to wait to be seated though

B-b0tIVpcVAoyS5jtwd9fw.text: Came here for dinner around 6pm and the restaurant wasn't too busy and we were seated quickly. We ordered a few appetizers, nigiri, and one roll. The appetizers like shrimp tempura and baked green mussels were good. The nigiri was terrible and the appearance was enough for me to lose my appetite. Tuna was grey and looked bruised instead of bright red and octopus was too chewy. Scallop nigiri was ok but unevenly seasoned, one piece would have too much salt or too much lemon. The Dragon Roll was average. Expected more for 4 stars. We will not be returning.

IpIBKyN3Bi-DI9MezvQaWQ.text: I recently came here with my girls and had a sushi roll fest. All of the rolls ordered were very delicious and not overly "ricey". I ordered some of the nigiri and they were fresh as well but the item on the menu that brought it home was the yellowtail collar. It was delicious! Would come here again for some girls night out before hitting the clubs.

O08EocJ8xJFGERk_XLimFQ.text: First time wife and I have had AYCE at a sushi restaurant and it was quite a treat. The fact their price is only $24/person makes it that much better. Overall the food was very good and well prepared not cheap/slop as one would expect. The service is super fast and plenty of wait staff around to help all the time. It was Fri night at 10pm and it was packed. The sushi was fresh and clean tasting and the rice was not overstuffed which showed they were not trying to fill you up on rice.......very impressive. We had a few exotic rolls with interesting sauces and each was unique and distinct. The deep fried soft shell crab appetizer was surprisingly good for such an inexpensive restaurant. The hamachi kama was the only dish that was literally ruined by over cooking it. I have had the real thing (large cuts off the head/shoulder) in Japan and Hong Kong for years and the way it should be is barely cooked over an open flame which draws out all of the oil and makes the fish super moist and melts in your mouth. This was dry and therefore almost tasteless compared to the real thing.  But the truly amazing standout at this restaurant is clearly the seafood salad. We started out with one and devoured it in joy. The dressing is very spicy so be careful......but it was bursting with flavor. What they do (in my opinion) is use the end cuttings from the sashimi plus 2 pieces of tempura shrimp for the ingredients. Amazing, pieces of every kind of fish and scallops and all melted in your mouth. Even the odd cut pieces of salmon were smooth as silk. When they asked for last orders we were pretty stuffed so decided on one more of the seafood salad (one allowed for each diner) but when it came out we were blown away.....it had twice as much fish as the first order.....it was absurd, had to have at least 25 pieces of fish/scallops....we could not even finish it and had to waddle out the front door because of it. Here's the thing: if you eat sushi in any form it is filled with rice, the menu does not offer sashimi for this reason: most would order it over sushi so as not to fill up. Well this dish is all sashimi and then some...........you can eat great fish and not get overly filled up to leave room for some of the great appetizers.  Will be back next time we are in Vegas.

9e8AZqLZCn_Qxf2fK5P8cA.text: This place is THE BEST!  The Seafood Salad is a MUST have!  All-you- can- eat for lunch is THE best deal in town. A great combo of food and service.

8HjW_Lp5gfVBTrw7uxYpgg.text: I'm definitely going to be back the next time I'm in Vegas!  The AYCE (All You Can Eat) buffet was an amazing deal and they don't limit your selection to the basic rolls, like other AYCE sushi places I've been.  It wasn't the best sushi I've ever had, but it was by far the best value.  Only wish I'd saved room for some desert.  Also the place was really really crowded and we had a 20 min wait but it was worth it.

A49lHpq5qeLD_r0ibK-nIQ.text: Been here three times this year so far and plan on going again and again!  The AYCE menu has a variety of appetizers such as seaweed or seafood salads, yakatori, gyoza, mussels, miso, and more! Overall the fish quality is fresh and the variety of rolls is great.   Yama sushi is kind of small and seems to be always packed with people waiting outside but its well worth it! Since its always busy, the service can get kind of slow especially when you've ordered a lot of rolls. If you get the all you can eat, order appetizers while waiting for your rolls and nigri! One of my favorite parts about this place is that they offer green tea ice cream and strawberry and chocolate mochi for dessert!  If you're a fan of sushi and ayce, I HIGHLY recommend trying this place!

9zXUFTKpH7yLD-E4DXaDlQ.text: This place was definitely worth the extra effort of traveling off the strip for food, despite the nightmare that occurred while trying to get back (keep reading for the full story).  First, we had a group of 11, so the place reserved their side room for us which was pretty awesome. Next, the wait staff was super cool and patient with waiting for our mess of people to figure out what sushi/other foods they wanted. Then, the food came out and was absolutely delicious. After, the chefs even sent out some rolls they made special for us because they thought we would like them. Finally, the mochi/ice creams are included with the AYCE deal, so dessert was free (and fantastic).  The best dishes there? The Giant Clam piece was unbelievably delicious and really fun to tell people that you're eating (get it?!). Wet Dream was tantalizing. The Yama Special was perfectly prepared. The Seafood Salad had great pieces of fish in a fantastic sauce that I actually used instead of soy sauce for some of my tuna rolls. They offered Uni with the AYCE, and although I didn't like it I certainly appreciated that I was able to try it. The Edamame was low in salt for a change, which I can't praise enough. The best part is that no one had a piece of fish that was unpleasant, a feat not to be taken lightly at an AYCE sushi place. Also, the three people who decided not to get the sushi deal said that their dishes were also delicious and that they would go back again as well.  After the meal, the manager called us some cabs to get us back to the strip, which was really nice of her to do. The cabs didn't show after the 30 minute promised window, which if you know the politics involved with Vegas cabs really doesn't come as a surprise, so the manager called them again and complained. Then one cab finally came, which wasn't enough for all of us, so she called yet again to get us a ride back. Meanwhile, the restaurant is closing up shop behind us, but they asked us to wait inside their lobby area because it was cold outside and kept telling us we weren't in the way and asking if there was anything else we could do for them. This is what solidified their 5-star rating from me - I can't imagine anywhere else where the food is so good and the staff is so friendly and accommodating. Overall, this was the best eating experience on the trip and I say it was definitely worth the traveling hassle to eat there.

fggBIBZgn9fMm4txczxytQ.text: 4 of us went there after reading the Yelp reviews.  We went on Saturday night and waited about 1 hr and got seated at 8pm. totally worth the wait.   We ordered about 10 of the specialty rolls but the best dish was the seafood salad - so much fresh fish - we ordered two of them. We even topped it off with red bean ice cream and mochi.  Totally worth the $23.95!! I'm definitely coming back here again when I am back in Vegas!

0gLwYeKbysUwGVi6ey5fdA.text: Come here every time I'm in Vegas. Made to order all you can eat sushi. One of the things I like most about this place is that it is not a buffet type of place, all the sushi is made when you order it. Also they have a lot of crazy type of rolls, like happy ending.
