To8BnGdWmWD1g2UqolZw2g.text: awesome, awesome awesome! be nice to the sushi chef and watch yourself get hooked up with yummy off the menu food.    cheap and clean and fresh.  going there today and get the seafood salad.  You can only get it once for AYCE.

SRpTzzs-hCH1Ar5G8vKS6Q.text: Love it!! Just make sure you plan out what you want to eat. That way you don't get too full before you eat what you really wanted!  From now on every vegas trip I'm stopping at yamas!! Thanks yelpers! The food was on point! You can have all the special rolls you like! But be aware of their strict rules...you have to eat the rice on the sushi, so forget trying to skip the carbs. Also you have to finish everything you order so no wasting food. They will charge you extra if you don't adhere to the rules. I'm not a big eater but I can get down. So, as long as I get $23 worth of food I'm good. Which isn't hard with sushi. Today I ended up with a total of $38  I recommend making reservations. Also its not a big restaurant so its better to bring a small group.

cBkQSeDZsG4Z7zm31n5Bxg.text: OMG!!! I was in doubt when my bff told me that this was one of the best sushi places in Vegas but apparently I was wrong. I mean all you can eat for $20!?! and I mean ALL YOU CAN EAT like everything on the menu. AMAZING!! Cute decor and out of this world sushi. Go go go NOW!!!!

37Kv91bOYUf-laAb_TDfpw.text: Over the years I heard good things about Yama Sushi so I decided to give it a shot.  Its in a so so location and may be hard to find at times. Once I got inside I realized that its not a big venue and people seemed a little cramped together. I waited about 25 minutes to be sat down, It was pretty busy on a Sunday afternoon.  The menu is pretty good and I highly suggest the seafood salad. They have an all you can eat special which is pretty good and there wasn't much I didn't like about the food.  The service was decent and it seems like they are making effort to make the place bigger which would be great. I still prefer Kaya Sushi a little better but Yama isn't bad...

TBY7LxxOUYd7saWv0fwydw.text: All I can say is WOW! Excellent service and food. Fish was extremely fresh. The Sun of the Beach roll was the best roll I ever ate! Very reasonably priced for all you can eat in Vegas.

fTbDfS5vVsyu5fs2GMCZQA.text: Yama Sushi... Yama Yum Yum!  Thanks to friends Greg, Kiks, Jules, and Karina... they steered a couple of out of towners off the strip and turned us onto a local joint with all you can eat sushi goodness.  The place is fun.  The food keeps coming.  And sushi is delish.  Favorites were the fried softshell crabs, the firecracker sushi with jalapenos, the Son of a Beach rolls... okay, I take that back... I enjoyed everything!  I concur with the yelp advice to order half orders to maximize sampling of the extensive menu.  The nice meal after winning a few benjamins from betting on the horsies at the bellagio... made our last dinner in Vegas just super.  Although the waitress was in training, she did her best... and that is all you can ask.  The meal concluded with some green tea ice cream and mochi ice cream!  When in Vegas, I will hit this place up again most definitely!

BStG3pOdgtyroNiY4qSx6g.text: Yama what happened to you!! Yama use to be my favorite sushi place but the service has gotten so bad. The past three times I have been I was not very happy. Service is so slow which means a lot when you only have an hour for the ayce sushi.  They brought out the wrong dishes they forgot to bring out certain dishes the appetizers came out Luke warm.  we wanted to sit at the side of the bar where our fav chef "Q" was working at they said no when their was 4 seats open on his side! The prices are very reasonable and the food is still decent.

R2X_WOsTHrpPYbJY7e_VOA.text: Went here yesterday for the first time.  I'm impressed.  The all you can eat had slightly smaller fish and slightly bigger rice portions than I'm used to.  But it was good stuff.  All inclusive: uni, sweet shrimp, ikura.  All quite good!  Limits to one uni and one sweet shrimp, but that's normal.  BONUS POINTS for asking me if I wanted the shrimp head.  Of COURSE I DO! :)  But I get that most yahoo rednecks in vegas freak out.  Also MORE BONUS points for iced green tea WITH matcha!  Service was quite prompt!  Never an empty glass or table. :)  And I like to eat, so that was a great combo!

ltDCUArLBD18JcHB3dpr8A.text: Excellent sushi Restaurant in Vegas, Location is great if you're staying on the strip... The food is great and their service is fast! The place is very small so there is wait times for awhile!!

OGeo4P8_5WTaSEZeLC1xGQ.text: THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!!  All you can eat sushi for $23 dollars!! That's such a steal in an expensive city like Las Vegas. The restaurant is located just right off the strip in a plaza with a huge parking lot, so the location and parking is a super plus. The wait time isn't that bad, but when I went, it was SUPER hot inside.   For the actual food, they have all the usual rolls, but they also have a bunch of specialty rolls that they created themselves. All these specialty rolls also have these HILARIOUS names that are all very sexual (like wet dream, happy ending, and manwhore). I recommend not touching any of the ordinary rolls and just try one order of everything and share with your friends. They are all delicious and its also hilarious listening to the waitress repeat your order to you. There is also unlimited ice cream and mochi included in your dinner! I would definitely come back in the future. Great food, great price, great location!

1mYgdrsNChNOT7HzbPaY4g.text: I was with a large group (they only have one room to accomodate a party of 8-10) and they all got the all you can eat for $22 which I must say was well worth it, considering the speed of service and the fact you can get anything on the menu.  I had weight loss surgery so I don't eat enough to justify, but I would definately get the all you can eat option if you want to try 2-3 different things.  Heck, you can have 20-30 different things if you want.  For the volume you get, the quality was surprisingly good.

ijLcrlfNzCg-wU05XjEGtw.text: Decent value, but with their all you can eat program, (lunch 11-3:$19.95, dinner 3-1030: $22.95) this place wins.  I had the sun of the beach, happy ending, you the man too, and the soft shell crab roll, normal price at about $40, but clocked in at $22.95 pretip and tax!  Great way to beat the pricey tourist trap sushi on the strip.  Better if you take the bus along flamingo way from bellagio... highly recommended for poker players trying to recover between bouts.

RUD9WQ4sYWBKTDb_TqDi8Q.text: Got a great tip from a chum. Check out Yama Sushi. I love sushi. Went. OK who knew there were two? I'm from CA. I sure didn't. When I read the reviews, only this one had the good reviews. Our sushi chef for this all you can eat, was Fat Macho, according to his name tag. Sitting at the counter, we watched him work his imagination and wizardry. I didn't order off the menu. I just said give me some spice and do what you want. What wisdom! OK, I haven't a clue what anything would have been called in the menu reality. Truthfully, I don't care either. What I had was incredible. I find in most places, the rolls, etc, have about the same taste. Not True here. Each one of the sauces  had a different flavor. No two tasted the same. Clearly, Fat Macho was a pro and really cared about exciting our sushi experience. The staff were ever observing to see if you needed anything without being intrusive. Bravo on our brief but richly satisfying culinary delight! Whenever I return to Vegas, you can make sure I'll be back...and I will give my chums in CA a great tip! Just a quick PS. This little event will probably ruin my sushi dining experiences back home, like fish and chips in London did. But...it was well worth it!

Q_FbM465S0ay1T7lQIQKhQ.text: I have never written a review about anything, but I am compelled to write this one...  I was on a road trip this past weekend and stopped at this place for lunch. I somehow left my shoulder bag there, basically with everything in it  from cash, credit cards, to ipad... I was devastated.  When I finally realized that I have left my bag there and called them several hours later, a waitress who I spoke with over the phone told me that they have found my bag and she was nice enough to take her time to verify with me that all my belongings seemed to be there. She also reassured me that I could come back at anytime to retrieve it, and that she would turn it in to the manager for safe keeping until I could make it back from my road trip.   4 days later from the day I lost my bag, we stopped by to pick it up. I was speechless when I got my bag back completely intact!  I offered a cash reward to the lady who brought the bag out to me(I believe she might be the owner), but she refused to accept it. Instead, she thanked us for dinning at their restaurant, and wished us a safe trip back home...   We had 2 great meals there, both the quality and the variety of the food is unbelievable. It is absolutely the best AUCE sushi restaurant I have ever come across...

wBQm_mYfzmQXU0W8lRwVVg.text: Great staff, awesome food. Need more of sushi business like this in Henderson.  They will get 3 times of business.  Other than that, I have nothing else to say.  Lol

MCU640fWu1hk05REOoIYqA.text: Went here based on the reviews for lunch. For 20$ and AYCE you really get a lot for your money. I loved the jalapeno bomb! The service was very attentive and was constantly refilling our drinks and asking us if we wanted to order more. For the price, the sushi was delicious but definitely not the best sushi I have ever had. It's important to note the location is way too far to walk from the strip and cost us 12$ each way in a taxi. If you're starving and in the mood for sushi.. worth it.

xk2poBwAIfNkmpkZ2-iEzg.text: Yama was the first AYCE sushi place i've been to and wow ive been missing out all this time on something so tasty and delicious.  I heard about Yama from a friend and that i should go here so i did.  Me and my mother went here for lunch, we expected as much, it was kind of busy aha. we ordered miso soup and just chose whatever looked good to us. I only remember Wet dream as the taste stood out and still does. I will definitely be going back as my new love for sushi will make me!

GpEvqs4DKgmQQeikCoHy8A.text: This is for sure one of the best sushi places I've been to. The outside of the restaurant look kinda ghetto, but the inside looks like a nice sushi bar. It's super cool how they set it up. The AYCE is completely worth it, and the best way to try as much as you can on the menu. This place is super good and try as many different items as you can.

-0xb-RjjTWWNn-etGqcAfg.text: I love the food! Wet dream is my Favorite however the service can be better! The wait is usually 20-45 minutes long depends how busy which is understandable being that its pretty popular but the servers can be friendlier. Seating is pretty tight fit so u are usually almost right next to other parties and thats a little uncomfortable!

zBMQQMxWKITVk2mWz_LIsQ.text: Visiting Las Vegas...Yelped sushi...this place came up...very yummy!!! I loved it...got AYCE...left very satisfied...sushi makers very sweet...service is mediocre...seems like no one is assigned to customers...a free for all...forced me to be more assertive...but I still got what I wanted...my husband stated it was ok sushi...I'd come back next time I'm in town...

oOfU3va-auoI7BZe0WYCVg.text: the sushi was good but really nothing to write home about. Sushi loca is better in all aspects.  The service was slow. we expected to wait a bit to be seated on a Saturday night, but once we were seated we still waited 15 minutes for anyone to acknowledge us. During our dinner service was ok. I got a nasty warm flat coke so asked for iced green tea instead and was charged for both. then our check came, I looked it over everything looked fine, the guy that has been filling drinks took it and brought it back and suddenly multiple beers have been added to it and he already charged my card! they void the payment then charge me the correct amount, thus charging me twice and took a week to be back in my bank...obnoxious and not worth it.

bUewLTS4TCODC6Va6_L2-Q.text: Best all you can eat Sushi I have had in Vegas.  Service was outstanding and food came quickly.  I love their yellow tail collar, fresh nigiri and so many rolls.  Only one issue is parking.  If you need to park, go behind the building for extra parking.

Y7AQ_7aMYlmY3ybpsozB3w.text: Thee best AYCE sushi!   You can literally have ANYTHING on their menu; no restrictions.  Cost: for lunch time ayce $20.95 / person  What's good: - seafood salad (mild or spicy) ---- MUST HAVE - no name roll --- MUST HAVE - deep fried mussels - green mussels - sun of the beach  No bueno: - plum ice cream --- tastes like medicine - grand canyon, or golden canyon - anything with cooked salmon on top --- salmon is dry

xhUg_-srIAwDF3Lg-Gdi7Q.text: This is the spot for sushi while you're in vegas! Place is always packed and the service is FAST no matter what you order.   AYCE is under $30 and open the whole menu, not just sushi. The only downside is it could take a while to get seated when it's the dinner hour, but it's well worth the wait!

nhVKJYgmz7cvrB627qKI3w.text: I've been here twice. The first time, we sat at the bar and had a great time. It might have just been the novelty of the place (and the fact that it had been a while since I had sushi), but my girlfriend and I had a blast, even though the service was slow.  The second time (most recent trip to Vegas), we sat at the regular tables. Water/food/any service was VERY slow. It took a while for us to order anything because of the slow service. Also, we had a hard time picking what kind of rolls we wanted because the novelty had worn off this time around. Great names for the rolls, but that's pretty much it.  We've decided that there's no need to come back to this place. Lines are long, service is slow, and the food is just mediocre. There are so many restaurants to try on and off the Strip that I don't see a need to re-visit a mediocre spot.

TRB5u0e0XDPfZSThu9e-mQ.text: 1st timer here. Sushi was good, but it was a bit the fast food for sushi. The rice was not very tasty, the fried tempura was pre made and not made to order. The wait staff was very nice and took the time to say hello and make sure our hot tea was filled. If the fish was better quality I'd give 4 plus stars. Fish did not have too much taste and too many sauces which cover up the taste of the sushi. Sea Food Salad was pretty good, but it would of been nice not to have so much dressing. If you like sauces on your sushi this is the place for you, they have lots of sauces.

KBHZzet8pNAgj0NR6GvODw.text: This all you can eat sushi place is a must when you visit Las Vegas.  We've all been intrigued and tried the $30 buffet. With all of its beautiful decorations and intricate deserts, I must say I'm a fan as well.  However, when it comes down to all you can eat sushi. I'm a much stricter consumer.   Yama sushi gets notoriously busy at night. So, I went on a Friday night. Surprisingly, the wait was about 30 minutes for 3 people. We sat at the bar, a little cramped for space. Then again, I'm here for the food.  THE FOOD IS GREAT. Everything we ordered is fresh and delicious. Many of the one order/customer items are top notch. Try the seafood salad- spicy, you will not regret it.  Unfortunately, this restaurant is rather small. A long wait and a small table is almost a guarantee. However, after a good hour of non-stop eating great food. It doesn't matter.  Definitely not a sit and chat place as many waiting customers will give you the death stare. Besides, after eating a full meal, the last thing I want to do is sit and stare at the reminants of my plate.

eGqtEt4L_EsqQ7I4GpVcuw.text: Haven't been here in years because it's a bit far from me and the waits were always long but I was happy to come back and see they've expanded the location a bit! Still pretty tiny and tight spaced compared to other sushi places, but the sushi totally makes up for it! I've never tried a roll that I don't like! I also love that they offer the soy paper as an option, and the no-name already comes with it! =) also during my recent visit our server was so hilarious and joking around with her, made our service more enjoyable! Can't wait to come back again! =)

SfmtwxmVCiFRsZxu1PqupA.text: Good sushi for all you can eat!! Fresh fish. Very surprised considering its in a strip mall off the "strip" but that also explains why the prices aren't through the roof and you can leave having eaten a very good and satisfying meal. This was extremely fresh, and surprisingly good!!  Way happier with this meal than having gone to "Yellowtail" which was the most overpriced sushi I've had in my life, and decent at best, and then I had to go eat another meal an hour later.

SESIHUDvCb_xfsZT0tXH2w.text: The service here is what impressed me the most.  The staff seem to enjoy their jobs and were very consistent with taking our empty plates away, refilling our water, asking us if we wanted to order more (we did the all you can eat).  One even took the chopstick wrapper off my table.  The food meets the expectations of a good sushi restaurant.  It's not the top tier but it's what you'd expect for a typical sushi place.  The decor is nice and clean.  I would definitely recommend this place!

jQOCLWXMvy8JKhIyZQaX6g.text: Everytime we're in Vegas we make a special trip to Yama for their awesome all you can eat sushi..  Best deal in town!!

vMfHMoy4dFBUW0EGXIEYjw.text: I LOVE this place; I am obsessed!  I have literally driven across town, from my place in Henderson to get this sushi spot!    The fish and sushi is FAST, creative  and FRESH FRESH FRESH! The BEST thing about this place is that its AYCE!!!!    I have a few staples and among them I recommend the Fire Cracker Roll: Stuffed Jalepenos tempura fried with spicy mayo; GET IT if you like a little spice! (some are spicier than others). I always get two orders because four pieces is just not enough.  Harry Potter Roll and Wet dream, also two of my favorites!   Just be sure that if you get AYCE that you do in fact EAT IT ALL because they charge you a la carte prices for what you leave behind (shouldn't be hard because its SO GOOD)!   The only reason I gave them four stars is the service, mostly lacking. They could have a wait and they won't open up certain sections and their waiters aren't the most attentive. Doesn't matter because the food here is the super star! SUPER STARRRRRR!!!! (yes, I threw in a Mary Katherine Gallagher reference)

WdJq_mH-FvTLkFnCdu25MA.text: I'm a huge fan of sushi, especially joints that offer AYCE. I was excited to try this place as it gets good enough reviews and quite a few of my friends love it. Unfortunately, I can't join them in their enthusiasm for this particular sushi restaurant.  Being a sushi enthusiast and just plain hungry, I was excited when we were finally seated [about a 40 minute wait for three people for lunch]. I looked over their rolls and the rest of their AYCE sushi offerings. Five minutes later, someone finally came to take our drink order. The drinks arrived pretty quickly, but after that, it was just a whole bunch of waiting for our server to actually approach us.   Needless to say, once the waitress finally approached us, I told her what I wanted for my first round of ordering and my fellow diners follow suit. It's not until we finished ordering that she tells us it's only two items per person at a time. WHAT?!?! Blasphemy. First, she should have informed us after I clearly ordered more than two things, or at least before letting the other two diners order. Secondly, what kind of BS is that? I should be able to order what I want, when I want.   The wait for the foods was pretty bad too. I understand a little bit of a delay sometimes, when the restaurant is super busy - but it was just too much of a wait here. I think I spent more time waiting, than actually eating - especially with the two at a time BS. Not to mention the fact that our waitress forgot about a couple of orders [which ironically worked out for the best as I didn't really want to eat anymore of their sub-par food].   As for the quality of the fish - it was mediocre. The fish on the nigiri [tuna & yellowtail] smelled a little bit and were dry. The only reason I was able to eat my orders was because I drowned the fish in the leftover sauce from the seafood salad. The pieces of unagi they gave me were small, and all I could basically taste was the eel sauce. I did enjoy a couple of the rolls I ordered, especially one called No Name. They have an unlimited amount on desserts, but not a very huge selection. Just a few different flavors of ice cream & mochi.   All in all, I wouldn't go back. Poor fish quality, long waits, & bad service is not something I would pay 20 plus dollars for. I'll stick to my usual sushi spots instead.

FUV-QdoEEZg1lF63-xmQ1g.text: I have been going here for YEARS now and not once has it EVER disappointed me! I always get ALL YOU CAN EAT because not only is it fairly priced but you can do 1/2 rolls as well. I haven't had a bad thing on their menu. I highly recommend Yama and I also recommend the "Happy Ending" roll. You can thank me later...  I hope they will eventually make their spot bigger!

asrJUxdg7y5jSxxpyOjfMQ.text: This is my favorite sushi place in town. The Sun of a Beach and Wet Dream roll are to die for. I'm a sushi fanatic and haven't found many places in town taste-wise that compare to Yama. I would totally give them 5 stars if the wait times weren't so long :(. Seating is extremely limited and you could sit and wait for over an hour without a reservation.

CUcb3JiseoGDAWA9pYKAkg.text: We chose Yama because of the great feedback and reviews. Upon arrival, there a short wait of 10-15 minutes; we took this as a good sign due to popularity. We were seated and ordered our first round of AYCE sushi. Half of our order arrived quite promptly, even before our drinks. The second half of the order never arrived so we reordered along with some more options, again, some items never arrived. Upon asking for said items a third time, I was informed that I could only order some of them once....but I had never received the items in question. Eventually, I did get a few of them while others never showed up. Apparently, some items take longer than others (I knew and know this and was being patient), but when asked if everything had arrived, I brought up a few items that I hadn't received. The server then, again, proceeded to inform me that some items take longer to prepare...and then brought out the time ticket to show that the order had been placed at 9:27pm; we were shown the ticket at 9:58. A sushi dish, cooked or not, does NOT take 30+ minutes to prepare, especially when other diners around us were getting their food with lightning speed. More than 4 groups dined in the 2 tables adjacent to us while there, and they all received every item ordered within 5 minutes...I wasn't taking note of this at the beginning of our dinner, but as time wore on it became very apparent how slow and spotty our particular service was. The food was decent, the service (and attitude of our servers) was horrible. I won't be returning to Yama, but this was only my particular experience. Everyone else there appeared to have a wonderful time with great service. It is unfortunate and I'm unsure why our experience was so much worse. Perhaps my expectations were just too high?

9lMP1XhFW_Hdb5dTid1hqQ.text: Went here with a large group of friends last thursday night.  Even though we got there around 8, the place was packed and it was about a 20 to 30 minute wait.  My friend who organized the get-together didn't like how she couldn't make a reservation because we didn't have enough people for it, but since I wasn't the one planning it I won't take it into account in this review ;).    The building is small but it feel very warm.  We had table near the corner set away from the main walkway, so we didn't have people running into us or elbowing us as they walked.  The table wasn't bolted to the floor or heavy, so it was very easy to push around, and we frequently had to recenter the table due to it moving under the weight of elbows and arms.  There was a "fake" table leg at the head of the table which popped in and out, much to the amusement of one of my friends.    The waitress was very kind and made it a priority to make sure she got our orders down perfectly.  All of us except for one had the All You Can Eat deal for 22 bucks.  She repeated all the orders just to make sure, and even explained which ones come out faster and which ones took longer to prepare.  Not necessary, but it it shows a great commitment to customer service.  Now, for "All-You-Can-Eat" specials, you often go in with low expectations in terms of quality, since most places emphasize on quantity rather than quality.  The food here, however, was way above average for an All You Can Eat place.  The TNT and Vegas speciality rolls were my favorites, but the best cut I had was the smoked salmon sushi.  I highly, highly, HIGHLY recommend that cut, it was the best cut of salmon I have ever eaten in an All You Can Eat sushi restaurant.    It did take us awhile to get our check when we were done, but besides that the service was good, and our waitress was extremely attentive to our order and making sure we got everything that we ordered and that it was prepared right.  On a funny note, they had NASCAR on the tv next to our table.  Quite ironic for them to have a sport like that in an Asian restaurant, lol.    PROS: Very good sushi for All You Can Eat Attentive waitress Good and fair price (i.e. you get what you pay for, and more) Clean bathrooms   CONS: Small building, can be cramped and congested on the walkways Waits can be long, especially at night, even on weekdays  WILL I RETURN?:  Absolutely!  When I'm in the mood for sushi, I'll probably come back here!

gJgQjH28O8tfqeFJT61YUQ.text: Best ayce sushi place I've been. Quality was great for the price point. My rating reflects that. However... I hated being hassled to finish everything on my plate before being able to place my next order. I understand they are working with slim margins due to the quality of their fish (which I applaud them for) and the Vegas market is tough for buffets but your patrons don't want to feel pressured while eating. 2-cents Thx yelp universe for letting  me rant

5wbaacjZvTLvy3WpQWRCzg.text: This place is great all u can eat!!! Good quality fun rolls ...appitizers are just ok my favorite tools are be mine wet dream and shrimp lover.... Try to make a reservation cuz there always busy

J4G8Z3QSCkkI5zpajpkTxw.text: Great place to eat all the food was awesome, need more space! Try the eel that was super! Best of all the prices, can beat the all you can eat, wish more places were that smart!

PrA2rrxGH3uMnZevDGycbw.text: Came into town with a couple of friends and one of our Vegas friend took us here, well because, we're tired of the strip's food and wanted sushi! Anyway, this place is pretty small and cluttery however, the sushi is decently good! Service was not great. The waitress was pretty short when we were seated. SHe just handed us the menu. Didn't ask us if it was our first time here, didn't ask us how our day is going. I mean, I know you could careless about our day, but you're in the restaurant industry...you're trying to work for your tips. Please, make sure you have good customer service, no need of excellent...just good. Once we were ready for our bill, our waiter suddenly hit bipolar and became nice and more talkative... okay... not cool. Good sushi not great service.

3pOi_2IX0WWoxYGEn0YmTg.text: I may have found an all-you-can-eat sushi place that beats Midori in Los Angeles.   For $23, you can stuff your face with every fish possible (no dolphin though, they learned their lesson from Blue Fin).   PROS: GOOD FOOD  1) Only $10 corkage fee. Bring a bottle of Sake from Lee's Liquor down the street, and enjoy some sake shots with your buddies.  2) They have a private room type place that seats 8-10 people, so call ahead to reserve it; it's pretty cool.   3) THE FISH IS FRESH! You would think that the quality would be terrible for the all-you-can-eat price, but it was actually very, very fresh. My party of five devoured yellowtail, salmon, albacore, and spicy tuna sushi. They have great specialty rolls too; get the "no name roll", literally a party in your mouth.   4) Mochi ice cream is included in the deal, so take advantage!   5) Unlike other places, you can have people on your table opting out of the all-you-can-eat deal, and just buy a-la-carte. Convenient if someone's not too hungry!   CONS: BAD SERVICE  1) I ordered spicy scallop hand roll, and they brought me spicy (imitation) crab. I told them that it's the wrong order, and she insisted it was albacore. I tried it, called the waiter again, told her that it's definitely not scallop, so she took it back. Next came the manager with the same hand roll who told me that they apparently mix their scallop with their crab because they don't get a lot of scallop. So I tried to scavenge thru the roll to find some scallop, and I found NONE!!!!!! I get spicy scallop wherever I go, and they tried to lie to me! I told them there was no scallop in there and she tried persuading me that its somehow mixed in there.....what did they do, puree it?!  2) My friend eats sushi a lot, and he asked for at least three special orders, and our waitress didn't know what the hell he was talking about. She proceeded to tell us that she is not Japanese, but Korean. And we asked her if she could ask the sushi chef if she knew these orders, and she said that the chefs are all Korean too. Why would anyone ever use that as an excuse to be uneducated about the food they're serving? Ridiculous.   I feel like the complaints were strong enough for at most three stars, but with the price and the quality of the food, it's a great place to grab dinner before you hit the overpriced, crazy Vegas nightlife.

exf4YBIUAQeEJ-GyuVdVnQ.text: i love yama sushi!!!! the all you can eat includes so much, from appetizers to soup to mochi ice cream!  The quality of the sushi is very good given the price. They offer many creative and funnily named rolls. I recommend the no name roll and whose your daddy roll. I also love their seafood salad, its basically a sashimi salad topped with some shrimp tempura. However, be wary of their spicy grade, the two times I've ordered the seafood salad mild and found it too spicy to eat more than a few bites.  When it gets busy, service can get really slow, however the fact that the waitresses have the foresight to incrementally send in your orders, anticipating that you will get too full and want to cancel part of your order, makes up for the spotty service. Putting up with slow service beats wasting (and paying for) lots of untouched sushi or eating until your stomach explodes

3vjUWQO9FMuC5GMkhkkr6Q.text: This is one place I just HAVE to go every time I'm visiting here in LV. If you are into big spacious restaurants, this isn't for you. You sit pretty close to your neighboring tables and are easily observed. It's loud in here, but keep in mind, it's always busy and especially during the lunch hour- but you'll still have more than enough time to enjoy all the goodness this place has to offer since they are super friendly and fast!  You can't go wrong with the ALL-You-Can-Eat option! I especially prefer this since it allow me to order all kind of different sushi specials. The nice thing about it is that you can order a "half" order of any kind of special rolls they have to offer. Meaning you have more room to try something else. Plus you still get the great perks of ordering meat choices of chicken or beef teriyaki or korean short ribs as well.   The staff is super friendly and helpful if your not sure on what to order. The sashimi salad is sooo yummy! I highly recommend! Some servings of particular orders may seems small, but that's OK, it allows you to venture out and try other things on the menu (all you can eat menu). Regular items that are not ordered from the all you can eat menu are of the normal portion of japanese bento box style.   Quality of the food is great. Fresh sashimi, fish and seafood found here in LV? Yes!!! I spoke with the owners and chef a few times and they get daily shipments of fresh seafood. You know what that means, this place is no joke!   Price? more than reasonable for what you get. If your on a budget or just not looking to spend over $25 for a lunch or dinner, I say keep more $$$ in your wallet, avoid those corporate buffets at the hotels on the strip and enjoy some great japanese/korean food in a not so busy environment.   There is plenty of parking since this is located at a strip mall next to albertson's and CVS. You can't go wrong!!!!

vNDwxreWtUx3ukCE6ZOZAQ.text: Good grade sushi. Well prepared and best of all it's All-you-can-eat!! It's $20 per person for all-you-can-eat and as small as I am I was able to eat at least $50 worth of sushi. If you choose to do the all-you-can-eat make sure you eat all your food otherwise they'll add on an extra charge. You'll leave this place with a very full but happy stomach

Z0yNVcU22NRwQ_3_btpiVQ.text: Yama is the Boma~ I LOVE the Noname. $21 for lunch and $23 for dinner for AYCE sushi. it's the best tasting and the best price!!

qCQ7ICintTstwsVAuhYtLg.text: I love sushi and have never been at such a wonderfully delicious restaurant. It is in a strip mall, off the strip, and worth the wait.  All you can eat but not run of the mill sushi....fabulous choices.  The staff is helpful and allow you to order half rolls if you want.  A must for everyone.

XDR57hc-wqaZoVp9wzJ5jg.text: This review is based off of my second visit about 2-3 weeks ago.  Honestly the first time I tried this place, I didn't think it was too bad. I felt lucky finding a decent sushi place so close to UNLV with good prices. However, after my last visit I take it all back. Their nigiri is mediocre at best and warm,  not chilled how it's supposed to be and it was weirdly chewy. I could barely stomach it. Their rolls aren't bad, I actually prefer their cooked items to their raw ones. Anything fried and covered in sauce is good, they're gyoza was also really good too. I'm not trying to throw this place under the bus or anything, but just be aware. I really wanted to order some ahi before I left,  but after the few pieces of warm unappetizing nigiri I had I just went for dessert instead.  Which btw, I recommend the ice cream mochi, the green tea ice cream didn't have a strong green tea flavor and that kind of made me sad. I hope this review helps!

N363JV2AlJpghYaNVs6Iwg.text: Very very good sushi consider it is an "all you can eat" spot. I find the quality of fish is usually sub par when AYCE is offered, but Yama sushi fish was fresh. This could possibly be because of how busy this tiny spot gets. Service was decent even during full house and they did not hesitate to keep bringing my guest and I our tuna sushi even though we were ordering 10 orders at a time. One star was lost because of how tight quarters the tables are and everything does tend to feel rushed. Be prepared to wait for your table even on a weekday.

-EELuur9XlfhTGwcLeQSIA.text: I just went today for Valentine's Day, so it was pretty crowded, especially for a place that is pretty small to begin with.  Service: They made up for this by having great food and FAST service. No joke, our orders were ready within 3 or 4 minutes. Even with the place being packed, the staff was very friendly and attentive.   Food: The food was tasty. I ordered nigiri, tempura, miso soup, and mochi. Definitely one of the better AYCE sushi places that I've tried, especially for the price.

WwnLe7f4dudl4wZDDQIYSw.text: This is one of my favorite places in town. The Wet Dream roll is lovely. Service can be a little spotty when it's busy but overall good.

pUi0QUjHzXV3IYd3_Zk6Hg.text: My fave sushi spot in Vegas!!! A friend recommended it to us, she swore by it so we gave it a shot. It is a little hole in the wall that is always packed and feels very crammed, but definitely worth it! You can really taste how fresh the fish is. My favorite item is the seafood salad spicy....delicious! My boyfriend and I never like the same places. but we both love Yama Sushi!

dTjnJwxYuXKR948xThpBIA.text: This place is owned by Koreans so don't expect authentice Japanese sushi. The best option is to get the AYCE sushi. The lunch price is around 17 and 23 for dinner. You have to eat all the rice. Most of the sushi was either deep fried or was covered in sauce. They do have a large selection of rolls, although they do seem like a variation of the same thing.

r-OFK0MHuNx0WpU6vmL_sw.text: This place is awesome!!! All you can eat sushi, but it's not buffet style. It's like any other sushi restaurant except you pay one price. I'm still wondering how they make any money. The sushi was up there with the best I've had anywhere. Don't pass this place up! Make sure you get the seafood salad and albacore. Enough said!

-uKPJ5GgXCLlzg_NEl9xzQ.text: Great food and service until you pay the check. As soon as they give you the check early and you pay, they don't bother with you anymore.

hnCTgAts1iJXiG6MrQgNAQ.text: In Vegas for a few days and stopped in here for lunch because of fellow Yelpers reviews.  OMG the best service and food.  Packed and yet the wait was not too long.  The food was fresh, clean and amazingly delicious.  I'd go so far to say that this place is my favorite sushi joint to date.  I wish it was in L.A.

JPvAkFr9htCytW1UYq0ZSg.text: I'm giving 2 stars because the wait staff was quite incompetent which ruined the dining experience.  The wait staff insisted that they take our order by memory (we had the all you can eat option).  Of course, only parts of our order would arrive everytime because the waiter inevitably forgot our fairly lengthy order.  Overall, food was pretty good.

HtKuq7M6F7bMbNuc-wfy2Q.text: I love this place! The sushi is awesome and the prices are so reasonable! They have a great variety and good service! The one thing I hate, is the wait! It's a small venue and always busy, but totally worth the wait!

ZP44I_7FB7EZJtCw12XrdQ.text: Excellent food!  I have shellfish allergies and the staff  was very accommodating.  Will definitely be eating there again!

dv6vIkVsCabhyJ73lU995g.text: I'm gunna keep this one short and sweet. As far as taste and authenticity...this this is by far the best AYCE sushi in Vegas. The fish is VERY fresh and flown in daily. The staff is VERY experienced and the overall quality of the ebtire menu is 5 stars for sure. Delicious. However, i give this plave 1 4 star rating because it is always very crowded, loud, and you usually have to wait a while to be seated...they also seem to rush you along instead of letting you enjoy your experience. Overall still a good place to have sushi!

dcwXnpo2cU1tn3jX5JfS8A.text: Been coming here for the last 6 years!  Fantastic sushi for AYCE and price.  Over the years, it's popularity has increased dramatically so it's best to arrive early for dinner....1-2 hour waits are the norm some evenings!  The mochi, red bean ice cream, and green tea ice cream are all delicious so leave room for them.  Yamasushi is no longer a secret.  I only wish they would open a second location on the west or northwest sides!

QvfCK59Cqqj9DdhUpF7C7g.text: The Sushi is phenomenal, but they are almost always packed, so expect a wait. The servers get a little bit slow two or three orders into an all-you-can-eat meal, but it's not terrible. I'd give it 5 stars if they had twice the space.

Hd2mP3a6l1cGhP8Q6qw2uw.text: Let me start out by saying I've been going to Yama for the past 10 years and over the past few years while the sushi has remained the best in town the service has declined tremendously. The past few times I've gone I've said it would be the last but I keep going back for my favorite rolls The No Name, The Sun of the Beach, and The Double Dragon but after this past time I really mean it when I say I won't ever be back. I ordered the all you can eat and wasn't as hungry as usual I guess so I had about 4 pieces of Sushi left. My server told me if I didn't finish my food I would get charged extra. I let her know I've been eating there for 10 years and have spent a ton of money there and have brought several new people there but she didn't care she told me that I better eat all of my food or I will be charged for it! I couldn't eat another bite so I'm sorry to say that the sushi went into the bathroom garbage.

oRs2qMg1y6KvZlZz5NDdZQ.text: It's pretty cheap for all you can eat sushi for lunch and dinner ($21 lunch, 24 dinner) The rolls were really good, and the fish (esp the white tuna) was SUPER soft and didn't have that day-old fish taste. The fish was pretty darn fresh. The desserts were delicious too!  The restaurant itself was really small and you feel pretty snug sitting inside, but the taste was great!

TvDWNEMM3LCjIuQtBaZhVg.text: I love this place. I keep coming back to Yama. The have a great community, and awesome servers. I mean how could you not with $21 dollar All you can!

uSxBKc9AKVI-zFiIwCX8uA.text: You can't help but love this place. It's not pretentious, the food is excellent and the atmosphere lively. If you go to Vegas this is one restaurant you need to visit.

xwIZBN90LonmybNZc2B7Dw.text: The whose your daddy roll tasted like ammonia. The rice was also bad. I will never come here again.

PmWdiCONHrCWpEQ0GIdWRA.text: Ok.  This is the best AYCE sushi joint  in Vegas.  I went there with a friend for lunch time on a weekend.  It was busy and the wait was about 30 minutes.   Good thing we decided to sit at the bar.  It's nice to at the bar and since I am not picky about what I eat, I let the chef  throw what ever he wanted at me.   I wasn't disappointed.  Definitely sit at the bar and let the chef just make what he wants.

vQ6MsOhKNah_KbwOmEuOCA.text: This place is too small & since they're one of the most popular sushi restaurants & conveniently located near The Strip, it's no wonder they're always busy & no longer take reservations. I've had a couple of bad experiences when I would go with my family or boyfriend & they would be too busy that they'd forget to bring in our last order. After countless times of refusing to order ice cream while we wait & reminding them about the last order, a couple of the waitresses told us it was our fault & warned us not to do it next time. Wtf? Whatever, star deducted for their poor service but I still effing love the sushi specials.

kK6oXf0OEGeszbxtpCU_KQ.text: I love this place sushi no where else! Service is superb! And all rolls are great! Ps sun of the beach and wet dream are all time favs. Try this place u will love the quality and price only 21 buks for Lunch.

B4_LOl9ZPWPABupiiZgTrw.text: Sure the wait sucks, and there is almost always a wait.  But what might that tell you?  Service once you get in the door is AMAZING, and the food is never a disappointment.  Best kept secret off the strip

jQTsIzz0CuqWOgA4VF4O7w.text: The best part about this place is the all you can eat! About $23 I think for dinner. The sushi is pretty good and they have a lot of different rolls. You can order the appetizers off the AYCE menu too! I love that! The downside is that it is always packed. It is a small place and the tables are really close together. The waiting area is small too and usually full. The service is okay. I usually overlook all this because you can't beat the price.

cc1g1COp30fOg2NjcYrF_Q.text: By far the best AYCE sushi I have had in my life. The place is small and crowded but that gives it a festive vibe.   The food was excellent. Thank goodness we were at the bar so you can order directly from the sushi chefs and get your sushi fast. I've heard that at the regular tables they usually get your order wrong and takes awhile to get your sushi.   It did take while to get our diet coke and ice tea from the servers. Thus the 4 instead of 5 star review. The sushi chef also were not pleased when my coworker ordered and seafood salad and I declined it but later ordered it when I saw his. Whatever. But the seafood salad was excellent. More like sashimi in sauce since there was no veggie to speak off except shredded daikon.   I would definitely come here again. The whole meal was less than $30 per person. Quite a bargain for Vegas AYCE restaurants.

X5GGL77dGDpeLHFNgip-8w.text: This is probably going to become our new favorite sushi house in Vegas. Delicious food, great service and reasonable price. Well done and thank you.

4rZ36tOxC6ARMmWBVeATMQ.text: Been here multiple times and I just got on yelp so I figure I write a review. Being from Hawaii, I have high expectations on fresh fish. Yamas did not disappoint me at all every time I went. The sushi rolls are good, the appetizers are good, and the fish is good. What makes it better is that this place is all you can eat.   The reason for the four stars instead of five is because one time I came, one of the waitresses just wasn't as friendly as the other waitresses I usually get. Also I wish they were bigger because sometimes when you're eating, you mite be sitting literally two feet from another table.   I recommend this place for everyone at anytime.

scF9OUHvhZbOnOG4eU8thg.text: The sushi was great quality and the all you can eat is a fantastic deal, normally all you can eat doesn't sound good for sushi but this was wonderful and good size rolls not small at all.

KmFGehYitp7DwPeRH5elmA.text: This is five stars for the AYCE, not for a la carte. $20.95 lunch   Came here for AYCE and it was delicious! Some AYCE joints don't offer appetizers and desserts on the menu, but Yama does. Sat at the counter with a party of four, and unless you're looking for more privacy, I'd recommend the counter. You can order rolls straight from the chef rather than through the server.   The seafood salad is pretty much a typical sashimi salad without the abundance of greens. Rather, it sat on a bed of radish strings. Would recommend. Nigiri is also on the menu and for AYCE, the hamachi was pretty good. A few items have a limit of one per customer such as the uni, amaebi, and seafood salad...understandable.   Some of my favorite rolls were the Mad Dragon (although super eel sauced) and No Name. Note that you can order HALF rolls for some of them...and if you sit at the counter you can actually talk to the sushi chef if he talks to you first =] calls for fun and giggles. Pauw made our rolls and he was pro awesomeness. They have a lot of rolls with mayo or cream cheese which isn't my preference, but if you like that this is def the place for you. It's good in moderation, but definitely not for AYCE. Of course it isn't ALL mayo or cream cheese, just saying it's more than what I am used to seeing on a menu.   Finish off with cucumber salad, refreshing...then some ice cream (which was average) or mochi ice cream!

Rv738Obsy0X9t5cuWV0Rgg.text: This is the first time I've been here , and I enjoyed and the food was amazing !!  I was having so much fun with the sushi chef his name tag says his name is "I forgot" lol... price are ridiculously affordable and is all u can eat and the food is quality food! I'm impressed

IUMO4veXhDE81STxCzYH8A.text: Amazing place...but there is something about Asian servers and customer service...its like water and oil...too bad: I guess their food can just served by it self...over all it is delicious and for sure its a "let's do it again"

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smeeeeeeell sooooo gooooood! Happy birthday Dominica....love you forever

y6s2lTTKhcKN4BwZi9oRZw.text: This is a bitter sweet review. Talking about his place will only make it more popular! Great great great sushi, high quality, made-to-order. I could barely get out my order before Maynor had the rolls made and was handing them to my wife and I. Great flavor, no errors, solid recommendations. My wife asked me to take notes but they made the rolls too fast, I couldn't follow.  Definitely try number 16. Wet Dream, you won't regret it.

xar8z1eW_5gt39RugClehQ.text: There have been times when the food tastes great, then others when the fish's freshness is questionable. There are better options in Chinatown that aren't far away. One time I had the salmon and it just tasted old. A little dry, smelled fishy.

lcMZq5jUg6-dpLgfmk2N9w.text: The food was terrible. I heard great things about this place but unfortunately it was one of the worst sushie I have ever had. I ordered The Man whore roll and The Vegas roll and it tasted like store bought sushi, the rice was mushed together and the fish itself tasted like fish I didnt even like the eel sauce! I was extremely hungry when I ate here and ended up forcing myself to finish the roles . I also asked for extra ginger and wasabi which I did not receive unfortunately I will not be returning.

umAVEWVxWWhKu6vhBWC3OA.text: Very Disappointed!! Been here 8-10 times over the years and was always good. Came here with friends on 01/07/17 and rolls were chewy, nigiri looked old, very poor quality sushi, hope for their sake this was a bad day.

5jpq0wm_i6H6U9NI42-pKg.text: Food amazing. Service amazing. Staff super friendly.  Our first day living in las vegas and we already found a small gem. I'll definitely invite my friends and family to dinner here.

hSYnqiuGj1BxkyPfJq_3uA.text: I've been going to Yama for years, and it is always  consistent and so tasty. Great selection, fast and friendly service. I've never had a bad experience. Favorite rolls: The Ellen, Spicy Sexy, No Name, and don't miss the spicy seafood salad - shrimp and fresh chunks of salmon and tuna, marinated in the most amazing sauce. You'll want to keep the sauce to dip your sushi in...or...maybe just drink it.

xaL8d9amEphAzN9ptOKvsg.text: If I had written this review a year or so ago, I would've given it a higher rating because at that time, the service was way better.  As of the last several months, the times we have gone in there - it's been not so great.  The service is slow, trying to get refills on drinks is a joke, ordering rolls & having them forgotten, getting the wrong rolls, etc.    The food is good - that's what keeps the rating from dropping lower.  I love the Son of a Beach roll.  The gyoza is super tasty.  The mochi often comes out so frozen that you have to let it sit for a few before eating it otherwise it's a struggle (I know - first world problem).    The price is just right for AYCE...I just wish the service was better.

iEukngGx-xVZmmc41bZ-Nw.text: This is my favorite place near me. The Ayce all you can eat is a must. I go here about once a week the workers are always friendly even other guest. I go sit at the bar a lot and rarely have i been to a place where other people are so open and friendly especially where this place is located.    Great sushi is not Fresh or too aged but this place is a great balance, Since i eat here a lot i have noticed difference at times. The first thing I order when I sit down is the Seafood Salad, That is eff'in awesome must have it and it is included in the AYCE. I order the Snow in Vegas and the Man whore. those things are my must haves before i order anything else.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Man Whore and Snow in Vegas

bwO7B-SKL7VIAtNhJhD2Uw.text: What happened Yama? Your quality took a nose dive off a cliff into a heap of mediocrity and bad sushi rice.   I used to love this place and made a point to come here every time I visited Vegas. For  under $30, AYCE sushi rolls is tough to top, and I guess something had to finally give at Yama. The quality truly is noticeably worse and the rolls are now stuffed with a higher rice to fish ratio. To make matters worse, even the sushi rice quality seemed to have declined as both the texture and flavor are subpar.   On prior visits, I would have given Yama four stars, but based on my most recent visit, I can't give it more than two. Hopefully, they bounce back and I can edit this review later.

BZejoC62xi8z0aoEpGO0SQ.text: Ordered the All You Can Eat.  The three of us ordered 15-20 different items.  All tasted great.  The "Man Whore" roll was outstanding.  To top it all off, great people, great service.

RW-mN8V_jivc4oBjUe-cgg.text: I don't know how this place has 4 stars. I've given it a try a couple times since it's near UNLV and cheaper than most AYCE places but nothing redeems this place of how below-average the sushi and service is. This place is crowded often but don't let it fool you, it's in a crowded area plus it's near the strip. The sushi is terrible. Their rice is always falling apart and the fish never tastes fresh. Plus their service is flat out rude. And if you don't want to take my word for it then take the Health District's word for it. THEY GOT CLOSED IN JUNE TWICE FOR FAILING THEIR HEALTH INSPECTION. And have gotten numerous C's in the past, many times getting over 30 demerits. Google it.  The last time I went, when my friend and I arrived the hostess seemed peeved we were waiting for the rest of our party. We didn't even insist we sit down at a table but she had attitude about us waiting. When we got to our table it was 2:50 and they tried to charge us dinner prices which we had to fight them about. (And who wants to do that?) If your menu has lunch prices till 3PM then it's lunch prices till 3PM. Its not a hard concept. It's not like a buffet where we are trying to get lunch prices for a dinner buffet..it's the same shiz.  One last person arrived at 2:59 and they made a stink that HE absolutely had to pay the dinner price. Okay fine, take your extra 3 dollars you crazy people.  Then we ate and I definitely didn't eat my moneys worth. Sushi looks like it's from a grocery store. Nothing special, tastes old.  I'm sorry but when your sushi is gross don't be so determined to charge the higher price. They were rude about the whole process too and like I said, the sushi sucks.  The first time I went there they started bringing rolls no one ordered and when we said that they argued with us then and put it on our table anyway. This business does not know how to pick their battles or treat their customers. It's scary going to a sushi place like this because they WILL argue you for more money, even when they're clearly in the wrong.   Sakana across the street is much better and relatively the same prices.

-I5eHqkWJ56s7u6CZFBLFQ.text: Lunch: 11am-3pm $20.95/person Dinner: 3pm-11pm $23.95/person  Fish is fresh considering this place is in the middle of the dessert. Their menu offers a large selection of classic sushi rolls as well as nigiri and appetizers. The have a lot of house special sushi rolls as well.   Service was great. The guys making the sushi were so hardworking and nice--even during peak hours.   Must try: Seafood salad, sun of the beach (roll), and the double dragon (roll). Mind you, I'm a big fan of unagi (eel) and tempura, so I only kept my eye out for the rolls that had those in it.

HY2-RjAbeE7atLFbCENhJw.text: If you're not a local, DON'T COME HERE. Sitting next to a local and their service was way better. Their food came out faster and the servers came to them 10 or 15 more times then our table. We ordered the short ribs and they got their short ribs in two servings before ours. OMG. The locals were literally 2 feet away from our table. Food was not that great. Philadelphia roll was the best. They honored my avocado allergy.

UJxcv2DCs_v-Y_7RtyoLVg.text: My aunt and cousin brought me here for the first time after raving about how delicious it is for hours and I LOVE IT!! My fav was the No Name roll and the Man Whore! The place was def packed but it was a 10 min wait for 5 of us and the service was pretty fast after ordering. The best way to do it is to do the all u can eat sushi with a group of ppl and sample everything u can. Make sure u finish everything cuz they will charge u for what ever u leave.

LZsP5I1gfra7wwkQm2m5gg.text: Great sushi and sashimi. Good price. Perfect service. Not normally a sushi lover but when sushi is like this I could eat it 24/7.

teNAZwBMUXHLvURuRm_rMA.text: If I'm in the mood for AYCE sushi I go straight for YAMA SUSHI!! It has about the cheapest AYCE that I have seen (22.99$) and they other lots of different kinds of rolls, appetizers, and the sushi is FRESH :) The staff is also very friendly and attentive, which I really like in an AYCE place as I frequently want to order more and more and more.. AND they double check your order   Unlike some other AYCE sushi places they offer hamachi kama (and salmon kama too!) this is one of my favorite dishes and it is certainly delicious ::drools:: I like to take the lemon from my water and spurt some citrousy goodness on it, but that's just me. The agedashi tofu its ehh, the batter around it is kind of rubbery and hard to eat after its been in the sauce for... well right when it was delivered. They might not offer as many appetizer as other AYCE places (Oyshi sushi) but they offer a different variety and it is tasty.  The sushi is very fresh and the cuts of fish are large. I LOVE the albacore, it melts in your mouth and it had just a dash of siracha. The yellowtail, garlic tuna and giant clam are also super yummy.  The ice cream is quite good as well! They offer red bean, green tea, and plum. They also have mochi :d  If you're thinking about getting AYCE sushi try this place out! The food will not disappoint. However, it is kind of crowded and usually busy so if you're not into that type of atmosphere be warned. They have one large room for big groups so if you have one they can accommodate you, but you'll probably need a reservation. Happy eating!!

76rJcjr5aQUAreTKg1Lugw.text: This place is a hidden gem. Make sure that you try snow in vegas. I have tried everything on the menu and this is certainly the best roll.

fu4pyIgt8PpmUE9pfruDXQ.text: NASTY!!!!! Why do Americans always wanna put sauce on sushi?  Sushi is not to be drowned in sushi. Since moving to the States from Japan it's been really difficult to find s good sushi place

tqNBBzPQDvBPBatnIGjuXQ.text: We love this place! Really friendly and fast service.  We had the all you can eat option and it was incredible! Great quality food! Thanks! We will be back again for sure. :)

CwWUDdX_Wzjjra8MnPC4fw.text: Some of the best sushi! I hope they invest in a bigger venue. It's always busy.

wOcGapgJ0-CZiMG9Z7GRyw.text: I've been here twice. Both times it was a great experience. The food was delicious and the service was quick and efficient considering how busy it was. Be prepared to wait at least 30 mins during dinner time. For the people who left a negative review, I dont think you should be complaining when you're paying $25 for ALL YOU CAN EAT sushi. C'mon seriously, if you want top notch quality sushi, go somewhere else and pay the price for it. It just doesn't make sense. If anything I thought the quality was awesome for the price I paid.

rDKxxINWCKj14tTRIWMN3Q.text: Yama.. you never disappoint and tonight was no exception! The best customer service, friendliest waitresses and awesome sushi chefs! I'm thankful for the AYCE menu because I'm able to try something new every time but my favorite is always the Yama Crunch roll.

uAlUC1uyEk8gonjEsV0GnQ.text: Love their spicy seafood salad! its always fresh and is the best! best AYCE sushi joint ive been to! Its where we go every time we are in Vegas and thats quite often!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy seafood salad is the best! Everything is good!

mOnjXUPJpalkB1nVoq_wvA.text: whoever thought the idea of all you can eat sushi would be a good idea was an idiot. a group of 18 and i went to Yama at 2pm for AYCE sushi. at least half of us were hungover, so the thought of scarfing down roll after roll didn't sound that appealing to me. but i'm never one to turn down a buffet opportunity so i gave in.  i was so confused about the ordering process of the place. i totally imagined a bar with tons of different types of sushi that we can pick up ourselves. instead, we filled out the menus, which were then sent to the sushi chefs ... i think there were at least 3, to be made. for a sushi buffet, i was impressed that they still made their food fresh. there were so many different types of rolls, as well as their own concocted ones, which had really interesting, yet inappropriate names to it.   one of my friends ordered the wet dream (that was really sweet), and other rolls donned names like who's yo daddy and happy ending and more nasty names that i wish i remembered. i had the harry potter, which had tuna on top and was a cucumber roll.   the buffet also extended to appetizers and desserts. the seafood salad was awesome and our table was filled with different flavors of mochi (vanilla, strawberry, mango, and like 3 more flavors) and ice cream (green tea, red bean, plum!!!) by the end of the meal. also, everyone lost track of what they ordered, so we all ended up taking a roll or two and passing it down the table. so i had no idea what i was eating most of the meal. eventually all the rolls began to look and taste the same. some had different names but was identical in ingredients.   it got really bad by the end because all the rolls came first and then the sushi. we ended up with like 6 full plates of salmon and the same amount of tuna that everyone claims they didn't order. the rule was that we had to finish everything, or else we had to pay for everything we ordered at individual prices, which would have cost a fortune. thankfully my table had some eaters and we were able to demolish most of the sushi and rolls.   considering how the sushi is intended for buffet use, with lesser quality of ingredients, everything was still really good. definitely worth the $22.99 for AYCE sushi.  and major props to our two or three waitresses accommodating a 19 person group. :)  would i do it again? yes! but give me a few months to recover :)

2_17Wz4TX2jCyvhv4VEnRg.text: it's ok. nothing great. service feels fast food like. they want you in and out as quick as the food comes out. food was ok... nothing stood out

cBf17N5EjQcOKMx8zJ8EnA.text: The best AYCE sushi and the friendliest staff. Their food is always on point. The wait time is long when you have a big party but it's wort it.

IPEDg1e4hMwmS63R_1qa9g.text: So today I went here and eat  the food was ok. :\ Not exactly cause there was rude service. There was this supervised I was really disappointed cause she try to kick us out. She even made us eat or we will pay I know that the rule and it's ok when she tried reminding us she said it in a rude way. The last time I ate there I stopped eating there for like 5-7 month,  the last time there she did the same thing. This time she did the same thing again but now worst she as if we were the half and half family **** she. She not allow to say that.

JFSs21AVRKbjkrzwNk_h6g.text: So this place I personally think is the best AYCE sushi in Las Vegas! not only is it affordable but also the sushi is great!  Especially their baked rolls, and all for around 25 bucks.  Its the best AYCE sushi in Las Vegas, hands down

h7qAn2oqNK3AjPlaLWJmsA.text: This place was recommended by a friend from Florida who I happen to see at the MGM. The decor is simple, but the food is amazing. I went with the "All You Can Eat" and it was so worth it, since I normally run away from the concept. I can't remember what rolls I had but I started with the Seafood Salad which I'll recommend to anyone. It's spicy, tangy and yummy! The chefs really know how to blend flavors. Yama is about 15 minutes away from the strip but it's so worth the cab ride. I'd recommend this place to anyone heading to Vegas.

gdylWI2-e1PphHRgr_D1gQ.text: There were quite a few FOB Japanese eating there, which usually a good sign that it'll be good. Super cute little hole in the wall, hidden in a really ghetto strip mall. Tourists pls note that this isn't the best area of town, so I be sure to lock your car door. It's next to a grocery store, so the parking lot should be pretty well lit at least.   My friend wasn't familiar with all you can eat, and felt a little pressured by the waitress to order quickly and not ask questions. But overall service was really attentive, and nice that the waitresses were speaking to each other in Japanese (meaning theyr'e not Korean run like most sushi places lately).    I may have found a new fav sushi place, although it's mainly based off of the awesomeness of a couple specific items. The menu had a decent selection of nigiri and specialty rolls, didn't have as much variety on sides as most other places. I could taste the vinegar in the rice more than others, some people like that, I'm not a huge fan. The nigiri and specialty rolls we tried were just so so, but I would go back soley for the salmon kama (grilled collar), the amaebi (sweet shrimp), and the ice cream.   I've had salmon and hamachi collar at sushi mon and island sushi, it was good, but nothing special. The salmon collar at Yama was probably the best salmon I've ever had. It had quite a bit of meat still on it, grilled to be really crispy on the outside, so rich and perfectly cooked on the inside. With the lemon and whatever sauce they give you on the side it was just heaven. Salmon collar on it's own is already $9 so you may as well just get the ayce.    Amaebi wasn't served as nigiri sushi - it was just the raw shrimp on its own w/out rice. Sweet, and texture was firm not mushy like it often is. I ordered it with the head, which was freshly fried - crispy, yum.   You can order more than 1 ice cream if you want. They also had variety of mochi ice cream flavors instead of just vanilla, strawberry - they had chocolate, mango, etc. The green tea ice cream was also the best my friend and I had ever had. It's store bought, not housemade but for some reason it stood out from the green teas I've had in the past. It was creamy and you could really taste the green tea.   Especially factoring the cheap dinner price, I'll definitely be back here sometime soon.

lVK9UCoDAE21f9v5Zdv1Qg.text: Great service, they're pretty fast! It's by far the best ayce sushi place I've been to. Presentation is amazing. 2 words SEAFOOD SALAD!!

NPhkKcCDtcsjOna7WV7TmA.text: This place was packed when I got there but good thing it was just me and my brother so we were seated at the bar quickly. But my chair scared the crap outta me. the chair was wobbly and i didn't want to lean back. Moving on, I liked the all the sushi we tried out but I felt really cramped for some reason. lol service was attentive and made sure my glass was always full. Mochi ice cream was awesome! And you're not limited to one order of ice cream :)   I recommend this place, but do come before the dinner rush. Once I got outside there seemed to be around 20 people waiting to be seated.

YRpmY3mTAl8hT0LuTSfd1Q.text: Crazy good service! Above and beyond. Great food! Go try it.

PffAIBASjiJESl2Ibm8izg.text: The sushi is very good. You can try fru-fru- rolls that you hadn't bought before because they were too expensive. There are some rules about not ordering more than a couple of rolls at a time. Appetizers are included, and some items (probably due to expense) are you-get-one-only.   This said, all the rolls were uniformly delicious and well prepared, and fresh. The crab is real crab.   Service is generally pretty good. When they get slammed, things can slip, but they're easily reminded you're waiting for something. It was a good experience. Not super-stellar, but pretty good. I'll probably return. Go hungry. Go with friends. It's about $25 for AYCE.

DH0eTF8I8GnXV_y8ZxmchQ.text: I don't know how many times I've been here, but I LOVE IT. Best ayce sushi that I've been to (I don't frequent ayce spots often either). Their fish is really fresh and I love their 1:1 fish to rice ratio. After going to another ayce restaurant (*cough* Goyeman), this place is a holy grail. At Goyeman, the rice was 3x more than the actual fish in a nigiri (we even have pictures) and all of the servers are either unbelievably stupid or have zero knowledge on what sushi is supposed to look like. Even one the chefs came over to personally apologize to us and told us that he was so embarrassed to see the ratio we were given. Anyways, this review isn't supposed to be a rant about how terrible Goyeman was lol Service was quick, friendly, and attentive. We get our orders out almost immediately even though we order A LOT of nigiris at once. Their uni is really fresh and I recommend trying their white tuna. I definitely recommend this place if you're looking to satisfy your sushi cravings in large quantities since their fish is really fresh, the provide good portions, and service is very quick. They are almost always busy as well, however I prefer this location way more than their other location since parking is easier to find.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qqLEwJt48qyk1Uw1mnikwg.text: Come here all the time and it never disappoints. During the week the food comes out really quick but the weekends are really busy so be equipped to wait a little longer. So worth it though!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love love love this place

cjFy-fJlv-a_TQHuhErQNw.text: Ok I'm not really sure how a landlocked city like Las Vegas is capable of finding high quality fresh sushi grade fish, and consistently, but consider me convinced. This is one of the best AYCE sushi spots I've ever had not just in Las Vegas but anywhere. We stick to mostly the Nigiri which is a significant portion of fish to rice, and the rainbow roll is a winner. The Sake specials are pretty good and I would say for $30 you can't get a better deal for a meal.

TIvdZO2WSO9PD5TIU6iwbw.text: Awesome place! The best ( accidental) find of the trip. Supermen (with eel ) was everyone's favorite, that's why we remember the name, we also spicy tuna, Hawaiian ,  Harry Potter, man whore, no name, volcano, one minute man, special hobo and all of those were great, not one piece left on the plate.  Couple of us didn't take a buffer, they got chicken udon- both loved it!  The only regret is that it's so far from home... we all wished there were more sushi places like that.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8b_yq2yPKw4u1yfBhgHzsA.text: This is our go-to place for AYCE sushi in Las Vegas.  It isn't too far from the strip, and they have a decent selection to choose from. There's decent parking since it's at a strip mall.  I would recommend the sashimi salad since you get a lot of fish and the uni (too bad both are only 1 per customer).  Also, soft shell crab is always good. I think just getting those 3 above gets you your money back, everything else you order is money well spent.  There can be a wait so try to get there before the lunch / dinner rush.  As a comparison, we went on 12/23 at about 5pm and the only free seats were at the bar.

PNLGzejRSkNykWe6h_UtrQ.text: The restaurant was wonderful! The food was delicious, the wait staff was attentive, and the restaurant seemed clean and put together. It was a nice night out. My husband and I thought that we found our new sushi restaurant. That was until about five hours later when I was sitting on my toilet hold a trash can. Listen, I only eat at all you can eat sushi restaurants and This was the first time that I got sick. Learn from my mistakes and spend a few extra dollars on a different sushi restaurant rather than getting really sick and wasting The next few days stuck in the bathroom.

lSVclhM0N8anF3NlfoXSew.text: The BEST all you can eat (AYCE) sushi in LV.  The kama is the best!

urT8axsiweB5tumq5CxpNw.text: Good Gordon!  These guys just give me the feels somethin fierce! AYCE on a Friday night and each roll made fresh to order. Ate the top 3 rolls (7, 24,27) as well as some of the top class nigiri and spicy tuna I've ever had. This place is a great find, deal, and worth while experience. Parking is terrible and its not a gourmet sushi joint like Sugar Fish in LA but if you want to throw down some serious sushi for $24 this is the place!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U-SmvkspSvwe7acf-GP1jw.text: It's a good deal for an AYCE sushi restaurant. They have a wide menu variety that's also offered as AYCE which many other sushi restaurants don't do. For example, you can order udon, yakitori, and other appetizers along with some rolls.   Everything I tried was okay. The rolls were somewhat underwhelming. The fish quality was just okay and the sushi rice, to be honest, wasn't very good. But I guess for $24 AYCE I can't be too upset about it. The service was good, and the waitresses constantly made sure we had everything we needed and that our waters were refilled. I just wish the sushi was better, because after the first two rolls I didn't want to order any more, so I just stuck to the nigiri.

PkqEBoc6PFB4js70U520Iw.text: Went on Christmas Day for the first time because Sakana was closed. I give 3 stars for the wide selection of items but left the remaining two stars for the different rolls with same repeated items and not a very good taste. The environment is pretty chill. I prefer the all you can eat sushi buffet near Yama(Sakana) It taste better although slower then Yama.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DfDcYGuaYnSrsPKGK2TjuA.text: Spicy Hawaiin roll was very good, little rice and small size, and enough heat too! Wet dream, man whore, happy ending, no name, soft shell hand roll, palm job, hamachi Kama was good. Dynamite was bad, too much mushroom. Giant clam nigiri wasn't fresh.

hPA6Ze-_gBruizhcjtOOVg.text: Honestly, we were a little skeptical based on the location of this place, but the sushi was amazing, super fresh. We definitely felt rushed by the server though, probably bc this place gets really busy and seating is limited, but that's the only complaint. The food came super quick. It's a great place if you're just grabbing a quick bite.

m6_au3No0lf9EiqYQLZXAg.text: All you can eat sushi... that's right. Located a hop, skip and a jump from the LV strip in a local strip mall makes this a gem of a spot for sushi lovers. There is another location on the other side of town. For the price you would pay for about 2 rolls, you can get all you can eat soup, salad, appetizers, sushi and ice cream. Not just any sushi but a menu filled with dozens of specialty rolls that you won't find many other places. My favorite apps are the shrimp tempura, soft shell crab, teriyaki chicken and the miso soup. Favorite rolls are the shrimp lovers roll, Baby one more time, double dragon and the wet dream roll baked with cream cheese. Yum!   Service is efficient and the food comes out quick. A few things to note are that ther is no sharing allowed, you have to eat the whole roll including the rice and you will be charged extra for food with large quantities left over. So order small amounts, go slow and if you're starting to feel full but still want to try something ask for a half roll.    This place is popular and can get busy at times. So understand that there may be a wait. But it is so worth it.

2rxBIzcpcdgd5J9MuMRKzw.text: When we arrived, there was a line, and some people were waiting outside as well. We finally got to sit down after 20+ minutes of waiting. This place was PACKED, and for good reason. You can't beat the price for the quality of sushi they serve! We ordered the Eat-All-You-Can Dinner for $25.00, and it INCLUDED Uni, Toro AND Ikura!! Where else can you get this kind of a deal?! We were only allowed one order of uni, but the fact that it was included blew our minds.  It really is worth the wait to get this much good food for $25. You simply cannot complain about "slow" service because you can't have it all. Remember the most basic restaurant characteristic choices you have - "Price / Quality / Service...Pick TWO". If you put more value in fast service, go to a fast food restaurant. OR... you can do what we did. We sat at the counter. Food came quickly because the itamae-san was right in front of us and we could directly tell him what we wanted.

uGBE9hcBUeFACU7zv8w0LA.text: Coworker and I had lunch here, it was decent.   Parking lot is large, found parking spot pretty quickly, though it is shared with the plaza and Albertsons near by.   We got seated right upon entering during lunch, it wasn't too full while we were there, and it was kind of nice as it is very narrow walking through the area and seating was a bit tight also.  This place was okay, heard a lot about it, but once my coworker and I ate there our first and only time thus far, we weren't blown away by anything out of the ordinary for all the hype heard, not the sushi nor the decor truly stood out.. It wasn't bad, just not a favorite, I had a few good rolls, though there lacked creativity in the combinations, most of them seemed repetitive, with lots of salmon and cream cheese, the fish variety was decent, service wasn't bad either rolls were brought out fairly quick, our check took a bit to arrive but it was fine, overall just left us a bit unsatisfied though full, but I don't think I'll be back in a while as I rather go to Sakana if I'm in this area in all honesty.

SDL40QnIWDrKOTGvb4zDzQ.text: It was time to try a new AYCE sushi for my new on arrival in Las Vegas ritual.  Our experience here was certainly more miss than hit.  Poor sushi rice is a tough knock against an all you can eat restaurant that requires you to eat the rice when you order nigiri. Somewhere between mushy and crusty, this sushi rice was not anywhere close to correct or enjoyable.  Fish was variable. Salmon (farmed) was fresh, Maguro was pleasant yet unremarkable, hamachi good, Unagi reasonable.  Scallops were a miss. I have a suspicion that they had been frozen for a good long while before finding the plate due to their strange, watery texture.  Tempura prawns were limp and just unfortunate. Not close to crisp and hot out of the fryer.   All in all, I found this experience underwhelming and not really the best value. A select couple of nice cuts of fish saved my lunch from being terrible.  Service was better than the food.

nRpm89UyQMb75PMNbJsU5g.text: My friend found a live cockroach in her eel sauce. Enough Said. It Was Pretty Gross It Took Employees 5 Minutes To Remove Her Eel Sauce. Once The Manager Arrived She Apologized & Said It Was Because She Was Sitting By The Door.
