lSh1PNgxP7QLxcODNJ_1RQ.text: Great sushi ! I love the customer service too . Super friendly and professional. Totally recommend

mq2es1T3OI8Ytxhr1uXQfA.text: Ate there for lunch today and we both had the Hershey squirts. Will never eat there again. We had all you can eat sushi and poke salad.

zdd9A5JLsqJxuQslZjK0BA.text: Place has been pretty good for sushi when I have gone out with my coworkers, but I think quality has been hit or miss.I was greeted right away and asked for a table since the bar was full. As I passed by for a possible table of 4, I was parked in a corner right up next to the cash register. Tight. I was worried my co-worker would have to squeeze into their seat and sure enough it was. I asked about the empty table that we walked by earlier, but that was only for four people. Oh well, we were both too hungry to be too picky. Had the all you can eat sushi lunch as usual and it started pretty good. Ordered the Seafood Salad in both spicy and mild. It's basically all fish without the rice. Nice, but you get only one order per person with AYCE. The spicy Seafood Salad was a little too spicy for me, but the mild was much better. Ordered the Harry Potter roll and that was my least favorite. No real outstanding flavor and the fish did not taste sushi quality. The more simple sushi options like tuna, salmon, and whit tuna rolls were better than the Harry Potter on, but still not getting that really clean ocean taste that I have had here before. Plenty of servers though. So I was able to get service pretty quick, although me sitting right next to the register might have something to do with it as different severs had to close out checks and tables. A plus maybe? The Eel handroll, had rice, cucumbers, avocado, and eel. One of my avocado slice still had the skin on as I was eating it. Boo. My coworker said her Eel handroll was fine though.   Overall, service here is good and friendly. I would come back for the Seafood Salad alone as that was the freshest tasting item we had. Unfortunately, my friend and I did not feel well after our lunch and concluded it's from the not also fresh batch of rolls we had last. My friend said may not come back, but I might give it another try at a later date in hopes today was an off day.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eel handroll.

3xSY6ITT-ovsmJcIBZfyoA.text: Best Sushi in Vegas for sure!.   I have eaten here twice and it is amazing and ALWAYS busy.   There will generally always be a wait to get in so be prepared for that.   This place has very high quality sushi on an all you can eat deal that is outstanding.     Both times I have eaten here the food was amazing and the service was mediocre.   But once you order the food gets to you pretty fast.    I recommend this place to all and will certainly go back here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PEk7G3HzqRBSSWzyPhKftg.text: Came here for my third time while in Vegas. There is always a wait but luckily when we arrived it was only 20 mins.  Our party of 4 ordered all types of rolls, green muscles and sushi. I can't remember the names of all the rolls we ordered but I do know the rolls here have weird ass names. All of our food came out fast!  The cool thing is you can order half rolls here.  A must try is the seafood salad! It's huge and very tasty. I got it spicy. Unfortunately, I ordered it after eating  tons of rolls. If I had ordered it first, I probably  would have ordered 3 of them! So good!  Dessert is also included: ice  cream or mochi! The red bean and mango mochi was very good.  Highly recommended  this place.

DJ_E5Tztc01Vg9WnjKZvXQ.text: Sushi were good! But the place is too small and crowded. I wish they have a bigger space.

WvLbjwoQiJ_U3SZsovOgdg.text: Love this place. Always fresh and good.all you can eat is worth it. The short ribs are bomb.

i97U9ZrqHflx5WEHJFifNQ.text: Yama Sushi was exactly as advertised. Came for lunch at noon and the place was packed with a line outside. Found a spot at the bar and was very well taken care of by sushi chef and waiters. Had some issues with the temperature of the beer and the waiter quickly and professionally took care of it. The sushi was good and plentiful. I have never had AYCE sushi. Service excellent and friendly too. Yum!

umVMfnXJGrbaIw_FJgYqaQ.text: Another year, another review for my favorite sushi place in town. I have tried lots of AYCE sushi places and yet I always come back to Yama. I just commented to a friend the other day how we've been eating Yama for over 10 years now, and the food is always the same. I've never eaten here and had a bad meal. I love that when you get AYCE, you can get the whole menu at anytime. I love the seafood salad, sun of the beach roll, and the wet dream roll. The rolls are pretty saucy, so if you're not into that I would say skip this place.   The seafood salad is unlike anything I've been able to find. There is no lettuce in this salad. It's a few different types of sashimi with mild or spicy ponzu sauce and sliced radish. It is seriously the best salad I've ever had. Yama gives one seafood salad per person with AYCE which is a steal because ala carte it's like $12. Yes this place is busy and small, but they must be doing something right. Lunch is $21.95 and dinner is $24.95. They are going to open a Yama 2 soon, so be on the lookout for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sun of the beach roll
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood salad

1pvh4UYlAgxvJAEhu5WHxw.text: Absolutely delicious!!! Fresh and unique. Very glad the original restaurant we were going to, was closed because we found this hidden gem!!! You have to try the wet dream roll...melts in your mouth.

ZPwQ6lvB5mQpgVLyTmaL1A.text: Amazing. Manor is fantastic!  Had a great time!  Will definitely come back.  Had a lot of sushi in my life and our meal was truly amazing

0dDUSs48XgfcG78JaQhAvQ.text: Great value!! Love this place everytime I go. The names alone, are worth the experience. My favorite is the "wet dream." Drink prices are great and all you can eat for $25 is great.

Kid-HhvzDStIKbgrwWBzqg.text: Are you looking for a great all you can eat sushi?  Well this is the best place! Not only the service is amazing! But extremely tasteful!! The staff is very likeable and polite! Sexy Mexican has top gun service! And they prep your food at a fast pace. Really good place! I recommend it

3r9PEqs2utrCz7u_gwnneg.text: I am surprised and impressed by this place. When I first thought about all you can eat sushi, I was a bit leery. We eat a lot of sushi in a lot of different cities and have had some of the best and some of the worst and I was expecting the worst from all you can eat. Wow what a surprise.  Everything was relatively fresh. The service was great. The all you can eat menu is extensive and there are a lot of delicious things to be had on there along with nigiri. The only downfall to all you can eat is that if you don't eat what you order, they charge you for what's left over, but that's not a problem for us as we are sushi hounds. This is definitely one of our favorite places to hit when we are in Vegas every two or three months.

X69XOvqSIFijT2tU6Ad0-Q.text: Tripped on this place by accident and found the pot of gold!  Great service and excellent food!  We already decided this is a must for us whenever we roll through town

yHWcu58PGrXzkIsgtVJbdA.text: Nice restaurant off the strip to get your fill of sushi! Lots of options and great quality. Wish we had AYCE sushi spots back home :/

6dhoBR7XgGx7IKv-P_FHoA.text: This is my go to spot every time I come to Vegas. Why waste money on the strip when Yama Sushi is around!!

c2TTdF158F6Jkgkc5qlaJA.text: Best sushi place in Vegas HANDS down!!!!!! The place is ALWAYS packed but they always make sure they seat you fast!! Servers are always polite & kind... Food always comes on time! I really can't complain about this place! They have not disappointed me yet...

NjLSxQAUseoKvBPQqa19Gw.text: My experience was out of this WORLD! The food was great and the servers definitely took really good care of me. I told them my steak wasn't cooked to my preference and they brought a new one back to me within minutes.

jMmWc8zGP7x4TESzU7s5bg.text: This sushi place is amazing!!! I had a reservation of 27 people, it was really busy tonight the host that was taken care of our reservation did a amazing job! I think her name was Karen, she seated us on time, making sure we were seated comfortably, another lady that was helping us, she made sure we all had our utensils gave us everything we needed, food came out on time plus I didn't feel like we had to wait for anything, I called her Filipino Mafia lol!!! Food taste fresh and excellent!! I will definitely be back!

CZnoxWKrpeJHAFMZOJ9NMQ.text: My friend introduced me to this place. It was about a 30 minute drive from my apartment, but I was willing to make that drive for the sushi. I always do all you can eat, which is the most affordable I've found in town. The iced green tea is also good. My favorite rolls are the wet dream, snow in Vegas, sun of the beach, and man whore. But honestly, I've liked everything I've tried and have had pretty much every item on the specialty roll menu. I've moved across country and am bummed I can't frequent this place anymore. I've been craving their sushi for weeks!

9rGp1f4JCSLGwCzVKJYWfQ.text: Avails if you can. My family and I were lured in by the yelp reviews. Fish didn't taste fresh. It all tasted like something you would buy from the walmart sushi isle at their supermarket. I know Walmart doesn't sell sushi. But if they did they would sell yamas sushi. There are a lot of AYCE places better than this.   Next time we're in Vegas. We are avoiding this restaurant.

nbkOAx4qwntkDWBcINgr2A.text: Not my favorite place to go for sushi but it's decent. It's pretty much always busy. So expect a bit of a wait. They have great sushi rolls but I normally order the nigiri. I'm not really impressed with their quality of the fish they used on their nigiri. There are times that I'd have to wait forever or even have to wave over someone to just refill my drinks & order more food. Kind of irritating considering it's AYCE & you're on a time limit.

sSEVY7g8vvZJTAFQ2Vx38g.text: This place is great! All you can eat sushi is the way to go and make sure you sit at the sushi bar. The chef was very friendly and had our sushi made within minutes of ordering! So yummy youll def leave extremely full.   AYCE pricing  Lunch: $20.95 Dinner: $23.95

0ZpJwQIGM7AzvTNtWLzNfA.text: Came after a friend recommended the ayce. Seated immediately. Tip. Be sure to order like 3-4 rolls per person first time they come by to take your order. If you peace yourself by the time they come around to get your order again you will most likely be full. This way you get to experience the food more. Another tio is any roll can be ordered as a half roll. The fish was just outstanding. The rolls delicious and the everything on their huge menu is part of the ayce. This place is amazing. I do wish I lived closer to Vegas. My wife and I love everything ate. We will be coming back here everytime we are in Vegas. One of the best and reasonablely priced sushi places I have every visited.

UPo2igTmC3tGmAjb6XZ0qQ.text: WARNING!  Horrible!!!  My boyfriend has been talking about this place since his visit to Vegas last year.  After our party of 3 was sat at a 2 top and asked to deal with it I was already annoyed.  After ordering and having our drinks brought to us, we were asked to stand up and move.  We initially thought "Great! They are moving us to a larger table!"  Too bad that wasn't the case.  Instead they had us move to another to a 2 top table!!!! Are you kidding me?!?! Then after my boyfriend got his food he and finished 3 pops he found a dead fly embedded into his lemon.  They tried to claim it came in from outside and landed on their food therefore it's not their problem.  WTF kind of thinking is that?!?!!!! They refused to comp his food, and only offered to take it off his drink order.  Calling Health Department now!  We canceled my order before it even got to the table.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Absolutely disgusting!!!!!  Fly buried into the lemon.  They didn&#39;t believe there was a single problem with this!!!!!

pl6fAvi3CRQdDqbT1cUuJQ.text: After eating here several times, I decided this place is good. Can get very crowded on weekends but the staff is extemely fast making sushi. I've found the staff to be nice and it is really good AYCE sushi. Would recommend.

haS3d5b4YzJV2-n5BH7I1w.text: This place does not even deserve half a star. Came here on Thursday afternoon for lunch and then got food poisoning. Been dead for the past two days. Things are just gross there. AVOID.

jKLriAsYFEZsdP2O47WkFQ.text: Being from Hawaii I know my sushi...and this was great sushi.  Not only was everything fresh but I couldn't believe the price.  This was all you can eat sushi for under $30...more like closer to $25.  There is no way that you would be able to find this kind of quality of fish in Hawaii for all you can eat for this price.  It's not only sushi that's on the all you can eat menu, they have edamame, chicken, beef, tonkatsu, tempura, SASHIMI. Say what?  All you can eat sashimi?  No way!   Of course you can also order off of their regular dinner menu also which is very reasonable.    If we lived in Vegas I would be going there every month.  If you are a vegas local, I would highly suggest you try this place at least once.  It's a great place for all types of groups, families, couples.  Parking...free and plenty of it.

V3Y7IejvHaI3KtmMqS-K9w.text: A Vegas fav!!! I come out to Vegas ever so often and this is a usual stop. I usually get AYCE which is around $22-$23 a person--don't quote me on that. What's really good is the salmon and other fish collar that is underneath the appetizer section. Other than those two items, you can find the typical menu items that you usually find in any sushi place. Dessert also comes with AYCE with a choice of one mochi ice cream ball or a scoop of regular ice cream.  My only complaint about this place is the location. Every time I've been here, I've either seen people get into fights, couples cussing each other out, or have a ton of shady people approach you for money. But once you get inside, all is well and yummy!

KBTwpzRs127nG6PIWpLQjg.text: This place is hella busy! I really dunno what all the hype is about this place.   It seems like a any other sushi restaurant.  The food was good, service was ok... but nothing really stood out to me.  If I lived on the east side of town, then I would hit this up again,  but I wouldn't drive out of my way to come here.  There are lots of sushi places on the west side that offer the same taste in sushi.    Overall, food was good.  If your near it, then eat there.  You'll enjoy yourself.  If not, don't drive out of your way.  I'm sure there are other sushi places in your area just as good.

mhrvDshw3xqFp37dRCs2SQ.text: All you can eat sushi and appetizers for around $23 dollars!  Yes, I'm in!  We came here on a Tuesday night and had a group of 6, the wait was around 30 mins and everyone has to be present to get seated.  The rolls were very good.  My favorite were the superman and no name.  The worst rolls were kiss the ass (seriously this shouldn't be a roll, no one likes pepper sauce on sushi) and strip tease (big chunks of cream cheese).  Stay away from those two and all others are pretty good.

djfAND9jcEKnlIpMyspqVA.text: I don't know what the hell people are talking about, this place has the worst sushi rolls I think have ever had anywhere.  The rolls are 90% rice!  Not only that but the rice is disgusting.  So wet and soggy taste like I would imagine old bath water would taste like. Barley any fish at all some pieces were all 100% rice wrapped up.  It was so bad we had to return all 6 rolls and we refused to eat or pay for them until the waitress tried it. She argued with us saying this was sushi rice, When she did finally try it.  She returned it and said sorry would we like different rolls.  Wtf no way we don't want anything with that nasty rice.    Service was horrible, waitress lost our order, and forgot everything we asked for and had to ask her several times to get what we needed.  We ordered a sprite 2x and both times got tonic or soda water.  We had to make them taste that too because they thought we were lying.  When they realized they tried to offer us free soda.  Lol at this point we now are in pure hatred of this place.    The only reason I give 1 stars is because it won't allow me to go lower and it might deserve 1, the only dishes that were good were  Short ribs and seafood salad, and soft shell crab appetizers.    Avoid this place and go somewhere else.

Iuwisv1CryEp-k6HSAvAVw.text: This place has super fresh fish! They even have a great deal on AYCE! This is now my fav sushi spot for nigiri!

lZk14R9uhvPoBvac5uKpvg.text: My husband and I were love this place. And when family or friends in town most of time we came to Yama sushi enjoy the food and friendly staff.. But since the new owner running the restaurant .... We found the food quality , portion and service all went down. Many times we give Yama Sushi a chance. Finally we have to give up and move on......SAD!!!

bM5kukuvEe-tPWQ8vqj-IQ.text: The All You Can Eat is EXCELLENT... huge menu to order from including appetizers, soups, salads, and desert to go with the hashimi and sushi rolls (over 60 different ones).  You can order half rolls to in order to be able to try more rolls without having to eat any entire roll.  Some items can only be ordered once per person (denoted by a red heart), but it's not a big deal.  You must get the seafood salad if you like sashimi (that is the closest you will get to sashimi when getting AYCE).  It is excellent.  Great deal for only $24 for dinner.... if you get 2 rolls and a drink, it's usually more than that.  Military discount only if you are in uniform.

G02T0O6pK_-GcQXEnPrHjQ.text: The food at Yama is still excellent, but I'm getting fed up with how impatient their staff is for you to leave.  Our group goes once a month; we know exactly what we order every time, so it's not like we're wasting their time being chatty and indecisive.  I'm actually pretty conscious of waitstaff and understand how rude it would be to hold up their next table -- for their tip, and for the people waiting in line.  But Yama takes this to a whole new level.  It's bad enough they often stick you in the most cramped, traffic-bumping aisle ways possible.  Many a groin have brushed our table as people try to squeeze past to their seats around us.  The staff have even literally lifted the table next to us, up and over us, to fit more seats somewhere else.  If they could fit a 2-seater in the entrance vestibule where people wait for their table, I'm sure they would.  I'm surprised they haven't removed the hostess stand to fit a folding chair and TV tray for solo diners.  From the time we sit down, to when we're finishing our last roll, is about 30 minutes -- which feels pretty efficient in my mind.  But at that point, they will come clear away all dishes and drop the check.  While you're thinking about dessert, they come clear the papers and napkins, and 60 seconds later, they come make a show of wiping your table while you're still sitting there.  90 seconds later, they come ask if you need anything else, and clear the menus.  45 seconds later, they come take the soy sauce.  If you have the audacity to sit any longer, they come make a show of wiping your bare table a second time.  Sometimes people need a little nudge to get moving, but sometimes it seriously feels like we're being punked, and these ladies could not be hinting any harder.  There are too many great sushi places in this town to be cramped and shushed away like Yama does!

1vHOkeDovmKAAqetv-ByWg.text: This is THE BEST sushi place in Las Vegas HANDS DOWN. I make it a point to eat here at least once a month. It's located off the strip so it's pretty much locals only. This is nice because you don't have to deal with the drunk tourists who wander around. It can get extremely crowded, and if you have a large party you will probably have to work. It's worth it!  The rolls are delicious and fresh. If you like Uni, this is the place to go. You can only get one order per person though so make it count!  For rolls, I recommend the Man Whore and Salmon Loves Lemon rolls. They do have a lot of choices though, so there is something for everyone. I try to try a new roll every time. You can even order a half roll which can be the perfect size when you are starting to get full!   I'm sad that I moved away from Las Vegas and won't get to eat at Yama. But I'll make sure to stop by every time I'm there!

bjO4FQCjNdtcGVHYCbkhoA.text: Our family came here last year and loved it so much that we came back to dine again during the trip.  Food was so fresh and delicious then.  Our whole family was talking about this place for the whole year.  So, on our trip to Vegas for Thanksgivings this year, this was our first stop for our meal.  What happened?  Everything was different.  Most of the rolls were not good.  Fish was not fresh.  The sweet shrimp we ordered were slimy and so yucky i had to spit out.  The hot food we ordered all tasted different.  Did the owner change?  Not sure what is going on.  Our whole family left feeling so disappointed.  Goodbye yama sushi...

SwZC0S3RmunWdkVUFQU9FQ.text: UPDATE 7/16/2014: I'm still a huge fan of this place.  The rolls are delicious, and are still my favorite rolls in Vegas.  Unfortunately, I've downgraded my review because the last number of times that I have been here, the rolls have been drenched in the spicy mayo sauce.  Don't get me wrong, I like the sauce, but they have been putting WAY TOO MUCH on the rolls as of late. I often find myself scraping goops of mayo off of my sushi before I eat it now.  Hopefully this changes.

cgm8wm_3_D29UMvSWBuSjg.text: Never go back again....  food is ok...  For those pricy items allow 1 order per person, such as uni, sweet shrimp, & the sweet shrimps are extremely tiny!!!! very disappointed!!!  the rest of the sushi are just ok... the waitress enforced u to finish the rice otherwise they will charge u with the sashimi price!!! how mean.... totally lost the meaning of All-U-Can-Eat!!! btw, our waitress is very rude too.  i do love the mochi ice cream !! it was my bday they created a mochi ice cream bday cake for me.. it was cute & nice~~  thats why i gave this place 3/5.... otherwise it worth 2/5 only....

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Wj8qeO_Gxn8svPIKW86N2g.text: Not exactly one of my top five choices comes too AYCE sushi. But am always willing too try restaurant once with open mind. I had friends visiting ones that not so much yelpers yelpers but enjoy reading reviews and notice the four stars never been so wanted too give it try. Hell yay! Really all about hanging out with family/friends in life.   We went early since it was holiday weekend plus went on friday night. My friends arrived earlier since it on the opposite town for me. Talk about making first impression is that they let my friends sit down before I arrived. I know some of my favorite sushi spots they won't let you sit down if whole party not together. Once we got sat down looking at the menu really not much different then any other AYCE. I am not much into the speciality rolls more of nigiri. Talk about nice size portion of fish on the nigiri. My taste actually not good thing or my sushi spots non of them cut the fish that thick. I understand people thinking more fish getting better deal looks better. The thing I found at Yama is bigger or thicker cuts not always mean better. I felt like the quality of the fish, and just the overall freshness very blah average at best. The sushi rice was really sub par for me. It lacked any kind of vinegar or just felt like plain rice. Since I had no idea that the fish was cut on the thicker side ordered 12 orders of nigiri too start thinking good kick start. Our waitress like yay that lot. True cause after that had no room too try more of the menu more less any speciality rolls. I did get in green tea ice cream. Good. Again had better at other sushi restaurants. Overall since such competitive market of AYCE and Yama on the opposite side of town stick too the ones I like best.  The service was great definitely four stars comes too never have empty glass. Talk about bringing out the sushi. I was surprise how fast our first round came out between the three of us ordering good round.

ivsREtIOi65bSnIMgIFhkA.text: Omg!!! Discovered this one by accident... It was really good and the prices are very decent ...

oIHDqwGqkfv46Cp1Yrg2uA.text: Best sushi in town for the price. I wish they would expand again, it's almost always busy, but, I guess, that's one reason the sushi is so fresh.  Worth the wait.

wMWNFzbcjGVreinKAJdd0Q.text: This has got to be my favorite sushi place yet!  Coming from Cali, this place is a must whenever we're in town.  The first time I came here was summer '11 & things haven't changed one bit!  This past weekend, my bf and I arrived from a long drive and decided to start our trip off with some delicious sushi.  Although we love to eat, our tummies cannot take that much food... but this time we decided other wise.  Lunch buffet for $20/each -- best choice we made this whole trip!  The rolls we decided to order this time were:  spicy sexy roll (we LOVE spicy foods and this roll in particular will leave your mouth on fiyah!!), you the man too!!, snow in vegas (this one was ehh... the sauce was too sweet for our tastebuds), strip tease (super yummy), Philadelphia roll (x2) and a salmon skin hand-roll.  I also got two orders of miso soup for myself & he got an order of muscles and gyoza.  The food here is amazing & service is pretty good as well.  Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t5xYpzsVHI9w1v5lv1ztnw.text: Woot! I'm a fan! I often will hit up Yama after a big workout to get some quality grub and nourishment in my belly!  For around $27 per person, it's not going to break the bank and like most AYCE places, it's everything included.. Rolls, hand rolls, Sashimi, Nigiri, Dessert... Beer and adult beverages are additional, but I don't often partake in Day drinking after the gym.. though it's been know to happen.. OK maybe ONE beer... for the carbs..  Anyway, it's near UNLV and as a result seems to be popular with the local student population, and it's popular with my group of friends too. check it out.  Happy Eating!

tBOHLe0yv0sMtMKJ4UHYGQ.text: $25 AYCE sushi. That is actually really good. I could probably just stop the review now. Ok, I will. When we were leaving around 7:00 pm on a weekday, it was starting to get super busy. I would anticipate a wait if you go, but it's worth it! AYCE special includes appetizers and desserts...entire menu is AYCE with few rules/restrictions. Yum!

FDf0MMIlvtJtMs1Rm5dQ5g.text: We frequent all the time ! They actually just expanded the store front so the wait isn't as long anymore. One of the better AYCE in town. It's a must. A good spend for your dough.

32Lg8Jkwr6R95QWAtMyUHA.text: I arrived at 4:30pm and they were already starting to take names for a waiting list. The other option (which I choose and highly recommend) is to sit at the sushi bar. Since you have the option of all you can eat or not it doesn't matter. You just flip the menu over to all you can eat menu and go crazy--asking your sushi chef to make whatever you choose. They also came around asking if I wanted appetizers which I had some Miso Soup and tempura shrimp which arrived after my first tray of sushi had already been made by my sushi chef. He wasn't really just mine but as I was sitting at one corner of the sushi bar, the chef that served my area was alert to any orders that were verbally tossed in his direction. Excellent, well prepared and very artistic looking--something you really wouldn't think about being in the middle of the desert but it is True what others have raved about. The Seafood Salad is a must. This truly is good food! Wet Dreams is for connaisseurs.  Sushi is by far, my favorite meal and it is safe to say I look for the all-you-can eat places in each city I go to, simply because I like to eat a lot of it! This would have to rank in the top 5 for sure--go figure.. I still can't believe it--for being a land-locked location.  Knowing when I have reached my limit of sushi,I stopped to allow room for some Japanese Ice cream and mochi ball which is also included in this menu..   It was almost 2 hours later when I was walking out of the place. Or should I say "rolling out" of this place and there were probably 30 people outside waiting to get in. I truly picked the perfect time to go for my meal. The night is still young, not that this matters in a place like Vegas, but if I don't do anything else worth while I know that at least my tummy is happy!

LaXQOogI8OPpsMEnkSFf8Q.text: Excellent service and great food! The all you can eat has a huge selection and if you want more than 2 specialty rolls then it's more than worth the cost.

Zn12IljhE3h44dyI9_fm3g.text: Lots of options for a very reasonable price ($23 for all you can eat), very tasty sushi and great service so would definitely recommend!  Cons: - Not on the strip, bit further out  - Interior is basic

tAevNygQo9fY4zrr_dGHvg.text: The awesome part about this place, is great friendly chefs. chefs here were much better than goyemon.  They were cheerful and encouraging you to try more sushi and don't give you Wierd looks when you order and act like they are doing you a flavor. Similar great quality of sushi.  Would highly recommend this AYCE sushi place. It's great quality and fantastic value for money.  Sashimi salad was just awesome!

NX28w33L_pniKwQcN2SezQ.text: Ayce sushi in Vegas!!! Got overly excited! Came here with my 3 coworkers and tried giant clam, uni, some hand rolls.  Not bad for strip mall ayce sushi lol.  But if you love sashimi and the better cuts of fish go to a nice place... You're in Vegas afterall

w4DJRuvGmEXU12PQBmoq7Q.text: Celebrated our friends 40th birthday dinner. We were a group of 16 and had the best waitress. Ingrid was on top of everything from refills and recommendations. She did a great job keeping the food coming. Sushi was amazing. Highly recommend this place.

0L2iIcq8oXxd3GJXrJeT5A.text: Love the updated space! Remembered our favorites even tho we haven't been there in 6 months! Brought friends from South America and they were amazed by the quality, taste, atmosphere,  etc. Sushi chefs are so fast it's unbelievable!    Loved everything.. already planning our next trip!

x5FtKkyZ8y7z0g82WtE_Gw.text: SPRING BREAK! I think it would be packed but surprisingly we only had to wait about ten minutes to get seated.  The seating seats at least four people per table.  Immediately before we sat our waiter got our order of drinks and got to our table before we ordered.  Yes, finally water service!   One of their famous rolls: Sun of the beach it came out hot and fresh. It was a new sensation for me. If you look on the menu the names are only what you will find in Vegas.  "One minute man"  "Wet dreams"   All in which, made me laugh with my friends.  It was definitely a great conversation to start with.   Especially when deciding what rolls we like to try.  HAHAHhahah.  ONE GOOD THING!!  The rolls are not overpowered by fillers such as crabmeat and Philadelphia cheese.  In this case maintains their five star rating with me.  Also, I love how attentive the waiters were with keeping our glasses full with water and our table with sushi orders.  I know I have Sushi back in Cali but if I am in Vegas this I will make an exception.  ***Fresh rolls: Double salmon roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wet dreams...only in Vegas. Lol
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double salmon and double dragon roll

k_Xn6COb8-90WDdGPOYPxg.text: Good sushi, price okay. I have two grudges... 1)When it came time to pay the bill (I sat at the bar) my cook told the server preparing my bill the wrong rolls ordered (more expensive ones). Since I wrote the menu numbers on my place mat I stood my ground. 2) When the server brought my bill she could have tapped me on my shoulder but instead just took the bill and shoved in front of my face. Again, good food but bad experience.

s2EyYvfHMFALhBl9NUwtnQ.text: I went with my friend because he was in town from L.A. (former resident), and he raved about Yama Sushi. It was my first experience here, but I have to say it was "ok".    The restaurant itself was alright. It seemed clean, and for 1pm on a tuesday, it was pretty busy. The AYCE is standard reasonable price. The 4 rolls we started our order with came at LIGHTNING speed, but the taste was....meh.. To me, it tasted less fresh and more refrigerated.    It seems a lot of the reviews swear by it, but maybe it was my mood that day, but it just seemed very "meh" to me.   The service, however, is very attentive. :)  I gave it three instead of 4 only because I probably wouldn't go back on my own (but I would go if goaded.)

b3fijwW7RYeqyEFoRIOkzA.text: All ingredients are fresh, quality is much better than I expected and the service is very attentive and friendly when not busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh nigiri! =p

MARiqcW5wuhRbJHb5IyMRg.text: No matter what time of the day that I come here the fish is always fresh.  Just a warning though, the wait time on their busier nights is from 45 mins to an hour.   But the demand for delicious and well made sushi is well worth the wait.  I wouldn't recommend bringing a big party (more than 6) because the restaurant isn't that big.    My favorite is Sex on the Beach and Man Whore.  I have always had their all you can eat (AYCE) whenever I come by.  But where they shine is from the nigiri (the plain fish on rice).  The fish is always fresh.  Service is great too, you can flag any server down that walks by and they will help you out.    Their alcoholic selection is good too, I recommend "Sake bombs" (warm sake dropped in a glass of beer [kirin gold is good]).

ORUm2tqa0lIyy6rxJeTddQ.text: Best place I've ever eaten!! The sushi was just amazing. Every single roll of sushi i tried was so good, i could not get enough. The ice cream was very good

4hwu2BRs5jfu4Va5lXdvDA.text: This is my favorite sushi restaurant in town. The service is great, the food is excellent, and the AYCE price is the best I know of.

jaN_6XXq8vT-nV8tX8k5Vg.text: The best all you can eat sushi in Las Vegas, there's a lot of them left and right like on every corner but this one is really the best in all. Its $20 a person for lunch, they do half orders and easy rice. Our favorite rolls were happy rainbow, Japanese lasagna, superman, wet dream. The fish in general is very fresh. Enjoy!!!

A5tU2u333pwKSHmaXy_Zaw.text: Terrible service. There was a reason why I didn't tip the server and before I left, she stopped me and asked me why I didnt pay tip. Seriously?  Okay food.   Try Blue Fin instead

iciBvlUpKftCtzKchc1Pcw.text: REAL sushi lovers, let's be honest - Yama is not that good.  I know a lot of friends who think Yama is the best sushi in town, and to each his own.  But in my opinion, Yama just isn't good.  The restaurant is small.  The service is absolutely horrendous.  I never know who is my actual server or who to order anything from.  They're super strict on their AYCE rules.  And the freshness and quality of ingredients are questionable.    I love baked rolls. And I love cream cheese.  And when I order a baked roll and it comes out room temp, the cream cheese isn't even melted in, and the roll falls apart when I start picking it up with my chopsticks, I'm just sad.  I've given Yama multiple chances to prove me wrong. But each time I decide to go back, they just reaffirm that they're just not that good.  No changes in service, no improvements in quality of food.  Just an overall sad experience.  It's not the absolute worst I've ever had, but it's still very sad.  Save yourself the trouble and go somewhere else if you're a real sushi lover looking for quality rolls, fresh ingredients, and a great experience.

8V1argGpcPf2tALPkZRW-g.text: Great sushi for an amazing price! Don't miss out on this gem in a strip mall on your next trip to Vegas.  It was crowded but it was well worth the wait.

aMRhIDyMrNqgiLgna99VAQ.text: Very good sushi,  friendly. Nice place to eat. Will come back. More cooked rolls than I prefer but they were great and made a few custom raw rolls for us

33GyfzwQjxwNMCEvbH1JAA.text: This is the first place sushi place I've ever ate at. This is the best sushi I've ever had. I would recommend the Harry Potter roll and the Sun of the Beach. Those are my favorite rolls by far. I enjoyed my experience eating here. I've ate at Yama sushi for the first time in 2008. Normally it wasn't busy back then, but since then it has gotten pretty popular. Try this sushi place! Well worth it!

6-oDOSRivr2wOKFHPmSdIQ.text: If your looking for sushi that will not hurt your wallet, this is the spot.  For $20 AYCE sushi and the quality and freshness of the shrimp and fish selection, it is simply an awsome spot to try.  We came with a group of 13 and our server, Moo, was great!  Hot tea never got cold, food kept on coming, grandma was taken care of and kids was happy.  Location is a bit off the strip but it is worth the trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What is left is an empty plate! Yummy!

Mu4sML0zosOaEZXy99gugA.text: I have been going to this place for about 6 years and it has only gotten better. Been living in California the past 4 years and this was always my first visit when I came back. Now that I'm back for good, I get to go every week!  The best bang for your buck AYCE sushi place in Vegas. Service is solid, the owners are even very nice. Not exactly the greatest location, but don't let that deter you. Here are a couple of suggested rolls that I love: Wet Dream Roll (lives up to its name) & the No Name Roll.

SpDlg3B_p2pBx-oV1e9iWA.text: I absolutely LOVE this place. I have been going here for years. This is the best kept AYCE sushi secret off the strip. Expect to wait maybe 45 mins-1 hour plus on weekends, there is ALWAYS a line if you go for dinner, granted that is a good sign!  Some of my favorites are: The seafood salad, no name roll, who's your daddy, wet dream and I like to polish it off with cucumber salad, edamame, miso and of course-MOCHI!  The fresh cuts are just that, FRESH, and the variety of dishes is quite remarkable.  Overall, if you plan on eating around 8PM on the weekend, try to arrive at least around 7PM. For lunch there is really no waiting time to speak of.  Yama Sushi-a diamond in the rough, referring to the strip mall it's located in. You will not be disappointed.

7xI_sHQHSx6CqduI3nXn3w.text: I won't write up a long review given the number of reviews already posted, but this is my favorite sushi spot in Vegas, bar none.  Initially we would order standard sushi.  Mistake!  The specialty rolls are amazing and I've found the quality to be consistently excellent over the past three years.  The prices are reasonable.  The biggest problem is that it often takes a while to get in due to the popularity of the restaurant.  (Do try the "Man Whore" baked roll.  Wow!)   The restaurant is located in the Albertson's shopping center at Flamingo and Maryland Parkway, making it very convenient for those of us on the East side of town.  Parking is easy.  During prime hours it can be tough to get in with a large group unless you're ready to wait.  It's worth the wait.  The place has been spotless every time I've been there and I've yet to ever see it empty, even in the middle of a weekday.

A6xJoGgRFtO6UtrC7OJY_w.text: Traveling to Vegas from New Orleans. Ran across this place online and checked it out. It is absolutely amazing.  Expect a small wait, but definitely worth it. Do yourself a favor and check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_tbhdhEPrbrmgA4m_qGe1w.text: The prices are reasonable and i love that they do half rolls! All the rolls I've had are delicious which is why I keep going back.   Only downside is that this place is hella small. There are so many people that go that if you go on a busy day the wait could be up to an hour and unfortunately, I'm not willing to wait that long haha My recommendation is always just try to go early lol

K937wrtlYhbAm_W11LsXbA.text: This place has great potential, but they give you soooo much rice!!! They literally packed it on, so we got full on our first round. The quality was surprisingly very fresh for AYCE and includes many special rolls which were tempting to order, but after just one roll, we just couldn't do it.   My favorite item I usually order  is a crunchy hand roll and they got the crispy part done right, but it was overwhelmingly drenched in eel sauce resulting in it being a sickeningly sweet and overloaded rice roll. The service was definitely lacking, you get ice cream or mochi at the end of you meal, and it took 20 minutes for the check and another 20 just to get our green tea ice cream. 40 freaking minutes to get out of there despite reminding two different waitresses 4 times!!! Throughout our meals, we had to request for more water, our rolls, and napkins several times. So the price and quality of the fish is decent, large selection of special rolls, but if you want to get full, just order one hand or special roll and you're set.

3XsRf9nPxH0a3uKHNDOS4g.text: Ok, maybe I'm spoiled with Sushi Mon and Goyemon, but this place was horrible! I would have given it no stars, but they did serve fried soft shell crab a la carte.   Wait is ridiculously long, and service sucked. My boyfriend and I both did the AYCE option. I ordered 2 orders of our usual such as uni, sweet shrimp, tuna, salmon, yellowtail, eel, scallop, etc. I paid attention to the menu as it said "each order has 2 pieces."  What comes out 20 minutes later?  2 pieces of each fish I ordered, I was expecting 4 pieces. After we ate everything in about 5 mintues, we had to wait another 10 before our waitress came back. She just ignored our empty plates, maybe she was hoping we wouldn't want anything else and we would leave. I asked her about the other half of our order, like were they saving that for a 2nd round or something? And she said, no, each order is one piece, so at this point i'm confused and pull out the menu that says each order has 2 pieces. She said the menu was wrong and we only get 1 piece. So at this point I reorder everything and ask for 2 more orders of soft shell crab. I still only get one. I wonder if she thought I was the only one eating as I was the only one ordering.   The only two good items was the fresh yellowtail and the the soft shell crab a la carte. The other sushi items were so so, the scallop was not good, and the shrimp heads were so tough, the exoskeleton wasn't even fried completely so it made for a very tough to chew and cut up your mouth bite.   This place seemed so popular with a 30 minute wait on friday night, but maybe it's their regular menu that's good. It doesn't matter, as I won't be back.

Zy5g8_TKthgDBXQthrK54w.text: This is an awesome sushi house.  Always fresh, an amazing selection, and all you can eat for a price that won't break the bank.  We eat here every time we are in Vegas.

sBuLK_kAZiw-XWESGiHlYw.text: Best sushi bar in town with all you can eat. I love the albacore...and the Happy Ending roll, Oh and the dragon roll is escepcially my fav. There are so many good items. Atmosphere can be load when its during there peak hours. Dinner time there can be a bit of a wait.

5BWspotm6ydIRuDFaB120Q.text: Fodd is really a 3.5 star, but the service make it a 4 stars  The place was packed, and had to waited awhile for a table. Most of the rolls has option of hand, half, and cut.  This offers different size option which is nice  We got several half rolls, and they were cold.  plum ice cream was refreshing sushi was decent size double dragon was good, Harry potter was a little below average  (some sushi, it's only 1 piece per person.  Ex. Sweet shrimp)  It's decent for all you can eat.  Even though they were quite busy, some of the waitress were nice and friendly

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xeaceFzUakXBeMWif6eGrw.text: This place has AYCE, it's not too expensive and they have a good selection. The rolls all have names suitable for Vegas (i.e. strip tease). Service is ok., They don't give you a paper to write down your order so you can keep track. Twice we ordered something that never came.  The individual sushi had too much rice for my taste. The place is on the small side and is apparently always crowded.  Not too bad for the price, but definitely not on any top list.

z1tJG1qjJgyw2KdiYiBY_w.text: Wow!  This place is the SHIT!  I found this place thanks to yelp and my desire to check out some local food with some local prices.  I did a sushi search and this one was up on top with other expensive places.  I wasn't aware that it was all you can eat until I drove past the store front.  I thought it was a gimmick (because EVERY other sushi place only has a handful of lame things for all you can eat) but I was blown away when EVERYTHING on the damn menu is all you can eat.  I had the seafood salad, the bomb.  Wow.  Lots of flavors and good portion.  The no name roll was pretty bomb also.  Everything I ate was impressive.  I really liked this place.  The service was excellent and I really didn't have any complaints.  Even their house sake was pretty good.  Next time I come here, I am going to bring my peeps.  They should have another special like $25 all you can drink....

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jun!
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yay Mia!

AhVtAKh3fNDtTLpMZ6PRFQ.text: I had their "Sun on the Beach" roll and it was delicious! It had spicy tuna, spicy mayo sauce, with avo. I also had their shrimp roll, which was also very yummy if you want to get something cheaper, but still have a delicious roll. The service was great! The waitress came by every time our water was getting low and I was even able to change my roll that I wanted last minute without them fussing! There was no wait at all, but we went on a Tuesday night. They also have all-you-can-eat-sushi for about $22 if you're interested in that as well. Overall, amazing!

4zHuAvYTJhmdOvSMMfxGgw.text: Don't go there!! Food is not bad but the service is crap. They don't accept normal credit cards so tourists are not accepted here. So you better go somewhere else!!

oIAcZDDhahvkJECeF0nlTg.text: Hands down best sushi in Las Vegas ! Clean , fast even when they're super busy , fresh and great service ! Used to come twice a week for months on end , worth every penny !!! Try the bbq ribs they are the bomb!!!!

j4Wk-BEESmgDxGOZYkbN2A.text: If I could give this place more than just five stars I would. I don't live in Vegas but every time I'm in town this place is a must and I don't mean on just one day/night. I mean on a couple, if not several times while in town. Stop searching for a good sushi spot and go to Yama! Off the charts amazing. AYCE top notch sushi for $22! Not a limited menu either, their ENTIRE menu is offered- apps, sushi, sashimi, dessert! Oh, except for your drink of choice... Unless you like water from Lake Mead w/ a side of lemon if you're feeling fancy, then that is free.   Some inside info & tips:  -They do not take reservations and the secret is out for this gem, so expect a long wait.  - After the waitress thinks you've had enough food, you'll notice she'll start to disappear.. Just learn her name and then she'll have to respond!  - Make sure you double check your bill. On a couple of occasions my bill has been incorrect.  - This place is VERY small and kinda crammed- Not very good for kids.  - You cannot go wrong for any of their specialty rolls- all are amazing!!  - DON'T leave without trying the Seafood Salad!!!!!!!!

V1br8dPLNXeQRwYdwFA1rA.text: This place is pretty incredible. I may have come in at 3 pm on a Wednesday, but the wait was less than 2 minutes and the wait on my food was also amazingly short. Almost all of the fish was terrific (shout out to the salmon). The only mediocre food I received was the albacore sushi and even that wasn't bad. The staff was ATTENTIVE and checked back often to take away our used dishes. Whenever we asked for something (ponzu sauce, more water, more food, etc) it arrived quickly. The only complaint I have was that sometimes good we didn't order arrived at our table instead of the table that ordered it. Luckily we all had the all you can eat so it didn't matter much. Overall, pretty fantastic.

RZ8zey9HomosqjhtwAHLeQ.text: Back at Yama Sushi again, figure it's time to finally review them. I love sushi and have hit a few different spots around town, Yama is still my favorite. I appreciate the variety of cooked/cold (raw) rolls. My love for cream  cheese runs deep and I have SO many cream cheese filled rolls to pick from it's perfect! We usually sit at a table but this time we went for the bar, I have to say I like the bar better(except for the idiot and his girlfriend with spilled sushi all over seated next to us, but I digress) My favorites are always the Harry Potter, Wet Dream, Be Mine,  and Yo Sexy. My only complaints are the location. Location, location, location. I sincerely wish this place was in another part of town, maybe they'll move someday. Otherwise I'll continue to eat here...just during daylight.

-5fJMz5AGI69YHu-oAfqRQ.text: Great food at a great price. AYCE with high quality sushi.   Unfortunately our crabby, sourpuss, downright rude chef (Paw) ruined my meal by being such a disrespectful jerk. I have no idea why.   Try getting a job you like!

MeGIe1mWcoxXxgLEEdB4fw.text: My favorite AYCE sushi spot in Vegas. It's located off the strip, so it's not as hectic. It's in the "ghetto" side but in all honesty, the area isn't THAT bad. It might look a bit sketch, but the food here is amazing. I always get the nigiri and some handrolls. My girlfriend opts for their sushi rolls and nigiri. Service here is also good. Waitresses are always attentive to your needs.   A must-try is their Palm Job handroll. It's only limited to 1 per customer. I also get the other items that are restricted to 1 per person such as uni. Bonus: if your significant other does not eat it, you'd get 2 orders! #win

R6-ooJt5KOmPpfUxUdpuoA.text: Very good. 1st time here and defiantly will be back!  Alot of flavor ordered 4 different rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Dv807tsO1OSfqQ7UjhTQiw.text: I passed on ayce and am glad I did. The fish was not fresh to the point that it tasted rubbery.   I've been to other sushi spots that were much cheaper, higher quality, and better prepared sushi than this place.  Service was not good as well. The servers were not friendly and looked miserable to be there.  I gave this place 2 tries and have been sorely disappointed. Will not return and highly do not recommend this sushi spot.

kbRduMtG0nOLnm82Jg_tpw.text: Worth the money!  I went to all you can eat here and it was delicious.  We ate so much food and the quality of the rolls were good.  We had a table of 8 people and they were still polite to use (which isn't usually the case at restaurants when you have a large group).  They also provided quick service.  Definitely a must visit place!

31SCfjuwFiktJ8L_qfQIVw.text: This spot is a must do when I visit Vegas. The all you can eat option is inexpensive compared to other all you can eat sushi spots I've frequented.   The seafood salad is available once per person and is delicious. The nigiri is fresh and the portions are large. The rolls are also tasty and fresh and the variety is awesome.   Things to keep in mind... It's about a $15-$20 cab ride from the Strip depending where you're coming from. Also, the wait here can be ridiculous, although the line does tend to move quickly.

iSxPh3awcCiXZ3mNol_-8g.text: Sorry but not eating there again. It is a very small place we went on a Thursday afternoon and it felt crowded. Secondly, the service was rather UNORGANIZED, I  was asked several times by different servers what I ordered. That got annoying fast, making conversation hard to keep up when your constantly being interrupted.Which I don't blame on the servers themselves,more on management. I stuck to giving my order to one waitress. I of course wanted to give her a tip, and left the appropriate amount and before my party even left someone else picked up the tip.  And lastly the food didn't seem quality. I've tried a few other places around town and this place left my stomach turning.

z31ZR5eqJ8GMd7CRFLB4Aw.text: Dinner price is about $30/person after tip.  I think it's pretty well worth it.  The fish was fresh and came out in a timely manner.  A lot of the rolls are california roll based, as expected, but decently flavored.  They also serve large sweet shrimp and uni (1/person) which were very fresh.    I like this place compared to other AYCE sushi places because of the variety.  They have tons of rolls and appetizers to choose from.  Make sure to try and call ahead of time to make a reservation - or be prepared to wait a long time.

0wfFxRA6N9bLpWZkXKhdiQ.text: one of my favorite place to be... service is great and the quality of food for ayce is awesome... i highly recommend this place.

iSIyY6Y9z7HYYuYz-e92XA.text: Amazing all you can eat sushi! Sushi rolls made to order and UNLIMITED SUSHI! The service was really good however there were 4 people coming around to serve us that we were asked the dance question several times which got annoying but otherwise the most best sushi selection and really flavorful!   Not much room for big parties and dinner is packed.  Lunch is the best time to go.   I'd say hidden gem!

Q7Zwrd7PQl47bN1aGZGBGg.text: As a former Seattle native, I actually mourned the loss of excellent sushi when I moved to the desert. (Don't get me wrong, I love everything else about my new home.)  Consider my experience here a full recovery! Highly recommend the "No Name" roll and the "Sun of the Beach". Also loved the double salmon.   We got to sit right at the bar and watch the chefs/magicians/artists do what they do. We got front-line attention and our orders were filled promptly. The waitstaff swooped in behind us to pick up plates and whatnot - all very efficient, given that the place was PACKED.  We'll be back to try everything else on the menu, and we'll bring our visiting friends - even from Seattle.

YeuNbDpHi3L3R2-LN9U2aQ.text: Hands down the best sushi place I've ever been to! Big, fresh rolls and so worth the all you can eat price. Definitely get my money worth. I've never had a roll I didn't like at Yama. A must try if you're in the area, so worth the trip off the strip if you're just visiting

FvAIdFh_xppGNDxbf8wu3g.text: I went there this afternoon for lunch and usually this place is fairly good and one of my favorites.  BUT they had some serious electrical issues and the restaurant was closed for a few days.  Today when we went, 2 of us got food poisoning and got extremely sick.  literally bedridden w diarrhea etc.    The fish/food etc. is NOT fresh so DO NOT EAT  I called and the owner solution was for me to go to the hospital and bring them a doctors note to prove it which I will.  sort of an odd response to a customer being sick but just wanted everyone to be careful!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is my receipt when eating there and got SICK.  The food is not fresh!  Beware

K1Wznxs7sg_ifxqKKZ4wcA.text: Staff was responsive.  Food was good.  I come here every time I visit Vegas.  The assortment is good and the fish was fresh.

VnrcivHl-luzWBpUngx-EQ.text: It's my go to sushi place in Vegas. Many wonderful memories there. You have to stop in on your next Vegas trip. The place is always packed because it's always good.

RNPOnRHuZtVRuU-x5yHAyw.text: I haven't been to this place in a while but today i took some friends because last i was there sushi was amazing!. Today was not so good am dissatisfied and upset that the quality of the sushi went down". Sashimi salad the fish tasted old the sushi rolls weren't creative or flavorful I felt like it was missing something i was embarrassed in front of my friends and will not return. The service was attentive and fast .

pFmu3rGzDOANuS90xOdKKw.text: Decided to try a Japanese buffet in vegas, as buffets on the strip has sky rocketing prices for mediocre food now a days.   I looked up many different ayce restaurants, and decided to pick the one with over 1000+ reviews for our first ayce Japanese buffet in vegas.   Arrived at around 8:30 and it was packed, we had to wait, but it wasn't long since we elected to sit at the sushi bar if it became available.  And I'm so glad we did that.    I'm used to Toronto Japanese buffets where you order everything all at once.  It was a different vibe here.  We sat down, and the sushi chef was making sushi and just asked what we would like. So I literally just listed a couple of nigiri (uni, sweet shrimp, ikura, giant clam).  Jose was the sushi chef and he acknowledged my order while making other rolls for other people.  He didn't write anything down.  And in 5 minutes he created the masterpiece!!   Just like other yelpers said, the sashimi salad is a must get!! Lots of sashimi, crunchy radish straws, a shrimp tempura in a nice vinaigrette.  We got it mild and it was perfect with a touch of spice.   The uni didn't have too much flavour, but the ikura were huge and explodes in your mouth when putting the piece into your mouth.  The giant clam, I didn't know what made it so pricey and premium. The sweet shrimp didn't come with rice and came with the shrimp heads fried.   We tried some half rolls, we wanted to try many things, but was getting full from the rice.  Had a palm job hand roll and that was really good.    Ordered the Hamachi kama and it was a little over cooked.  They forgot our order so I had to ask them twice to check up on it.  It finally came after 30 minutes piping hot, so maybe that's why it was over cooked.   Had a strawberry and mango mochi along with a scoop of red bean, green tea and plum ice cream. I've never had plum ice cream before but it was really good!!   Very much enjoyed my experience here, definitely different from Toronto in the selection of foods.  They don't offer too many cooked foods from the kitchen, but are more geared towards specialty rolls and nigiri.

Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon skin roll

LJHKdHlluLWLs28P1Sm0-Q.text: It's been awhile since I ate at Yama so my friend and I came back for the ayce. Service was not great. Waiters seemed anoyed cause they have to work. I went into my orders and was told that anything with a star is limited to one order. I told the waiter yes I knew the policy. But when we try to order the tuna poke and the salmon poke at the same time. We were told "NO" you are not allowed. Only one or the other. I asked him then why doesn't it specified that on the menu. Because they are separated on the menu. No reply. He just grin and repeat that we can only pick one of the two. Fuck your smirky attitude bro..I hope that readers and the owner reads this. The owner really needs to read or see our reviews cause there are plenty of other places now to pick and choose. I pick the place with nice customer services first then policy and food.

CX8wgXgMDCz4zVacRiF_UQ.text: I have been here several times. Never disappoints! Always delicious, fast service with plenty of selection to choose from!

JepK_3DeQbbZNQ3noBF_Dg.text: All-you-can-eat nigiri, rolls, special rolls, appetizers, and desserts.  Unlike buffets, everything is brought to the table after you order.  There's three rules at Yama.  One, sashimi isn't all-you-can-eat.  Two, don't waste your rice or you'll pay for it.  Three, don't share with your friend who isn't doing AYCE.  Do I need to say more?  I went to Yama Sushi after running the Las Vegas half marathon with my friends.  The restaurant is cozy - you can sit at tables or you can sit at the sushi bar.  As mentioned, everything on the menu besides sashimi is fair game for all-you-can-eat.  So, in addition to eating over 20 pieces of sushi, I also ate gyoza, pork katsu, miso soup, and green tea ice cream for dessert.  The salmon nigiri was excellent.  I'd mention and recommend specific rolls, but my table ordered so many that I lost track of what I ate.  If the sushi was fixed portion, I'd give it four stars.  But, it's absurd to complain when you can order unlimited amounts of both the California rolls and the rolls loaded with crab, several types of fish, eel, and special sauces.  Price for dinner AYCE is around $25 plus tip.  On the Strip for dinner, that'll only buy you a burger and a soda in some places.  The only downside is that it's a bit of a drive to get here from Downtown Vegas.  When you add your Uber, you're paying the same as if you just ate dinner in the Bellagio.  Do I regret coming here though to satisfy my sushi craving after burning 1,000 calories?  Definitely not.

K12_4Auio14NqZAeHPxewA.text: The food looks very different from what were posted here. The food wasn't fresh and service was bad. I would not recommend this place at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

biFHaEoAke1E_yWkcimDAw.text: This place is great for the AYCE specials!  Good seating even in the busier times, although right after work one may need to wait a bit.  Selection is very good and the service staff was very attentive.

f2iI_6hVYyH5k0uEa5g8BQ.text: Not sure how the sushi here is 4 stars, it was terrible. We got 2 rolls- both just bad. One was drenched in so much sauce it filled the plate and looked like a wet burrito. The "who's your daddy" is $12 and tiny. Tasted like they put tahin powder in the roll- it was some spicy, citrusy powder season, really gross. We ordered a soft shell crab roll to wash down the nastiness and try to satiate our appetites. It wasn't great either.  If your taste buds are retired you might like this place. We were very confused by the 4 stars. It was not good. $50 on lunch and hated it.

YcLH0VkhDQPFOMGDpNbyZA.text: This is the best sushi restaurant!! Love the food, customer service the best, totally recommended, we went to many different restaurants, and nothing like Yama sushi, this is one of our favorite places.

GfEzgJmmME2hPbrpy8ToGQ.text: Authenticity: Not japanese-run. Every customer in there was white.  Food: AYCE. As previously stated, I am a sushi snob, so not sure why I decided to try AYCE, only that it was convenient at the time. Ok. I think that maybe AYCE sushi should exist in its own realm and should not be compared to non-AYCE establishments. Ya know, if you go to Japan, these things that pass for "sushi" do not exist there (i.e. rolls with cream cheese, etc.) We tried a few nigiri (white tuna, salmon, unagi, uni, and salmon) to get the ball rolling and ordered one roll. The rice was shockingly WRONG. All wrong. That is not how sushi rice is made. The texture and consistency was all off. Rice was balled up tight and hard and too much vinegar.  The rolls were passable, but then I really can't deal with rolls when it comes to sushi, so maybe its unfair for me to rate this at all....  Location: I only chose to come here because I was looking for a place for lunch that was near Ranch 99. Will not be returning. Oh no. No.

OgfGQ989EYkkWJ1KLcF5Dw.text: Came here to try out a new sushi place and was not impressed. The eel sauce has a strange, tangy taste. The rolls took forever and weren't even prepared properly. Everything had a very old taste to it, including the rice in the rolls& the miso soup. Most rolls have tuna in them so not a huge variety. My boyfriend & I got extremely sick shortly after eating here.

YvpTCd1gOaya4WvK3NyQyw.text: Let me start off by saying Yama used to be my go to sushi spot in Vegas.. Well that changed a long time ago but I still decided to try it out again and I can honestly say it was one of the worst experiences I've ever had in a restaurant.  Every time we place an order it was about 3 to 5 items and each time they forgot at least 1 item so the entire time I was constantly asking for something that was previously ordered. The sushi has gone so far down hill with portion size and quality and was lacking flavor in ever item. After the 3rd time asking then for a side order of teriyaki chicken for my 2 kids to eat they finally brought it and by that time they weren't hungry any more which was a good thing because after eating a piece myself that tasted undercooked I decided to check the rest of it and it was completely raw. It takes a special kind of person to cook a paper thin piece of chicken medium rare (and calling it mid rare is being generous because it was hardly seared). If the service was good it would of made up for the food being horrible but that wasn't the case at all because service sucked. Thank you Yama for permanently crossing yourself off of my list of places to dine and recommend. I'm a chef on the Las Vegas strip and a highly respected restaurant and will usually forgive a place for bad experience but not this time.  Sakana right across the street blows you guys out of the water

jyp59wE2URe2JAcO46EsRg.text: I must say amazing services, love the food and always have Ana amazing time when I eat there.

wxKVveWsdkz_3FNt3_3Mag.text: Hands down the best sushi place in Vegas. I brought my bestie here when she moved from Atlanta and she refuses to go anywhere else. Loves this place. The option to order half rolls is amazing as it let's one taste a few different rolls without over eating. The wet dream and super cali are my favorite rolls as well as the rainbow roll. The fried soft shell crab and garlic spicy edamame  is a must.The only thing is the area of the location  over the years has become a little questionable at times.  My bestie took her mom who was visiting from Atlanta and there were drug addicts in the parking lot.  Kind of made them a little nervous but they still loved their food.

7G7r9KfJp1HXE5Xuke9qHA.text: NEVER EVER go to this restaurant. I went there with my friends the weekend of thanksgiving 2018 and all of us got food poisoning. It was without doubt the worst sushi I ever had with rotten ingredients.

rZeAfGzRCVanmAp1R4_P4w.text: Despite how busy they are, the wait goes quick and orders come out fast- sit at the bar for the quickest experience. Pricing is on par with most other AYCE sushi spots in vegas, and the fish was mostly fresh.   Definitely start with the seafood salad! Nigiri was okay- scallop tasted like it had gone bad, garlic tuna did not taste like garlic at all. The rolls had too many sauces, and too much of them for my liking, but I do like that you can order by the half-roll. The Son of the Beach, Oh My Harry, and Ellen rolls (ordered based on multiple mentions in reviews) didn't blow my mind like some people claimed they would. The Palm Job hand roll was decent, wish they had a few more special hand rolls. Avoid the plum ice cream for dessert- tasted super artificial, more like bubblegum than any fruit flavor.  Service was initially pretty quick sitting at the bar, then the sushi chef started forgetting items. I don't know if the rolls are generally oversauced or if it was just the guy making them for us. Not a place I'd go out of my way to return to, but not bad for the area.

FBT_PKrPbDIzBE2KRUnofw.text: So good  another favorite sushi  spot . I love  sushi but I don't always love the spots I try . The rolls can be too small , too loosely rolled . And at times the sushi is not fresh . But not this place it was on point . Loved it all

gnQsa5867t455anLPHhgow.text: All you can eat!? Yes please! Such a great deal for the quality you get! So happy they don't lack in the quality just because it's all you can eat! Everything we tried was delicious. Double dragon roll was our favorite. Delicious gyoza (good sized pieces and flavorful!), hamachi collar (so moist and big!), tonkatsu (crispy goodness!), chicken teriyaki, kalbi! And the list goes on and on. Some items is a 1 order max per person but most things aren't. A must try!

Yku5ck4zJVesuJoP6wJA-w.text: This was garbage ! I was never into sushi (I never tried it) until I went on a team building at work one day and got introduced And I've been hooked since. So I've been traveling from sushi to sushi my friend raves about this location.  So me and my S/O decided to give it a try boy did we make a mistake !  I ordered tempura veggies and my broccoli was still doughy. I forced it down and said it happens even tho I've never had that happen at any other sushi location ive been to. so i continue eating, and was just disgusted by it all . IT ALL SUCKED ! I couldn't even keep it down.  Sorry bt not sorry . Your sushi is disgusting, ill never recommend anyone to this location ever in my life.

xT2_QScBPhsfGAKfJrpNeQ.text: You could tell if a place is good by the amount of people dining in. It was busy the day my cousin and I went to eat here, and I feel like a good crowd really determines if the sushi is worth it. (You know, "the bigger the crowd, the better" type of mentality). Yama Sushi seems to have a big fan base since I always hear people talk about it a lot, and my friends tell me that it's always busy whenever they go.   I really like that it's down the road from UNLV's campus because you don't really find any good places to get your grub on around there. My cousin and I decided to go with the AYCE lunch special. It's pretty fairly priced (a little lower than average), and you can indulge in some pretty good sushi rolls!  The interior is small compared to some other sushi places, and the seating may be a little packed. We sat right next to another table with just a small divider keeping my elbow from knocking into the person next to me.  Service was okay, and they had different people check up on us throughout our time there. It wasn't warm and friendly, but it was fast and efficient.  I liked most of their rolls, but I think the side orders are what really won me over. The Palm Job was pretty bomb, and the sashimi salad is the best thing if you don't feel like eating sushi rolls. Ask for the creamy sauce when they ask!  Even though Yama Sushi has a cramped interior, the appetizing sushi and sashimi made up for it. I'm so glad my cousin showed me the ways of Yama!

Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k8OrSi6VtPvhxQ5oQf56JA.text: This spot got recommended to me by a local Uber driver. I saw it also on Yelp and I decided that this had to be a good spot.   Went here with my brother and we got the AYCE. I got all the good stuff. The salmon, and the yellowtail. The grilled yellowtail was amazing. It was so succulent. Wished I gotten more.  My brother enjoyed himself as well, even as a vegetarian. I was skeptical at the options at first but my brother was content.   I definitely would recommend this place as it wasn't too expensive. Around $24 for the dinner AYCE which is cheap compared to spots in LA and NYC.   If you're in Vegas stop by.

58YQ1UdfGVh85JdJh42uQA.text: Disappointed. Tried this place once last year around the same time and had a great dining experience. Can't speak the same for tonight as I found bone in my sushi! I showed the chef and he just said "must have been from the fish, sorry". I have NEVER encountered this (We get sushi in CA all the time) and am not pleased. Won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No Name &amp; Sun of the Beach

IZYrJx-6bLa8kBJy8gkG3Q.text: This is by far my favorite sushi place in Las Vegas. I have only eaten at the Flamingo location, but I have never once had bad service or bad sushi. Their spicy food has a good heat while still maintaining a good flavor. We eat sushi at least once a month, and I would only eat here if it were closer to home. I definitely recommend this for AYCE sushi.

UatGkIFmjr0USrSr8_u4uQ.text: I've been here a dozen times, and every time has its ups and downs but mainly ups, obviously If this is a prime choice when i want sushi or a tourist friend asks for a good sushi spot, and your guaranteed to leave happy and taste good food period, the wait has always been 10-35 min in the past, recently it's been no longer then 5-7 minute wait and are seated pretty quickly as well.   We could've been offered refills more, our cups were left pretty empty at times.   My husband ordered the beef teriyaki sushi roll and it was pretty cold by the time it was brought out to him.   Our favorite rolls are  "No name" "Philly roll" "strip tease" "kiss the ass" "snowing in Vegas" "happy ending" "super cali"   Try the miso soup, it's good!  The ice cream and mochi are a must try to cleanse your palette after all those rolls.  I RECOMMEND AND WILL ALWAYS RETURN WHEN I COME BACK TO VEGAS.

9t1jH-RDLykQ-uP35IO5Gw.text: There lunch special is the freakin bomb all u can eat for like 21.00 every roll we had was amazing each appetizer was on point... they did charge me for club soda but hey whatever... definitely going back

4ui_S8rZq6IecRO5IXg0Ew.text: Very good sushi spot not to far from the strip. All you can eat for lunch is only $22 PP. the rolls are good,pieces are kind of small but that's ok can just keep ordering. The sunrise roll was very good an ask was the Man whore. We really enjoyed our meal here, great prices and didn't break the bank.

EfXw66BaBxsLEJc41hl_eQ.text: This place is POPULAR, so be prepared to wait for your table even if you have a reservation. But the food is well worth the wait. Once you place your orders, the service here is FAST! And the rolls, while they all have bizarre names, are all very delicious. We were also given extra nigiri and sushi than what was ordered, which was fabulous. My husband said the salmon nigiri was very good, and I loved the many spicy options. Great portions and availability of choice (no exclusions on the menu for All You Can Eat, which is great!), and the green tea mochi was the ultimate happy ending :)

5S1XEcSdwDhrUhI7Oy7E6w.text: Enjoyed this place, absolutely one of my fav places to go to for sushi  a bit of a drive for me but worth it.

FtoE9pwdJNa4TFVXMqU-5A.text: This is the best all you can eat I've ever been to! Not only super affordable, but specialty rolls are included in AYCE which I'm not used to!   Their spicy mayo is the spiciest and best I've ever had! I enjoyed all of the spicy tuna roll varieties I tried (allergic to shellfish so i stick to those). Love that there's something for everyone here too - some people can do AYCE but some can do apps and rice and chicken and it's no problem. Service was quick and we ordered frequently throughout our time here. I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas!

PF9oO19tE879iMxJFLPV9A.text: It's so sad to see what used to be one of my favorite places go downhill throughout the years.  Anyway, on this recent visit I arrived there with my young son and 2 young grandsons. That's 5 of us .... We met up with 2 friends of ours. That's now a party of 7   The first orders were great! But after that the food was awful and took a long time to come. I ordered a DYNAMITE that smelled like rotten fish soaked in Vinegar... My only regret was not taking a sample to the health department. And yes I notified them ... Unfortunately, we had all eaten a portion.  Needless to say it made us sick later the day.  On the menu it say you will be charged or what you don't eat ... We tried but couldn't do the entire DYNAMITE   But it didn't stop there, there were other things that tasted a little bad or vinegary   So, like I stated after the first order we placed things just went downhill in flavor/taste and presentation....  So we decided to leave and had 2 separate bills .... Can someone explain to me why I had a $19 dollar tip included on my bill and my 2 friends had a $9 tip included on their bill?  That's $28 dollars just for 4 adults and 3 children(who didn't really eat) sitting together. That's 7 people ....We all had the lunch buffet   This place needs to been investigated  NEVER GOING BACK HERE

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My hunnies first plate.. But after this, the quality just went downhill... Not sure what happened but still left a huge tip
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My first round of California wet dream was just perfect... But after that it just went downhill LOL

D5Tj1PKhW0pwztuW5VvwxA.text: This is my favorite all you can eat sushi!  You'll want to arrive early to avoid long lines as it is a popular restaurant.  I also like that it includes mochi & ice cream dessert. The seafood and poke bowls are unique and something I'd order each time.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5tVt4AyxN9Yij4s59oMKww.text: Went for the first time ever over the weekend and all I have to say is amazing!! It was delicious!! The service was fast and friendly. We definitely reccomend this place. You can tell it's all fresh. Will be making a trip there soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2h3S-GhPrMBg8Up4Sb8sjg.text: Went back gave them  a try still one order  but  23  for all you  can drink  and all most didnt get that  was a great  place but no more

ug6XTisz0PisenYchxzZhg.text: I love sushi, and I love buffets. This place offers the best of both. Two-hour time limit (challenge accepted!) on the buffet, so you can't stay forever. Excellent selection on a reasonably-priced buffet menu. Cheerful service, too. There is a reason this place gets rave reviews.  I will definitely return here.

M3FFb06YYgXLkVzWXAsRcw.text: A lot of sushi choices. All you can eat option as well. Very good and sushi comes out in timely manner.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tA7VMqueTR51yNp0RNw8TQ.text: Took my niece & her roommate here for lunch when my usual place was closed. Arrived around 130pm and was seated as soon as a table was cleared from the exiting lunch rush. Somehow it seemed optimistic to be trying a new restaurant but quickly went downhill. Orders taken but had long pauses in between food being delivered to our table despite the lunch crown pretty much gone. Shrimp tempura was cold and tasted like it was sitting under a warmer as there was hardly any crunch on the tempura. I failed to get the names of their rolls as none impressed any of us. Flavor, if any, was flat or they overpowered what flavor there may have been with some sort of spicy seasoning that was was too hot due to the excess amount on the rolls. Drinks were not refilled regularly and for supposedly a "highly recommended" place, it was lackluster. And if you need a fork due to difficulty using chopsticks, know that it will be a plastic fork.
