We also sat at the bar which seemed to be a different experience than at a table. The service was amazing and the sushi was quite tastey, they have some very creative rolls. You even get mochi with the All you can eat! YUM! I wouldn't say this is the most incredible awesome sushi I've ever had, but it was right up there on my list. I will probably hit this place again when in Vegas.

HzCjKUMd92neXHNnmVc3cg.text: I've been here many times and I'm done - too crowded too long of a wait and was charged for all you can eat but didn't order it just had 3 rolls and water - the service was really bad.

dKOquV5bqaJqZTBl5Be0Dw.text: Forget the overpriced Vegas buffets. If you love sushi, you'll love this place. For an AYCE, the quality is good, wide selections. AYCE lunch (1.5 hour time limit) is only $20! Make sure you try these rolls: Man Whore, Wet Dreams, Oh my, Harry! Must go sushi place in Las Vegas!

BTW7eNH5tbTsjrjQtUEuOw.text: Our waiter was AWKWARD... SUPER AWKWARD.  Sometimes he would show up at our table and stand there until we looked at him and said something.  He also brought out a couple dishes we didn't order and said "it's on the house" which probably translated to "here, eat more."  They purposely make the rolls big so you get full faster.... However, our party of four totally defeated their so-called "trick."  We were already hungry coming from the airport and ordered appetizers, rolls and literally the entire menu.  Their seafood dynamite is nothing to praise about.  A bunch of shelled clams and some scallops in their version of dynamite sauce tossed in the oven for a couple minutes.  On the flip side, their rolls are really good.  Can't go wrong with any of them actually.  I just wish they served nigiri and sashimi as part of their "All You Can Eat" buffet.  Other than the service, I would definitely recommend this place.  Not exactly located in the best part of town but if you get there early enough, you can miss the circus running around outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sushi bar at Yama Sushi

ITlIf6lcI_8q6RZnnjoBmQ.text: If you are looking for AYCE go to Yama.. lunch is $22 and dinner is $25, I  HIGHLY recommend the seafood salad as a starter! This place is a little hole in the wall on flamingo but it is worth the drive!  The place gets busy and they do not take reservations so if you have a big party make sure most of your group shows up together or they wont seat you. They recently expanded so there is more seating and they have two sushi bars instead of one. They are usually pretty quick with making your orders, like I said they get really busy it might take a little longer during dinner and weekends. Plan accordingly. Worst part is the wait, ive waited upwards of 30 minutes, but the sushi is worth it!

kKBaZ6_N4iUYZiecrfSkUw.text: I'm a frequent AYCE'r at Sumo Sushi II, but I had a friend in town from Reno who wanted some sushi. Since he was staying on the strip I didn't feel like taking him to the SW part of town so I yelped for something closer to the strip.  We got there around 7pm on a Monday and it was packed which is always a good sign. Since we didn't mind sitting at the bar, we got seated right away. I prefer this because you can always have the attention of the sushi chef and get served right away.  The food was delicious and there was plenty of options. I ate all the yellowtail until my belly was content. The staff was very attentive taking the dirty dishes away.  However, my -2 star review has to do with the sushi chef we had. He was the only Hispanic chef there and at the beginning he was very nice and accommodating. Towards the end he completely changed, he must have got irritated with us because my friend and I H-A-T-E spicy food. We ordered the seafood salad and the options on the menu were (none, mild, spicy) we told him we didn't want it spicy, so do what you do. He rolled his eyes at us like it was an unusual request. Then he gave me a sample fish (I had no idea what he was doing) and then put sauce in a bowl and handed it over. However, he didn't let go....we were trying to pull the bowl down and he didn't let go... It was like a struggle!!! So I ended up bringing up my fish to the bowl and took a sample of the sauce. Did he think we were going to run off with his sample sauce??? After that shit, it was just awkward. My friend was like, "wtf???" Pretty sure I'm not going to wrestle with the sushi chef for a sauce sample. There was also a language barrier, I had no idea what he was saying.  I would go visit again, but I would definitely avoid the Hispanic sushi chef.

MyJGSN-W6c_fGDsuAoCyZQ.text: Best sushi I have had so far in Vegas. Yes I know that's a little bit weird the best sushi in Vegas. They have several additions to the menu in the chichi me that allows more in flavorful infusion different types of spicy spices. Staff is very helpful in finding the perfect dish for your pallet. Tonight I had the jalapeno sashimi, it was very fresh and delicious. It did have some heat to it but well worth it. I can not express the freshness to the fish. Over all a wonderful dinning experience. Ps try the cucumber salad and the deep fried banana thing. Wow

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas and ice cream! How can you go wrong

wvJ2uUP3ycu4LWpvzbLG6A.text: This is always a place we stop while in Vegas. It is usually not disappointing but this trip just did it for us. Once they expanded, their service went down. Food takes forever to come, roughly about 20 minutes in between orders. Orders are always forgotten and missing. It took about 30 minutes to get edamame, even though tables next to us got it right away. When you tell them you want something, they sometimes write it down, so if they don't, your order is forgotten. The food quality is always average, except for the sashimi salad. Seafood salad is always a must! It never disappoints. Each person can only order one, but it's enough for one person. As for sushi, I feel like every time I go, there's always more and more rice to make you full faster. The rice also doesn't taste too good, very dry and sticky and no taste. The mochi ice cream is a must as well!!! They used to give 2 per person but now only one :( I guess it was getting too expensive? Anyways, we still come here when we just crave sushi. The price is fair for lunch and dinner for the quality of food. They just need to improve their service and quickness of food delivered to your table.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood salad.

U2lzlm_zm_oGbB8oh_6sOw.text: If you dont mind your personal bubble being invaded in this tight hole in the wall but looking for awesome sushi, look no further!!   Yama sushi is VERY compact and I'd imagine it would be similar to living in Japan but they sure do deliver.  Service is very important to me and they are friendly upon seating and promptly asked for our drinks ( 3 servers asked us for drinks lol). Once we ordered, our first roll came within minutes. They checked on us regularly unlike other sushi places who neglect to see if you'd like anything else to order when eating AYCE.

dupIpL8TRLapQZ1G2qqK7Q.text: Still the best sushi place in Vegas. Dinner is about $24.99 for ayce and it does get very busy on the weekends, so plan to wait 30-45 minutes.

LO_p2GwsXHplQUVxfSxpmQ.text: I came her for the first time last night, it was very busy so we had to wait about 25 mins for a table, the staff was very friendly and the sushi was delicious..I am definitely coming back

N9s5Fpk2GScW1zh0GnM27A.text: Most of the rolls have Cream cheese, which I refuse to ear. No Name, Ellen and Oh My Yama are pretty good. The last time I went I got the seafood salad, 8 orders of nigiri, one of each Kama, ice cream and mochi. Pretty happy with that. Might not get seafood salad and get more Kama next time (there is a limit of one per person but most people do not order it... win for me).

Ine6PtI5smyMzsmSujU1lQ.text: Two years ago, my husband and I went to see iHeartRadio Festival in Las Vegas and stopped by this restaurant based on recommendation from my best friend.  We loved the AYCE there.  This time, we came with our 5 children. Shrimp Tempura, Hamachi Kama, No name roll, seafood salads, soft shell crabs, Gyoza to name a few dishes that we ordered several times. They all loved the foods, We ordered from the AYCE dinner menu and the children said that was the best AYCE sushi they have ever been too.  We have to agree. Can't wait to eat there again.  Highly recommended.

8TfkaoLtnIOymnAtL-CDBQ.text: I love this sushi place. Do not be deceived with the look of it. This is the freshest and the tastiest sushi you can ever taste. I have paid a bill of $600 and more visiting other places. But this place has the freshest and the best food you can taste.   Yes I agree not the fanciest sushi place you can go. There are million more good looking restaurants but if you wanna  taste a fresh and good sushi. This is the place.   Try and let me k ow what do you think?  Tip: go for all you can eat.

bifjR0uoUv5uveCferXYgw.text: My friend and I both got food poisoning and I was out of work for almost a week. I went on a Monday and I'm just now feeling better...

z6tkejBxzS7gGMre2zxQJA.text: Mediocre.  This place is suuuuper packed and always has a wait outside so I was excited to come in with a group of friends. We were a group of 10, so our wait was about 30-40min (understandable). When we were called to be seated, they guided us to this little cute isolated closed in room! It was perfect. The service wad a solid attempt for excellence, but sadly they forgot 2 of our orders twice.. Regardless, they were super kind.   As for the food.. I loved the menu and what they offered. Loved how they had the huge seafood poke salad included with their AYCE, plus the crispy soft shell crabs, etc (great appetizer choices), BUT as for the tastes of it all, it wasn't as amazing as they looked. Don't get me wrong, it was still good, but all missing something. This also goes for the sushi rolls. I felt like the quality of all the food just wasn't there, compared to other sushi places I've gone to...  Knock out of Star #1: mediocre food Knock out of Star #2: forgot some orders multiple times (I waited like 30minutes after everyone else got their sushi rolls until I got mine)   Overall food was okay and service was okay too. Great attempt, but just not all the way there for me..

Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gotta finish off with strawberry mochi ice cream!!

JyqvU6Ow1Xtp2573JL4BwQ.text: This place isn't too bad when it comes to food.  What I would have to say is that their service is kinda slow. I think they're really busy because it's one of the better sushi places near UNLV, but it still doesn't give an excuse as to why the service once you get seated is so slow.  Not too much going on here that's special. But a good sushi spot to hit up.

sH250s5cbkGhFtdTwnrUdg.text: Food was good but the experience was ruined by the terrible service. The food came late and the waiters ignored us a lot. It took around 20-30 minutes to bring out a plate of food.

ubBy9rJKFvY8khFgXrnAHw.text: So so. It was busy and service wasn't great. Sushi was just average, somewhat bland, and not shockingly fresh. Disappointed with how high the rating was. Atmosphere was really poor, somewhat run-down.

EVbJvfC44HKp0pAsYlsL8Q.text: Worst service ever during lunch ! Our server totally dismissed us and we had to contact other waitress to check on a California roll that took 30-40 minutes to make. Who the fck takes that long to make a California roll?! We spent more time waiting for food to be made that half the time I was playing with my soy sauce. I'm never going back there go to spring mountain Yama they have better service and you'll have food on your table

IlCCpFgS6CYFSNEKWb8ZmQ.text: We have visited Yama Sushi three times trying to give it the benefit of the doubt. The food is not fresh. We will not return.

ojRvtH4mOklJezGz73y1fg.text: Prices: (AYCE) Lunch 11-3pm $20.95 Dinner 3-11pm $$23.95  For a very cheap all you can eat sushi and GOOD quality fish, this place is the best place to go! It's a hidden gem away from the strip. I have to say this is my second favorite spot.. it would be my first if they had  all you can eat sashimi, but it toes very very close to Hikari.  Service can be a little better, but I don't blame them. This place is always so busy! A very, very popular local fav!   I love the sushi roll names! Some examples: One Night At Yama, Yo Sexy, Man Whore, Dancing In The Sheet, Strip Tease, Oh Dam!!!Harry, Kiss The Ass... just to name a few! Do you see their style and theme of sushi roll names? Haha it's very funny when you order them out loud. It is definitely a topic starter and a fun way to entertain your group at the table!  Their sides are amazing. I can't stress enough how fresh the fish is. I LOVEEE IT! Everything here is amazing! Must try place in Vegas!

vHAJbIhihw10TxZsERdGig.text: Excellent service, the sushi comes out quickly and is very fresh. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to get off the strip and have good sushi.

tXyiI0vlMdIpPICTsua88g.text: One of the best sushi restaurants I've been to in a very long time. Great staff a large selection of sushi to choose from and greet sake list. This place is becoming one of my frequent go to sushi spots.

5GC6ycNp9N5jtU66tUOh8w.text: 95% of the time, the best part is the service.  There are plenty of waiters/waitresses to fill your drinks and bring you appetizers.  A handful of the sushi chefs are great and fun to talk to.  The food speaks for itself.  Just pick what you like or what sounds good and you'll have a good time for sure.

zqtpbmRrr0yfV8TwlVmhzQ.text: your Urchins are NOT fresh and the sushis are all too small. and try make The sushi taste better because they don't tast that well

b9AnqQe1bhDf0kjIfquuOA.text: When we first moved to Vegas, we came here on a 118 degree day while the in-laws were in town and discovered what all-you-can-eat sushi was. We were foolish because we stuffed ourselves beyond capacity on a boiling hot day, after my mother-in-law was experiencing being drunk for the first time. We had SO MANY leftovers, and were charged $18 overage, fair enough.   Since that fateful June day in 2013, we've eaten A LOT of AYCE sushi - nearly every week...but this was only the third time we've been to Yama. It's probably our last visit.   You can count on Yama being jam-packed with people at any given moment, so much so that they've nearly doubled their size since our first visit ...and it doesn't feel any roomier. They jam a table wherever there is an 'available' two foot square space. Mood lighting is how I would describe the brightness inside - which isn't always good, as you'll see a few people using the flashlight on their smartphone to read the menu. Yikes.   When we arrived on Friday, our friends were already there waiting on us, and as we approached the table, one of the three waitresses serving us that night (a bit overkill) asked me if I knew what I wanted. ...I politely told her, "Yes, to sit down and look at the menu." I was totally thrown off. So much so that I never ordered my usual order at all, and ended up with things that she just awkwardly suggested to me that were the opposite of my taste preferences. Crazy.   When it comes to my palate, I can't do spicy things - my theory is that I overdid it as a youngin' and broke my mouth. This being said, I didn't try the spicy tuna roll, but the three guys at the table who normally shovel them down their gullet returned the one they ordered because 'it didn't taste right'...and that was good enough for me.   The nigiri was a good size, and you can get any roll as a half roll with the exception of those which only have 5 or 6 pieces, because size-wise it's already a half roll. The seaweed salad was on point - (odd to mention the seaweed salad, I know - but it was good!). Sometimes there's too much dressing(?) on it, making it slimy - but it was just right. Also, whatever the chef's special was that they brought over to us was delicious.   The sushi is just okay here. it's not phenomenal nor memorable, but if you're okay with being jammed in, pressured to order, and squinting at your dinner-mates while sipping on nasty tap water and celebrating at least 8 birthdays in 60 minutes - then this is the place for you. At least it's a bit cheaper, at only $23 per person.   Oh! something great was that they have fantastic plum ice cream, and they let everyone at the table have a mochi, even if they've already ordered a dessert. ...it's the small things.

3bs9DCU_uR_kMda8mCZ99A.text: ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI?!  As a sushi lover, I was delighted to hear that during my most recent trip to Las Vegas, we were going to try this place. We went during the lunch hour and did not have to wait for a table for 5 adults and 2 three year-old kids.  We looked at the menu and strategically decided which rolls to order and share between all of us. All of us were AYCE (all you can eat), even the kids, which is a pretty good deal since the lunch AYCE price is about $20 and if you purchase two rolls, that would probably come to the same price. The kids were half of that price, if anyone was wondering.  Anyway, we order the first round of sushi and it came out within 10 minutes of us ordering. I ordered the double-salmon roll and the baked man-whore roll. I thought out of all the sushi rolls we had ordered, the man-whore roll was the best.  Unfortunately, if you want to order soup (other than miso) they don't have any. Their portions for things that are under appetizers like chicken and beef are pretty small, but everything on the menu is AYCE, so if you want more that's always an option.  There are limits to how many times you can order certain things on the menu, and you get charged if you have leftovers at the table, so be sure to only order what you can eat. At lunch you have a one and a half hour time limit, and for dinner I believe it is two hours.  The sushi was fresh and delicious. I recommend coming earlier in the day rather than later to beat all of the late risers looking for lunch in the area. We left the restaurant around one and there were quite a few people waiting outside for a table. In my opinion it is worth the wait! You can check out all the cool photos as well so you can see what each roll looks like and other things on the menu as well while waiting!

vZ9tRixmmxVbdKioWT1s-g.text: Excellent sushi selection and good service! All-you-can eat price is reasonable. They bring out your order immediately! They are constantly making their rounds to see if you need to order some more or if you need refills to your drinks!

rSzghVROZRu4yXNm-ghUlw.text: 2nd time visiting here for AYCE sushi.  Always quality cuts and good service.  Love it!

1z5fniXZu2vzYHBnT-XbXw.text: We wanted to go to Nobu, but they weren't open for a few more hours, so I found a place with great reviews. So it's isn't Nobu quality, but it's damn good. Couldn't believe how fast the service was, food was fresh, staff was well presented and attentive. Pretty damn good here!  Note: if you see one of these,  BELIEVE IT!  The Who's Your Daddy was too spicy for me!

ujfMEcgk5Sp7DnoiIgsNeQ.text: This is probably my favorite sushi place to eat. As soon as you see it it looks appetizing to eat it. Our server Mia is very sweet and helpful which makes it better to enjoy and I would come back. Lucky for me I live in Vegas. The place isn't big so if you come with a big party make sure you have something to reserve and it does get very busy by Friday-Sunday nights.

LsDJC_I3ffCrS2442VbBJg.text: We came to Vegas from Denver, we took a cab to the hotel, so we asked the cab driver about a good sushi place, so he recommended Yama sushi, and I'm glad he did, we started our meal with a seafood salad, it was really good, the dynamite on the other hand wasn't good it was just a bunch of mushrooms with barely any seafood just tasteless. But the rolls were excellent, the 'wet dream' and 'Man whore' is a must try. Over all we had a great experience.

jB8vkH7V9emDJeMIZ1mBGQ.text: The sushi here is off the charts! Good quality for good price. Lots of interesting options. I recommend this place all day!

xIKsNRLeX6P_5W3GDPtZ_A.text: The sushi was absolutely delicious.  Menu is quite large,  and love the fact that they allowed to order in half quantities so that we could try a variety of options.  Sun if the beach,  Dragon,  wet dream roll very fantastic.. We enjoyed the meal very much.  Can't find this sushi at the strip.   We had to wait almost an hour to get a table for 3 The only downside was we had to wait atleast an hour on our way back ( was also restaurants closing time)  to wait for taxi.  None of the taxis coming were willing to take our 3 year old.  The hostess in the restaurant was genuinely concerned and kept calling the taxi company to make sure we get our proper cab.  Quite impressive service I must say!

cAXUhqk4-nAhKHycsJjqRQ.text: I mostly ordered Nigiri when I visited, the fish were not fresh at all.  We sat at the bar and the sushi chef were not very friendly; felt like I was asking for money when ordering sushi.  I think I would rather take my money and go to that Other place.

6TpQs7-q21IykdYXVtxIHw.text: I like coming to Yama Sushi because of the cheap prices and fast service. Yama is my third favorite sushi place and I'd come more often if they offered brown rice and if I didn't have to wait over 40 minutes to get seated.   This joint is definitely a neighborhood sushi joint, which could explain why they are always packed on friday and saturday nights, but that's a good thing.  Overall this place is still great and my favorite hot dish is the Tonkatsu chicken and their california rolls, which are a little on the small side, but still good.

3BKv4QjUJsgohyE6LAzqxw.text: My to go place when it comes to raw fish.  Always #1 choice. Fish is super fresh, great menu selection, and if there's something special that you're craving you ask and they will try to fancy your taste buds.  We have been coming for the past 4 years and never disappointed unless it's one of their off days in the service.  That would be my only recommendation is for the service to stay consistent

fnQGg6-PEMwN2WO3SDzejw.text: Crowded for a reason!! Great price, great food !! Open for lunch and dinner, we showed up at 5 pm and had a great meal. Our sushi dude Getman recommend the spicy sushi salad and it was awesome!! We will be back next time we are in town.

73u6gHT53e6C4rfDzCNVsg.text: what a find! luckily we had a friend whose cousin lived in Vegas, he took us here since Ive always wanted to eat at an all you can eat sushi place in Vegas. I have to give a big thumbs up to this place. coming from san jose, we dont have many all you can eat sushi places, especially because it would never last in our city. we have a couple but the fish is totally not that fresh in my opinion. this place gets packed though! so there might be a wait. i initially noticed that this was a korean ran sushi place, since a 2/3s of the staff was korean.   we were seated, we started marking off the paper. they had salads, appetizers, nigiri, rolls, dessert for about 24 bucks a person?! WOW what a deal. Especially when the fish came out they were skimpy on the fish and the fish was actually fresh! Sashimi salad was awesome had a hint of korean flavor to it. All the nigiri was awesome, my gf is a fan of uni and said the uni was not as good as fancy sushi places we go to in San Jose. We ordered a few rolls and they were pretty good too, but to get your money worth you have should order the nigiri hahaha! if we calculated all the things we ordered, we probably ordered over 200 dollars worth of sushi but only paid 100 or so.  i wish we had AYCE sushi like this in san jose.

-KabYN8Z5Yne9LHQE2_IAg.text: I honestly have NO idea how this place is so highly rated. I came here with my husband. The seafood sashimi salad everybody raves about is not good at all. The quality of the fish was so low that I wonder if it is even to the standard of the sushi grade. They ran out of hamachi kama, which is totally understandable but did not even let me and husband know until 1 hour of waiting for it. I didn't eat any rolls. I was too scared. The fish itself looks scary and I wonder how anyone could ever treat their body so horribly by eating the fish here. My husband's uni looked repulsive. I literally actually felt like vomitting. This place is so crowded and busy. My husband ate a couple rolls, and he is not a picky eater but this place exceeded his tolerance of non tasty food. I will never return. Even the dessert was bad. The green tea ice cream had 0 hints of green tea and the mochi was so frozen I could not chew it. It was as if they left it in the freezer without covering it or something. Just... no. Never again.

qCKmStfdrEyySe2XPBZhLQ.text: I have been a loyal customer of yama for years not kidding I would eat there any day of the week one of my top sushi restaurants only to compete with sakana sushi that is about a block away I have many pictures to show so eat up have a good time.  service can be a little slow but well worth the wait.

xFcPKE6GbU2eXq68V-O-Tg.text: It was a pretty good value. Overall it was better than average. The place was packed so the service was a bit slow. The sushi ran from good to excellent. There were no awful dishes or ones that "blew me away" either. I will go back and try a few more menu items and update my review afterward. Maybe I will add a star if the experience and food impresses me more next time.

fDB2Di6COdI6EnRnBSnKXw.text: LOVE THIS PLACE!  After reading Joy's review, I thought anything meant everything... without limit! But as with life... there are always limits. But it is okay! This place still rocks the house. So a week ago, me and the bf planned a date night with Yama Sushi, but the day before decided we couldn't wait!  This place isn't super easy to see because it is in a big plaza and the signage is tiny. With such wonderful reviews, I expected a fancier restaurants as with many newer sushi places these days. Nope. This place is small and simple. But simply delicious also. We took the advice of some of my fellow yelpers: we sat at the bar and did many half orders to try everything we can. Our goal was to see how much moneys worth of sushi we actually can eat, and we did pretty good! And we got to try so awesome sushi.  First off we HAD TO try their Uni, and it was a small order, but surprisingly fresh! Great taste, though of course getting it fresh from Redondo was better, but in Vegas, it is the best we can do. And then there was the giant clam! YUM! The bf doesn't usually like giant clam (from Chinese restaurants) but he really enjoyed this. But there is a limit of 1 order per person for the uni and giant clam (and sweet shrimp, but we didn't order that.) And a limit to 1 order of seafood salad per person. *picture provided*  And sushi rolls... we tried so many different ones I can't remember them all. But we did half orders instead so that we don't stuff ourselves too quickly. Had to save room for dessert! But before I knew it, I was bloated and couldn't eat anymore sushi. But I HAD TO order dessert. And I couldn't choose, so we got 1 of every flavor. *pictures posted also* Oh Em Gee the ice cream and mochi was fan-ta-bu-lous! Mango and Vanilla Mochi was incredible, and the strawberry was good too. Bummed that they didn't have the chocolate one that day. Oh well.  Overall, great food, good sushi chefs, and nice simple and clean environment. The service was good, though the servers didn't have to do much for us. I will be back for sure. And I am gonna bring everyone I know! $23 AYCE is a great deal.. and even better when the sushi is actually good!  BUT...There are a couple more stops I must make on my journey to find the best sushi in Las Vegas! Oh sushi, why do I love you so? Maybe it's the rice. Who knows.

Besides sushi we had Dynamite which was absolutely yummy. It was packed, but it added to the ambiance. Not a great place to have a first date if you actually want to get to know the person, but great hang out for friends!!!

5uvNu_X7lmSPuUADWmN-jQ.text: Sushi is Japanese right? Well, there were absolutely 0 Japanese chefs behind the counter. The fish is pre-cut and does not taste fresh. Yama is "fast food." There is no authenticity here, no quality, no creativity, and no passion. This is not sushi.

StGPyiYZ01ruUmzotl_7dQ.text: I was looking for a spot near home that could satisfy my sushi craving and was pleased to find this one. They offer a really great all you can eat option that has all sorts of my favorites such as seafood salad, edemame, fried soft shell crab, double dragon rolls and fresh salmon sushi! I literally tried a bit of everything and was happily satisfied.  They also have beef teriyaki and Beef rib cutlets which is a great alternative for those who aren't down with the pescaterian options!  Will Def be back again!

95HV8jSgOO4tYY0Q8_A3xw.text: Super good service. I found this place on yelp and had to check it out.  I was not disappointed.  Everything was tasty and very fresh.  I was also surprised to find that for the AYCE meal, you could order anything on the menu. I would recommend Yama Sushi to anyone in the area.

JsYD6RqgI-ZrNnFE4u_uAQ.text: I find this place mediocre at best. It's always crowded with undesirable people and the rolls are just outright idiotic. Their website is moronic to put it lightly.

ci24s023z_aqh01EiM7GMw.text: Cynthia, our hostess who got us a table quite fast, and Ingrid , our server , are top staff in their position at Yama sushi. I like to say, they deserve more than a pat on the back. I wish good reviews got people raises. Either way, the sushi here is top notch in Las Vegas and the service from everyone, as well as the names mentioned is high end quality at a local spot. They really stayed on top of our refills and I do drink a lot. Ambience is great as well. Half rolls are available on all orders so you can get a great variety if you enjoy specialty rolls. If you are looking for sushi in Vegas this is the place. Be forewarned that you do have to wait to get in usually,which is the sign of quality sushi, but it's worth the wait!!!!! Love this place!!!! They need a stamp card!!

L3iyTWKZ0l6Hs-1bFutpew.text: 5 stars for the best all u can eat sushi. I have been to a few and Yama is a lot better by far.

C3JGkjxB8xSW92Yuv2MF4A.text: We are not from Vegas and literally just yelped "sushi las Vegas" and this was the top rated. We ate there and I'm so baffled as to how so many people gave this place a good rating. I mean, it was edible and not disgusting. But that's all. Pretty bland flavors. The seafood didn't taste the freshest. It just did nothing for us and our "all you can eat" was over after 3 rolls. On a side note: the best and only considerably good thing was the Moshi ice cream

fKBd41yD_R3rJyceyyoI7A.text: Great selection on the rolls,  pretty much every roll we tried we're delicious but favorite one's are Wet Dream, Man whore, son of the breach. I highly recommend this place,  yes the exterior of this location is not the greatest but the food is great, friendly staff. I read someones else gave it a bad review due to bad service and bad  location. honestly in my opinion if your that sensitive then don't go to Las Vegas!

twi8Ptj1TSQa_ffqUfILSg.text: The experience here was not bad, the waitstaff were friendly, the prices are comparable to other sushi places, especially good for an "All You Can Eat" restaurant.  The only thing is, I don't eat seafood, so I ordered the appetizers.  We were a group of 7 and two of us didn't eat seafood, I would've liked it if they offered veggie tempura as an alternative. Everything else was fine.  If you're in the area and craving sushi, this would be a place you might enjoy. I would call ahead if you're a larger group to minimize wait time during busy times.  :)

Cwhcj5GGJTM9-Aonn1Bz8g.text: My husband and I are in Vegas for the first time and were in the mood for sushi. After running a quick Yelp search, we settle on here because it's close to the MGM Grand and offers all you can eat.  When we walked in we were greeted by happy staff and were seated immediately. It was BUSY, which is perfect when your at an all you can eat Sushi place. The food was so much better than expected and I finally got to try Uni for the first time. Everything was fresh and done to order, right down to the hibachi items.  The staff were friendly and very attentive. Always someone around to clear empty plates, refill drinks and bring more food.   Would totally recommend to anyone visiting with a big appetite for sushi.

ncZmGmB1GCrwZf8go7Rg9A.text: Nothing special despite multiple hyped/good reviews I've heard. Forgotten along with a bevy of other good but not great sushi choices.

mbskRVAU6AaUwEy30zG4EQ.text: Very good great price.. Excellent customer service. The food was fresh atmosphere was fun you have to order their seafood salad but mind you there's sauce is very spicy if you choose to get the miles it's really creamy unless you like a mayo base then stick with it plain. That seafood salad plate is sore with so much fish it's a meal in itself

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CYjprrkl4E9mRVPc5erXrA.text: All you can eat for $20 for lunch with this quality of fish is unbeatable.  It is limited items, but sea urchin, sweet shrimp, white tuna were even in the limited menu.  I wasn't big fan of scallops, but I was pretty happy with everything we ordered.  I mean we ordered all nigiri sushi (no rolls) from the menu.  Our favorite was garic tuna, saba and salmon.  See urchin was actually good as well.  Chef's super fast service was like a machine.  You have to order within 1.5 h, but we had pretty of tome to order and eat.  I highly recommend to sit at bar and order as you eat.  Otherwise, rice gets cold and fish looses flavor when you order a lot at once.  Also, you don't appreciate what you eat as much as ordering small portion at once.  And you don't have to worry about leaving leftover.  We also orderd softshell crab appetizer, but it was very soft, not much crispiness on the shell.  It was ok.  We also had plum wine, that wad very authentic flavor.  We got good buz after a glass.  We must have ordered $100 worth of food for 2, we were soooo happy after all.  :)

PQnaHwchG2QY_DYnfT5ifA.text: do not eat here ever!!! i was served multiple old pieces of sushi!! one piece of tuna came pink the other one almost brown. the uni looked like it died a week ago. but the salmon roll i ordered was beyond rotten i put o e piece in my mouth n spit it out right away. when i complained to the manager mia she went to the back with my plate came back and said she tasted it and it was fine. i told her to eat a piece in front of my face because i knew she was lying because no human could swallow that. she brings my plate back out and of course not one piece eaten i then make her eat just a top piece of salmon sashimi that was tiny i watched her almost throw up in her mouth lmao then she tells me it tastes fine but couldnt even swallow the tiny piece of fish i coildnt believe what was happening lol! if i owned this restaurant or was part of food and health inspecter i would have mia not only fired but banned from working at any restaurant in the united states!!! worst service and sushi ive ever seen! mia ur an embarrassment as a human smh

midLPQPqDG2et9czC0Lj6w.text: This was the second time I did the "all you can eat Sushi.". The food was good but not amazing.  The prices were amazing.  I am a sushi snob so I am very particular about my sushi.  There is a menu with a lot of variety on it.    The staff were pleasant.  I definitely ate $25 worth of sushi.  I finished my meal with mango mochi + pistachio ice cream.   The only improvement would be to clean the table of dishes before bringing in dessert.  But overall a good experience.

1VajThe3SekEsdQjJBP7RA.text: If I could sum Yama up in one word, that word would be overrated.   I feel slightly biased because I have two regular AYCE spots that I go to, but I wanted to branch out and see what else the world has to offer in terms of sushi and Yama is a favorite among my friends, so I gave it a shot.  We came in on a Saturday afternoon for lunch and were promptly seated. The servers were very attentive. We ordered the Double Dragon and No Name rolls first. They were amazing!! It was a great start to our lunch. Those were the only things that are keeping this review in the positive. Everything seemingly went downhill from there.   Every other roll we ordered after the first two mentioned were not good. Slimy in texture and a little overdone. The Volcano roll had huge chunks of cucumber that really took away from the entire roll. We couldn't finish and were okay with the fact that we would have to pay extra. Our bill came and we were charged for the Volcano roll - they charged us $12.95 for a roll listed at $9.99 on the menu. The price was adjusted with no problem, but the fact that something like that could happen leaves a bad taste in my mouth, just like their sushi did.  Needless to say, I didn't find Yama special at all and I won't eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Volcano
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh my Yama
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish n Chips - skip this one!

6HT3V4iB5wFNk302X_cFoQ.text: i tried their all you can eat ( ayce ) pretty good, definitely worth the money lunch is like $21 and dinner i think is $24 ( not too sure ) all you have to eat is 2-3 special rolls then you get your money back. fish is pretty fresh so no complain. For ayce place this is very good.

pWTBqEPZfnIOiQ2Wna4ioA.text: We have a table of 6... take forever for us to get our foods. We have to Constantly ask water to be refills and they keep forgetting our order.

m9sJKXjbygkD7w6zyBlX8g.text: First time coming here but we knew it was all you can eat and it's worth it. We came with a big group of more than 10 and we were quickly seated because we got there early right when they opened.   Most of their sushi comes with roll which including the sashimi and rice together. So it's pretty easy to get full. All their portion is pretty big as well. We ended up ordered too many fishes but we still finished them. Lol all dishes were pretty fresh and warm. I like their oyster and fried shrimps.   Overall, pretty nice restaurant with good environment especially for all you can eat in Vegas. If you want all you can eat in Vegas, it's pretty much more expensive compare to this one. So if you like Asian food definitely recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KN1gGA0jOPQsA0ImQDqwdw.text: They have all you can eat sushi special for lunch and dinner! They include appetizers and Desserts In that special too. They are always busy because their sushi is delicious and fresh, but it's worth the wait. Their Pistachio ice cream is the best.

M4Mfwy7W196HSJd_mAslXw.text: Service was excellent. However, sushi quality was underwhelming. I'm not a big fan of their batter on their fried dishes e.g. soft shell crab hand roll and the fried amaebi (sweet shrimp) head. It's too thick as they don't use the traditional Japanese panko batter that's light and crispy. Frankly, I'd rather stray away from AYCE when I come to Vegas.

DQ94g_2H8jR8DV-1em8zzA.text: Food was delicious and the price was fair for ayce. I'm giving a 4 because it wasn't the cleanest place and service was so-so. Waitress visited us once as we ate and I had to chase her down when we were ready for the check. Definitely would go back for the Yama crunch roll. Everything seems pretty fresh.

Rl1sPiXYHCwzYa9i2tjwAQ.text: We are so big fan of this place that we decided to drive from Cali to LV and then fly out to our final destination from there which is towards far east. Going there for couple years now and I can vouch for their quality , the endless variety and the smiling service. We highly recommend meeting the Super Man and the Super Woman, my kids got a kick iut if their name tags all evening!

vNQAmhhEvb7tI8vfHCWXEA.text: Our group of 17 people got food poisoned after eating all-you-can-eat Sushi at this place. This is totally unacceptable. 17 people are sick now because of your trashy food. We should sue you.

uJQ0bZdY1qOkHh_a8CcKBw.text: This location has a bit of a crowded atmosphere but was still a nice experience! The Sushi was fair and the Sake was amazing and the service was decent. Maybe it will be better next go round.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

brSMiuL7kvWJFYBw0dX7pA.text: If you're looking for unlimited, as in unlimited sushi and all in the menu; you won't be disappointed- no hold bars! Service was excellent and friendly. I don't know how they do it but the orders come in very quickly. EAYC price is cheap for $23. Come in hungry and go home 10 lbs heavier  or more

Jm4YrhKNaOQosu_sxYpzSQ.text: I love this place. Everything is so fresh and the service is the best. The waitresses and cooks are so friendly. They make you feel welcome. I introduced my wife to this place and she's not a huge seafood person and never had tried sushi. Now I can't keep her away. If you're coming or live in Vegas check this place out. Oh and all you can eat for little over 20 bucks.

CbgdewRXMPCa5tlA6rkgiQ.text: Best ayce sushi with an awesome selection of sashimi. The seafood salad is to die for.

uWZnkTF_n_6Dn-BRjg_9ow.text: Good price (hence the two stars) but def mediocre quality. My friend even got sick from our meal. Not sure why there were so many positive reviews... I'm just visiting Vegas, so maybe this IS considered good sushi/fish for the desert.

NEV-y9-WoCxW8xiWpFEDcA.text: Food was so good!! The buffet deal was totally worth it as you ordered a few dishes, the price would be more than the price for the buffet. Especially love their soft shell crab!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy ending

Emn-NWbzf9R9u4YRYWgG6g.text: Have been frequenting Yama's AYCE menu for the better part of a decade as often they featured some of the best fish in town. If you could look past the generally long wait times (down the street from UNLV), sometimes rude or just ignorant staff (and yes that same waitress is still there after all these years of complaints, incorrect and totally forgotten orders) you always had the food. Menu items such as the Man-whore, Harry Potter or Son of the Beach and appetizers including the Agadashi Tofu, seaweed salad and the incomparable Seafood Salad (with the creamy and the mild) kept me coming back. If you're in the area and there's no ridiculous wait, I do recommend it. There's always the Spring Mountain location as well.

TSLOdtEOJPZ6ujXSY47fYA.text: I have been a guest here over for many years. While visiting LV my wife and I stopped by. The menu has expanded but the quality has also gone. The service was regrettably impolite and cold. I don't know if we will return or not. As time changes so does all things......

17GmRuLF-4WsVWv-AJUtjg.text: Went here with friends and they love it , i on the other hand was disappointed.   First of all, it's way too cramped which makes it stuffy inside to where i couldn't enjoy my rolls. My salmon came out warm in the center where the rest of my roll was cold which has me a bit concerned as to how long the fish was out.  Next, i get you need to get people in and out but they are so grabby. I literally put my miso soup bowl down and it was picked up in a Nano second. This is not a place to come in to relax and hang out with friends.  The miso soup was good and my mochi. Other than that i think all the hype got my expectations way above what they could deliver.  Sorry yama , but i won't be returning.

if8ekn0qo08MCWpyBF0jFA.text: For all you can eat sushi at $20 this was a good value. However, I was not very happy with the service. We came in on January 4th right before lunch ended, and we noticed quickly how different the waitress treated us and another table next to ours. She didn't smile at us, she got irritated when we requested something, and she sent out food to them faster even though we got there at the same time. But for the other table (they were obnoxious as well) she catered to them and gave them significantly better service than us. She made sure the other table was satisfied, but when it came to us, she just ignored us and got annoyed when my friend asked her what the dish was. If she's reading this, I hope you learn how to treat your customers equally.

rFh3pFu4un6K0w6BCA9AXA.text: This place was better when it was Doh! Sushi. My order was not done correctly, it took them 15min to realize we were sitting and it took more than 5min to bring me my drink. I have been here twice and the second chance did not work out.

bF8HEn3-neYj7-QbDwQpOg.text: Grear customer service. Made sure our needs were met. They also have a wide variety of sushi rolls that I enjoyed. Space is small. But had a good experience overrall.

VDj5IrMCysdk5WJZPRU0MQ.text: This place is AWESOME thy have some of the best rolls in town , sometimes it can be a little cramped on seating !!

n9rwjQFhkT12R5dmVe1Eyg.text: Great service and yummy all you can eat menu. My husband and I were pleasantly surprised!

NRECRX6xr2Sfu8tzHlsO1g.text: I have been dining here for nearly 5 years now and this place has never failed me nor do I think it ever will. This place harbors such a broad range of memories for me: from experiencing my first all-you-can-eat-sushi to my Aussie cousin & me pretending we're on The Amazing Race forced to eat everything on our plates in order to get our next clue (WOOP WOOP to fellow TAR fans!!!! You KNOW what's up!!!) to my tragic break-up with my Marine to screaming profanities with a former Bestie over sake bombs. I know Yama will keep the great sushi and the great memories coming.   The service is to be matched. The entire staff is friendly and accommodating and must be vampires because I get my orders so quickly. I love ordering the seafood salad, sushi: albacore, yellowtail and smoked salmon; and practically every single roll. Then for dessert, no matter how STUFFED I am I ALWAYS get mochi. Check out my tip.  The only downside is the place is very small and cramped. If you can tolerate not only gazing into your dining companion's eyes but the table to your left and maybe even your right's eyes then by all means hypnotize them all with your "smize"! & test your listening and concentration skills because it'll be tempting to listen in on the convos of other tables while looking intrigued with your dining companion's squawking.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hello there Harry hiya Ellen -- Harry Potter roll on the left Ellen roll on the right

Py-xu9SzMvDkLt15-Pij_w.text: We had a reservation at Yama because we had a party of 9 people to celebrate my birthday. When we arrived, we were told we would need to wait "about 5 minutes" for our table (our entire party was present). We ended up waiting well over 15-20 minutes and since there was no inside seating we were forced to wait in the scathing Vegas heat.   All but one persons in our party ordered AYCE. I will say that their AYCE is affordable and the limit is 2 hours, which is nice. But, they never brought out a roll that I requested, even after reminding them when everyone else had their food but me. At the end of the meal, I still hadn't gotten the forgotten roll, but by that point, I was ready to head out for birthday drinks.  Overall, pretty meh. Nothing to write home about and certainly not worth standing out in the 115 degree heat for 20 minutes.

Y4Na7O2MLdZrsn54f7Tfkg.text: Yama sushi has to be my favorite sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. When I go I prefer to sit at the bar and give my sushi order directly to the chefs. They are more likely to perfect your order and especially if you customize your rolls like I do. My favorite item on the menu is the Seafood Salad (mild). It has such flavor on each of the assorted fish. It also comes with radish, which gives it an amazing crunch. Every roll is described perfectly. You won't have any surprises. If you're having trouble finding good quality fish, head to Yama.

EKKP25GB0LQitY_H1015Jw.text: I like coming to this place because it's close to my house, the AYCE deals are good but it's not for me so I just prefer to order a la carte... I just ordered the two rolls I typically get and also a side of garlic tuna sashimi. The sushi chef argued with me trying to tell me I can't have the sashimi even though I'm not doing AYCE, telling me I'd be spending too much money and to not order it? Like I'm just trying to order what I want ya know and he was trying to tell me no or something like I was just not allowed to do it. I know what I'm getting into here, I'm aware that I'd be spending maybe $8 more by ordering this way. I'm sure it was a misunderstanding. Also I have my food now but still haven't received my water.

XQbUd7TZjRD3eYIrxxFFtQ.text: TLDR: AYCE available, unassigned wait staff, drinks not included.   Yama Sushi is located in a strip mall, but the interior definitely does not match the exterior appearance. The staff is identified not by names, but by numbers evidenced by their blue pins. I have never had to ask for my drinks to be refilled as the wait staff is excellent. This is one of the few restaurants that presents a donburi, even if it is a commercially prepackaged wipe. Their fish is acceptable, but nothing exciting stands out.   Appetizers are pretty consistent and plentiful. Their agedashi tofu is unusually fried and not pleasant to enjoy. They have salmon and hamachi kama which is large, but not the best quality. On the two occasions which I've dined, the appetizers came at the same time as the sushi and rolls, even though they are ordered at the same time.   I tried the Ellen roll, the only roll that is limited to one per person. It is wrapped in green soy paper and with plenty of fish. It's not worth it, in my opinion. Stick with the nigiri and sushi. They say that rice is supposed to define the quality of the sushi, and not just the fish. In my opinion, the sushi rice leaves much to be desired.  I would come back, although it would have be on a different occasion.

vxYrj2ofcfBZurS2wqT18Q.text: I love everything about this location except that it's always crowded the wait is forever & it's usually hot inside but I can't complain about their rolls. The best! Wet dream & tiger rolls are the best. If you don't mind waiting deff check this place out

o2gWNaKB5_koW8RtSenKGA.text: I came here for a late night snack to-go. So my review is only based on the 2 things I ate. I got the salmon hand roll and the shrimp tempura roll. The salmon hand roll had 3 large slices of salmon in it for $4.50! It tasted fresh and melted in my mouth. The shrimp tempura was ok- it probably would have tasted better if I ate it when it was warm. Overall, seems like a good place!

b0Q5W5KKYfgCfNe4uZgM7A.text: Here today, and service is terrible.  We were the first ones in and 6 other tables came in after us.  They all got their orders taken first.   First time this has ever happened.  Now let's see how the food is after taking 20 minutes to take our order.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XUMLuMuXnpQd7j1IGZPNhQ.text: Before I rave about how much I liked this place, I have to say how much I hate all you yelpers for making me try their wet dream roll. You are all trolls. It was disgusting and I thought I was going to throw up. UGH.   Now...every thing else was wonderful! I loved the option to do half rolls, so you can try more things! We had their seaweed salad, crab legs, gyoza for apps. Rolls we had who's your daddy, devil, and some others I can't remember. Everything was great, the people working were nice and quick. I highly suggest this place! (But do NOT have the wet dream roll damnt. Dont do it!)  We took the 202 bus from the strip, quick 10 minute ride!

DF9hejoTtI2Rbbv_8mlaPA.text: This is my favorite spot to go with my boyfriend.  We always try and go once a week and they have never disappointed us!!! We always do All You Can Eat since its super affordable ($25 per person) and we get all the food we want.  The food always come out super quick after we order and on top of that the servers there consistently come and check on us to ensure that our next round of orders were placed, that we are satisfied, that our drinks are full, and that the dirty dishes are not on the table.  Great customer service! We will definitely be back.

m0yayV3DjszXdOpkbamtkA.text: My family and I were in Las Vegas for vacation.  We were looking for an all you can eat sushi.  This place was recommended by the hotel.  Wow, excellent.  The all you can eat is different from traditional sushi buffet. This one you order from the menu and made fresh.  Wonderful service and the food came quickly.  We had a party of 8 and came during dinner time. The food still came quickly.  We will come back again next time we visit Vegas.

QQuTtmx0lu3WTfE1k8KV6g.text: This is our FAVORITE sushi restaurant! We read the reviews on Yelp and are so happy we decided to try it out about 4 years ago! Since then, my boyfriend and I come here every time we're in Vegas, which is several times a year. We crave the sushi when we're back home. Lol. The service is fast and the staff is attentive. Everything is always fresh and delicious, especially the baked mussels, spicy seafood salad, garlic tuna, yellow tail, really everything is exceptional. The sushi chef even makes special custom rolls for us. We love this place!

Qz4K8gkJazlEPS53wFGLsw.text: I been to Yama Sushi a couple of times when I came to Las Vegas a few times and back then I was an amateur sushi fan. I was only into the fried types of sushi rolls but now I gained my love for nigiris and decided to eat at the AYCE menu. It's $27 per person for dinner so we decided to take advantage of that so we ordered a lot of nigiris right of the bat. And man they were so fresh.   Since we were sat at the sushi bar we got enough attention from the sushi chef, which was a good thing because you want your food to be there faster. Plus he was also very helpful.   I tried Uni for the first time ever and I thought it was okay. Not my favorite sushi but it's decent.  I think it's safe to say that this place is my favorite AYCE sushi restaurant and def will be back next time I come back to town.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AYCE PART TWO
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AYCE

8ZuFy2hdPYd_PW2dxDFB6g.text: Amazing! Great food. Great service. Stuffed and happy. Warning: I like spicy, but, when they spicy--they mean spicy!

sKI0g6riUe39qLOStOxeRA.text: First experience there my boyfriend and I ordered to pick-up. We arrived ariound 7 and they took our order immediately. We waited like 15 minutes for the food to be ready which I think is really good. The food was amazing! the teriyaki chicken yummm! Only thinking about it makes me want to eat it again. We both loved the food.  Second time we went there we actually decided to eat in the restaurant. We sat on the high chairs.  Staff took our order quickly, maybe a bit too fast actually, I felt a bit of a pressure but I won't complain because I'd rather have them always be around and taking fast orders than having to wait.  Food was again, delicious. I ordered much more than I could actually take in!   Prices are very reasonnable for such a great quality!!  I will certainly go back again!!

MkdVE2o-0kWF85ayw4dKCw.text: This is my favorite sushi spot hands down! At the bar or at a table you can expect fast and courteous service, great food, and good portions.

Ji7I1kpaeX_xDAQv4QkOpQ.text: Maybe I shouldn't have expected very much from fish that served in the middle of the dessert, much less an AYCE joint...two red flags I ignored, so bad on me. I was born and raised in Hawaii so I've had my fair share of mediocre fish, good fish, and kick ass fish. And this fish was sh*t fish!  Now, how the HECK does this place have so many stars?! Even as far as AYCE places go this was not worth the $25 per person. I would have gladly paid twice as much for even half decent fish. The specialty rolls were completely masked with the spiciest sauce I've ever had on sushi, probably to hide the old fish. The nigiri was so fishy and old tasting I barely ate any. Our table ate more mediocre salad than anything else to save our stomachs from the bad fish.   To top it all off, my friend got the worst runs ever all night from this place. It totally ruined her night and she ended up having to stay in the hotel room and recuperate instead of hanging out with us.   Boooo Yama sushi! Shame on you.

aSkHfRLwDggQ9DZm9zhw6A.text: ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI FOR $20!!!!! You honestly cannot beat that deal anywhere. I entered lookin' fly and left lookin' 20 months pregnant. This place is vegetarian friendly and the staff was extremely accommodating. I ordered various versions of their vegan/vegetarian roll, in addition to their tempura and edamame. My friends had the rolls I couldn't eat and they all left looking like me, which is rare seeing as how I'm the cow of the group, LOL. This place is definitely worth your money, even though it is kind of off the strip a bit, but not even by much.

3MrnydSAaSOKJglVBi9U-Q.text: Worst customer service experience I ever had. wish I didn't leave a tip but I did.i originally ordered salmon sushi 1 order and a hand roll.Mexican chef with an accent said u should do AYCE I said sure fine. Why in the end did they try to slap me with a 40 dollar bill miss me I wouldn't have sat and ate had he said no too late for AYCE muther fuckers won't ever come here again and if u like being treated like shit still don't come here there sushi is Ok.

BkekvS4-2RIrp9Of8RHCQQ.text: If you want an amazing AYCE sushi experience, Yama Sushi is one of your best bets in town!  The place is a bit hidden, since it's located in a commercial complex. We waited about 12 minutes to be seated. Servers were attentive in taking orders and giving suggestions. They also refilled our drinks well.   They make your food as you order them, instead of a typical buffet. We had miso soup, shrimp tempura, agedashi tofu and mild seafood salad as appetizers. Me and my mom were surprised with the quality of the food that they serve, since it's a smorgasbord type of thing. The tofu and tempura had a light crisp coating matched with some sweet salty sauce. We had some salmon, saba, white tuna, uni and sweet shrimp sushi. All of them had a nice amount of protein. The rice had the perfect blend of tartness from the rice vinegar balanced with the natural sweetness of rice and a bit of sugar. It was also cooked al dente.   For dessert, we had green tea ice cream, which also took our breath away, literally from being stuffed and figuratively.   I'll bring my other friends next time so they can experience Yama sushi!

WMKPpfYfXc4CK3XOFHbSDg.text: I have been here on many different occasions, this was by far the worst experience I have had. We arrived early and we're sat right away. The waitresses were very friendly. We ordered the all you can eat.  We placed out first order (seafood salad, sweet shrimp, tempura vegetables) we never received the shrimp. The sea food salad was full of salmon and was lacking everything else, maybe had 1 small piece of shrimp and a little piece of tuna. The vegetables took a very long time to come out and we're not cooked through.  After about a 20 minute wait to place out next order we got (no name, you da man too, crazy jalapeno, sweet shrimp and devil roll) this time our devil roll was missing. The other rolls were very lacking in finesse and preparation, this is usually Yama's strong point.  When we finished eating the sushi we ordered a vanilla mochi, and green tea ice cream.  We waited about 10 minutes for those to come out and both were melting and had appeared to be sitting for some time.   Overall we did not have a very good experience that night, Yama's main head chef must have had the day off because the standards were very below par. The waiting crew was good but seemed to lack leadership. just for the sake of saying everyone has a bad day, I'm giving then 3 stars. I would recommend coming here on the weekends just not at 6 on a thursday.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sloppy no name, and you da man too!
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hard vegetable tempura.
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood salad

LTc4cLTKaRjY8_MOBGrruA.text: Superb AYCE! And I am talking nigiri sushi, not the Americanized rolls. The fish are always bigger than the rice, and tastes pretty fresh. Well, as fresh as you could get in the middle of desert anyway.   This place have a good spread of selections - salmon, white tuna, albacore, red snapper, mackerel etc so you can explore the distinct taste of different fish. They also have uni (sea urchin) and sweet shrimp (raw body with tempura head, which is kind of creepy but delicious) but we get only one order each. With many other varieties, this doesn't bother much. If you are almost full and want to avoid rice, you can get the seafood salad. It's several type of raw fish cut in large cubes drenched in sweet and sour sauce. It's delicous! One serving can get you pretty filled up. For me, this is the highlight of this AYCE.   Dinner AYCE is 23.95 and must be eaten within 2 hours. If you are like me, that is plenty of time to slowly devour your catch while sharing few earth-shattering gossips at the table. The place is always crowded, but it only took me 5-10 minutes to get table. I sit at the sushi bar, so it was easy to order directly to the sushi master. One comment though, the sushi masters are all non-friendly. They look fierce so ordering was like a student asking for a toilet break.      With the price and quality of sushi, I will totally come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big octopus
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet Shrimp. Raw body cooked head.
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Salad. Get this! It&#39;s delicious!

KeYPjINbx2otaJjWQFUOFg.text: Came here on a Saturday night at 7:30ish.  The wait wasn't that bad, approximately 20 min for a table for 5. The server was very nice, helpful, and patient.  They don't wear name tags, very odd, they wear numbers.  Our server was number 6. We spent approximately one hour with all you can eat. Our food came out very quickly. The food tasted good. Kinda heavy in the rice.  And dishes that contains cream cheese was flooded with it. Happy ending and seafood salad were my favorites. On to the next   Xoxo

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wet dream and Man Whore.  Entirely too much cream cheese on both.

2xh6r6lIr0jlajzpQoTvUQ.text: Best sushi in vegas.  Quality, great sushi chefs and reasonable prices are hard to find.  Especially close to the vegas strips.  Celebrated a friend bday and they came out and sang and made a fish roll with a candle on it. I've been going to Yama sushi for over ten years and never have been disappointed.   If your not a fan of rice.  Have the seafood salad.  You can get spicy, mild or creamy.  Big recommendation. Try it and you will be a "lifer", like me

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh fish, big portions

jjYe045Jzj6B_o1jxz--yg.text: The amount of good seafood I ate for $24+tip was a little amazing. Some items are limited to one per buffet visit and that's pretty much what we started with. We sat at the bar and I let my friend do the ordering as he's a faster eater. We shared everything and I think sharing among two or three is perfect as you have to pay for anything that's left on the plate.  5* Seafood salad appetizer - shared one; regret not ordering the second dish we were allowed 5* Hamachi Kama, the collar of yellowtail fish - grilled, fantastic - great to have hot food break during a sushi buffet 5* Tamago nigiri - I love tamago so maybe biased 4* fried soft shell crab 4* deep fried mussel 4* raw shimp with fried shrim head 4* salmon nigiri 3* Uni - dull dark orange color, not very fresh 3* Mochi mango ice cream 3* quail egg nigiri 2* some sushi roll with a bunch of cream cheese - it was a mistake ordering any sushi roll when you have better options 2* Plum ice cream *** forgot a few other items and I can't find a complete menu

JaaglLCrbuYoI3SU1PkKqw.text: Stumbled into this place on yelp as we were in the area, and decided check them out! Awesome half rolls (so we could try more) and sushi, etc etc. Great staff especially our waiter Lester (friendly, polite and efficient)! We'll definitely come again for the great AYCE menu whenever we're in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
