Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xGIt5_qjk9uAqg6P_XQC2A.text: First Salmon nigiri wasn't as fresh as the later orders which really tells u how inconsistent they are.  Uni was fresh not fishy but not sweet either.   Sweet shrimp amaebi was a misnomer because the texture and slight sweetness was not there.   Even in premium supermarkets, amaebi is $17 each! So I doubt yama will use real sweet shrimp.  Seafood salad was great,  basically a sashimi salad.  Star of the night was the Hamachi kama.  Tender meat perfect with the dipping sauce.  All in all, goyemon beats them with just the quality of fish.

EABjmDXoNvJWtGUy_kadqg.text: We just do the last minute dinner search and this one sure come with a surprise! Price is set at excellent mark and fish and food is fresh. Sure will come again !

tjtNGzTTiSv7FU9PtvLRDA.text: When you enter, there is a second side towards the right. Well don't sit there, they forget about those people. Sad but it seems like I've been waiting here forever for my order.

3FvQlbztuw4u8UCev_mn9A.text: It always amazes me how these places out in the middle of the desert can produce pretty decent sushi!  The same goes for Reno (but that's a different review!)  This place is a few miles off of the strip, so you'll need to cab it if you are staying on LV Blvd.    For AYCE, it's not bad.  I've had better AYCE, but I've also had waaaaay worse.  I'm super super picky about my sushi so if I ate it, it had to be pretty good!    I was a little disappointed in the what seemed to be lack of selection for the AYCE menu.  The rolls on the regular menu seemed much more appetizing than what we were offered, but for the good price, beggars can't be choosers right?    This is on our list of places to return to when we come back to Vegas!

euj9_8rSuHUGYY0_AxAkgg.text: Yama Sushi is one of the best sushi places in Las Vegas! The location is close to my apartments which is very convenient and the food is amazing!  If you are in the market for an all you can eat location then this is the spot!  Sea Food Salad is an amazing dish, I prefer the spicier version! the rolls are great. definitely worth checking out! plus the new remodel allows for more patrons then ever before! 4 stars! check it out!

D4XcuZNHW3Hu-5fZFSvxFg.text: It is with great sadness and a deep sense of loss that I must amend my previous rating of what was once the best sushi in all of Vegas. Once rated a 5 star, it now lies more around the 3 star range.    To be sure, the crowds are still lining up for a seat at this one-time fine establishment, but one wonders if the restaurant's popularity may have contributed to its current downfall.  Since my last review of Yama, the place has certainly gotten a lot busier. But management has not responded well to the rush of new business.   Here is a few things that have gone very wrong at Yama: * The fish is no longer fresh. Rather than cutting the fish from the filet as it is ordered, they pre-cut several hundreds of pieces at a time - and the quality of the fish has suffered immensely, with most pieces having a soft, slimy film covering them. * The place is way too crowded. Rather than focusing on a great dining experience, management has decided to try and cram as many people as possible along the bar and around the tables. Turnover seems to be the most important factor. If I didn't know any better, I would say they have added seats to accommodate more customers in the same sized space. * The chefs are rushing. It appears as though the place has completely abandoned the 'Art' of sushi in favor of speed and efficiency. They give little regard to the presentation and balance of the dishes. Far too many times I have been handed a plate that has way too much or way too little of something, like so much vinegar on the roll that the rice crumbles at the slightest touch.  Be sure that these issues were not a factor for the many years I have enjoyed Yama - that is until recently. Hopefully there is still time to fix them.   Don't get me wrong, I am happy for Yama's success - I just wish it was not at the expense of what made them great to begin with.

GTJi-VfirtQpZLpr86slVA.text: Great AYCE sushi! I am so pleases to have stumbled across this gem. I had a few rolls ala carte as I neber eat enough to partake in the AYCE but my boyfriend tore up th AYCE. My favorite roll was the Strip Tease. The Miso soup was good too. I will definitely be back!

8rD5JZoxylikNiy0rawTmQ.text: Totally worth the cost.  The food was great and the staff was very friendly.  The names of the sushi were definitely ice breakers and kept our group entertained and laughing the whole night.  I.e. "who's your daddy" "son of  the beach" "man whore". I loved the spicy seafood salad, and the "Damn harry"...not to be confused with the Harry Potter.  If you start to get full but still want to try other options, you can ask them to do half rolls.  Time limit for AYCE is 2 hours.  They start timing once everyone is seated.  Dessert is also included :)

_RclZDF9hOv7phByt19Oxg.text: The sushi and other oceanic creatures were very fresh and for the price, you can't complain! I loved the soft shell crab and the happy ending...no really, its a roll. Lol the service was a little crazy but all in all a great experience!  We try to go there everytime we are in town.

D2lF6Qo9YfaynhEjLONmfQ.text: I know what you're thinking, strip mall all you can eat sushi in a land locked city, and not with a major namesake behind it...don't worry. I had that same feeling, and someone told me to just be a little carefree. Risk that ocean biological neuro-toxin, motor control is overrated anyways! Once you get beyond that initial hesitation and you come inside, you'll be glad you did.   The prices are amazing, and unlike many (read almost all) all you can eat sushi joints, every roll is not on top of the artificial crab California roll...which is a great, great, great thing since artificial crab gets real old real quick and is such an over powering and pungent flavor that no matter what you put on top of it, if it's the third or later roll with a cali base, all you'll taste if fake crab.  So based on my extensively perfectly researched and developed rating system Yama gets a solid 4 stars. The service is good, the quality is good, and I really like it. However, the ambiance is a little awkward with only Japanese paper walls separating dinning tables...hello overhearing of someone's medical problems...Other than that if you're near UNLV and have a BIG sushi craving, hit me up and let's pig out!

NI_YjIqh5P5OrrT94qRteg.text: Bleh what a disappointment on my return visit 6 months later!  FIrst of all - the all you can eat deal used to include the Uni, and Toro, as well as a few other special items - now - you can order only 1 per person.  Secondly - when I was there on Tuesday Sept 6th - they were out of everything! No toro, no uni, no whole hamachi.  What a waste of a meal!  It was not worth it without these items... I feel deceived! I will not return.

TIvgK2RZ70ibRTrSd3CH7w.text: Best all you can eat sushi in Las Vegas. $21.95 for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mochi.

PH7KDu2H3r3YlRTnqJxv5A.text: With all you can eat lunch for under twenty and dinner at twenty three, I can see why Yama is always jammed pack. Quick turnovers must be the business plan for this restaurant, because no table sat dirty for more than a minute. The speedy service and vast amounts of food is good enough reason for this restaurant to be constantly busy.   My friend and I were greeted at the door and sat promptly upon entrance. Our drink orders were taken and delivered within minutes. It took a couple of minutes for our waitress to come introduce herself, but you need that time to look over their menu. When she did come around, she was helpful and gave good suggestions.  We ordered the a bunch of rolls and they were all good, but drowning in sauce. Every roll on the list comes with some kind of dressing, and they do not go light here. In fact, everything on the menu comes with something on or on the side for dipping. The nigiri were enormous blocks of rice topped with an equally frightening slab of fish. I prefer my nigiri to be on the smaller side and will order more if I want. The overall taste was good, but I wonder how I would feel if I had the chance to taste the fish alone.

4n-kHsgmrGNtdJDfDuhtww.text: In Las Vegas on Business and used Yelp to find this spot. Based on good reviews we decided to give it a try and are very happy we did. The hostess was very nice and sat us promptly. There are so many rolls to choose from I was having a hard time deciding on what to order. Our waitress explained that we could choose the all you can eat option and order halves of the rolls so that we could have a good variety. A lot of times people reference good food to simply quantity or size and I am always disappointed. That is simply not the case here...the sushi is fresh and the rolls are excellent. Our server Leslie was awesome...THE VALUE FAR EXCEEDS THE COST!!! I will definitely make sure to come back next time I am in Las Vegas!!!

sg1_LibWFS97WYQqXc16Kw.text: Got sick here in sept of 2013, then again in sept 2014. I wont eat here again. I was so sick, I was layed up for SEVEN DAYS. It's always busy here though,  and its a great deal if you like playing Russian Roulette with food poisening.

KHKwFlEd2_RxVZ7f80Fvyw.text: I started coming to Yama Sushi back in 2004. When my wife and I started dining here, there was usually like 2 or 3 people there and is was quiet and very personal. Now there is consistently a line to get in.  It is possibly the best AYCE place in town. The menu is huge but it does not need to be on the menu for you to order. You want something special just ask and they accommodate. All the appetizers are included and the beer is cheap. The service is STILL personable and exceptional even with it being crowded all the time. The food comes fast and most important is that everything is fresh. I have never ever smelled the fish when walking in to the restaurant.  This place is a hole in the wall dive with no frills just awesome food and great friendly service.  I keep trying a few new places closer to me but find that I continually compare them to Yama and no one meets the same standard.

wwo2JWb5h53KBig6UwT_WA.text: This is a nice option off the strip.  The kama teriyaki was quite good.  I tried several specialty rolls and they were better than average, which for an all you can eat is a score.  If you're coming from the strip, make sure you ask the hostess which taxi company to call for your ride back.  I called 2 that left me standing before I asked, and the one they suggested came within minutes.

R1lLV2dD6auabQQ4iKTqLA.text: Love this place. About $25/person for AYCE dinner. My favorite is the Japanese Lasagna and the chocolate mochi ice cream.  My boyfriend's favorite is You the Man.  My only complaints are that the service is inconsistent and the tables are too close together - you're practically sitting in your neighbors lap.

sGfGfdaCvswWv70ZKxFZmg.text: An all you can eat sushi restaurant with QUALITY sushi. They had excellent selection of sushi and appetizers (the hamachi Kama was excellent! My mom ordered 3 on top of all the sushi we had!!) What surprised me was the eager service they gave us! Regular restaurants are hard to get the waiters/waitresses' attention. Nope not this one. These people were willing to serve us and continuously came to our table to see if we wanted more.

dAaKDFOHwQSn1jSntFeoJQ.text: All you can eat sushi for a flat rate! The rolls just keep coming till you say "no mas", The specialty rolls are quite awesome. I had several of the sushi pieces, the fish is fresh, firm and just as it should be. The rice is cooked well. However, this a personal choice, I like a little bit of the vinegar on the rice to give it a subtle sourness to compliment the sweetness of the fish. The rice felt like well done steamed rice. It's a matter of choice. It absolutely beats the sushi served at most buffets on the strip. If you love sushi, this is a must try in Las Vegas.

EHolOG-7OCG5IJFD2z2l1Q.text: Ate here a few months back and seriously there food is excellent!!! Man whore roll is amazinggggggg. The Garlic Tuna is excellent, and there Unagi is very good as well.

6JbKL_Jlf0raURImJrUVWg.text: I used to like this place until my friends cars starting getting broken into at this location. Ghetto!! Last time I went they charged me $4 for a tiny portion of uneaten rice off of halibut hamachi. I took it out of her tip and won't be returning here again.

IBJ3MoEkMFnlnFdge3dIBw.text: We were very impressed by this all-you-can-eat sushi joint. It was a gem! They have a wide selection of appetizers and sushi rolls to choose from their menu.  All the sushi was fresh and really good. The service was great and the food came out quickly. I highly recommend Yama Sushi!

X0XRZhpp2yeSUawS6hklEA.text: Way over rated! The all you can eat sushi is a joke! If you don't finish a sushi roll they charge you extra. So if You don't like a sushi roll & don't eat it you get charged extra. The staff is extremely rude and act like they are doing you a favor by serving you. Avoid this over rated place!

naOHfJk3veMTMr0yT5rBzA.text: I don't know what all the hype is about, this place was terrible. We arrived early to avoid the rush and was promptly seated. The service was good. Very fast and friendly but the sushi was mainly rice, looked sloppy and didn't seem to be fresh. Some of the fish was chewy. The restaurant was small, cramped, and dirty.

o7jXV6coY9ACORELAOcTAA.text: Once in a while I get an ultimate craving for all-you-can-eat sushi. I feel like it is sushi junk food and I basically try to order everything creamy, crunchy, and baked! During a recent trip to Vegas I met two of my best girlfriends at Yama Sushi to stuff our faces, and that we did! You just have to know that when you go to an all-you-can-eat sushi place it's not going to be the most amazing sushi there is, but this place wasn't actually bad. The best part was seeing my girlfriends again and the heart-warming conversations we had about what we have accomplished over the last several years. Time sure flies by! Photos on my blog...

DGH8T9bA47sQK80It4FU8w.text: I don't always eat sushi but when I do it needs to be fresh. Yama Sushi provides great sushi at a great price in Vegas. Save yourself some $$$ and go to Yama 5 minutes east of the strip. You will be happy you did.

19dHocV2s1nT4yd8xo9MNQ.text: Holy hell!  This is easily the best sushi I've ever had. Cray flavor, AYCE, and it's just off the strip (driveable). The only down side is the size of the restaurant. A little on the small side...

7thr0gZnppyzfmrfXk3AeQ.text: We are having some great sushi in Vegas. It's good for not being in Oceanside. Good food at a low cost.,

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seaweed salad kicks butt!!!

sLSwTQDMGu1x7GmlhjBIaQ.text: Good Sushi too long a wait. I still recommend the place though. They have great Ayc menu and they always let me have all the mochi I want.

77NiuMU_O_nLsutWxmrjBQ.text: Best place in Vegas and most of the country. Great prices. Can get busy as this is a local spot and small. Hidden in a strip mall. I always suggest this place!!

MMFMRcJIFVza3JGDfa0zjQ.text: I gotta give this place 3.5 stars. Quality of sushi is better than my past experiences at Sushimon, but still can't beat the variety and taste of Sushimon sushi! They definitely have better service here, but TOO much rice in their nigiri! Boo for that!  Dunno if I'llbe back here again....

REQfUaiVJ59CsYLY7EX9PA.text: The first time I came here  with my boyfriend was back in November  the service and the food was great,  the servers were on top of you and your orders. Decided to go back for his birthday and the service was awful. We got the all you can eat, and it took forever for our orders to arrive, by the time they would bring us our food, the rolls previously ordered had already settled and we were unable to eat more. We had 3 different waitresses so it was extremely unorganized. We were aware that this place gets extremely busy, so we decided to go early so we could enjoy ourselves but it turned out to be the opposite. It really spoiled the dinner :/.

guhRhWtRVUfbFqAfwZyN6g.text: Wow, this place is so worth cab fare!  The rolls are so well put together and delicious!   Not your 'traditional' sushi place but man do they deliver on quality.  Located in a 'reasonably sketch' part of town.. (definition of reasonably sketch; "well i don't fear for my life but that hobo screaming obscenities toward the sky is certainly looking at me funny, better mind my wallet) If you can appreciate quality sushi rolls this place is a must visit!

NncsuGKXj-AgJjg3SUboIg.text: I come here. When I'm desperite. Service=mediocre, and I'm ALWAYS down for all you can eat sushi, but I seem to get heckled about my options. Eh. Most times i get a semi dirty table, why i still go? Hungry. The miso soup is the best you can hope for, and i feel the servers are usuallyh playing dumb.

vu1o60Cb9-_L4Pb5gPxr-w.text: Oh my goodness, AYCA Sushi for $20.95 (2 hours) is a heck of a deal and a lot of other people seemed to have realized that as well. This place was crowded and fast paced. As we arrived on a Saturday afternoon there were about 10 people outside of the restaurant waiting to be seated. We actually got a mini table for 2 right next to the door,  crammed in a corner, right away. This was definitely interesting. Nonetheless, the servers were quick on their toes and our water cups were full during our entire visit. Quality of Sushi wasn't bad. I really liked it actually. The only thing that bothered me a little bit was the big cuts of fish on the Nigiris, and the big chunk of rice under the fish. I had a hard time chewing and swallowing those, other than that, the sushi cuts were really good.

-HuMIcd5z1w_kSDymCsCBw.text: All I can say is WOW!.  I lived in Okinawa for seven years and this is as good or better than anything I had in Japan.  The menu is very thorough, the prices are reasonable, and the fact it's less than $30.00 AYCE made while you wait and always fresh makes this the best place in town.

F1H7joezd6H0X7d6BfYOgw.text: So after photographing the first day of the AVN Expo, I got the urge for sushi (no pun).   I passed by this placed since it was next door to a CVS and I needed batteries.  Okay, I really wanted was just fish. Not rolls. Just cut fish. Sashimi and sushi.  The maguro was a bit frozen and pale. The sake lacked in luster but the hirame and hamichi (kudos).  Luckily, it was AYCE and I took advantage of it. They even had uni and sweet shrimp as part of the deal. I had the bar, so the cuts came on coming. I wish they had ankimo though. ugh!  Good sushi is never a roll.

vYz8jub0SLrNv38UmqaUog.text: Yelp has this one pegged well!!  Yama's got it figured out. The only comment I can add is they need to raise their prices!!  The meal I had (both quality and quantity) can easily command a $40-50 ticket.   Well done Yama Sushi!!!

6pBltas33gnKEnnEo7tcVQ.text: This stuff is good. I mean like good GOOD.   Service is iffy sometimes,but I haven't had a completely terrible experience yet. It's kind of a tiny place so it gets pretty packed pretty easily. The area it's in is kinda ehh. But I dream about this sushi. Prices are good.

8DxGSkplwDgKLeRG4cbg0Q.text: We decided to try a sushi bar away from the strip and were not diasppointed.  The fish was great, and so were the rolls we ordered.  Seafood salad was delicious.  Since it was our first time, we tried different rolls than the normal ones we get at our local sushi bar in Los Angeles.  Price is reasonable and comparable to what we pay at our local bar.  Will definitely be going back.

pmRy_OFW2hQIXK3XblyHkQ.text: Sushi Heaven....did the all you can eat, I don't know how this place stays in business.  No Name, Harry Potter, Wet Dream were very fresh and very good.  I tried many others and they all were very fresh and good, but these three stood out to me.  Love the seafood salad, and the red bean ice cream was spot on.

plpq_XnAPE2KLtfr6Qdy3w.text: All you ca eat sushi,Good price in Las Vegas, Missing one star cause Service should be more improved. I ordered a cup of water, it never came until I called the waiter 3 times.

q3IyzLVDoMKpn9bFphii2Q.text: The food is good, but the service is horrible. My service was Maria she brought us 2 rolls and left our party for rest of the night and they got some of our rolls messed up. Carlos was the only friendly and helpful person at this sushi place.

NJFzWhTfAT5pfKiBoER_yA.text: The first time I came here was March of 2010 with my best friends (4 other girls) and we all loved it.  We stumbled upon it by mistake, I think we might have seen an advertisement for it either that or we yelped it.  I just remember the interesting names of the rolls (manwhore roll, sticks out the most loll) and the fact that everything we ate was delicious.    So why the two star review?  Fast forward to edc weekend 2013 and I came here again with my boyfriend.  I was telling him about how good this place was because I had it before.  He loves sushi, and he's very picky about his sushi places.  This time around, it just was not good anymore.  I think it is because this time we focused more on nigiri rather than rolls and the fish is NOT fresh at all and they pack on so much rice.  The rolls are still good, but I mean anything is going to taste good if it's deep fried and smothered in spicy mayo.  The 2010 version of me did not try the nigiri, just rolls cause I did not really eat a lot of nigiri back then, just rolls.  The 2013 version of me though, will probably not come back here.  The fish is old and horrible, and I was happy I did not get a tummy ache because that would have ruined my edc plans.    Oh and I like to eat my fish first before I eat the rice because I actually enjoy the taste of sushi rice.  So I had a little rice pile on my plate that I was planning on eating.  The waitress comes by and tells me that because it is all you can eat, I have to eat the rice too.  I understand that she is just doing her job, but that irritated me a little bit.

L612Z64RU07KV1CNQ9VamA.text: A friend suggested we check this place out while in Vegas.  "$20 for all you can eat quality sushi" she told me, and she was RIGHT!!!  From the appetizers to the salads and hand rolls and specialty rolls to the nigiri, this place ROCKS!!!  Our servers Olaf and Mama Mia were totally awesome.  Always making sure we were satisfied and always keeping food on our table.  We even received omiyage b/c we're from Hawaii.  MAHALO Yama Sushi !!!

zTy6iVwlVHbxLNe2acUbkA.text: We saw this sushi place on yelp while we were visting las vegas this past weekend and thought we would try it since it had great reviews and we were looking for some great sushi without the high dollar price! Let me tell you when we found tjis place it looked very uninviting from the outside but once we got it .it was soo packed and noticed lots of business men inside eating so that validated us to stay. We ordered AYCE for a fair price of 24 dollars and you can choose anything on menu including desert. Every roll we tried was delicious and very fresh! We sat at sushi bar and service was good .We will always stop here for sushi when we visit vegas its a must! Highly recommend just get there early or you will be waiting for awhle.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tuna roll bomb!!

4UcHzfsgsbLrkM85QcR74A.text: Wonderful sushi restaurant located near UNLV and just down the road from the strip.  Food is excellent my friends and I usually come at least once a month.  Staff is very friendly and every one is eager to help make your experience very enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cmPnPc1Ighq7cBV2KUeizQ.text: This is the hidden jewel in Vegas. The diamond in the rough. A lot of out of towner's don't know about Yama because it's off the Strip. Don't waste your money at any other sushi spot in Vegas. Eat at Yama once, and you'll never wanna eat at another sushi spot again! $25 for all you can eat, tons of choices, great staff. All your typical appetizers, all your typical rolls, sushi, and sashimi. But what puts Yama above all the others are their special rolls! Many tasty selections to choose from. You can order by the half or full roll, and most of the rolls can be rolled into the seaweed cones by request (Son of the Beach hand roll!!!).   Hands down, Yama is the best sushi spot in all of Vegas. Don't go anywhere else to satisfy your sushi fix. You'll regret it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Son of the Beach hand rolls!!!

24ijyv96oCdwBfYEP6J-Xw.text: Another place I found by accident while exploring Las Vegas, and it was a pleasant surprise. I enjoyed the $20 all you can eat sushi lunch special, and it gives you your bang for your buck. The fish is incredibly fresh, the nigiri sushi is prepared and served quickly, and the waitstaff is friendly, attentive, and efficient. I would recommend this place for fresh sushi at a fairly reasonable price, as you can try so many options to keep you satisfied. I'm definitely coming back!

rxBaQdBHN7GbS2lhvhcU9Q.text: Seems like it's always crowded with out of towers. Its an AYCE sushi restaurant, which for me always sounds alarms. The fish was not that fresh and they were really fast on delivering sushi to you table. Which is good if you are hungry, but if you are trying to chat with your friends than forget about a peaceful conversation.   There was an interesting incident that happened in front of our eyes. A homeless man walked into the restaurant, his jeans were torn as was his shirt. The server got him a table right across from our table and later got into a huge argument over the homeless man eating left over food from other people's plates. It was kind of embarrassing and sad, but the restaurant ended up kicking the guy out. And this is what I mean, when I say that their service was really fast and it seemed like getting customers, feeding them fast and serving new customers impacts their quality of customer service. Also, sushi quality needs a lot of improvement.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi Kama
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unagi

ZeDxax1QjYDVcMqO7BSmoQ.text: Recommended by some friends.  The first night we got to Vegas. We had this for dinner.  There were a total of 6 of us and we literally ordered everything on the menu.   Customer Service - Definitely up to date. They were nice enough to offer us samples which I do not believe we have to finish. Yet every time they give us those samples , it's always 2 full plate filled. Yeah , that's not why we're there though but we finished it anyway. I was not impressed how when it comes to Sushi or appetizer , we only order 1 order of each and they hand us 2. They were literally throwing food over food at us.   For desserts , they let you choose 2 flavors and you can always get any flavored mochi with it as well.   I will definitely come back.

R3a3PPrP4O4xlamPeiccvA.text: I had the seafood salad and a califonia roll. All very good and well prepared. The aervice was excellent. Had all the attention I needed. Ill be back.

G75R2QS6FYiz0-yAyTtrAw.text: We came in on a very busy Valentine's Day! Our service  was very speedy, there were a ton of workers circulating picking up and dropping off plates everywhere. Definitely a lot more crowded than other times, did feel a little rushed but overall had an amazing time and the food was delicious!

cuW4LT5LGdgRcQijRHxpwQ.text: This place is amazing!  My family and I were on vacation and we were missing our sushi. My Aunty and her nephew are locals here in Vegas, so they suggested we come here. We are so glad we did. Being that we do not have sushi buffets in Hawai'i, you know we took advantage of that "all you can eat" sign we saw.  Reasonable pricing for all you can eat, and includes desserts as well? You can't go wrong at all, and if you know Hawai'i people, you know we can eat. Although, their spicy ahi(tuna) is far more spicy than home, because they don't mix mayo in it, it's still bomb ass sushi! If you're from Hawai'i and you're reading this, take a drive out here, you will not be disappointed.  Cheap prices, all you can eat, and good service! Definitely gonna come back here when in Vegas again, which we will be.

dO2ZihX0iYU8vZOTQkr5Kw.text: This is my eastside Vegas sushi pick.  Mainly if I just need a quick uni fix.  It's a bit tight quartered inside and sometimes there can be a wait to get seated because of it.  Decent, polite staff and quality sushi.  The price is moderate.  AYCE is fair and the "mandatory AYCE rice-fill" is not as aggressive as most other All you can eat joints.  Avid sushi goers know what I'm talking about.  Recommended -Hamachi -Uni -Yellow tail  Not impressed -dynamite -soft shell  Good spot for sushi lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very flavorful fresh uni here.

w4G1ScQOK2IQ2W4gWd_8pQ.text: Don't eat here. I almost died of a heart attack when I pointed out a COCKROACH to the waiter and he said it was a normal thing to see in their restaurant.   Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach! Cockroach!

o6xg7VkZiWknKan8H0f3Og.text: Best. Sushi. Ever. The fish was so fresh. The all you can eat (AYCE) for lunch for $20 is a steal. Like most AYCE places, I was expecting the nigiri and the sushi rolls to come with way too much rice to get the customer more full quicker, but that wasn't the case at all. The amount of rice was perfect. Not only was the fish buttery and melt-in-your-mouth fresh, the appetizers were equally tasty. We got the Korean barbecue short ribs, the agedashi tofu, shrimp tempura, as well as a few other items. All were well worth it. And to top it off, the service was efficient and very pleasant!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon (sake) nigiri

cK5TP4sp6ww9NpLLTPHBoQ.text: very good sushi and great service! the happy rainbow roll is a must! the spicy sexy roll is spicy but delicious  recommend this place for lunch or dinner with the family

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XrLQgXKD-d5zfJBrInGS0w.text: The food is not bad, but not great. The service was fast but they forgot our soups, and we were given plastic forks and it's very dirty inside. But it's cheap so you get what you pay for. But the place is so compact, it can get very claustrophobic and it's just not a good atmosphere...

9ZVNYTQDx7zQx8SQb8U6MA.text: Great sushi and good service! Everytime I'm in Vegas and craving sushi I stop by here. Sun of the beach is definetly my favorite. I have tried a couple other sushi spots in town but I like coming here when I want good sushi and fast service.

Q5WRZ5SGyNYO3La6IT293g.text: 3.5 stars  Yama I can say is sure dang efficient! They whip sushi out like its premade and service is attentive. We got here on a Saturday night at 5:30ish hoping to beat the dinner rush, the place was already busy!  I can't really comment how the raw fish tasted as I cannot eat it at this time, BUT the unagi was pretty good. The husband said that he enjoyed the scallop, yellowtail, uni, etc. BTW when the menu says spicy tuna/spicy crab, etc...it's pretty dang spicy! The nigri was a bit overstuffed with rice, but other than that the hubby said it was fresh. Another thing that threw me off was the there was huge stack of salmon in the cooler that was precut...gross! Mussels were a miss, but I think overall everything else was good.   We will probably be back eventually when I can try the fish!

Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy ending

T8iEjCKEMJR3L7JNXYKQMA.text: First yelp review...I recommend this place for AYCE or regular visit. Great service, many options, and the fish was fresh. The edamame was also delicious. I will come back when I am in Vegas and  want some sushi.

sD9N8zXNyv2fuQhNyKjMyA.text: Yama was once a awesome place, but now it has turn to crap. reason is they have forgotten the reason they became very popular was they had a very awesome presentation and quality in there sushi. Now its rush rush rush and it really doesn't matter to some of there sushi chefs which some of them shouldn't even be there. Paul  and  a couple of them are Great/Awesome chefs, like Jun was when i first started going there 13 years ago or longer. Farewell

zR3RCrFk2AmhWQ7DBhXhPw.text: Yama's Garlic Tuna is candy.  To the point that I've asked out-of-town-sushi-place's chefs to make this.  Yama does sushi perfectly. If I could afford it, I'd be here every day.

tUv4mLTfoM50njsEjFia7g.text: This place is amazing. The price is great, food is awesome, and service is super fast. I randomly found this place last year, and as a visitor to Vegas, I hate paying strip prices for quality sushi. But all you can eat for $24?! Yes, please! Normally all you can eat sushi is crappy rolls, but this is premium stuff here, so it's well worth the money. Definitely a must eat if you're looking for great sushi but don't want to pay $200 for two people.

td0hYTatRlp-n24Feu39uw.text: I see what the previous reviewer meant by the "80% rice" comment. Food was good. Good variety. I'm just gonna need this one chick who turned her nose up at me when I asked for a Perrier to have a stadium of seats the next time she feels like she wants to try it!

TC1i0CbigxuLWB7yScxt1w.text: Ok for one time to experience,  Way too much rice in rolls, food & service is just ok,

Z-9_NN5Rw7-j4IHfCP5cqQ.text: This place is just ewww. The sushi isn't fresh. The rolls have too much sauce. The fish to rice ratio is ok. Although the rice is rather hard. The decor is in need of a serious remodel.  If you know sushi, not Americanized sushi, I would not recommend. I really  can't believe yelpers have rated this place so high.

Sc4ulEa6wc7qvjURK92ouQ.text: I go out of my way for this place you can't beat it. Price and food quality all the way I love it   I love you Yama

JQUu8357aDdXd1FYj89t2w.text: Confused by the high rating.  It's inexpensive, but low quality.

MArGpcCbgINWNtxxboAxUA.text: The reviews are definitely spot on about this place. You can get good sushi anywhere, but great sushi and great service is hard to find. Definitely do the all you can eat but do half orders and try everything. Can't wait to go back.

F6KNq6f435b10LH5VQHZzQ.text: Been here before, sat at the bar, and it was good.  Tonight we brought family and it's terrible.  We waited for 30 min for food and it's not good at all.  Edamame came out last and it's over cooked.  Nigiri is flavorless and the cooked rolls took forever.  On top of that, service is terrible.  Our waiter is very nice but clearly spread too thin because we haven't seen him in about 15 minutes.  Probably not coming back unless we're desperate.

CljLNGaTHeJf8UaOE5nfLQ.text: Yama sushi: Maynoir is part ninja I swear I ordered food and the knife went wild. Food was amazing and fast plus the service and care with this kinds turn over is amazing. Be prepared to wait 20 min. It's worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yama Sushi is amazing

wRjjr_qydB5v2nRc4FN2FQ.text: Rolls were decent.  Place is busy which wasn't a problem.  Took about 20min to get seated.  Pretty good time.  Service is chaos.  Found it funny the waitresses weren't named, but numbered.  They forgot 2 of the rolls we ordered.  The table next to us had half their order forgotten.  Other than the price im not sure if we will rush back.

eYfj2-QTJwBved7Yf_0EaQ.text: Sushimon is greater than Yama sushi.  Service sucks - waitress = rude Tuna (Saku tuna from Walmart) sucks Dining area sucks  Although it is the cheapest AYCE dinner sushi in Vegas, you get what you pay for. Their hamachi was decent so that's why i gave this place 2 stars. I ordered uni first, it was not until the 4th time I ordered they told me they ran out... Spend the extra 2 dollars and headway somewhere else.

adjJWn20AmK81bShYS-D5g.text: Great food and price for lunch - all you can eat sushi, and the perfect place to meet up with friends!

wR-Y-KjjEO_DgkeuMvCGDQ.text: Went in on a Sunday night around 6pm and even though there was a crowded wait, we were seated in less than ten minutes. What you do with AYCE is scan the two menus (one with everything on it from desserts to appetizers to hand rolls and the other with pictured specialty rolls) and order a few choices. They are delivered almost instantly! Devour those and REPEAT! I love this system even though at times it can be confusing. This place is great even though its crowded, get to know your neighbors! it can be as fun as you make it. I love the waitresses that urge you to try everything. It was my dad's first time AYCE and I'd have to say he was liking it.   Tips:  -Bring a pen to mark what you have tried!  -Drink green tea (which is included in AYCE) when you feel like you've eaten too much yet still want to go on! :D our little secret. which isn't really a secret as it is a known fact... -Ask for half-rolls when you just want to try a roll for the first time! Really saves your stomach.  -Don't skimp on the mochi and ice cream dessert at the end!...or inbetween rolls ;D

jTOhZDa4fEubJZDZAQ7oKA.text: The sushi was enjoyable, ALTHOUGH the service was the worst I have experienced in my life. My boyfriend and I sat at the bar and two Chefs were preparing our food. While conversations with the Chefs they asked if I we my boyfriends sister/cousin. We politely said that I was his girlfriend and that we had been dating for quite a while now. The comment that one of the Chefs said complete dumbfounded me. He had said " This girl looks different than the previous girl from the week before. (This was our first time visiting this sushi place) Then they kept making rude comments towards us as a couple. We left that place with such a horrible experience. If I could give a place no stars for the experience we had this is it. The food was good but the service was the worst.

dDeJ7WWzGQxusUBGgtubFw.text: One of the best AYCE Sushi places I've ever been to!  The restaurant is small, but you know it's good because people will wait up to an hour to eat some sushi!   The AYCE menu is big and it includes dessert as well!  You have to try the seafood salad, get spicy!  The flavor is amazing and it has a fresh taste that leaves you completely satisfied.    As far as rolls go I would recommend the Man Whore (this one has cooked salmon),    Whenever I leave Yama I literally feel like I gained 10 pounds from eating so much delicious sushi.  The fish is very fresh and the rolls come out very quickly!   Whether you're a Vegas local or a tourist, this place is a must!

N4Twa45dn2TNkZrta1Lj5g.text: Chef is pissed and waitress doubted that the rice has too much vinegar.  Also loaded on rice which is not a good quality. Service is slow.  The chef yells who complains in all you can eat sushi place. Very rude. Never come again. Vinigar taste...worst sushi place. Do not come here.  Oh and one guy ran to the restroom to vomit everything.  Later waitress was more attentive and nicer.

vsHtBhrORbsAeJcCFOannw.text: Simply the BEST in Vegas. I have been going to YAMA for ever 10 years and will always recommend it...so GO!!

lgrEkcDLGWmGJQNs-_TsSQ.text: awesome service from start to finish. food is very good i recommend to try em all especially the salmon collar/hamachi collar. i would have given it a 5 if the walk ways are not narrow and have a better cooling system.

ZRixVZ8Ajf-JqauOAfNr9w.text: Another Cockroach confirmation.....but this is far worse than the previous stories...  Yama Sushi was once a favorite place of mine.  Fantastic food, quick service, fairly priced....however, as of late....it's getting just out-right scary!  As I sit at the bar during lunch, management decide's it's a good idea to pull the wallpaper off and change the scenery of the restaurant.  So, as they pull the sheets off from behind the bar (literally...above the cooking stations)...dozens upon dozens of CockRoaches begin to scatter up the wall and around the bar!  I stopped my chewing and stared in utter amazement.  Really guys? ...Really?  But they didn't seem to think twice about it....because they decided to just play it off and offer everyone at the bar a free Tiger Roll as compensation...lol.  Nice try.  It sucks...because...they really did have one of the better spots in town, but I can't go back, knowing that they have a complete disregard to maintain a proper facility (note the other reviews regarding cockroaches).

HLBwVOBbjtGsRs8qwORipw.text: My favorite Japanese restaurant at the moment!!!   Quantity AND Quality. Ate here two days in a row. Enough said!

O3OGKZ4lRwmMYhd76skHgw.text: I think I'm addicted to all you can eat sushi now ever since I tried it over here in the OC.  It's such a good deal!  I mean one roll is like 10 bucks usually, so just ordered 3 items on the menu, you pretty much break even!  I yelped this place before we came to Vegas and was really looking forward to it.  My favorite roll was one that had cream cheese, damn I forgot the name! Wait, it was called The Wet Dream.  I guess the cream cheese represents the "wet" part of the dream.  Oh Yama, you so nasty!  All the other rolls we tried were okay.  One thing I didn't enjoy was that most of the rolls have raw fish on them.  I'm not a huge fan of raw fish sushi.  I don't know why, I'll eat it, but it just tastes....rather raw...  The service was a little weird, we had like 10 different girls coming to our table, so nobody really seemed to keep track of what we were waiting for.  That was odd.  I did enjoy this place, but next time I come to Vegas, I'll probably look up a different sushi place.

OcGzWXs2rv94SikFnkb8QQ.text: 25 for unlimited sushi, doesn't get any better than that! And it's cooked when you order, it's not a buffet so it's hot and delicious! Very very very good rolls, pretty dang big too! I highly recommend this place for any sushi lover! I walked out extremely satisfied!

hlGtYX5NoKXlQMXJfhPB9Q.text: I'm writing this 1hour after I've experienced all the hype.  I had expectations for this place from all the reviews and a friend reassuring me its the best in town... if that's the best in town its a pretty slack standard...  The service is good. The hostess was prompt, a little unorganized, confusing the order of names for people waiting to be seated, (which could have been solved by simply using numbers...) Don't fire her for this she's cute.  Jokes aside lets get down to what was not impressive.  While getting seated I ordered their soft shell crab appetizer, as recommended by a fellow yelper. Disappointed that it was heavily breaded, overcooked, it wasn't a nice golden brown, but a dark-borderline singed brown, the sauce that accompanied it didn't compliment it all. I decided to just hastily consume the food and down it with my drink.  I love spicy tuna and its many variations, but was extremely disappointed at how flat it tasted! No tang, no kick, no flavor, just the rice. Moving onto the soft shell crab, there's was no prominence in its taste, the crab lacked significant flavor to make me say, hey this is crab! & it tastes great! None of that.  Moving to my third & fourth set, came the "devil" & the "you the man" rolls, the devil roll flat out failed when it touched my palate why give it such a name if it fails to deliver. The next roll faired a little better, its doesn't go all the way to impress but stops short of uncertainty. The jalapeno sauce gives it a mild tinge of attitude, but for its contents, it just doesn't hit the mark.  Man Whore. The idea of taking a sushi and coating it with cheese and throwing it in the oven was most appealing. The first roll went down smoothly and I thought this night was going to turn with this roll. Come the second roll it just abruptly ended with a wtf! I suddenly found myself trying to figure out the weird mound of meat on top of my roll, wth is it exactly, cutting corners/cost using ground beef/pork/chicken? Where's the fish? Why does it feel like I'm eating someone's leftovers...  Last roll for the night. Before calling it a night & grabbing my disgusting check, I was greeted by my final plate, dubbed the "No Name" by the person making my sushi. Tuna & Salmon wrapped in a green something...(assuming this is lettuce), coated with jalapeno sauce & God knows what else. As this was a custom creation, it felt that it had more character & creativity involved, it was a well balanced morsel, a hint tang, a mild spike and a dash of sweetness. Thank you for that Mr.Jun  In closing, wth you're still reading this...go find another sushi place if you're looking for something special or something that doesn't taste flat.

Sv1Rj_sF13flzXgglLwfVA.text: Great Sushi Buffet! One of the best sushi buffets I've ever eaten. For around $25, you can order fresh sushi, appetizers, deserts, and salads. There is no conveyer belt, and nothing is premade. Everything is fresh from the chef. Rolls were delicious! Definitely come here on an empty stomach. Ordering individual rolls isn't worth it.  Go for the buffet!

Uyi2n_yhCQmsm3AsSnB2cw.text: Love this place! Have tried several sushi restaurants since i moved here and this is hands down the best and the best priced. Is always crowded and the small space actually adds to the ambiance!

boecysTZ2HWPoK43P80C8A.text: Best sushi I ever had. Then again I'm from the Midwest so probably not the best judge. Al you can eat sushi was about $25. Well worth it, just make sure to try and eat every thing as its made as you order. I heard they may charge you more if you just waste food. I started doing half orders now that I go solo when I get the craving. But I recommend starting with the seafood Salad. Mmmmmhhhm. I went from a hater to a lover of sushi because of Yama. I wish I could give this a 5 star but honestly, I've only had like 10 different sushi places and never on the coast. Plus after watching "Jiro Dreams of Sushi" an awesome documentary on Netflix, I now believe there is a better sushi out there that will blow my mind... Not in the desert though.  This film gave  me a better understanding and deeper appreciation for sushi. Japan is in the bucket list to enjoy the best Sushi in the planet!  Till then Yama is the best in the South West and only one for me in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A free mug after my 3rd visit!

1p7awl2KYzRXfQnBElJGWQ.text: I sort of grew up in sushi restaurants and I have been to the best ones all of the world.  My comments here might be bit harsh for a sushi buffet.  The service is amazing, both sushi chef and waitress were smiling a lot.   The sushi rice is bit too hard, and obviously not flavored enough.  The sweet shrimps were very tiny and I will never try their Uni again.  But if you prefer CA rolls and other stuff that has tons of sauce on it.  This is the place.

rmICY7dpdFG1_pGF0LMfTw.text: So I finally got to try Yama after going to UNLV for how many years now. Lol! Yama has a great all you can eat menu which isn't bad based on pricing. Two rolls already covers the price so might as well get all you can eat right? Plus, you can get ice cream or mochi after your meal if you still have room. FYI their rolls are kinda dirty i.e "Wet dream" and "Morning after" however, very unique and fun!

Wq6VGUN90lB0axzOEZsRcA.text: Thank you Yelp! This place is one of the best AYCE I ever had.   Like other posts, its Premium sushi unlike Todais. I am glad we walked two miles from the strip. The walk was brutal so heres a tip...take Bus 202 from the Westin behind Harrahs. Its two dollars a person.  For 23 dollars a person, 1 person gets to pick two selection. For the first round, my fiance and I got 4 custom rolls, Wet Dreams, Superman, One Night Stand & Strip Tease. Yes the names are funny but they are hella good.  After the first round, we ordered some entree items with nigris.  We got full after that and ordered half rolls (AWESOME)  To finish our night off, we got 3 orders of Mochi, Mango, Strawberry and vanilla.   The service was excellent, they kept taking our orders and fill up our water.   Definitely coming back here in the future!!!!

Mc72UxleXdk1gI5dVT1rQg.text: Great staff, good sushi and always busy. The constant wait should tell you something.  It's one of better AYCE sushi places in town but the wait time can be a hindrance. The sesame chicken and teriyaki beef for appetizers are very good. Most rolls I had are great and made well. I would refer this place to anyone just be cautious that the wait may be a while.

inFPsAsdV9TMbiQjXj1nDA.text: Awesome place!  We got to the restaurant around 8 pm and waited about 20 minutes to get seated at the bar. Super packed but the wait wasn't that bad.  The AYCE is $23 and includes made to order sushi, rolls, cooked foods, salads, appetizers, and dessert. A steal.  Ordered lots of salmon, tuna, yellowtail, baked mussels, some rolls, uni, sweet shrimp and demolished it all. They also have the option of ordering half of a roll instead of the whole just in case you want to try something new. Fish was fresh, and the rice didn't fall apart.  Servers were pretty much on the ball as well, as they kept our teas and waters capped.  For dessert... mochi ice cream balls :D  I'd definitely come back  when I visit Vegas again. :)

jdxpQdSwV9ofYuHDBinG3A.text: I wish this was by my house. I love the rolls here and their garlic sauce. I had the Hawaii roll, the Harry Potter roll, and the Halibut. all were great love that they put a little bit of the garlic sauce on the halibut ( i could eat the halibut everyday). I would get all three again and again. I agree with Misti Y. do not sit in little side room to left of entrance. air was full tilt in there and felt like we were eating in the walk in cooler.

feCJYjlmNZpPm08GBzPkBQ.text: very very dirty restaurant. i got food poisoning from here. avoid at all costs!!!! trust me they are very dirty my friends used to work here. i will not return.

XCLkkTW2ESopvKdcU39uww.text: I like to sit at the counter I have no problem with the sushi chefs, they do their job well and are very attentive. I was once asked by a server not to ask the chef for tempura but I didn't see the waiter for a bit and I love shrimp tempura! The next time I went there the girls asked us what we would like to drink and thats all she asked us. I did'nt want to bother so I just order items like rolls. The waitress came by to refresh water but never NEVER asked me what I would like to order. My boyfriend sat there and watched me be to shy to order from her.

X_z22OhGWwCyA8HZXXRtVg.text: Very good but a couple steps from fabulous.  All you can eat 24.00. Wait a little long

p-SAjFclKNok9WbbWzK69g.text: I'm new to Vegas. I have eaten here about 12 times.  I try to sit at the bar and watch them work. Never had a bad experience here. They do require you to eat whatever you order. The cost is  $25.00 per person.

A-rzgabBEGn_uRHvJeHSOg.text: I was there the other day and it was really busy. I  waited quite a while and I felt like I was ignored. Finally I was seated but it took long time to get any sushi. I prefer Sushi Mon on Eastern. They are more fast and have better fish.

m3awu2bgemuCKhXK2QT05Q.text: Came here for the first time with a co worker at lunch! I will totally be back!  The all you can eat lunch special is well worth it!  The firecracker roll is a MUST! SO good!  It is a rather small place, and the seating does tend to feel a little on top of each other, but the service was fast and the food made up for it!  It did seem to draw a large lunch crowd, to get there somewhat early!

OKnlq3Dau4am6Z5KLwEqGA.text: Came out for my brother in law. We had a large group of 12 guys ready to eat! We all did the all you can eat and it was perfect. The food never stopped coming out of the kitchen! The service was great. First time here and when and if I'm ever back in Las Vegas I'll know I have a good spot to enjoy myself.

TfJsCGsSotQZ9otC3F1brQ.text: Yuck would never eat here ever again. I have no idea how they managed to snag a 4 star review. My cousin literally had to run to bathroom to throw up while the rest of us tried to suffer down the remainder of our food. Gag.   Recently they also had something on the news about roaches in their sauce like legit roaches. Gag there are far better sushi joints in Vegas but yamas is far from good sushi. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

yKeuLqiJuwWx3sW76IdNLQ.text: Good place to Sushi with family & friends. Great services & smiley faces. Highly recommended will come again sure

v3YnDe9YKAG0JZvt1GzjVg.text: Reno has a lot of all you can eat sushi (AYCE) restaurants. However my good friend recommended we go to this AYCE while we were in Vegas. The restaurant feels small with cozy, but we didn't feel like we were ever crowded or bunched up. The servers and sushi chefs were proficient and provided great services. This restaurant also had a lot of options that Reno's restaurants don't have.  First off it was about $20 for AYCE and everything on the menu was included. I, myself ordered items on the menu that I knew wouldn't be able to get in Reno. Some of those items were Takoyaki (wheat flower based batter filled with minced octopus), Hamachi Kama (hamachi collar), and Uni (sea urchin). My friend also mentioned that he always orders their gyoza (potstickers).   Their sushi rolls were delicious, but for me I made sure to get my money's worth with those unique items. My favorite was the Hamachi Kama because the collar part of the fish tends to be the most fatty and juicy part. The meat was buttery and very flavorful.   I'm glad my friend mentioned this restaurant because I definitely left feeling full and happily satisfied.

eU2QZuVVvRBkDeZC7hR75w.text: Too loud because too many people in this small place. You literally siting very very close to other customers that you have to think what you talking about and no one listening you. Also food there has different taste, not really delicious, I like more Yama Sushi in Chinatown.

OG7hVjjhmIKls_tethFKxA.text: We eat at yama sushi all of the time on spring mountain. However this one opened at 11am so we decided to give this one a shot. This location is very out dated, seats are too close together, menus look like they've never been cleaned, walls just look like filth which is a turn off.  My normal order is wet dream, I ordered it here and they slapped a chunk of cream cheese onto it. When I order it at spring mountain it's melted into the roll. I ordered something simple as edamame and it was hard as a rock. Not the soft salty as usual. Clearly recipes aren't being followed. Salmon also is never available at any location I eat at? Why is it on the menu if you guys don't want to serve it?? Very frustrating.   Customer service is just as bad, many females talking gossip at the register while one Asian waitress runs around taking everyone's order. She was the best part of this place. I definitely do not recommend this location. Very disappointing not worth the money.

NxgLI9UemB7-V6kE-n2-Lw.text: Went in around 5 on a Saturday, and the place was packed. The service could be better as we had to wait more then 10 mins to order food and also wait another 15 upon waiting on side items, SIDE ITEMS!! But nevertheless the sushi was good and the service actually got better as we were eating. But still not an excuse to keep ur guest waiting to order.   (Also got beef teryaki and sesame chicken and they were both burnt so i would stay away. Would recommend the wet dream and the no name)

uvz9HRCTSgV5Oa2SJeBrLw.text: Wow never expected a sushi bar on the strip would be so accommodating, offer great sushi and drinks at non-tourist prices! The sushi was excellent, very fresh and included exotic choices! Highly recommend when in Vegas!

_WaS2cE_rEzrQHYK6ckINg.text: I don't understand the hype of this place.  Service isn't very good, and the quality was ok at best. For me service plays a huge part in any business, if you have to wave someone down or can't find your server at all there's an issue.  It was a busy night so I can understand having so much to do, but they were staffed properly and they didn't seem to want to help each other.   Honestly this is not my go to place for sushi, there's too much hype for a place with poor service.

SdzVH1TUFS07wiDlEr-htg.text: I'm really not impressed with this location. We witnessed two separate employees not washing their hands after using the restroom and returning to serving food.  Several of their menu items were overly spicy drowned in some type of pepper powder.  The service was very slow.   They are also sloppy in the way they cut their fish. We found a bone in one of our pieces and the pieces are unevenly thick.    Something has changed with this location. Years ago it used to be one of my favorites. I will now take my business elsewhere.

N9j2d56vQ8YB2jPUg9d6UQ.text: We came here for dinner to celebrate a family members birthday and they took our reservation for 26 people. The other location on spring mountain would not. This flamingo location appears to be smaller than the location on spring mountain.  The reason I gave this location 4 stars is because the sushi just did not play up to par. It seemed like every roll we ordered was a standard California roll topped with different toppings. The salmon nigiri was perfect but the tuna nigiri was embarrassing. Either the fish was not sliced nicely or it was a very low quality tuna that was used. It was like chewing on rubber. The salmon kama, on the other hand, was delicious. They did run out of it right after I ordered my share.  Not much of a dessert option here.  Just different flavors of mochi ice cream and flavored ice cream.  Maybe it was just an off night because we have been here before for lunch and everything was delicious. Regardless, I'm sure we'll be back. My family from Kauai love the AYCE option since that's not available there.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UPHoP4NNGSeN9sUyN7l-Kw.text: This has always been our favorite sushi restaurant. We haven't been here in a while... we decide to stop in last Friday for dinner.   The food here is soo worth it!! My favorite roll is the happy ending, the lemon on top and the ponzu sauce pair very well together.   The service was a little slower than I remember but for as busy as it was, it was decent. I loved that they added items to their menu. They now have fried rice. I know, why would you want fried rice at a sushi restaurant? My son does not eat sushi and we usually order him noodles but they now have more options because he loves fried rice. I also noticed poke options that I dont remember seeing before.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half order volcano roll

OW8IXQmIRtCfCfGpumBY7A.text: Came here last week for lunch, and I've noticed that the quality of the food has deteriorated, which is very disappointing as I have referred many of my friends to this place.  Over the last 10 years I've been a loyal customer here and this has always been a go to lunch spot for me. However on my latest visit the fish quality has degraded much more than before, and it's very noticeable. The fish to rice Ratio is no longer the same as it was before. The quality of the fish is also not as good anymore. The cut is of a lower quality, and the uni was not fresh.   Service was good, things came out pretty quick. Bathrooms are still clean parking can be a little difficult in the plaza during lunch time.

AJrKznNL31vwc43qnfK98Q.text: You cannot beat the price of $24 for all you can eat sushi.  The reason for the three stars is you get what you pay for.  Sushi was good and fresh. It other side items were less impressive.  We ordered two soft shell crab appetizer.  Second one was old and fishy.  Agedashi tofu was not memorable.  Udon was good but came with tempura soaked in it even though I asked it to be separate.   My tea was lukewarm and I had to ask for a new one.   Overall I rather pay more for more consistency In food quality and service.

2HRBPhmLxxjxcdP1nzaT_A.text: Love this place so good and nice people work there always get my food fast never a long wait

Tb09nLnIaW65kGXCcKSJFQ.text: 3rd time here and everything was delicious today.  We had the AYCE again which is totally worth the $20 for lunch.  Service is good but the food could be on the slow side coming out.  But it's all worth it to have hot, fresh food instead of lukewarm food that's been sitting under the lights at the buffet.    My favorites are the Yobo Roll (shrimp and salmon baked roll) and the Hamachi Kama.  Beef teriyaki and sesame chicken are also some tasty little dishes.  Haven't tried everything but we definitely weren't disappointed today.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber Salad
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Tempura
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sesame Chicken (white meat)

m4SN9jpTh5Bb4eV3dyRjZA.text: I hate giving bad ratings/reviews, but this place was just horrible.  We ate here bc we saw the ratings, but let me start off by saying, it's in a very bad shopping center. Lots of no good people hanging around the area... I'm sure it's drug dealing.. kinda scary. Had a guy walk up to us and ask us for a dollar while we were just getting out of our Uber.  The restaurant is very small... tables are wayyyy too close to each other. You will feel claustrophobic eating here. I literally had a partition right next to the next table.  Especially since it is AYCE, they give you a very small table so you CAN'T AYCE.  They had a lot of items on menu, some are very vulgar... ex: wet dream sushi roll and a few others. If I didn't know this was a sushi place, the menu could pass for a happy hour massage parlor.  Well, we ordered a few things, and when the food came out, they weren't even our rolls.  Also, they have lots of rules here, that if you order, and leave left overs, they will charge you full price. I totally get that, but since I didn't order the rolls that came to my table, I shouldn't be responsible for it right?  Well, more rolls and food came, wasn't ours. Again. The table right next to us, got two dishes, and said that those weren't theirs... comes to find out, it was ours.  This happens throughout our whole dine in experience. Wrong food to tables. Staff was very sloppy and rushed... and the food was not that good. The quality of the food was not worth me paying $20 for lunch AYCE.  I'm sad to give this place such bad reviews, but it was just really bad. I'm shocked at how many people gave it good reviews. I was def disappointed. Needless to say, they got our money and we didn't get to eat our moneys worth. My husband even said he will take his loss bc the food and service was horrible.  Only positive thing was, their mango mochi was delish. That's it. :(

rV-UcO-p8slHQ_6FS2Vp2Q.text: Still my favorite sushi place in Vegas! Stopped here with my brother for lunch a few days ago, and was a little worried about some of the recent reviews that said it had gone downhill. Food quality is still 10/10! We had sea urchin, salmon, red and yellow snapper, yellowfin tuna, and several others off the all you can eat menu, and the quality was superb. Will definitely be back in the next week or so!

BYsmx0fZHVIR8VjohGn5Aw.text: In my opinion best sushi spot in Vegas off the strip. Friendly staff sushi is fresh and is all you can eat. Highly Recommend the Son of the Beach roll and the double dragon.

Very fresh,tasty and clean....I am super-duper,extremely satisfied! Ole girly,Loved it She is in Love and I thought she only Loves me! All good though! I might be able to have all of her intimacy, but that goes to show I can't have all of her Love! Man it's hard to please you women! But,guess what! I have a good time while I just keep on pleasing! 7PJQUA3oi1DOezjg9DP3rg.text: The service was great and the variety to choose from was plenty. The Spring rolls, yo sexy rolls,and miso soup were amazing. Had a few other dishes I wasn't too impressed with like the shrimp tempura but overall I was pleased. Would definitely recommend checking out

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A Variety of tasty options. Highly recommend. Came here with family and everyone enjoyed their meals and the atmosphere.

ONgGqOTH8GePoOHgDpIkMw.text: Food was good, price was very reasonable, and the service was nice as well Very friendly servers The quality is quite good compared to other places. If you have good unagi, everything is good in my eyes  Unagiiiiii

UY1ByxXLaZSdV4TTfahvIg.text: I don't know why they put that sauce on almost everything. I ordered two rolls because it says it didn't have any of that nasty sauce on it, but when my rolls and my deep fried mussles it had the sauce. :( never coming back.

isxQ6UZaplG7sCmz79_TgQ.text: One of my favorite sushi places!! Everyone is always so nice even after two spills back to back from our kids! Sorry about that again! But the food is amazing!!

erDqmZd8Rx24OQqIwUYwRg.text: Girlfriend and I came here twenty minutes after they opened for lunch. Despite the seating being entirely open, the hostess put us directly next to another couple, actually sharing a table that had a plastic divider in the middle. Needless to say we stood up and moved to one of the many 2-tops open. She also gave us one menu, so that we had to pull a chair around and both cram together to try to share it. We had to ask the waitress for another menu, because neither of us can read upside down.  We tried 5 different rolls and two appetizers. We didn't enjoy any of it. We didn't have breakfast so we were starving, so that's saying quite a bit about the food quality. If you order any rolls with cucumbers, make sure to ask for them without - they'll put giant slabs of cucumber in the roll that really ruin it. The baked mussels were rubbery and just had thick, uncooked mayonnaise slabbed onto them.  Gf found a fishbone in her roll; that's not something you want to bite into and puncture your gums with. Completely unacceptable.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too much mayo on the mussels
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber overpowers the rolls
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fishbone in sushi

XmSFheEP-AwDD1VbcAKe3w.text: Really good sushi especially for an AYCE restaurant. Looks of the outside are deceiving.

CI7u1F5HnEZVTLjw7S2h-Q.text: Let me start off with a couple negatives before talking about the quality of the food.  We were seated against the wall under one of the TVs, right next to the register station. I heard every beep, staple, and numerous conversations of servers. It was totally distracting and annoying. What made it worse was seeing all the space on the other side of the restaurant. Get rid of that table location!   Now, the food was very good. It was worth the price. Try the deep fried mussels and Crab on a Stick. The no name roll had a bit of a kick in a good way. I don't think any of the food will disappoint.
