DIDtJ1mNblHlxMoEQLvueg.text: Terrible period. If you want to throw up this is the place to go!! This is also a great place to go if you wanna experience indigestion. In addition to the body pain this will cause, you get charged because you don't wanna eat the dog food served. I think my chef had a seizure when he was rolling my sushi. Great business to die in.

0XR3CIAh6BeWDGEVldN07g.text: Omg what can I say, this place has always been my boyfriend & I's favorite sushi spot! I have been steering away from eating rice for over a year now, but this place still has so many options for low-carb eaters like myself! On their all you can eat menu there are still tons of meat options like poke salad, seaweed salad, chicken, beef, etc. my boyfriend loves sushi, so it's a win-win for the both of us! We definitely be coming here for more lunch and dinner dates! Service is fast might I add!

fhs2LNQhfPNmSA3fRrMIrQ.text: Verry good only sushi place I will eat. Sometimes it's kinda busy but if you go on off hours usually you can get rite in

7zFk9utXpOsEWgVzrlsbzA.text: Great hours! Always packed and the waiters are always so busy. Everyone shares tables for serving. Very loud. Sushi is amazing!! Best sushi in Las Vegas for sure, was always worth driving across town for. Cannot beat AYCE!

sUAfUmp920uLgog-Er100g.text: Another ayce sushi place in the books.  Came here for lunch with a buddy, and it was pretty packed.  Lunch is reasonably priced at $20.95, and one order of uni and one piece of sweet shrimp is also included in that price. However, the uni did not taste very fresh, and the color was brown when it was served to me. Yuck!   The menu here is very standard. They offer the usual nigiri and rolls along with some appetizers. The only thing that really grabbed my attention was how sexual some of the rolls were worded such as wet dream and kiss the ass. The nigiri wasn't the best quality, but what do you expect at an ayce place? I was hoping they had more appetizers like ramen or udon that some ayce sushi places offer these days. The hamachi kama was really good, but they limit you to one order with the ayce.   Service was excellent. All the servers were friendly and accommodating and on top of our orders. Additionally, my water was constantly being re-filled. Unfortunately, the food just wasn't that great for me to want to come back.

7skAGVd4c_vcULVXzpFaFg.text: Service was great, food was not. Didn't eat much and left shortly after arriving.

zVV_L3eNNKH9_NuKjOqZag.text: There's nothing horrible or offensive about this place, but I'll probably never go here again. And I would never recommend it to anyone when you have other similarly priced ayce sushi options all over Vegas. So that's why the rating is so low.   First, the service was great. Some of the best service I've had at an ayce place. They seemed happy to have us there, and were pretty attentive.   But good service can't overcome meh food. Their offerings generally reminded me of something I'd find at a cheaper traditional buffet where you grab your own food.   The only items that rose above that were the Hamachi kama (grilled? yellowtail collar), the salmon kama, and the green tea ice cream.   The house salad reminded me of the stuff you buy out of the bag at the grocery store. I can understand it if you don't think salad is a big deal but I literally can't think of an ayce place I've been to with salad that bad. The tonkatsu and soft shell crab were both dry and it was a chore to finish one small order. The short ribs were some of the worst I've had - chewy and overly sweet, reminiscent of jerky.   I tried the Harry potter, the sun of the beach, the double dragon roll, and one other I can't remember off the top of my head. The sauce overwhelmed to the point I couldn't really enjoy the other ingredients in the roll.   If you're on a sushi tour through Vegas, I'd recommend skipping this stop.

xrUrT0h8vbiM7gAYkxjvEA.text: SO GOOD. if you're going Friday or Saturday, make sure to get there early. This place gets incredibly busy. The all you an eat is a great deal and the quality of the fish is incredible. I went with a self proclaimed sushi expert and he said it was some of his favorite.   Definitely check it out!

EVe3_xAUcrOZQrUGht3p3A.text: This place is never disappointing.  Definitely one of the best sushi places in las vegas.  The place gets very busy so expect a wait.  The AYCE is always the best option at any sushi place.  The sushi rolls were great and the thing that impresses me the most is the service.  The place is very small but the staff is still able to squeeze through all the full tables and quickly brings out your order.  I love this place!!!! Will be back again soon

Zt44Hkx44U5WfzKHUlegmA.text: A great value for getting a lot of food.  I was just not overly excited about the rolls I had.  The ice cream and mochi balls were great.

49WG8BTV6wZGzz_VG8yXbQ.text: After being here for a conference and vacation, it was nice to venture off the strip.  My friend and I found Yama through Yelp and are truly pleased by the excellent selection and variety and freshness of their sushi.   My only negative is the seating is rather crowded however is made up by attentive wait staff offering recommendations of their favorites.  Hope to see them on our next adventure to the Las Vegas area.

YgXbegzkgjMn5M0y9M9rWw.text: Great all you can eat, while its off the strip and a little busy, the food was yummy and the options many. Great recommendation from a friend.

CVIumt423d7zbztfipjKMA.text: I had visited yama sushi over labor day weekend and they had the best poki salad ive had in the states in a very long time, we will return soon again just for the food. The service was average could use improvement. The food was great though.

tu6NaoerHpu90Q6NWrxgzw.text: Food is good for what they have. menu doesnt seem over complicated. Yes many different rolls but seem they use the same 4 bases to make all the rolls pretty much. Just ok. Nothing special. many better places in vegas

30bGjdjaIs2Ft_QU36FsyA.text: Long wait to be seated. Once you're seated, you may end up using some other customer's back like the back of your own chair...or worse, you could be seated back to back with a BABY IN A HIGHCHAIR! I've never been seated so closely to other patrons. That takes away from my experience in a restaurant right off the top.  The sushi was good and tasted pretty fresh. That waitress was somewhat hard to understand, she appeared to be very, very shy. Luckily, in this restaurant any of the waitstaff that passes you by will refill your drinks or place another order for food.  I know someone who was followed out the door for not leaving a tip. His waitress ran outside and yelled "was the food not good, was the service not good?!". I've never heard of this happening anywhere else before. And to my recollection, he stated that the answer to one or both of those questions was "yes".

eGKlEG4IREbCwyQwuKUSfQ.text: Definitely one of my favorite sushi places. The service can be slow at times and you should prepare yourself to be repetitive when it comes to your order because most of them won't write it down and after waiting a while they tend to ask if you're waiting on stuff. We always get the sashimi salad spicy with a side of their creamy sauce. Idk what it is about it but it's yummy!!

MoGQ8yLaXtuFA6ISIoHjfg.text: This place was great and was a steal. Boyfriend and I sampled a lot of the appetizers and got a few rolls ( 1/2 order available to sample vs full roll)  Loved the poke salad and my fave was the quail eggs, but everything was tasty.

n-6toLJCWKdyyli4S8D_2g.text: I expected a wait before we got here, from previous reviews I had read... and they were right. This is not a place to go to if you are in a hurry. They were not able to give us a wait time, but in the end we ended up only waiting about 15 minutes before the manager seated us, although groups of 3-4 that were there before us were still waiting outside. I think they were so busy that the host didn't realize there was an open table until the manager whisked us over there.  Also, all of the staff there looked like they hated working there and were not the most pleasant. The sushi here is the AMAZING! It all tasted fresh and was very flavorful. We ended up going with the all you can eat sushi, but in the end didn't end up eating as much as the a la carte cost would have been, but only short by a couple of dollars. If you can eat a lot then definitely go for the unlimited option! I wish they would include the ice cream  and drinks in the all-you-can- eat price, like they do with the appetizers. We hope to make it out here again in a couple of months, but as there are so many different dining options in Las Vegas we will see if the wait is worth it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yama Sushi, Las Vegas

bkvWvJQd8nGYRLJ9Iav7WQ.text: This is without a doubt the ultimate sushi experience.  For $25 you get to have as much high grade raw fish as your belly can take.  This place packs up quickly so expect a bit of a wait.  My way was a good half hour.    Once you are in they give you this menu and you can pick anything you want as much as you want.  They want you to choose a roll so that you fill up quick.  The rolls are not that great anyway

-0sjJryQPx6XXZ6IYwTNmA.text: This place is super good!!! The staff is so friendly, we had Elexser as our sushi chef and he is AWESOME!! Very friendly and fast! Really good prices for an all you can eat sushi bar! We are coming back for sure!! Leaving super satisfied

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This all you can eat sushi place is SO good! Super good prices and good portions! The staff is very friendly! Delicious!

wfeWA1tworDncBf0qNd64g.text: I did not like the quality of the food...pure and simple.  The Sushi did not look or taste fresh.  The garden salad used iceberg lettuce.  Who still uses iceberg lettuce for a salad?  The shrimp used for the tempura shrimp were the thinnest shrimp I have every seen at a sushi restaurant.  I would have given 1 star but all the people were very friendly. Unfortunately, you just can not make up for sub-par food.

v40vS2Z7nIRX1fZ95OGrgg.text: Lots and lots of selection for AYCE! Dinner was $24 which is a couple bucks cheaper than most AYCE sushi places in Vegas.   I really enjoyed the sides at Yama Sushi! Loved the tempura, BBQ ribs, agedashi tofu and gyoza. The nigiri sushi was fresh and delicious. Rolls were yummy as well - be careful though since some of them are really heavy and can fill you up quite a bit! My favorite roll was sun of a beach.   Yama gets really busy so be prepared for a long wait. I came on a Friday night and waited a hour during prime dining hours. The service is fairly quick when you do get seated though!

9_af_-WAuykfbHE1qk5I5A.text: Yama Sushi has excellent service, fresh sushi, and reasonable-sized servings.  I went for dinner around 5:30 and my friend and I were seated right away.  We both opted for all-you-can-eat sushi for $26.95, which was a reasonable deal for the amount of sushi we eat!  What I like about Yama Sushi is that the size of the servings is PERFECT!  The sushi is not overly filled, and you can even order half-orders if you want to try several different rolls!  Many other all-you-can-eat sushi places try to fill you up and only allow you to order a couple of rolls before you literally have to roll out of the restaurant.  Yama Sushi is not like that.  Additionally, the servers were extremely friendly and helpful here!  I was asking the server if they had a california roll topped with spicy tuna, and she said it was not on the menu, but the chef would be happy to make it!  The servers were always present to refill our water and ask us if we wanted to order anything new.  Although the quality of the sushi is fresh and delicious here, they did not offer as large or unique of a selection as other sushi restaurants.  Yes, I know the names are unique, but looking beyond that... The only sushi I distinctly remember eating here was the "Yo Mama," and that was my absolute favorite roll!  All in all, I would definitely return to this restaurant because of the convenience of the half-order rolls and the accommodating service.  However, it was not the best sushi I've had in Las Vegas.

io1YUq3MB6iDq_e4-Bbk8w.text: Yama is my go-to sushi spot. Dancing in the Sheets and No Name are must tries! I rarely go anywhere else because $21-$25 for AYCE sushi (depending on whether it's lunchtime or dinnertime) is such a great deal.  The place is always packed, but I have never been disappointed with the service. Occasionally a waiter will forget a roll, but when you're ordering 5+ rolls at a time, what do you expect? They're so quick, you can have a new roll out in just a few minutes.   I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a yummy AYCE sushi spot.

cKuAAGSUlUKErgN-a0oC0A.text: Mmmmmm I've never tasted so much delicious sushi before, every time I come to Vegas I'm going to have to eat here every day. Damn to delicious I just have no words. I recommend this place when you hit Vegas. It's a must

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat, soooooo delicious

3t_aU4nx6hbQH_jRzwozFA.text: What fun. Great sushi. Love the selections. Had the Harry Potter. Delicious. Double Salmon Really Good.

GV_3-wuuHOgwSxIMdewLmg.text: My boyfriend and I are from Orlando, and had just completed a Death Valley NP trip. We were looking for some fantastic local food away from the strip, and had to try this place considering all of the YELP reviews. We arrived at 3 minutes before 6:00 p.m., just at the cutoff of the Happy Hour special. Fortunately, the waiter rushed us to our table and got an order in for us so our ticket would be clocked in before 6:00 p.m.! Nice!  Our waiter was extremely attentive, knowledgable, and very nice. He made sure our waters were always full. My boyfriend ordered only 1 beer, but our waiter took such a liken to us, that he would bring him another beer (for FREE!), three more times! Wow!!!   The head chef visited our table as well, and asked if we had tried his signature dish yet. Why no, we haven't!!! He ordered for our table a plate of yellowtail sashimi with sauce (for FREE), for us to try. All this, while knowing that we are from Orlando and won't be a repeat customer anytime soon.   The fresh was surprisingly extremely fresh, I mean, we are in the desert here! Happy Hour has some incredible deals and you can't go wrong with anything on the menu!  We were charmed by the staff and how pleasant and attentive they were to us!!! We can't say enough about how please we were with the service, on top of, the spectacular food!

9PyXrxBRkAB9uA_1RS2UGg.text: I came here with my friend and got the All You Can Eat and it was great! We waited about 15 minutes but it was totally worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Having Superman! This food is delicious!

5Lh_wWHWirv-2oKmCFz8KA.text: The cut rolls are great!  Try the "no name" "sun of a beach" with a "wet dream"!  Nigiri's are good but a little too much rice for my liking. But for a buffet to offer Uni, sweet botan shrimp (w/ the deep fried head mind you!) and giant clam that deserves 2 thumbs up!

2ahke1taCp45iec0w9DXDw.text: We love this place! My partner and I eat there as often as possible. Get the Harry Potter roll and Wet Dream roll!

gSOlBqO4k1qK6tk3qb-hUg.text: We found Yama sushi from a yelp search. It east of the strip and NO TOURIST.  A very local place.  We are not from Vegas and took a cab for $15.00. We paid $24.00 for all you can eat. Very fast service and great wait staff.  I was very happy with the rolls.  There might be a wait but it's because it's a great place.   Save the $200 that you would spend at Nabu and go to Yams Sushi

mglfScHb6RMIUcItLBw6vg.text: WET DREAM! WET DREAM! WET DREAM!  No Yelpers! Take your mind out of the gutter! Wet dream is the BEST roll they have there. God, I'm drooling just thinking about it right now. Creamy with a kick of spiciness from the jalapeno.   Your trip to Vegas is not complete without stopping by Yama Sushi. It's reasonably priced at $23ish dollars a person for AYCE (sorry I don't have the exact price) but it's definitely worth it.  They only give an order of Uni and Sweet shrimp to each person, which is fine considering those are the "expensive" types of sushi. I personally loved the Yellowtail and Spicy Tuna handroll.   They also have mochi ice cream and regular ice cream.  Don't forget to finish all your food!

ukRtw8HvjhVU4kPoIAPkNQ.text: Where to start... Well I love sushi and this place know just how to hit the spot. They have many different varieties of rolls and the fish is always fresh. I've yet to have anything here that tastes super fishy or old. Be aware that this place is normally packed... but it's worth the wait.   The seafood salad is the bomb dot com!!! It's tuna and salmon sashimi over (I'm not sure if it is daikon) veggie noodles and topped with a sauce of your choice of spiciness and shrimp tempura. The wet dream roll is out of this world! If I start to name off rolls, I would never end this review. Every time that we have been here, we've ordered different rolls and have loved what they bring. I definitely have this sushi spot as one of the top sushi places I'll go to.  Bring people to help you!! I always go with my BFF, she's all I need.. or we'll go in our usual girl group.  Definitely a place that will always have a spot in my heart.

dIxAzFW6LDPqPFJY2jwgDQ.text: Yama Sushi, is good sushi at a reasonable price for all you can eat. Two locations in Las Vegas. We tried the Spring Mountain location for first time last week.  It has an open setting and food was good like E. Flamingo Yama. The Yama on E. Flamingo location is older location, smaller and always packed, but food is good.  I prefer Spring Mountain Yama in Chinatown SW Vegas corridor, there is more room to dine comfortably and lots of big screen TVs with sports on.

bBWCuCJp4cvyhJ2h2G5orQ.text: My boyfriend and I go to Yama sushi at any chance we can go. It's so yummy. It was my first time eating at a sushi restaurant. It it always full of people, but the people there are very  friendly. I love the Ellen roll eat all the time when I'm there. I recommend going to Yama sushi epically those who are visiting Vegas it's worth the trip. I love them and there plum ice cream don't miss out on that either I can promise you its delicious :) It's all you can eat sushi too at a good price go there NOW!

VOFSa18pSGk29IyS0ctHOA.text: Excellent service & delicious food! My husband & I visited Vegas for a trade show & are thankful we found this place!! We did AYCE & liked that we could sit at a table for this (whereas other places make you sit at the sushi bar).   Our server, Ken, was awesome & made great recommendations. We always order the Rainbow & Caterpillar rolls - both were great! Our other favorites were the Sun of the Beach, No Name, & Hot Dang rolls - all amazing & rec by our server. We ended with delicious ice cream & Mochi balls (apart of AYCE).   The entire staff was very friendly & attentive - keeping our drinks full & trash/empty dishes cleared. Very prompt service, too!   We will definitely be back next time we're in Vegas!

hZ6lXezdreEdqa60J2Vu9w.text: I moved to Vegas about a year ago and I have yet to eat at another sushi restaurant because Yama is so good.  I'm sure there's some really good places out there that I could get better sushi at, but I used to spend $100 on sushi just for myself.  Now I can eat all the sushi I want for $25 and be content.    I do miss certain items, as they only have the standards.  But they do have sweet shrimp and hamachi kama, so what can I do?!  (Answer:  Go back to Yama over and over again)

1EM1xi0DS-wNen1q5DVqUg.text: Had to finally give this place a try because it was so close to me. So came here for the dinner the previous night and it was packed. 45 minute wait for a party of two. Anywho I was determined to try this place so we put our name on the waiting list and walked around the shopping center ( TJ Max ) haha. So it's finally time to eat and the host (one to take our reservations) was a little monotone and somewhat of a downer. But other than that everyone was nice. Orders came out fast and tasted pretty good. We ordered smoked salmon, tuna, salmon, tuna, and some rolls. Taste wise everything was on point and also they do half orders so you can try everything :) the downside was that my sushi was not cut properly the pieces were so big that I couldn't just one bite it. I would have to take like 2-3 bites and that would cause a mess. But yeah taste wise it lived up to its expectations. I would come back again but only on a slower day. Because the restaurant being filled to full occupancy caused some mistakes and delays. Took 30 minutes to receive our ice cream and Mochi. Also the server spilled water in our orders. And some appetizers were forgotten :/

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon skin roll
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu part two
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu part one

_8fd-sTFwbDQfpLsUNjusA.text: I'm no sushi connoisseur but I know when I taste crappy fish. I'm no restaurateur but even I know that good customer service is the way you make fans and have them come back. I'm not a picky y eater but Yama was just clearly unacceptable.   This restaurant is super tiny. I'm not hating on the size of the restaurant but when the tables are so close together that you can hear the conversations of those around you more than your own, then this becomes a problem. Getting in between tables to take a seat was a near impossible mission in as well. By no means am I a large individual but I had to suck in pretty hard to get to my chair.   Our waitress was prompt in getting our drink orders. Two waters. She took my friend's AYCE order and started to walk away. Umm, hello?! What about my order? We called her back to order my lunch special - veggie tempura, 4 pieces of sushi, rice, miso soup and salad.   After about 5 minutes, we finally got our waters. Mine had a black speck in it. My friend and I were convinced that it looked like a dead bug, resembling a gnat. The waitress insisted that this "gnat" was a green tea leaf. Whether a bug or a green tea leaf, nothing should be floating around in my water.   I let the water fiasco slide and ordered a diet coke. No joke, I waited about 15 minutes for it. My friend and I asked three different waitresses for my beverage. I was parched! Not only this, my friend got his sushi but wasn't given his wasabi and ginger. This also took about 15 minutes in addition to kindly asking three different waitresses. Mind you, it was not busy - there were empty tables around the restaurant.   The fish was dry and had a rubbery consistency. I felt as though it was left out for a while. While my friend and I were trying our best to enjoy the not-so-yummy fish, my friend found a hair in the ginger. That was the end of our meal. Dunzo. FInito.   Vegas has some of the best AYCE sushi and Yama is NOT one of them. Needless to say, I won't be back.

evYLWIga1_wH4-uZnGpXtA.text: Around $25 for AYCE sushi that's not excellent but very good is a already a great deal. But with the range of appetizers and desserts that are also available on AYCE, this becomes a fantastic deal. Well worth the 40 minute wait.

iv-AFBwMZNTAUJ8tHZGkNw.text: Here for lunch with my family. I would give it a 0 stars if I could. All the rolls were super tiny. The shrimp tempura roll had no shrimp in it but fired batter. My 2 kids both ordered shrimp tempura, one came before the other, one came with the normal 6-8 shrimps. But the second one came and there was 3. Wth? Did someone eat it on the way? And the fully art was it was being served next to another tray of shrimp tempura that was full! The sashimi I had send me to the bathroom with diarrhea 1 min after consuming. And of course couldn't finish my 2 rolls I ordered because I lost my appetite. To be honest normally family of 4 can kill 2 roll easy, but the food was just too nasty. I couldn't revenge ask my family to do that. And it's not about the mo why, but restaurant usually charges more because they add things to the dinner menu, but there is no different selection you get for having dinner there. This is the worse place yelp has lead me to.

cSisND0H9iMiBH3aFdjABQ.text: I've been here three times. Each time I've gone, the sushi bar will "lose" part/most of my order. (My first round I usually order two things. A roll, and a bunch of eel or tuna or something...) They usually only bring me just the roll, or just the sushi. Never both. *Never* both. They just give me one, and I never see the other part.  Or --like the last time -- none of my order.   The last time I went, I was in a group of four. The other three guys in that group were on their second round. I hadn't received a single thing. I'm just sitting there, waiting. I bring it up to the waitress, she goes to "look" for it, returning five minutes later to refill water. (Without food, nor a single word about my order.)   The other guys were just about done, when the waitress (out of pity?) brings me *someone else's* order that they didn't wind up wanting. By this time, I had ordered at least or or five things (over the course of an hour), and not a single thing was delivered. When I asked to speak with the manager, "the manager" (whom I maintain was just another waitress --she was too young and too combative off the bat to be a real manager) claimed that everything had arrived to my table.   "You were given everything you ordered."   "Uhm... no I haven't."   Rest of the table: "LOL, no he hasn't! He hasn't received a single plate of food he's ordered!"  "Yes you did. We have the ticket!"   "Then why am I hungry after an hour? Why would I bother you about this at an AYCE restaurant, if I had --in fact-- eaten? That doesn't make any sense!" (This detail still perplexes me, to this day.)  The "manager" left in a huff, never to return.   We had to leave around then, to be on time for plans we had later in the evening. I paid the bill in full, and left hungry. I'm *still* mad about that, to be honest.   This place is popular, but there are better places in town.

duCSMR-A9jxY6BIU9Jqdbw.text: My experience at Yama sushi was okay. I've had much better sushi at Sushi Mon  (AYCE). It seemed like we were bothering the server by just ordering. I would have been upset if we had paid over $23. We ordered 9 rolls, and i can honestly say I only liked 2 out of the 9. Needless to say we won't be returning.

JCzbDh31vgVDU2WJlRBq4g.text: It was OK.  To be fair, I'm from Hawaii so we are very fortunate to have an abundance of fresh fish available to us every day.  Why sushi in Vegas?  IDK, sometimes you get tired of the hotel buffets and steak houses.  My normal staple of Ikura, hamachi, and uni was ok.  Because of UPS/Fedex, you can get fresh fish anywhere in the world.  They just didn't have it here that day.  What I did love was the salmon skin rolls.  Wow.  Talk about crunch on the outside and crunch on the inside.  Those were pretty awesome and I ate about a half dozen of those.  Something I would caution is the "white tuna" that they serve.  As I said, being from Hawaii we see a lot of fish.  Never heard of it though I'm not a fisherman.  It was the most expensive nigiri on the menu so we ordered it to see what it was about.  It was drowned in a ponzu sauce so not sure about the taste.  It was white, seemed like it was cooked(?), and it was...different.  The next day, after my friend had the shits, we googled white tuna.  Yikes.  Not sure which on ewe got but it wasn't good.  I was ok but I have an Andrew Zimmern stomach.  Probably won't return but if I did, I'd stick to the salmon skin rolls.

qcp9wryfaAqzSJvVwujBVg.text: Such a long wait! Every time my group asked the host how much longer, the host would go around the question & never gave a straight forward answer. She led us on & should have have told us our table would take longer than expected.  Besides that, the fish was fresh & the sushi was so good. Since its an AYCE spot, they have a lot of rules (must finish all your food, no sharing, etc. otherwise they will charge) but that's expected.  Our server wasn't fluent in English, but she was patient & helped us get around the "rules". Kudos to her.

BDbNMtKI5hWpM3KX4KS-ZQ.text: Simply the best place for sushi. Everything is exquisite. My favorite rolls are Wet Dream, Ellen, and Spicy Sexy; the seafood salad is to die for. Yama made sushi my favorite food a few years back!

JhAyMTlm4z-UJ01pdMcYzg.text: What more could you Want!!! There was a wait 10-15 min .. So?! Hot foods,salads, sushi misc appetizers- OMFG 23$ getting $100+ worth of food.  Super small spot packed with people- bustling with nice happy servers & food being passed everywhere. Clean restroom Older sushi slanger took like a hour to crack a smile then we slipped him a $20 n he was smiling.. People next to us tipped $4 for a unbelievable amount of comida.. Comes around goes around.. Anyway even comes w ice cream .. Dang worth our 15-20 min drive from north V.  Try grilled salmon app: huge salmon filet done perfect & had crispy skin!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet ending
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon skin roll
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Tempura Rolla

teXGhQOX1i2IpyavNbUaTg.text: Our friends raved about this place for months, kept telling us it was one of the best sushi restaurants out here in Vegas - only problem was the ridiculous line to get in. We finally made our way there and tried the AYCE, and all I can say was it was only alright. Pros: the menu for AYCE had a LOT of items to choose from, so that was awesome. We went with a large party - all ordering AYCE - so we basically got to try every roll there. The Seafood Salad was pretty good. Cons: A lot of the rolls were very similar in taste, so nothing stood out as exceptional.   Probably won't make any special trip to eat here again, but otherwise, not bad.

puV3oBTNooRgBnkvYlzLuA.text: This place was pleasant, service was fast, and unlimited sushi. Super awesome good stuff!!!!

II-jTCrNV3C2cmnfkfnoqw.text: Hands down my favorite AYCE sushi joint in Las Vegas. I have to go here at least once a month. Dinner is something like $25 to $26 dollars but includes everything on the menu, including appetizers. There are a few things you can only get one order of however.   One of those things is the "seafood salad" which is a must have. If you like Sashimi, you will like the seafood salad. Don't let the term salad scare you. It is literally just a plate piled high with different types of raw fish covered in either a spicy or a creamy sauce. No vegetables to be seen. I also recommend the "no name roll."  Overall the quality of the sushi is pretty good. This is a place I would go and order food A la carte. The fact that it is all you can eat is incredible. If you haven't been here and like sushi, do yourself a favor and try it out.  My only two complaints are long wait times (it is a medium size restaurant, so popular times are usually pretty packed) and drunk homeless people (it is located in kind of a sketchy strip mall, so if you are outside waiting for your table be prepared to be accosted by people begging for money or drunks mumbling to themselves).

LrPDZizUR7iaj-2CygUdZg.text: Yama Sushi has such good quality of fish, and it is so fresh. The best thing is that it never stops you are able to get the all you can eat and it is not that expensive for the amount of Sushi you get. My favorite dish was the Japanese Lasagna. It was a California roll that was baked in an oven and it has a massive amount of cream cheese on top. In the end I strongly recommend this restaurant.

mT_Tevy-XfhqvQhcYIZqSw.text: Best sushi ever!!!!! The wait is well worth it... The customer service is hit or miss but the Sushi is hands down the best I've had. This is a bit far from my place but I have yet to find sushi that even compares to Yama and trust me I've tried many others only to be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the Yama Crunch is a little sweet and very good
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. On the left: Oh My Yama  &amp; On the right: Vegas Style is very good but a little too spicy for me

sjss3SjzVUZiml0gWSY2sw.text: One of the best AYCE sushi i've tried so far. But I wasn't satisfied with the dessert. It would be great if they would not limit the ice cream order per person. Or at least allow per person to order the mochi ice cream 3 times the most just so that we can enjoy a variety of flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pcj1-Ui6LDEslQN9qnXdKQ.text: First off, I don't appreciate how every person in the staff except the host has an attitude. I mean these people looked as if they were upset to work today.   Besides the rude staff, this restaurant is small. Very tiny! It get crowded very easy and then you're stuck numbing elbows and unwantingly eavesdropping on other peoples convos.  The food was ok! Some of the cooked sushi rolls were over cooked and basically burnt. One of the people in my party even found black hair in her food and they acted as if she planted it there and she's a blonde!!  Overall, the all u can eat specials are cheap and a portion of the food is good, but, after this experience I will never eat here again! Yuck!

bFNsLGh9VOIqgCQ4xWRXhA.text: Be warned, this place is busier than a church on Christmas.  A whore house on New Years.  A VD clinic on the day after Valentine's Day... It doesn't matter.  The service is pretty spot on.  If you order half rolls (4 pieces), 4 types at a time, you can constantly have food on your table.    I totally fell is love with a few of these rolls.  The firecracker and the 'one minute man' are the best.  The 'snow in Vegas' is pretty legit too.  It was a little disheartening to find out that the Sapporros are $6.50 a pop.  We had two, in addition to the sodas, so that's a nice surprise when the bill comes.  Other than that, the $50 for all you can eat goodness is worth the price... and the wait.

NwSKMmFGWpUc04DpGVvKUg.text: The last time I left a review for Yama I had only been there twice. I've probably been to Yama now, 10 - 15 times and I am never disappointed. The service is great. Even on a busy night, I get my sushi in a reasonable time. My favorite rolls are the spicy sexy role, happy ending and wet dream. There are so many options at Yama. I would definitely recommend.

KBSZ1ti2TWcLQC91H0DBNg.text: This is a very good sushi place, and I really do enjoy it, but they need to learn to seat people in the damned order they come in. Last weekend my husband and I went, and asked to be seated at the bar, which had two vacant seats. Instead, I was told they're being held for a party of four... (along with a rude customer who injected his two cents into the conversation, despite the fact that no one was talking to him in the first place) Sit your damned party of four at a fucking table! ee  While those seats sat empty for 30 minutes (which we would have been pretty much done by then), we waited outside, then moved in to the bench there. Another 15 minutes passed and a few parties of two were called to be seated, and we noticed that they had come in after us. Finally one group said "Um, they were here before us..." and the guy went "Oh! I'm sorry. I lost the paper with your name on it."   Right.... you're holding it in your fucking hand.   I ended up speaking with the manager, who made things right with an apology, good food and some beer which was on the house. The food does make up for the occasional poor service, but yeah... After I spoke with the host and explained to him that I was not angry, but he did need to ensure that people are seated correctly...  Sad thing is, this isn't the first time I've heard of this happening. If it occurs again, I'll be lowering my rating a lot and heading off to Goyemon more.  As a side note, NEVER EVER get the Devil Roll. The special sauce = enough mayonnaise that it looks like the sushi roll was participating in a bukkake film.

AgVhjsIQWL00p4B7tAjYjQ.text: AMAZING fresh sushi! We did the All-you-can-eat sushi for $20.95 & it included the entire menu unlike most places where it's limited. Service was excellent! Will definitely be back!

0wBVFXpKtMMS8jNpABQGzg.text: Yama is one of my favorites! Of course I do the AYCE! Their fish is always fresh, sushi to rice portions are great. The rolls are never too big and are always flavorful. You have to get the wet dream, I'm serious. You have to. Service isn't always the fastest but they do their best and are friendly.

lkQmossRED9NM_-IaVP6Ow.text: Some of the most annoying ppl in the world are apple iphone users that take hipstamatic pictures. Lame.  I  ordered the vegas roll, sun of the beach and no name. Also, for dessert, I murdered the green tea ice cream, mango mochi ice cream and red plum ice cream. Yeah, I ate all that in one setting because I'm a beast. 5'7 and 145 pounds of sexy.  The food was good, service was great, but there are some bourgy people around... It is near UNLV.  I wanted to eat PHO. Ionno, smashburger is overrated.  Anyways, imma go workout. Yama was better than Passion of the christ but not better than Lethal Weapom 4.

oenoVMzlh00ACjgn2dgWeA.text: Lured into this place with promising yelp reviews. Awful sushi and service. Wait staff did not know how to coordinate, had to order multiple things multiple times. I love eating sushi and this place was a new low.

jpOCP2ew9Od14Zgb9CgCyA.text: Best AYCE in Vegas.  Salmon and yellowtail collar, seafood salad, great tempura, quality nigiri for a ayce, bomb diggity rolls, good service and chill sushi chefs.  What else can you ask for, if yelp had a 6 star option, this place would get it.

l_J9O3sTFwBaq3_bSXLP3A.text: Wow. We were sitting at Paw's bar tonight, too. We thought it was us. Guess it was him afterall. We like Sasa Sushi on Cheyenne and Buffalo better. A FRIENDLIER, more personable atmosphere.

PBLGXwMMCuY5tQGMZNg8yQ.text: Went here today for my bday and it is absolutely excellent. Service was great and food was even better. I was probably here for around 2 hours and the sushi was fresh and fantastic. A bit cramped when full but will definitely come back for more.

GGHsve8aEHK3zMtUFboXkw.text: Service was AMAZING and specially noted with consideration to how BUSY this place gets, among my favorite sushi places in Vegas. Food quality and rolls are very tasty! Great price @ $21 for lunch and $24 for dinner for all you can eat. Very much recomended

_9_TRcya2kjblxU7XOAgDg.text: Have been here a handful of times and finally decided to write a review.  During previous visits, service has always been spot on.  On my most recent visit, however, the service wasn't the same.  The place wasn't terribly busy, but for some reason, our sushi orders weren't coming out as quickly as they had during previous visits.  The food is great, though.  It's a fairly small place located in a strip mall, so if you happen to show up during the lunch or dinner rush, be patient.  Despite the less than stellar service we received during our most recent visit, you can bet I'll be back for more.  Can't beat the price for an all-you-can-eat sushi bar!

Y47RHPQYI3bKNjgeDmrpZQ.text: One good thing when dining alone is that you get seated pronto no wait at all!! Back to Vegas and of course back to yama!!! So what is different this time around? Still crowded,price might have went up.portions still the same,quality still the same although the seafood salad I had the dressing was watery. Other than that it was what I remembered it to be.

qQe2QROzJq7EcDz4D-5PnA.text: Excellent service the seafood salid with spicy sauce is the bomb.

Ba8RLExLAPDnsmCrovJtMw.text: While attending the 2015 CES, I took the occasion to dine at Yama Sushi, an all you can eat sushi restaurant. The sushi and the wide variety of interesting sushi rolls were terrific. The service was also very prompt and polite. Strongly recommend this place.

qEDHYrQrhGP9B8B-BmCzNw.text: Tried this after Sakana. They don't compare. Rice dry and not well seasoned. This makes the AYCE option not as good. Fish to rice ratio also the wrong way round. Not good value for money as easily full with the horrible rice which if you don't eat, you get charged extra for. One major positive is the quick and attentive service. However this doesn't make up for poor taste and quality of food.

D4mvHR2FmkzYl80hJonT1Q.text: Just got back from Vegas. Was told about this place did not believe it until tried it for myself. What a  unbelievable experience!!!!'   OMG!!! Going back in March to Vegas that will be our  first  stop from the airport.

9-2Cm804KGKz_CVNKErd9g.text: So far, by far, the best AYCE Sushi joint I have been to. Usually I don't like to order the Maguro because it's usually on the harder side and not good, but here it's soft and tasty! A very good AYCE Sushi experience here at Yama Sushi!

rvdgnjx0asCZUU7Ka83Fbg.text: my favorite sushi place in Vegas! Decor sucks, service is okay.. but none of that matters cause the food is just so amazing and AYCE is great deal!

rFOEIEMWNEnMrBHjGkOGFA.text: To be honest the food is good and the service is somewhat good, I understand that they have so many clients at the same time it gets kinda hard for them to service everybody but that is not my biggest problem. The biggest problem with this place is the air conditioning. As soon as you walk in its hot as hell and moist. I understand the place gets crowded big time on weekends but they make so much money and can't afford to invest in better air conditioning? That's ridiculous! Food is good but you gotta eat it in a hot as hell room in a really crowded restaurant! If you like good sushi and eating it while being baked alive this is the place for you.

AQtIxxSR03g564h92Za8ew.text: This used to be my favorite ayce sushi restaurant in Vegas and I recommended it to family and friends.  It had been about a year and a half before my last visit a couple of weeks ago since I live in SoCal.  The quality of the sushi was HORRIBLE (not fresh), service was SLOW (The yakitori came after our dessert), and to top it off they overcharged us on the kid's AYCE.  It says HALF price on the menu, but I was charged more than half and when I brought it up, the manager said they've always charged that way.  I've visited multiple times before and this was the first time I had this problem.  Also, if you're not going to honor the stated price on the menu, why even bother putting HALF price??  I read there was an ownership change last year so perhaps this is the problem?  In any case there are plenty other AYCE sushi restaurants in LV and I will not be returning

-235k9BBLCPbhnnM1hxj5A.text: Know why this place was given such high Stars. All the sushi came a bit Saucy like they were all drowning. The fish is delicious though. The price is right for a y c e sushi.

LKm7BzrPTnyWFdo-cY9l7Q.text: Lord give me strength.   this place took my love of sushi, fed me to the ears and left me not wanting anything in roll form for about two weeks.   this def lives up to the hype, its a little ride from the strip but its well worth it. its a cozy interior and if you can get the small side room. the waitstaff girls and that one dude are very cool and will tell you their favs from the menu (by the way dont make jokes about the off color items on the menu bc they will think its an actual order and you will get rolls up the ass; not a menu item)  anyway you pay for what you dont eat, so leave the gym class humor at home and chow down; also get the jalapeno rolls; amazing

i24yqAHl0pfJSEbgRt8bxQ.text: For an all you can eat sushi restaurant this place is great! I really thought it was going to be like buffet style. I love the fact we get to order off the menu. The menu was extensive with lots of options from hot/cold appetizers, soups, salads, nigiri, hand rolls, traditional rolls to specialty rolls. You really do get your money's worth! I recommend going with someone or a group so you can try more menu items. This is a late post so I can not remember everything we ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Specialty rolls and pepper tuna nigiri
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood salad...yum!

VkGsDmEnKDzAG1Sx7wekMg.text: Anyone who's been here knows that the waiting area is ridiculously small so I'm not gonna say much about that because everyone knows that it's terrible.   The biggest thing for me is the service. I'm not sure if the waitresses are used to getting stiffed or if they hate how busy the place is and they're just over it. Ive never had multiple waitresses walk past me and ignore me for so long. It's insane how blatantly obvious it is that they are ignoring you. There's a 2 hour time limit for all you can eat (which I never would think to ever wanna be somewhere that long) and it seems like they want that time to run out so bad!   I've been here twice now and I'm pretty sure this is my last time. Food is good but there's nothing here significantly better than your average all you can eat sushi spot.

8jodA_mSoSStKiN7142cQg.text: Great food terrible costumer service. I ordered 2 "No Names" one without mayo and another with mayo but they apparently mixed our orders for the table next to us. I asked if it could be made again because I am very lactose intolerant but they told me my order was already being eaten and I would have to place another order if I wanted another plate.

bE30JjAtNgkfhC49G6ZVHg.text: Salmon nigiri- portion size is HUGE!   Crab stick nigiri - very good  Hamachi kama - neckbone of yellowtail was REALLY GOOD. one per person only tho.   Salmon kama - i liked it. My friend said it was a little dry (he got the worse one hahaha)  Seafood salad was probably the best. 5/5. Portion is huge with ginormous chunks of salmon. However, mild spicy was not spicy.   Miso soup was salty.  They have ice cream and mochi as part of the ayce menu ^-^  Service was excellent. Food came very quickly.   Con: Hour+ wait.....for a party of 6 on a friday night.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ayce menu. Literally anything on the menu lolz

Ta8lDpUDqcwNyR-O0M1kOA.text: This was the perfect lunch after laser tag.  Ayce sushi.  Totally hit the spot, made all my friends happy.  And the waitress was super nice and even recommended us some stuff.  I was reading some of my friends reviews and they said they had bad service, well I'm glad we went anyway cause they were awesome.  I loved that dessert was included and they had plum wine ice cream :) sweet!  Mochi ice cream :)  Sushi was good, Kama was good, nigiri was solid.  Rolls came in different combinations and most were pretty tasty. No complaints.

_Eq4aBHD5EHhb5OlNPe-aA.text: We were referred to this place and it was fantastic. Definitely worth the half hour drive and reasonably priced.  We were seated quickly and the staff were very attentive throughout the meal. Everyone in our party of five had the AYCE and the finished plates were always bussed quickly, and the new orders came out promptly. The only downside is that the plates didn't all come out at the same time, but I really didn't mind that.  I can't remember everything we ate, but it included some regular sushi, some dumplings, some ribs, and about half of their specialty rolls. You can order a half roll so you can sample more items.   I didn't think any of the rolls were spicy, but everyone else said the spicy tuna was too spicy. I ended up eating all of it since I thought it tasted great. I wonder why someone would order spicy tuna if they didn't like spicy food. There are many other options to order.  Some of the rolls we had included the 007 roll, the philly roll, the mad dragon roll, the sun of the beach roll, the Hawaii roll, the Harry Potter roll, the Vegas style roll, the strip tease roll, the one minute man roll, and the crazy roll.  I highly recommend this place. We will definitely be coming back.

6yzFOiAEJBwnXVO7VuaCeA.text: Overall 3.5 stars  Gold medal - sweet shrimp  Silver medal - uni Bronze medal -  gyoza  If you are looking for sushi then sushi coma is better.  If you are looking for rolls, the rolls at Yama are really yum.  The sweet shrimp at Yama is really good.  It is large shrimps and they fry the head.  The uni was fresh and super creamy.  The gyoza was very crispy and tasty.    Super long wait, so try to get there early.  Happy Sushiing!!

PYDLXXKBpqkDdAHmoxGstQ.text: Been going here for years. But they got me really sick. I had the Uni and Seafood Salad. When I called and let them know the girl was odd all she said was 'no one else has said anything'. She asked if I wanted the supervisor I said 'no I just want you to know something I ate made me sick probably the Uni' if no one else got. She said ok and hung up... no we are very sorry or we will throw it out.

OtvnQIx1y_NdOhIBgKG52g.text: After many, many 30min-1hr long waits at Goyemon, I decided I needed to find a new sushi joint. Thanks Yelp, I LOVED Yama Sushi!   I give five stars to the types of rolls they had at Yama and not necessarily the quality of fish. The fish in Vegas just doesn't compare to Japan! The rolls, however are another story. Yama has all of the basic rolls, but most of their menu is filled with original rolls with dirty names. The waiter brought us out a plate of the Wet Dream to try while we waited for the rolls we ordered; I love when they do that! Also, Wet Dream turned out to be my favorite roll.   The seaweed salad was good, cucumber salad not so much. The deep fried oysters had too much fry and not enough oyster. A couple of the rolls had too much cream cheese for me. Thumbs up to being able to order THREE DESSERTS (2 ice creams, 1 mochi ice cream).   Don't let the less than ideal neighborhood and plain exterior of the restaurant scare you away. The interior and sushi make up for it!   Yama Sushi is my new favorite sushi restaurant!

vM70UUVACCkWW1yt079xyg.text: This place converted me. It's that good.  I don't eat the fishies. Cooked or raw. In fact, I fully intended to eat chicken teriyaki while my girlfriend went to town on the all-you-can-eat sushi. But today something came over me, I went into absolute beast mode. I was like a honey badger smashing on sushi! I must've cleaned out half the ocean in one sitting. GF stared at me in complete disbelief as I voraciously devoured roll after roll. Here's what you need to know:  Oh My Yama - 10/10  Palm Job - 10/10 No Name - 9.5/10 Oh Damn!! Harry!! - 8/10 TNT - 8/10 Shrimp Tempura 8/10 Seafood Salad - 7.5/10  Pro tip 1: Remember that you're allowed to order half rolls during all-you-can-eat, for more variety.  Pro tip 2: Order the Palm Job, which is not listed with the rest of the sushi. It's frickin bomb.  Pro tip 3: items with a heart next to it on the menu are limited to one order PER PERSON, so if you're with a party, you can order as many as there are people at your table  Summary: If you're looking for exceptional value paired with delicious sushi, this is where it's at. 5 stars!!

4Jxib7CANO9QC4kKDRHdbA.text: This is our third time at this place, every time we come to Vegas we have to come here and every time we love it. This time we sat at the bar our sushi chef was a young man his name was Coca Cola he was very sweet, we started with hamachi yama ( fish head) it was so good, seafood salad always my favorite, sun of the beach, and wet dream, No name, all so good. We're definitely coming back every time in Vegas!

bidYi1p2PN60MDRWjSeVKA.text: My all time favorite sushi. I eat here every time I come to Vegas.  I've never had anything I don't like. They are friendly and fast. There always is a line for table seating, but we usually sit at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

upqbFvOtqustQtu1fUOa5A.text: As sushi places go, this place is ok. Not fantastic, but definitely better than some places I've been to. However, since their prices are comparable to other better sushi restaurants that are nearby, I would have expected a better experience if I were going to give a higher review.    The sushi recipes were similar to most of the rolls I've had elsewhere. Nothing I had stuck out as particularly good. What did stand out were the mistakes the waiting staff and sushi chef made, the wait after asking for the check (which was not split as had been requested at the very beginning), and the tin foil I found in my baked sushi.   The reasons I am not giving a lower review after these errors are because the food was still decent, the staff were all pleasant, and one of the chefs overheard me talking to the waiter and saying I'm allergic to onions and did not put onions in a roll I requested even though I forgot to request no onions in it (I guess this proaction would have been a bad thing if I'd been ordering for someone else in my group)   I'm not making plans to return here, but if someone else loves it here and offers to treat, I won't refuse to eat here again

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yama Crunch, part of AYCE sushi bar, flavor 8/10

a-e452yw6CdZZLzGj_1Ykg.text: This place is awesome, the seafood salad is great. So is the yellow tail, and everything else we had.  Definitely a place we will go again!!!

H1xTGY1ASjnlzGhv78goeA.text: This place is hands down the best place to eat AYCE sushi in Las Vegas. Been coming here for 7 years and the quality of the food has always been up to par. Lunch is 20.95 and dinner is 23.95. Ages 3-6 are half price - 7 and up full price. I definitely recommend anyone who enjoys good sushi to here and check it out.

dP0tAWlMQWY8UXu0Wu9V1g.text: Read the reviews and thought I try it out.  I'll start with the positives.   -two yummy rolls- Ellen and No Name Roll were both good.  -service was quick. Severs kept checking in on us and our table was never without food.  -includes dessert.   Cons- Nigri- not so good. The fish had a funny taste. My hubby had to spit out the albacore. Ruined the rest of his meal. The fish was chewy. Good sushi melts in your mouth, chewing is don't effortlessly. Not here tho.   Overall was OK. Nothing spectacular.  Don't think I would come back just for the two rolls. Waited 40 mins.

2FUGAJVritYU57OhoPIx-A.text: Go here a little maybe a few times to see if i can peek that redhead girl fine as hell

8ttxGNxwRdgKfZ9sFESSfQ.text: I thought Vancouver BC is the best place for sushi in North America. No this place overshadowed my fave sushi bars in Vancouver. This is a must go to place when you're in Vegas. Fresh sushi, good price, my only comment is they are too generous with sauces. Sushis need to be wanting more sauces not bathing in it. Other than that this is my favourite sushi place - at the moment at least.

SGuyXdDFaIGMOSrZNX6kzw.text: Definitely not a fan of this place. I've been here twice and the second time I'm not sure if some of the fish was off but it had a horrible after taste and all 3 of us felt pretty bad the next day. They also screwed up our order nearly every time we added another roll/sushi. Just write it down if you can't remember. I won't chose this place again.

vWhGYMNCNc76VoCH5bPiUA.text: I came for AYCE sushi and let me tell you, I did not even want to eat all I could after the first bite.  1- Really bland badly cooked sushi rice.  2- Fish does not taste fresh, is bland in flavor, and comes drenched in sauces to try to hide that fact  I would not come here again. While the rolls are very creative the poor quality in fish ruins the taste  I have been to many AYCE sushi places but have never been this disappointed in the sushi quality.   The Saving grace was the very fast service on a Sunday afternoon.

rzZE51b02RWnf7mqLDE3Zw.text: I didn't expect that much at first when I came in. But their salmon n Ikura was so good!!Even all you can eat sushi,it's good quality.And waitress is so friendly.one point it was super cold inside this restaurant.i wished I had a jacket...

XqpPtpN-PyNLxTMwLn-Hug.text: One of my favorite sushi restaurants in Vegas. They offer a variety of rolls and the fish is fairly fresh. My personal favorite is the "Sun of the Beach" or anything with spicy mayo really. Their rolls are delicious and the decor here offers a nice calm vibe when you come in.   Today's visit was probably the best as our chef was a cool funny guy. Servers always provide good service and the chefs are attentive to whoever is sitting at the bar.   However, this place can feel crowded as it's usually pretty busy and the restaurant is relatively small (even after they expanded the restaurant). It would also be nice if they had stamp cards here, but hey, only one can dream!  Overall, a nice place to get sushi, but just be aware that this place can feel crowded due to the lack of space. Also I wish they had stamp cards here.

by6GNvH_eWC8CfFh2WTqFQ.text: I'm really only giving this place 2 stars because of the good service. The food and even the drinks were horrible. We actually received a couple of rolls that were not fresh and my mochi ice cream even arrived to my table almost room temperature. I don't even want to think about where the fish is kept. This is my first and last time visiting this place.

quC2VLVpiuVTK_sdAmAV3Q.text: I thought I've had bad sushi before but this is disgusting. The fish quality is definitely not the best. The only thing decent here is the seafood salad. My friends and I sat at the bar. For four people, he only gave us three plates of wasabi. When I asked for another plate, he rudely said he already gave it to us. The waitress was actually friendly in comparison but the food is not worth it. I rather spend an extra dollar/ long wait time and eat at Sakana or even Kaya. Will not be returning.  Update: We all ended up with stomachaches  afterwards

0ZUDZHR-0sqqs82Kpxaj0w.text: This place is awesome! Fresh food, fast and friendly service, and super cheap AYCE!

CJpt3DxmsgIDEue7tEzirw.text: Amazing deal for AYCE sushi!  Go for the rolls and your favorite sushi.  I skipped the much recommended sashimi salad, because I felt it would fill me up before the I could sample the rolls and I'm pretty sure I made the right choice (I don't eat as much as I used to).  The sushi tastes pretty fresh, and I they didn't skimp on the fish like they would at buffet places.  The sushi and the rolls are pretty much as you would get at any mid-range sushi restaurant in LA.  But seriously, you're not here about the quality of the food, you're here to stuff yourself silly with sushi, one of the best things in the world to eat.    The good thing is you can order half rolls, so you can sample more.  I really liked that they have detailed descriptions on the menu, so you know the difference and what goes into them.  I don't particularly care for the cooked rolls, so if you're a little tepid about raw fish, you should be ok. It's hard to remember the rolls I have, as it seems to all wash together pretty well, but overall the quality was excellent and I would go back.  They have several AYCE sushi places to choose from in Vegas, and so far both places I've gone to exceeded my expectations.  The thing about this place I remember is they have the salmon caviar sushi - ikura- which is worth ordering if you like it.  I don't think the other place I went to in Chinatown had it.    Also service was really nice and quick, they had people constantly coming in just pigging out and indulging themselves, I'm sure the waitresses here are exhausted.  I'd recommend eating at the bar, as you can order directly to the chefs so it's a quicker service.

ihcPL1UOwRFCsdvG7vWApQ.text: We came here for their AYCE sushi for lunch today. There will probably be a wait, but it's worth it. The service is great. Your drink will always be full, the rolls are fresh and delicious. I highly recommend the Superman and the No Name. Don't skip out on the mochi after you've gorged yourself on several rolls of deliciousness. The vanilla mochi is so, so choice.

R5OqGiGPRsNA6UsPLq4XPQ.text: Incredible establishment the service and the food where phenomenal!! This my second time here and I would definitely come back anytime!!

fjPsc0wfTYz2NoD4U_6L-w.text: This definitely isn't a place you can come to when you are in a hurry to eat, because there's ALWAYS a wait. All you can eat sushi for $23 totally worth it! Rolls are delicious and flavorful. If you are a sushi lover i do suggest checking this place out. Kind of a drive for me but so far this is the tastiest sushi ive had in Vegas. Prices are Normal. Service is average.

_7CcTgfMDcXXXJt6z-ZcsQ.text: Wow, best all you can eat (AYCE) sushi that I've ever had! Everything is made fresh to order, instead of sitting out waiting for people to take it. For lunch it's only $20.95 per person! Such a great deal, compared to going to Bacchanal for $50 a person (ugh).   You can order pretty much anything you want, including Sweet Shrimp (OMG Get this), Seafood Salad (pretty much sashimi in spicy sauce), rolls, Korean short ribs, nigiri sushi (including uni), and dessert! I recommend the Ika, Sweet Shrimp, Seafood Salad, Yellowtail, mochi ice cream, etc! Why not try everything you can?   DEFINITELY A MUST TRY!

pr3BGZw4yMUg9vxfvqO-jg.text: I honestly think this place is a little "over-hyped."  It's feels like a can of sardines in there. It's always super packed and there is not even close to being enough space to actually enjoy your meal without being constantly bumped into. Claustrophobics beware!  The sushi is good enough, but most of their rolls are drowning in cream cheese, and while I am a fan of the cheese that is creamed it can seriously get to be too much at this place.  The only other thing I have to say that was a major factor in the three star rating was the customer service. Every one working there looked like they hated working there, they hated the people they worked with, and they hated their lives in general.   Probably will stick to Daisho Sushi since its close to our home and everyone there at least pretends to be happy.

DNjK1TyvMB5s_RKFFLlWXQ.text: This is without a doubt one of my favorite sushi spots I have ever been to.  I come here at least twice a month.  I am not a big fan of sushi if it isn't all you can eat since I am a huge eater.  Yama offers all you can eat for between $22 and $25, depending on the time of day.  I prefer to come here with a large group since they have so many delicious rolls.  This allows you to pick one or two pieces off each roll and indulge in dozens of assortments of sushi.    Favorite Rolls at Yama: Wet Dream, you the man 2, yama crunch, spider roll, snow in vegas, kai roll, and unagi.    You have the option at the end of your meal for mochi or ice cream.  Both are delicious.    Warning:  If you are claustrophobic, do not go to yama.  This has to be the most tightly packed restaurant ever.  It always has a wait, so expect during busy time to arrive about 30-60 minutes before you are waiting to sit down.  Food preparation time is fairly quick, considering how busy it is.

DnBlb0OCfS9dqCOfoKzOJA.text: One of THE go-to sushi places in town.  You're not doing it right if you don't do AYCE.  Seafood salad is amazing, and you can order half rolls so you can try all the different rolls on the menu....if you eat as much as I do =)

iLaj4MuayfvrkczF7tBsMg.text: I LOVE sushi and this place is a hidden gem in the ghetto. My coworkers and I love to go after a long day at work and stuff our faces until we look like we are 9 months pregnant with twins. Plus, it's all you can eat!   The sashimi is excellent. Big, fresh pieces of fish, not the small pieces you get at other places. The white tuna and the garlic tuna are my favorite. The white tuna literally melts in your mouth. I could eat only that and be satisfied. It's like butter baby!   Now the rolls, where I even start they are all amazing, and I've tried almost all of them. My favorite is the Be Mine roll. It's lightly fried with a crab meat/cream cheese mixture in the middle, and it has a sweet taste to it. Very tasty. Some of my other favorites are Happy Ending, Baby One More Time, Sun Of The Beach, and No Name just to name a few.   The only down fall to this place (but I still wouldn't take a star off for it) is it is alway busy. It doesn't matter what time of day, it's busy. They did just expand the restaurant, but it's still packed. So prepare to have to wait, but I promise it's worth it!   Don't forget the mochi, mango is my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic tuna, white tuna, salmon, and yellow tail.
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X1q1B5wIDGIlb6lfYSNXcw.text: Living in San Diego and coming to Vegas every New Year, my family and I came here twice and I have been pleased every time.   I always get the Nigiri which was fresh and also the Seafood salad is a must get! It's a mixture of different types of fish in a delicious sauce.   The price you pay for AYCE is well worth it because the portions and quality is on point.

S7EZkjfRnPQZfNo4P-4idQ.text: $20 ayce lunch is pretty great. I try to get there when they open if I go on the weekend cus it gets very full very quick.

718Df9CpVjablrgNH3FClg.text: Tried this out based on a friend's recommendation. I had never heard of it, & even though I drive by it often I didn't know it was there. Walked in and was surprised to see how busy it was. Service was OK & it didn't strike me as the cleanest place, but the food was really tasty. I would definitely give it another go!

The place isn't big but they accommodated our party of 16 guys with no problem. I would definitely recommend this spot. It's off the strip a little but only about 5-10 minute drive

U3H1V8Sb8id6oCUKoEB3Tw.text: This place is the bomb!!! It has been over 3 years since my last visit but they have not changed. The food is fresh and proportion is just right. Ohh and they are fast!!! I only wish they have a location in San Francisco.

YfQ-amCQ5Y4W0pvpS4Mmug.text: Yes, Yes, Yes! Best all you can eat sushi in Vegas! Sometimes (most of the time) there is a bit of a wait to be seated but it's worth it.

pgjVbzSnJXL2t7zJHPPdQA.text: This was my first time eating at this restaurant. I absolutely loved it! We came here when it first opened for lunch. We instantly knew this place was popular because it became packed very quickly. I loved the all you can eat menu. I pretty much ate until I was about to explode. I ordered mostly raw stuff and must say it was really good. My favs were the handrolls. Our orders came out pretty fast and the waitress was very attentive. This place will be a routine pit-stop the next time I'm in town.
