CI0E91x6bv6uEz9c8o7Ldw.text: Love this place! It's my favorite! My roommate and I come once a week. Best sushi in town!

1eQK3tZi9ChVKLikxs5AHw.text: I love this place to death like literally. Oh man where should I start lol ever since the day I came to this place to try it out for myself, I think a whole week straight I couldn't stop ranting about how delicious everything is on the menu. Hands down one of my favorite sushi place in Vegas ;)

UXYryYEG-n1mGxfNSAEVhg.text: I've had almost every AYCE sushi place, and this place still tops them all. I'll come back and post pictures later.

GESFbFB9ghPwIwGd_s3ENw.text: Came highly recommended. Roach climbed up wall behind while eating toro. Didn't seem to bother anyone else.

5H4XrjRhmuAa1_lBTd727Q.text: Bad location but awesome food! Best sushi I've had in a while. Service is amazing everyone is so nice an helpful. Also the food comes out fast!

f46zkyEvLSnazcejlgV-Og.text: Love this AYCA Sushi venue! At first my friends and I saw the 40 minute wait and the people waiting outside but realized it must be popular. We went ahead and waited it out and it was worth it for sure. It cost $20.95 person. Service was excellent as food came around fast and drinks were refilled. I ordered the seafood salad (as when you do the AYCE deal, you can have 1 salad per person). We were ordering all sorts of shrimp sushi rolls. The mussels were amazing as we shared 3 orders of that. We also got 2 orders of sesame chicken. I ordered some eel rolls that were also tasty. Great experience overall.  The reason I gave it four stars is because the place is very small and there was a wait to get in. We also tried to make a reservation here and they only do first come first serve. Other than that, I recommend this place to anyone that wants AYCE and doesn't mind the wait.

cvBxRG_oqRlEMyw3wQ-spw.text: Isaiah #18  aka Superman was awesome made our visit so much better with his top notch service.  The food was to die for as always!!  Never disappointed or hungry when leaving here.

5vCuYBsWfqCuNZHzpxSjrw.text: This is a hard review to write, I was going to give this place a 4 stars, till we got a called from our bank and told us our credit card was duplicated the next morning. Went on Sunday night and the place were crowded, service was fast and food came out quickly.  We give our waiter credit card and it took them a long time to bring back the card. This is the first place that we used our card on this trip and the next day our bank called and said we have charges that we never make. We end up canceling the card. Be careful when use you CC at this place.

dd5n9RcsR2uJcRo1-3XbFQ.text: Man, do i LOVE this place!!!!   Every time i got back, it is like I'm trying the sushi for the first time and just get sent to that wonderful place of "mmmmmmmmmmmm".   I have been to quite a good bit of AYCE sushi places here, and this is at the top of my list. Every time my bf and i have went our orders always come out fast, the service is good despite the place always being packed, the sushi...oh the sushi is so heavenly! All the combinations and sauciness....so so so good!   If you are going to try this place out, you should know that it is a small place and it is pretty much always packed, so you will have to be prepared to wait awhile depending on your party size. For me and my boyfriend it is ALWAYS a 45min wait, but it is SOOOOOO worth it! Also, SUN OF THE BEACH is a MUST try!!!!!   Happy Sushi : )

UpVnwx60bgIKHuv3kQNN2A.text: Just moved out here and I needed a new sushi spot, and this was so good! Clean, yummy,and quick. We had the yo sexy, no name, and couple others!! Definitely recommend it! Can't wait to go back!

p-T5-fny6TX6ZXWwXMHSDQ.text: Best sushi in Vegas, and you can't beat the AYCE at $25 a person.  They have a long list of specialty rolls.  I haven't had one I didn't like!  The baked eel roll is one of my favorites.  I eat here every time I come to Vegas!  Be prepared for a wait if you come during busy hours though.  It is a small establishment and a favorite with the locals.  You can order half rolls to be able to try more things before you get too full!

t79UYYIsVW6OuL2p6EvWJg.text: Yama Sushi, YUMMAYsushi :)  My friends have been raving about this restaurant they accidentally encountered the whole ride from socal to vegas. But they didn't remember the name of the restaurant or where it was located. However, they WOULD remember the names of the rolls, especially the 'Man Whore.' Good thing for search and yelp :D  The price of the ayce sushi already got meee and we DEFINITELY ate more than $23 worth of seafood. The waiters and waitresses are very friendly and accommodating. And with a group of 4, we really ordered ALOT OF FOOD and never once got a mean glare of 'OMG stop eating so much aaaaah'. I loved the ordering with the paper because you can see the complete list of different appetizers, sides, desserts, and main dishes and just order them so easily by writing in numbers. They also had shrimp heads and uni. I didn't try the uni, although I regret it now, because I thought maybe I really don't like uni, but realized maybe my first time eating uni wasn't the best... The orders came out quickly and seemed to be in succession of how we ordered it. And everything was delicious and well-presented.   To be honest, it seemed like the price and food was too good to be True so I was half expecting to have a stomach ache on the drive back home. But happily and luckily to say I was extremely fat and content in the car =)  Must go back to Yama sushi! oohhh and I didn't know last time that you can order half rolls, will do that next time! :))

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. shrimp heads

psUuKdLwlXaPLwlkJnmgHg.text: This has to be the worst sushi I have ever had. They hide the flavor of nasty tasting fish with tons of sauce . The rice taste like rubber, the fish was brown and the crab tasted frozen. Not only does the fish stink, literally  but so does the management . We told them not to give us anyymore of the all u can eat because we did  not like it.  The manager said oh this  is like Nobu quality. Ya, I actually think when Nobu throws there 3 day old fish in the trash that Yama goes dumpster diving for it . That Is The Only Way They Can Charge $20 for all you can eat.  As I'm writing this I am sitting here in the restaurant  and I feel like I have to vomit. Excuse me while I throw up..

JJJw6yexnrskofxxpXLc4w.text: LOVE their sushi!!!! There is no other place I eat sushi at.   It is a "hole in the wall" type of place. Despite it being in an iffy area, people stand in cold & heat to wait to get in. This place is ALWAYS busy. Today, Friday, was no exception. They do not take reservations  Our server took a while to get to us but a bus boy was quick to jolt down our orders & pass them on to our server. I think the fact that they are so busy takes away from the service but ask for anyone for anything & all are helpful, even if they are not your server.   My recommendation: AYCE, come with an appetite.

9lqFXOD_QMhg5bljmSYDOQ.text: Came with the whole family for mothers day. Everything was good and I know the sushi was good because my sister doesn't even like sushi but she liked the sushi here !

-8trjXi07xFxxxo1c56eBw.text: Ran a train on these rolls, cuz it was ALL YOU CAN EAT!  I decided to give this place a go, since I wasn't in the mood to shell out 50 bucks for a hotel mediocre buffet on the strip. Since I had a car, we decided to venture off strip to find some good eats. The group decided on Yama Sushi.   We showed up around 7:00 pm on a Saturday night. There was a line out the door and a 1 hour wait. By the time we sat down, I was already gnawing on my arm. I was ready to pig out. I looked around for the buffet station and saw none. It turns out, you have to order the items individually. Son-of-B... I thought the food was going to take another 30 minutes to prepare, so I was apologizing to my hungry friends. However, within 2 minutes of ordering, our food already started to come out. We must of tried at least 16 rolls, 8 types of sushi, 10 different appetizers and all of the mochi ice cream. I actually don't remember what I ate, since there was just a blur of hands going from the table to my mouth. Everything that we had was delicious, with the expectation of the edamame and yakitori (chicken skewers).   The place is really cramped, crowded, and dimly lit. It's also not that expensive.   A little about my credentials: I first got into cooking & food when I was in college. After being rejected by numerous girls and getting zero action, I decided it was time for a change. I needed a new makeover to boost my geeky image. I applied for a cooking position at a Mediterranean-Italia n Restaurant near my home and learned to cook all sorts of pastas and dishes. I never became a professional chef, but 8 years later and 55 lbs heavier, I continue to enjoy & love food.

Dy_3xsm3GisTiZiW6nk9_g.text: I've been going here for a few years now and have never had a bad experience until now. The staff was great as always, but the sushi was just disappointing. The mussels seemed to be undercooked and the yellowtail nigiri I got was really fishy smelling. Not good. I started gagging towards the end when I was eating my last piece of yellowtail. Don't think I'll be going here again.

ipvOmc6EaYqlsp1ESH7bzQ.text: My first time here. A great lunch place for AYCE sushi. I loved their Mixed poke salad and their soft shell crabs was pretty good too . Finished off with the strawberry and mango mochi balls for a very fulfilling lunch. Must visit in Vegas.

AhWekjNL2aqEMOS-vap7gg.text: Always the best for AYCE (all you can eat) sushi - they cover everything from appetizers, to sushi, rolls and sashimi salad (excellent here).  We have been going here for the last 5 years to get our sushi fix on!!  Try it - great for cooked or raw fish dishes. The fish is always super fresh here too.  You should try it - if you love sushi this is a great place!!

LMnz2Vnvgoa3DixEl5BTOg.text: Never will go back there...Had lunch this past weekend and I got major diarrhea....when I say that, I meant I ordered the fried shrimp heads and though they were fried, they had been very juicy and not thoroughly fried.  mmmm.....sorry Yama, you lost a 10-yr customer.

UVtCxENvjA0Z8tUxSD4Pgw.text: Hands down best overall sushi place in Las Vegas. Service is a little slow because the place is always packed but you can't beat the variety and flavor and freshness of the sushi rolls.

vi_quCCBNpnS28TZKlmVsw.text: Even though the place is always packed we have always received excellent service and the food is always great. We live in Henderson, and it's's by far our favorite sushi restaurant in the Las Vegas area. Highly recommended.

WBGg3p7YrPjPSb82IHlJBQ.text: No oysters in their AYCE Sushi dinner menu! Try the spicy seafood salad.. you can get a half order, you'll like it!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. all from the AYCE menu

5huOuEX8B8e_4e7YQkblVA.text: Great value and the food for an all you can eat establishment is delicious.  It is not a limited menu and they have all the standard sushi fare minus Toro, bummer.  That would be a dream come True if they had all you can eat Toro!  We came on a Tuesday at 2:40 and it was pretty busy but did not wait for a table.  Shrimp tempura, bbq ribs, I ago and spicy tuna roll were my favorite.  For 20.95 it is a superb value.

VY2U7jRlBtvMsngzummZJg.text: The food was really good at this restaurant, and reasonably priced, but OMG, the table LOCATION was awful. This seems a silly thing to get worked up about, but the table was crammed up against a "private" party room with windows. My chair stuck halfway out into the entrance of the party room, so when a party of 15 came, I had more ass in my face than if I'd been at a strip club. Each time someone entered or left I had to move my chair for them.  Honestly, though, I just about screamed when a man's rather large ass bumped into my face as he tried to move around people. Seriously, how can you enjoy sushi with a faceful of buttocks?  I wouldn't mind going again sometime if I'm in the area, but I'll just sit and wait thank you very much, until a better table opens.

pqxDWDQ-8mCWXum6EaO2MQ.text: Over the past 4 years since I moved to Vegas this is hands down the best sushi place in town.  Not sure why there are some negative reviews.  I bring all my co-workers here during lunch time and we go to town.

OL9wzjxdzEz-9RLbc4_Y4Q.text: My favorite sushi spot in town! In my book there is no where else to go! The seafood salad is amazing! If you want sushi you need to come here. Best all you can eat and it's only $24 for dinner. I love they let you do have rolls too! Check it out!

6TKyWuQlKvCny3oMYSImdQ.text: Love them! Best sushi I've ever had (but I'm not that experienced in exploring new places for this deliciousness around town....)! Wonderful pricing for regular and all you can eat menus. Even though I only go once a month or once every two months the staff ALWAYS remembers you! Which makes for a fantastic place to be entertained and like you belong there! Can't stay away! Always sit at the bar for quicker service and great customer service!

4gYAUH0xPu7BzPluktl07Q.text: Today was the first time coming here and I wasn't all that thrilled. We ordered the "All you can you eat" and got our money's worth but service wise it sucked. The sushi was pretty fresh and tasty but you can't place orders with just any waitress, you have to place orders with the waitress assigned to your table. The service to me should be better must be better especially in a town that depends on the tourism industry.   I don't know if it's purposely like this or just by coincidence but the employees who work there are mostly Asian and Mexican but there are no Mexican waiters/waitresses, they are the cooks, the water re-filler persons and the cooks, while the Asian people are the waiters/waitresses and front of house cooks. I'm not saying the owners of Yama Sushi did this on purpose but that's how the employee staff breaks down.   This was my first time and sadly probably the last time.

6moKxGyZMEO6d9gZjEvJkg.text: I tried sushi for the first time in my life (I'm not a fan of fish) and I loved it! Great prices wait can be a little long with groups over 4 but the place is small and super delicious. Highly recommend.

QPxIsgSIEhhnSoVm3KMHcQ.text: Did 2 people AYCE lunch. Very crowded, bumping elbows at the bar, no room.  Burnt ManWhore Roll. Burnt Salmon Skin Roll. Rude service from sushi chef and wait staff.  HAIR in my wasabi ..... Showed the staff and chef and no reaction.

-BTXiUY71V941bNONHF4_A.text: when I think of all you can eat sushi, I think of compromised quality for more quantity, but at Yama, that is not the case. Delicious fresh fish! Also great service!!!!!  I ordered mostly nigiri, and then was unsure of which rolls to order so I told the server to pick us a few rolls (because there are so many to choose from !!!) and not to tell me what they were and to just bring them lol....still not sure what they were but everything was sooooo good and I can't wait to go back :)  I don't normally make yelp reviews, but I this Yama definately deserved it! 5 stars

kaATiOLHoqh8WnhXkxrsRQ.text: I have to this is one of the best sushi places I've eaten . Outstanding service and the fish as fresh and delicious as fish can taste . The owner has done a outstanding job buying freshest fish he can buy , which makes this place 5 stars in my book. So affordable for so much food truly outstanding. Thank you for the great food and great service

IwpyRrhgebMcXL14GaMKRA.text: This is my favorite all you can eat sushi spot. They suggest to order little by little and they keep up bringing what you order timely!  All their sushi, specialty sushi are served fresh. In all the times I have eaten here, never experienced anything less than fresh sushi.  The place is always full which speaks for itself. Order everything on the menu, it's just absolutely delicious. End with ordering mochi flavored ice cream. Writing this review from home is making me Yama Sushi hungry!!! For realz!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

blmlHhTDVJq_DkzW1sVMBw.text: "This place is great!" All you can eat for $20, "YES!"  I had three servings of the Harry Potter! Lol. It's that good!!!!!! If you want good, fresh sushi....."Go here!" Hole in the wall location....."Big Taste!" The sake is good too. :-)

9yaNjX793CcTEXj1U2RDWQ.text: Love this place! Would give it a 5star if service was a bit better. Usually go here once a month. You can't beat all you can eat sushi for $25. Food quality has always been great. Not once have we had something we didn't like.   Usually pretty busy. Always packed for lunch and dinner! It can get a bit noisy with all the people.

HvPzRF6rTG4dzUM5cvNqAw.text: Best AYCE Sushi in Vegas. Take my family here at least once a month, no matter the wait its always worth it! Great sushi, fast and friendly service. No Name and Ellen Roll is our favorites and the Fish Salad is amazing!

1drNH2vsYG2eWorvDSt6ew.text: Real sushi, buffet priced, too good, all menue

POjVeUOMd49nsjQFLSojnA.text: Let me jut say, if you know fresh sushi, you won't like this. We are from Seattle and eat fresh fish quite often - that is not the case here. It isn't really the company's fault - what can you expect when you are in the desert. However, I wouldn't recommend this as it took a lot of effort to try and finish my rolls because the taste was just so bad. The service was fantastic though so that was great! They were very nice, fast and attentive. I just personally couldn't stomach the poor quality fish.

JAHEqKVTOf4KZskUGvM8ZA.text: I only wished we had this exact same place in Orange County, CA!  It's only a couple of minutes off the strip and for $21/person for lunch, the price can't be beat for AYCE anywhere near the Vegas strip.    My husband and I sat at the sushi bar and ate more than our fair share of $21 worth of sushi, rolls, and appetizers.  The items we ate that I just LOVED included: Sweet Shrimp (By far my FAVORITE place I've had sweet shrimp.  Perfect clear sweet after taste and the batter used to fry the head was not overwhelming and complimented the delicacy of the shrimp brains) Garlic tuna Halibut Tuna Salmon Baked mussels (one order contains 4 very small mussels) Soft-shelled crab  They were very busy with a line out the door.  So expect average/sub par service.  Our waitress forgot a couple of items we ordered, but it didn't bother us.  It just left us more room for delicious sushi that came from the sushi chef since we sat at the sushi bar.   I can't wait to go to Vegas again just so I can come here to eat again.

TDDMWHPPEMagR5cy0eW-pQ.text: This place serves delicious sushi. They are expedient with orders too. My only issue is that they are so incredibly busy, that the servers rushing orders take away from the dining experience. It almost feels like a "factory" Get in and get out. And you're rushing in between.  The space is really small so go somewhere else if you want an intimate meal because you are less than an arm's length from the table next to you.

T_2uEI1nUV1-KA-iKPi0-g.text: In a sketchy plaza is this amazing sushi place called Yama! I do love going there but one word of warning, it can be a long wait! Get there before 6pm or well after 8pm and you may only have a 20 minute wait. It's worth the wait but if you're starving at a busy dining hour, darling you're gonna wait. Best to plan ahead for this place, no reservations are taken. I've never had a bad roll. Try it all, do all you can eat!

6gXrb-DMgA2bd5gU77QIxA.text: By far has to be my favorite sushi restaurant in Las Vegas! The striptease is worth ordering twice! Love the food and almost everything on the menu. I have tried other places and nothing compares to yama. Any family members that come to town we HAVE to bring them to yama to experience the best!   The staff isn't the friendliest and they aren't too happy with groups bigger than 5 but the food is worth it. Trust me!

hpRTmYtmbLV7lMB8wx435A.text: One of my favorite sushi places in Vegas!! The all you can eat deal is a great price. I probably wouldn't do it again since I don't eat enough to justify it, but many will find it worth it. Loved the You Da Man roll, California was good as always, the asparagus tuna was delicious, and also had dumplings and edamame.  The only place I have had better sushi here was Sushi Twister, where I liked their crazy rolls a little better.  Only complaint is the slow service. We had to ask for a 2nd menu and drinks two times each.   For sure I would go back, but would order a la cart so I don't have to unbutton my pants and eat 50 Tums on the way home.

iQTu-Mpz1c5_HLvgvratig.text: Great Sushi! Great service! Place was packed but sushi is made fresh right in front of you fast. Price was 23.99 all you can eat. Can't beat it. Just a heads up a lot of the sushi dishes have sexual names. Great place for a date. Definitely will go again.

E18IbtmdHglr_sEYuo73sg.text: Great sushi! My favorite place to go with a nice all you can eat price & selection. Always delicious with decent service. Call ahead or be prepared to wait a bit on the busy weekends.

2tFRHMiK3S_8KDTt2pfDAA.text: Really good sushi and service.  Wait times can be a bit long at times.

9EvWQK5f08fBjEc1ikLlAA.text: The sushi are fresh, but it take for ever to bring the order to the table, and they have a 1h30mins limit time dining. And the server is not nice and well trained.

YgNgf1Us5KylCmjMVFFFzA.text: The food here is decent for the price, but service is terrible. You have a 1 hour and 30 minute time limit, but you spend most of that time waiting for service. The first five minutes during our visit, we were waiting for someone to come and greet us, then waited another three minutes for drinks. Our server was rude and in a rush. She was also arguing with the men making the sushi in front of guests. Long story short, this is the last time I'm eating here. Because we were a party of six, we were required to tip 18%. I don't think our server even deserved that.

6RG75f6B0vB_1tbl9J1kEA.text: Sushi isn't my favorite thing to eat but when i am in the mood this is the place to go

QXUeiSyngZNO357Bt_iL1Q.text: I usually stay on the strip in vegas and eat mostly on the strip.  My brother's gf recommended us to try this place and it was only about a ten minute drive away so we thought why not.  I was pleasantly surprised!  They have an all you can eat menu for about $25 a person for dinner and the selection and quality you get is really good.  Everything tasted really fresh and the rolls didn't have too much rice on it.  I'll definitely be going back again.  The only bad thing about this place is the waitress we had tried to memorize our order and didn't really write anything down.  She forgot some parts of our order which ended up being okay because we over ordered.  Try to get their early, it was super crowded even though we got there around 5p for dinner and the place is relatively small.

dB9AKsviimZZWaA9IbMSXw.text: Amazing Food!!!! Amazing service, very friendly, efficient!!!  The AYCE is so worth the price... on some of the rolls you can even do half rolls!  Thats what we did and was able to have more of a variety.  I totally recommend this place!!!!

gwaO9cHOOLJr7D_Fa3CFTg.text: Best rolls in Vegas!! They also have a seafood salad that is bomb!!!\ Its probably the tastiest sushi in Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No Name roll, one of the tastiest!!!
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Salad!! Get it Eat it Love it

IKgvKpWUxxUdOLDWTRJ_Fg.text: DON'T EAT THERE!!!! My husband and myself ate at the bar and the guy making the sushi was sick. He kept wiping his nose with the back of his hand and digging the same hand in the rice to make the sushi. THAT WASN'T EVEN THE WORST PART! What killed it, was when he disappeared under the bar with one finger holding one nostrel, then he came back up and kept making sushi. My husband and I wonder if he sneezed, or shot snot out of his nose. In any event HE DID NOT WASH HIS HANDS. To top it all off, we talked to the manager, he said he would talk to him while he was ringing us up. We were charged for all you can eat and only ate a roll a piece. Poor sanitation and worse Customer Service. Do yourself a favor and go to China Town!

xPoaX7yjZ4EY4tXqEU9fMA.text: This place is great. Great value for food. Sushi places are supposed to be expensive and small in comparison to other restaurants, but we were surprised to see that this place is quite big. The service was prompt. I won't say that I had the best sushi ever, but I just loved this one item called Wet dreams. Do order it when you are there.

UppaZuNOVuhUDaK7WuJu8g.text: I have never been to this sushi place before, and I went based on the suggestion of a friend from work. She lead me in the right direction.   It was a busy night, so I was very lucky to get in, and get a seat at the bar. The staff was very attentive. Although, they did forget my potstickers, but I won't hold that against them. Every roll I had was made right in front of me, which I had never experienced before.   I had maybe 5 different rolls before I called it a night, and every single roll was great! I have a very weak stomach, so I only had one spicy roll. Definitely would go again. Either alone, or with a group, you're in for a great experience.

p51cfdw8Zep1ExHIDghoGA.text: Best all you can eat, hands down. Quality control excellent , fish always fresh, those of you that know how to spot fresh fish, will know this place is legit. First review, but eat here several times over the years.

RhJTLuKL2BiV_G1V99dC3Q.text: I ate at Yama one night, two nights later ate at Sakana... Yama won hands down. Larger portions, fresher quality, tv's that work (Match Madness) and they accept Amex as opposed to Sakana.

yAKB5IYqMSaB1jznXkguyQ.text: Great price for fresh sushi. We sat the sushi bar and the service was awesome. It was $25 per person for all you can eat for 2 hours. You can order anything on the menu! Yum

g819nxJ46wIjoLNRvEsYfw.text: Yama has always been a favorite of mine.  The staff there although busy tries their hardest to keep you content and happy.  I always get the dancing in the sheet and the sun of the beach rolls.  Also never pass up the small dishes.  LOAD UP ON TEMPURA because it is oh so good.   Their Seafood salad is off the chart as well, only catch is one order per person.  For an AYCE place I most def recommend it.

isCIrEuhC1iacl_Bul65cA.text: I have been to Yama twice and both times sat at the sushi bar.  It was packed and sometimes it was hard to get the attention of the chefs (they serve the bar directly). That being said...it is worth the wait! Some of the best sushi I have ever had!! The seaweed salad and seafood salad are a must and every roll I have tried so far was delicious. I recommend the "all you can eat" option so you can try more dishes.

Z9LcaaaxiWE2jZuVwaHGvg.text: Horrible place if you want to grab a fast lunch. I was on my break, and another friend was going to meet me. Due to my limited time, they would not sit me to start eating while I waited for my friend. Very inconvenient.

8v3KIn1j-R_n9ikAWZjAqQ.text: This is a great place to eat sushi. The place is located off the strip in a parking lot which is convenient and not that much traffic. The All You Can Eat is the best deal. Service is ok although the last time we went we felt rushed out since the crowd started to come in. Strip Tease, Man Whore, Shrimp Lover and Wet Dream are my all time favorite dishes.  My only grip about this place is that I hope they had more bathrooms available they only have 1 bathroom for each Men & Women which is an inconvenience. Definitely recommend coming here to eat sushi that is priced very well.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wet Dream
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strip Tease
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Lover

Pq3im1Abbs7tgefzOSF9vA.text: Affordable all you can eat sushi! $25 dinner with sashimi salad, soft shell crabs, mussels, shrimp tempura and unlimited sushi rolls. Plus Mochi ice cream for dessert!I highly recommend Yama Sushi.

VjiOLG9c6pz5fPlCmha5JA.text: This is my favorite ayce sushi place ever. I recently brought some people from Japan here and they were very impressed. Can't argue with that!

5HMmW4BtMyrmGfW8lisHrw.text: All I can say is average sushi. Very bland flavors, too much rice, and the nigiri was well below average. Service was crappy as well. Our group got there at 250pm during lunch hours and they tried to charge us for dinner hours when it clearly says on thier menu that the price switch starts at 3pm. Very dissapointed again. That was my last visit ever.

5qySaM8cikieDOz5ESt6KQ.text: Great Sushi Spot! Well Rounded and I pretty much enjoyed everything.  Service was fast but we did order some stuff that they forgot. We were full anyways, so it worked out.   Note: This place is very busy & packed around lunch time.  My Favorites: Spicy Seafood Salad - A Must Try! Soft Shell Crab Tuna - Pretty Fresh White Tuna No Name - A Delicious Roll! Mango Mochi Ice Cream - Yummy!

uPzgaNL9w_4SYDWs5cOXgw.text: Amazing sushi you will not be disappointed don't let the look or location of the restaurant fool you!

S96vl6b6esRyHePllSePYA.text: I love sushi and am very picky, I was in the area and saw this place.  It was packed at 1:30PM so I knew it had to be good.  I ordered the lunch AYCE $20!.  The great waitress brought my first two rolls in five min and they were AWESOME!  I ordered two more even though I was stuffed and she said, "Do you want half order of each?"  YES! that is perfect.  I wanted to taste each but was full.  The only bad thing was the music was really loud!  LOL!  It was pop music, not my favorite.  But the service and food were awesome.  When I am in the area, I will go back!

IIfA1S-VOhSij0vTPdl59A.text: A couple of colleagues and I went for dinner, so we sat at the bar and was excited bc I had heard great things about this place. But 10 mins into our dinner we saw two roaches crawling on top of the coolers where the kept all there raw sashimi.  After that we were pretty grossed out so decided to ask if we could pay half and just leave.  Might be good but they def have a roach problem.

26-0NaXcCAVlOnffbPJVDA.text: Best sushi in town, well worth the 30min wait!! Service is great, the only thing is that it gets crowded but very good all around

Y1Ymh7sV8jFTOqUXcnmD_Q.text: This is one of the few great AYCE sushi joints in Vegas that are actually open for lunch! Both of my favorite spots are dinner and late night only! After checking out of our hotel, we had sushi withdrawl symptoms and needed raw fish asap!  It was already packed right at opening. Luckily for us, there were 2 spots open right at the bar. Cha ching!  The quality and selection here were excellent. Right up there with the best Vegas AYCE spots. AYCE items include appetizers and desserts also. It was about $21 for lunch which was great.   Sushi itself was fresh, rice was made perfectly.  However I give them only 4 stars because my favorite 2 spots in Vegas still reign on my list. I felt service was a bit rushed because of how crowded they were. Hikari and Sushi House Goyemon still are my tops.

SeDu0Hr_8wxpXdrxLmBoMA.text: FOOD: We did the AYCE during lunch for about $20/person.  We tried a good chunk of the menu, especially the specialty sushi.. and everything was hit or miss. A lot of the rolls seemed kind of dry or had bad quality?... I'm not sure, but it was off.  Some highlights: Wet Dream, One Minute Man, Yellowtail, Halibut, and Green Mussel  AMBIANCE:  The restaurant kind of had a weird layout where there were two rooms. It also felt a little cramped.   SERVICE: Servers were very nice and attentive but they kept messing up our order. They would give us plates we DIDN'T order and would forget about plates we DID order. I also don't like that they don't give you the paper to mark your order.. you have to tell them what you want every time.   TIPS: Definitely do the AYCE so you can try a variety of dishes.

cVGU8XJGBCHl9K1nMI3GMg.text: I have been a longtime fan of Yama but sadly it has progressively gone down hill the last few visits. I have never liked how they cram every last seat they can into the place to the point of causing discomfort to their guests. I am not sure what they think those little shoji screens do but they might as well remove them. You feel as if you are dining with the people at the next table. It is awkward and uncomfortable.  I had put up with this because the sushi was absolutely amazing but unfortunately it is no longer as fresh as it once was. The rolls now seem like a small step up from supermarket sushi. Either the chefs don't care as much, the quality of the ingredients has been downgraded, or probably a combination of both.

SUyG7AcOMWI9bH-R7qO-Vw.text: For $24 bucks a person at lunch including tip is pretty good for AYCE sushi. Yama has a good variety of different sushi and rolls for you to choose from. Besides sushi, there are also other appetizers (soft shell crab, chicken, edamame, tofu, etc) that you can order. So you can come with everyone and anyone that wants to eat because you can pretty much satisfy everyone. From people that like sashimi, to rolls, or people that don't like sushi at all they have options here too. There are a couple items that are limit one per person and of course, those are the "premium" items. Uni, yellowtail collar, sashimi salad, sweet shrimp, etc. yelp.com/biz_photos/yama... So heres some tip... - Don't get greedy with the sashimi salad yelp.com/biz_photos/yama... . Even though its one per person, on order is good for 2/3 people. We made the mistake of ordering 1 per person and that pretty much filled me up 1/3. - They really are anal about rice thats not eaten. So be warned! my friend had like 2 balls of rice on his plate and the lady made it a point to tell us that if he doesn't finish it then we will get charged. - Call before you come so you can see if theres a wait. When we went around 1, there were no wait but by the time we left there was a line forming. I'm guessing that this place gets packed at night. Overall, this is pretty good AYCE Sushi and I will definitely recommend it. Everyone needs a break from the vegas buffets.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon skin roll and most importantly.. UNI
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi Salad

9zK_JxfQ8lnpT35MjGTqog.text: Looked for a place to eat in the area , opened yelp and saw a four star four for this place, I have to say that I agree.  Food is great, price was great ( $20.99 for all you can eat lunch 11am-3pm) and service was on point.  I was reading that some people had a problem with the service - I don't know if they were reading your comment or what but I couldn't take a sip of my water and someone was there for a refill. App came quick also.  Go there during lunch , sit for an hour at least and enjoy the food :)

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango mochi ice cream
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special yobo roll.
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sushi bar

uzk9TpwVg9O5_QmEkiBkIA.text: Heard about this place from the Excalibur pool cocktail waitress.  She said they had great all you can eat sushi and she was right.  When we walked in this place was crowded.  We ordered two all you can eat dishes, which came out to $51 total, tax included.  You can order rolls, sashimi, and sushi for this price.    The sushi chef was extremely fast, making sushi rolls appear in under three minutes like David Copperfield.  The baked and fried rolls took a bit longer-- probably a six minute wait.  We ate a total of five rolls, which would have been $50 if ordered separately, so bring a hearty appetite and try to kill six rolls to get your money's worth.  That's a lot of sushi, I could barely walk after crushing five rolls with my wife.  A word of caution, if you leave any food on your plate they charge you a surcharge, so don't go overboard.      The rolls were extremely fresh and delicious.  A must order were the Striptease and the Wet Dream Rolls.  Our waitress told us that the fish is delivered daily from three different locations.    This place is definitely on the re-visit list next time we are in Vegas.

zcJLtpPkShlWMFKhQhY9MA.text: We ate here the other night and for the first time we have to say we give it 4 stars only because of the service we got. We asked for a fork and it took forever to get one. We were handed a fork with a plastic fork? I have no idea why. They sat us at the bar because we they were very busy and there was no wait for the bar. The guy making the sushi was more interested in flirting with 3 girls that sat in front of him. I seen him make them something special on a plate with 3 pieces and they looked at him and he said try it. We sat there and did not know what we were suppose to do or who do we order from because he was really busy, and the girls are always so fast when they go by it is hard to stop anyone to ask what we were to do. This is the last time we would sit at the bar. We will for sure wait for a table next time.  We still love this place and it is still our favorite you can not take away the good Sushi they have especially that Spicy Fish Salad it is to die for!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I am in heaven.. this spicy seafood salad is the bomb!
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So yummy!

Enmc0k_g_hZIqQ7T_IKeQA.text: Majide!!! Look, this place is an AYCE sushi joint not some three Michelin star winning sushi restaurant like Sukiyabashi Jiro. So if you are looking for top quality sushi, you should know better than to come here. I mean, do you go into McDonald's expecting USDA prime beef? I should rephrase that to do you expect real beef at McDonald's ... I mean it baffles my mind that people expect 5-star sushi at an AYCE where lunch (11 to 3) is $20.95 and dinner (3 to 11) is $23.95! Then again, there are insensible morons all around us like the crazies that I saw the other day buying sushi from 7-Eleven. Oh the horror! Let's put it this way, compared to the prices of buffets on The Strip, Yama Sushi's price is a steal. Moreover, have you even seen the deplorable sushi on The Strip? Either way, I came here expecting quantity over quality, but was surprised that the quality wasn't too shabby. The wife and I ate at Yama Sushi because we were in town with a bunch of Los Angeles Yelpers as part of an unofficial summer break weekend for July 4th. You see, the wife and I don't usually eat AYCE and Yama Sushi was not even on our radar, but since the group decided to check it out we decided to join them as not to be party foul. So yea, although I still needed to tackle down some of the Vegas restaurants reviewed by my Yelp friend and Vegas aficionado Rod U. (yelp.com/user_details_li...) who has several awesome Vegas restaurant lists, we took the detour with Yama Sushi that ended up being better than expected. Despite our large party (20+), Yama Sushi accommodated us by putting together 4-5 tables. Since I am an aisle-person (planes, concerts, sporting events), the wife and I sat at an end table. Our end table of six was the sober table because we had come to eat and not to get drunk and rowdy. I mean pro eaters know that AYCE places recuperate their money via overpriced alcohol, DUH! Anyways, we must have ordered a million rolls. I can't even remember what we had because the food just kept on "rollin". There were rolls with cream cheese, rolls with eel sauce, and rolls with gooey mayo goodness. But with AYCE, everything all starts tasting the same after awhile. Good thing Ed A. (yelp.com/user_details?us...) was at our table to clear the leftover roll pieces our gluttonous asses could not finish... so that we could order more of course. Coming in with low expectations, I was surprised that the food wasn't too bad. The rolls were decent and the appetizers such as the soft shell crab and sweet shrimp were tasty. I really do not know how this business model works because pretty much their entire menu is available for AYCE (some items such as the uni had a limit of one order). The only real awkward moment of the night was that there seemed to be some disagreement with the drunk table at our party about whether they had ordered 3 or 4 small bottles of sake (375 ML). While I was not paying attention to their count, either they are real lightweights with sake or the restaurant overcharged a bottle. At the end of the day, they ended up only paying for 3. Aside from that moment, I was impressed by how good a job Yama did of servicing our large crowd. So is Yama Sushi 5-star quality? Come on now. However, for the price, it is as good a value that you will find in a town (Las Vegas aka Lost Wages) hell-bent on stealing all your wages. * BTW AYCE sushi places get you full with the rice in the rolls. ** The only sashimi-type dish for AYCE they have is the sashimi salad.

yihMeQ1GqSHKGNGsQVHCxw.text: Warning: Do not come to this restaurant if you eat sushi often!  I don't consider myself an expert on sushi, but I've eaten at a lot of good sushi places around the Socal area. My favorite places are Sushi Ota in San Diego and Ootoro in Walnut. I also like places like Akasaka in Rowland Heights and I even enjoy the cheaper sushi joints like any of the revolving Kula bars and also Sushi Q in Chino Hills. With that being said, this is absolutely the worst sushi restaurant I've ever had the misfortune of trying.  We tried pretty much everything. The salmon, the tuna, the yellowtail, the sweet shrimp, the uni, the cooked fish, the hand rolls, the specialty rolls, you name it. There was not one piece of fish that was appetizing. When eating sashimi, you want it to be fresh and you want the pieces that melt in your mouth. Well, the sashimi here was the opposite. It was so dry, I felt like I was swallowing paper at times. I'm not even joking here, even prepackaged sushi at Japanese marts are significantly better than the stuff served at this sorry excuse for a sushi joint.  Honestly, the best thing I had here was the miso soup. I shit you not, even the edamame was disappointing. The edamame..  To say the least, this meal was the worst meal I've had in a very long time. If you're not from around Vegas, don't waste a precious meal coming here. Your stomach will thank me.

IxvP3aJF-8EnuLdAVyQecw.text: A sushi roll lover's paradise.  This is my favorite ayce for sushi rolls (I prefer Goyemon for nigiri). You almost can't go wrong ordering any of their Special Rolls..Happy Ending, Wet Dream, Snow in Vegas and One Night at Yama rolls are all very good. My two favorite rolls are SUN OF THE BEACH and DANCING IN THE SHEET. And they serve the best mochi ice cream in town. Yama served me the best meal I've eaten in Vegas, going on 6 years now they have not been beat. And the lively crowd makes this place a lot of fun too. It gets packed here, so go on a weekday or get in line. Service is very fast and friendly as well.  Keep up the great work!

70tBIV9nZZXklTGqBLJkxg.text: I am sorry...  /Commences Rant  I will never return here. I was sorely disappointed and feel like I was treated as a subpar customer. Yeah not everyone eats sushi. I am that guy. Consequently I did join a large group of friends here. I knew that things wouldn't exactly be outstanding, but this place took it to a whole new level. The only reason they get a two star vs a one star is that most of my friends received excellent service and food.   Whereas I got worse treatment than the red headed step child... Hell that is demeaning I don't even have red hair  *SMH*. In fact my trip here was one of my worst restaurant experiences in the last 10-15 years. *extremely disappointed*  So while all my friends purchased the AYCE meal and started to receive their various foods within 5 minutes of ordering, my appetizers (sesame chicken and shrimp tempura) took about 45 minutes to receive the first item, the shrimp tempura. It took another 10 plus minutes to receive the sesame chicken.  REALLY YAMA SUSHI!!! You brought out appetizers to my friends on the AYCE menu within 20 minutes. Why cant you bring the non AYCE appetizers to the guy who has nothing else to eat?  But your attitude seemed to be who cares he isn't getting AYCE.  Knowing that they are concentrating on the AYCE folks and the rolls that most of the people are getting, I knew I would have my food delayed. What ended up happening? Everyone was on their third or fourth roll at least before my food was served.   Consequently I think you guys can go jump off a cliff. Way to treat a customer who wanted to partake in what he had heard was an awesome restaurant experience. I can count the number of times on a single hand where I have had a worse dining experience in my entire life!  Way to ruin what was otherwise a wonderful day for me with a large number of friends. I SERIOUSLY HOPE YOU DECIDE TO REVAMP YOUR POLICY TOWARDS NON AYCE PAYING CUSTOMERS OR THOSE WHO WANT SOMETHING A LITTLE BIT DIFFERENT, AND YET STILL ORDER DIRECTLY OFF OF YOUR MENU WITHOUT A SINGLE CHANGE REQUEST!  WHY THE HELL EVEN HAVE THOSE CHOICES LISTED WITH PRICING THAT IS NOT AYCE IF YOU JUST WANT TO IGNORE THE GUY WHO ORDERS DINNER THAT WAY.  I HOPE BEYOND A SHADOW OF A BELIEF THAT CUSTOMERS TURN AWAY FROM YOUR RESTAURANT IF THEY ARE LIKE ME. SOMEONE WHO WANTS TO BE TREATED FAIRLY AND NOT MADE TO WAIT AN OVERLY EXTENSIVE PERIOD OF TIME TO GET WHAT YOU ARE ALREADY SERVING TO THOSE ALL AROUND HIM.  I WILL NEVER BE BACK HERE AND I HOPE THAT OTHERS WILL NOT AS WELL.  To add insult to injury your staff came after me for leaving less than the pre-ordained tip as listed on the check since I was part of a party of 6 or more. You should have been happy I left a tip at all. But to have you come after me demanding more for absolutely no service and unreasonable treatment, well F YOU. I am still pissed off about it and it has been several weeks.    I hope your business goes bust!  /Ends Rant  I am Schel and I approve this review!  Edit: Screw it I cant stand to give them 2 stars... I have to drop it to a 1 star... still super ticked off...

iWbU1qzTQayN4YmqyL-0QQ.text: Can't believe I never heard of this place before a girl took me out on our first date. Its actually really good. I've been to a bunch of sushi restaurants in town but this is in the Top 5! And if you know how many sushi joints are in town than you know that this is a hard thing to achieve!

qyP_g8IDbtZNLSrHEFPTrg.text: I've been on this sushi craving for a while now and after all the talk threads asking for "favorite sushi place" I decided to try this place out.   We walked in and it was busy, which I thought was a good sign because then it must be good right? Nope I couldn't be more wrong. We were seated promptly and our order was taken quickly and that's pretty much all that was good.   Can I please have a pot of rice with my thin pieces of nigiri? That's exactly what it was. A big ball of rice under a thin piece of fish. The fish was good, but the rice was too much. As for the sushi rolls themselves, pretty much all rice as well. The menu didn't give a good description of the rolls, so 2 of the rolls we ended up ordering were fried, which we wanted to stay away from. The variety of things that came in the sushi rolls were pretty meh, just crab, shrimp or salmon. Nothing that jumped out or made me say "omg I have to get that!" Lastly, I freaking love soft shel crab. I ordered it and was completely disappointed that all I could taste was the tempura batter.   There are sooo many other sushi places in Vegas and unfortunately to say that this place is not one of ones I will be back to.

DVoNBis_BcM1VR2cNh8jiQ.text: Fantastic!  GREAT service, Good food! continued to provide "unexpected extras".  We were visiting with family. Everything about the restaurant was GREAT!  It is not in the most glamorous part of town, but not supersizing since had to get this kind of friendly, attentive service in those glamorous parts with out a 2nd mortgage!   Highly recommended, worth returning to Vegas for a meal here.

_ZSRT38ubwpvcqLmOy5UfA.text: My hubby and I love this place.  It is pretty much a go to spot when we go to Vegas for a trip.  Gregg M did a little research and found this place several years ago.  Back then it was pretty small (not that it is large now, but in the past year (or year and a half), it looks like they expanded to the space next door so that they have more dining area (and they also have a sushi bar on the other side too).  My favorite dish here - well it is hard to choose just one, so I won't.  I will say that every time I go here, I must get the Seafood Salad.  It is absolutely wonderful!  the sushi tastes great, and that sauce; nice and spicy just they way I like it.  Second on the must get list is ,the hamachi kama; the last time we were there, they had run out of it (gasp!), so we got the Salmon kama instead.  Now I'm not sure which I like more (thankfully since it is all I can eat, I don't have to choose).    Roll wise - they have an abundance of rolls, all with, I will say "interesting" names.  One of my favorites is the Fire Cracker roll - whats not to love about jalapeno's and tuna?  For the most part we go heavy on the sushi, not so heavy on the rolls since they fill us up faster, but there are some rolls that are definitely worth tasting.    A great place at what I think is a reasonable price.  I'm ready to go back again!

DrXI3-MwbiohBr8RPqe1Mg.text: Excellent service at sushi bar. Appetizers come out quick, and beers. Friendly staff,  and clean bathrooms. This place is always packed.

H5JNuNC87EWs2ecnr2NYsQ.text: 3.5 star.  After hearing from some people that liked Yama better than Goyemon, I just had to taste it for myself.  When we arrived on a Thursday evening, the restaurant was packed.  We initially sat at the bar since we didn't have time to wait for a table.  But as soon as a table opened up, she asked if we still want a table and we quickly said yes.  Pros:  The Super white tuna, big clam, salmon, and hamachi kama were awesome.  AYCE is a bit cheaper than Goyemon  Cons: Scallop wasn't fresh, mackerel wasn't as good, and 2 order limit on the mochi icecream.  Verdict:  Yama is decent, but Goyemon is still the reigning champ in my book.

h5ol0SnbXSKb2WGeRgKZ1g.text: This is literally my favorite sushi place in all of las vegas. All the fish is super fresh and all the rolls are super delicious. The staff are super friendly and attentive. You never have to ask them to refill your drinks or pick up your dishes. THEY ARE ON TOP OF THEIR GAME!!! Snow in Vegas and No Name are some of my most favorite rolls on the menu, So worth the waiting time.

I3XRPFBLRETpmBq6IlbCoQ.text: Came here with a VERY large group, which the staff quickly accommodated.... and didn't mind when we continue to pull tables over for friends who kept trickling in. At AYCE sushi at less than $25, it's a freaking steal. And AYCE means ALLLLL YCE....... the entire menu, no time limit, no charges for leftover food (but they won't bring new food unless you finish it).  My advice: - Order half rolls so you can try more - Share everything! - Seafood salad.... all sashimi with no rice. Best bang for your buck! - Wear loose-fitting clothes, because you are about to get down on some serious fatassery - Don't come here if you plan to wear a ho dress to a club immediately afterward.  I wish I could remember all I tried, but we tried just about everything, including ice cream. They also serve sake and beer, which my side of the table indulged in (and quickly because those loud, boisterous people, which no one seemed to mind).   I wish I could give them more stars..... but the service wasn't the friendliest. A friend of mine who doesn't eat seafood was completely ignored, and his dish wasn't brought out until we were almost done. We also noticed that we were charged for 4 bottles of sake, when we only ordered 3. We told our waitress, and a few minutes later, 4 waitresses filed out together, stood in a line to confront us, and angrily insisted that we ordered 4. It was pretty unecessary and in poor taste. We eventually resolved it and paid for the 3. That left a bad taste in my mouth, but the sushi and the copious amounts of booze left an amazing taste. 3 stars.

mSkIOU_xe804PMl-Gb2qgg.text: All you can eat!!? What more can I say!! But here's the catch.... order enough where you can eat because they WILL CHARGE LEFTOVERS! but very good  sushi!

Receptionist won't even apologized and keep walking by us. I know that they good sushi, but they really need to work on  their costumer service ,i'd rather go some place else. Expect waiting even if u make a reservation.

8V08cxyP2bNX4MJuF_RoVw.text: Wasn't as good as I remember but still not bad. We usually hit an ayce while in Vegas and this is one we frequently dine at. But I wasn't impressed this time. Not as good as usual and I think I'll stick to sushi way. Just seems to have better quality. But come on we are talking ayce. Is there really ever any quality

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ojo4aKz-bvGSw0mQkuYQOw.text: I don't know what the fuzz is about this place. Food wasn't that great. Sushi was pre sliced and sushi is supposed to be slice from a chunk of meat when ordered, ya know made to order. On top of that they still took ages to give us our food.  Being an avid sushi eater, I think the fish wasn't even fresh, I guess the plus was not getting diarrhea after it's all said and done. They over load the rice on their thin pre sliced fish to get you full fast. This place gets way too crowded for crummy food and negligent service. I'd advise to check out another place.

UhBrkDlfm4IOdF42G9JPKA.text: A secret hidden gem of AYCE sushi in Vegas. Who would've thought there would be one in this part of town?  Salmon Collars is the best. Grilled to perfection and not fishy smelling at all. The white tuna, garlic tuna is to die for. Seriously, such a great deal for so many variety of fishes and side dishes!   If you are out here in Vegas, come check out this steal!

sNoVRKHu2HldFVsp6q3gIQ.text: The last time I have been here was basically in months/years.   Ambiance: 2 - Yama is just way too small these days on the inside; especially the waiting area. I came early yesterday to eat, but when I left, there were about 50 people were waiting outside. It's crazy how long people will wait just to save a few dollars! There is just NO space to move inside there.   Service: 3 - The service has gone down since when I first ate there. Our server was really nice, but we had to repeatedly re-ask for our orders and everything took a super long time to come out. And they tried to rush us out of there. Not very nice. I understand you have a lot of people waiting, but don't be rude!   Food: 2 - I'm really into nigiri, and theirs is just okay--I'm not sure what it is, might just be the quality of the fish, sometimes it won't taste super fresh like it used to. Though, my favorite nigiri is garlic tuna. I also suggest the Seafood Salad w/ spicy sauce and Hamachi Kama.   Overall, there's just not enough quality dishes anymore to revisit. This place has really gone down, and it's sad. But there's just a lot of competition and places that are way better.

0Qpbksbvugdiq2UIJp1VVw.text: Read through many of the reviews and this is a summary:  Asians who know authentic sushi gave this place one or two stars, based mostly off of the quality of the fish. Also, Asians want the most bang for their buck. In LA or Orange County, one can find a fresh sushi place for $25/person (Sushi Asahi in Riverside & Sake 2 Me in Tustin, I'm looking at you).   People who do NOT know what real sushi is, namely, white people, gave this place four to five stars. They don't eat sushi for the quality of the fish and probably think they are getting a great deal. Which they probably are seeing that they are in Vegas where people expect to dish out $40-$80 for a buffet.   I, being an Asian person who somewhat knows a little bit about sushi (or at least pretends to know), gave this place one star for the not-very-fresh sushi BUT also gave them an extra star because the rolls were pretty delicious. I ordered the Ellen roll which is imitation crab with shrimp tempura and rice wrapped with soy paper and topped with raw salmon and some spicy sauce. And it looked way to saucy but the flavor... It was really something else. Though I wouldn't recommend it for people who can't take the heat.   Anyway, definitely try this place and you're not picky about what kind of fish you are eating. And if you liked to eat the cooked kind of fish! (ew)

A7jV2qTbjY3A4-58rAgJIQ.text: Earlier today my husband and I were counting the number of trips we've taken to Vegas in our five years together. Since the very first time we came, he's been telling me that this was the best sushi restaurant ever. I've been skeptical because sushi is not exactly my fave. However! This place is so. freaking. good. Worth the wait! We did the All You Can Eat and you better believe I stuffed my face. For only $24?? It's a steal! Tried at least 5 rolls including the happy rainbow, baby one more time, oh dam!! harry, kiss the ass, and the no name. All delicious. My favorites were the Hawaii and the Oh Dam!! Harry, but DANG they are SPICY! Took a helping of mochi to cool my mouth down! Also not to be missed - the seafood salad and miso soup. Both top notch. The only complaint I have is that my stomach isn't bigger and I had to stop eating before I exploded. Omg. I am so happy right now.

lO3s5Mq7ECw5733bucgOag.text: Great sushi place!   To be honest its not worth going to unless you get all you can eat because it ends up being cheaper in the long run. Try the seafood salad, and you cannot go wrong with any of their specialty rolls.  I absolutely love this place, even though its pretty small.  Worth absolutely trying nonetheless.  Bringing someone who never tried sushi? Take them here and make them try any of the specialty rolls.  Personally I like the wet dream, man whore (yes thats the actual name), no name roll, double dragon, one minute man. (these would be great for novice sushi eaters to try! believe me I was one of them!!)  However, there is this one waitress I dislike, she needs to smile more and needs to be more alive. She doesn't constitute my definition of "welcoming" and she was a bit rude one of the other times I went here.  Overall, great place so try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KBZK1hDhnYjXuxdy6rg3OQ.text: I love, love, love Yama Sushi! I've tried other sushi places, some bad, some ok, but this is the only AYCE place that I'm always excited to go to.    My favorites are the No-Name, the Sun of the Beach and the Harry Potter. They're so delicious,  I could eat them every single day. Another must is the Spicy Seafood Salad. And you must finish your meal off with the Plum ice cream or some sweet Mochi.   The only reason I don't give it 5 stars, and as others mentioned, is that it's always so crowded so it makes the service kind of slow.  But hey, that means it's just THAT popular.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Tuna, No-Name, Sun of the Beach, Harry Potter... oh my

svI0PTMBGxU3Txff31-O7g.text: Found this place on yelp while visiting Vegas this weekend and I have to say it was pretty good. Very friendly staff, great food and pricing. Would go back again while visiting Vegas next time.

gmhT5JA2WXFcSyGGkCLauw.text: Sushi is amazing !! Such great flavor! Great customer service !!! They will never leave you unhappy! you're so spoiled and taken care of there!!!

hFaL-jNtsGl6jq4v3sbMLw.text: Excellent sushi place. They do big volume and precut the fish for the most part but because of the volume stuff is pristine. I did ala carte, but their ayce special is probably the bomb.

HAsu8Rjr9q4eP9bzMg26HQ.text: This was a great sushi experience for my family, the servers were extremely attentive and the food was excellent. One person in our party was not a sushi fan and they enjoyed the tempura shrimp and the chicken . I would definitely come back the food is worth it

0cY27kXoSIVNSJbsWs26vA.text: Super excellent service! Omg!!!  Must be back very soon!!! Thank you so very much for the good experience. Puji, U r the best!!!!!!! Thank you, Puji!!!!!!

hiMjWACZxleDjmVDEaM-Hg.text: Decent food for a very crowded and small place service was not there for me people just literally drop the food in front of me, I think they need to improve their menu half of the menu is spicy tuna base rolls and the other half its spicy crab nothing more exciting than that... I started with a yellow tail nigiri and it was good so I thought it was going to be awesome but it was too soon to tell and boy!! was I wrong, its actually sad cuz the servers are trying you can see it, but they had no support from their manager who seem more interested on looking good in the floor than actually looking over his guess witch I think it's Sad  ANYWAY....... I think this is my first,  1 start review but to be honest the yellow tail was really good  And hopefully this can help them improve their restaurant.

TXwEAXfrcQiaWKcaoAGaUQ.text: We have eaten here dozens of times over the years and normally my reviews are stellar. Today.... not so much. The office ordered for take out and the entire order was a let down. Nothing seemed fresh today. The yama crunch roll seemed like the shrimp was old, the spicy tuna roll was super mushy and flavorless, even the chicken teriyaki bowl was bland. This review is based on the opinion of 3 different people. Dare I say we would have been better off at McDonalds! Yuck!

pioKszXqp-_ebVu3wZOmUw.text: This is a very good all you can eat sushi choice. Many of my friends claim it to be their favorite and the best AYCE in Las Vegas. While I don't thinks it's the best, you definitely get a good bang for your buck.   The nice thing is they accommodate large groups very well. Call ahead and they will likely set up the side room for you. I also have to commend them for their ability to serve large groups so quickly. It's always awkward when you get your roll but half of the table hasn't gotten anything to eat. This is rarely the case here.   The menu options go on forever. Almost anything or any combination you can think of is an option. The sushi is pretty good (my favorite is the smoked salmon) and many of the rolls and other dishes are descent, but nothing really catches my attention. I feel like many of the dishes are too bland and quickly thrown together.   A good place for AYCE sushi, but not the best.

pHlqYZicVTq6hDMmk48IyA.text: I have been here before and liked it so I decided to take my fiance here so he could try it. We had the all you can eat a decent price and got a good amount of food. Everything was delicious he really liked the chicken teriyaki unfortunately at the end we both went to the bathroom at the same time (I have to go all the time I'm pregnant.) and I didn't realize he still had some chicken teriyaki and his mochi on the table. When we got back they had already Bussed our table and threw out his stuff whoops. It's ok I guess we made it seem like we were leaving. Anyways yummy food. Another thing as a server could've checked up on us just a little bit more.

_grBQWvgiVEkl2H6rY0jQA.text: Hands down the best sushi in town in terms of volume and quality.  You must try their bbq beef short rib and seafood salad spicy! It gets super busy and very tight - be patient and enjoy. Great service sleuth a smile and some of the freshest sushi and nigiri.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna &#34;sexy style&#34; delicious! Thanks for brining it out Mia!

dmyD7xKXtXQ5F0xvfzgsjg.text: Really good sushi for the price and very filling best to try new rolls not bad in prices and types of rolls.

cZ7j5-jVcMJSjqhsx4BT3w.text: Beware, i love cream cheese:)  Wet Dream and Turning Japanese definitely hit the spot! 10 Yama Crunch and Superman were right there behind it. 9 Harry Potter had a white vinegar kick to it which was interesting. 8 Double Dragon id say only turned out good because of the eel. 7 I was not a fan of the Tiger Roll only because of the texture of the spicy tuna it was topped off with. 4 Their Fire Crackers had a spicy level of 3 out of 10. 5 Aside from that we had Shrimp Tempura, Baked Muscles and tried all 4 mochi desserts. Never been that full in awhile, thats for sure.  Im pretty sure these guys are making more than enough money being the #1 sushi spot on yelp. But its kind of ridiculous to be sitting so close to others to the point where you can engage in their conversation. I felt claustrophobic:(  Thats the only reason why i refused to give this spot 5 stars.  Knock down a wall and expand!
