wnk_26ZUtigaGimiGPFiTg.text: Crowded but there a reason,  fresh sushi and good. We had a large group of people and had a great time. It will be a regular eating spot when iam in Vegas. Would have given fuve stars if the waitress spoke better English.  Few mix ups with orders but it was crowded and they were genuinely trying their best.

wQk0iGnGYLz-dXtR0jkXFw.text: Service is slow. There is a 2 hour limit but it took them 10 minutes to get our drinks 10-15 to get our order every time. They see us but they are just slow to react.  Other ppl were served ahead of us even though we got there before them. Must have been a busy night. The buffet price is worth it rather than ordering individually.  You have to finish all your food or they charge you extra.  The downside is what to do when the fish taste like crap. Can I renegotiate the price? Another thing I don't understand is why some of the sushi were already presoaked in soy sauce. May be it's the chef's style. I'm from out of town and I've had better quality of fish.  I tried all the fish from their menu and I wasn't impressed with any of them even the Uni was a let down. My only recommendation would be the dumplings and the edema me.

Ho9U_2LPLDRQ82nlbL3ouw.text: By far the best sushi you'll find in Vegas and at a good price. The staff is wonderful and everything is fresh!

tnrOEVgAM9de1pdgXn4HDA.text: Service = fast, fast, fast!  I love how fast everything comes out here. The speciality rolls are pretty awesome- great selection and combinations.... I love the Harry Potter! This is a great place to go for all you can eat sushi!

srFASP5M4DhaDSPULx_s5A.text: I've been here 2 times! Awesome both times, just make sure u dont expect amazing raw fish quality...it was realllly good and some fish taste better than others, but overall I really enjoyed this place... so much I went a year later remembering how good it was.

gfTvDjahSudQw_HzchOGOg.text: LOL....They weren't kidding when they say you must eat all your food. The couple next to me ordered this spicy roll and it was too spicy.  They had 3 pieces left when the waitress stopped by to check on them.  They asked her if they have to eat the last 3 pieces and the waitress immediately said yes. The look on their faces was comical. I admit I can eat spicy food but their spicy rolls are really spicy. Overall the food is good and fresh. The service is fast and efficient.

yEadokwKyskzA75RO4QfpQ.text: For AYCE sushi, this place is tops!  Been here twice.  Both time OUTSTANDING!  We sat at the bar and the service was super fast.  Often I've seen AYCE where they make you wait and try to load you up on soups & appetizers.  While you can certainly get those, their many sushi chefs whip out some amazing creations super fast.  You can get basic Nigiri, which was fine.  Actually, the salmon was quite good.  And, they have an amazing selection of rolls too.  But, my favorite was the "seafood salad" which is huge plate of various Sashimi (no rice) with a ponzu-like sauce.  OMG!  Wished we lived closer!

8uYPrbLR3BLC0UiDWqw3Yw.text: Wow! Heard from everyone this place was amazing, didn't believe them but I wish I did sooner. Just amazing sushi and the names for the rolls are probably the funniest and most original you will ever read. They have quite a few tvs so you can watch the game and eat while on a date. The pricing is about the average every where else like vegas but the quality of the food blows most places out of the water. Definite top 3 sushi place I have been to.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M8pT52KFyNU6GBZiDIlaag.text: I don't live in Vegas! so i've been craving for this place in forever. The best thing about Yama sushi is everything on the menu is included in the buffet..except drinks. Yes that means, appetizers! unlimited miso soup!!!! all the sushi, desserts, everything!  20$ lunch, 24$ dinner. NOT BAD AT ALL.   Considering all the sushi are fresh, aka made to order, it's awesome. Service was so-so. Place is a bit cramped. But as long as the food is good, I am with it!

GxpoOnBWkAC1uSHdKkeq1A.text: This place... *sigh* I usually go to goyemon and I wanted a change so I came to Yama. I saw all the good reviews here so I was like why not. The wait time wasn't bad like 10minutes? We got seated and the server got our orders. The shrimp tempura was good and the baked mussels. Seafood salad was good. Everything was all good until  those three came out. Just FYI I usually order sushi not rolls because rolls just fills you up and I order alottt at once because I don't like food pauses. I don't like it when there is a pause for my sushi to come out because you can slowly feel full. This is where everything went wrong. The fish was not fresh and the amount of rice they put with the raw fish is freakin ridiculous. You can't even taste the fish because there's so much rice. After 4 or 5 sushi, there was a 10minute pause. And also the server got mixed up with our order so she gave it to the table next next to us...FAIL. we ordered half a roll which was the no name and that was actually good.   So in my opinion, I think this place is popular for their rolls not the fish. If you like rolls then it'll prolly be a hit for you, but it was def. a miss for a fish lover like me.  Oh and also, we ordered dessert and the dessert came out twice became the servers got mixed up again.. The ending didn't even end up nicely... I am def sticking with my goyemon and sushimon nxt time

QdDirtqKdYKESgCuD0zERw.text: i like creative cut rolls and that is the one thing i did not like here.  they have over 20 specialty rolls, but after reading the descriptions it seemed like 3-4 rolls with one thing changed to make it a new roll.   our service was great and everything was fresh.  the nigiri is the best i've had from an ayce sushi restaurant.  nice big fish piece of fish and just enough rice.

oyZh3qQWPxa8UtC7_BAIlw.text: I love this place! I have been coming here for 4 years and it has consistently been a great experience. Food is good quality, people give great service and remember us and our orders. Well worth the $25 all you can eat. Elixir is always amazing with the seafood salads. With out fail I order a wet dream and i am always satisfied. Even my brother who hates sushi is now a regular!

TRUSjo2o1c4EUNIZ2dvY4Q.text: Delicious all-you-can-eat with lots of choices for $24.  Friendly service, too.

4WmeKlAuLgZe1wXzE8JGRQ.text: Terrrrrrrible!! Terrible service!!! Waited 20 minutes after being seated.. Waitress walking passed up n not one stopped to ask to see if we were ready to order!! Had to get up n go get a server to come take our order!! First time here and I will never come back!!!

hP5MUtVjl7UT1-Oey53w6g.text: i LOVE Yama Sushi. Good prices, AYCE, and food is great.  We personally like the NoName Roll, Spicy Sexy Roll and the Sea Food Salad.  Great. Im craving sushi now....

LChkhOg-q-F94D8sH4U1-w.text: We dined on march 9th. We are from out of town and this was our first time in this resterant. The lack of communication between the servers and us was ridiculous. Water wasnt refilled until we had to ask, how the "all you can eat" idea in this place isn't explained thoroughly, and trying to get our bill was ridiculous. We had four different waiters try to break down our bill and it took almost 20 min. To get out of the door after eating. All in all st the end of the night the food we ate didnt taste so good anymore because of the poor service. I do not recommend this place unless you have an extra 2 hours dealing with servers who dont know what they are doing.

G7ns4uaoltGroeXgLrYu5g.text: The sushi was great and so was the staff. Very friendly and often stopped to ask if we needed anything.

-lZ4QRTn-lqcMKNZJpGixA.text: So if you're in Vegas and you're looking for an AYCE sushi place, this is it! I can't vouch or compare it to other places, but it definitely is one of the best buffets in the area if you're down for sushi. It's a little ways off the strip on Flamingo, in a little shopping center near the Chase bank, so also conveniently located so you can refill with pocket change to test your luck some more.  This place is very casual. Just stroll in with PJ and you'll be fine, but the food definitely says otherwise. If you're looking for service that's more attentive, I would try coming during the weekdays, as opposed to the weekend. The 2 hour limit goes by pretty quick, and a lot of time can be wasted while waiting if you don't order a whole lot at one time. But just be sure to not go overboard on your second or third round of ordering because they do charge for wasted or leftover food (which is how it should be).  Sit at the bar if it's just yourself or the 2 of you, but get a table if there are more in your party and everyone is doing AYCE. There are items on the menu that have hearts on them, and those are the ones that you can only place one order per person. Those items are picked that way, because IMO they are truly the better and pricier items on the menu (amebi, uni, sashimi salads, soft shell crabs, etc). The dishes are all made to order and everything we order was fresh and sooo tasty! The grilled tuna collars and salmon collars are my favorite because they cook it so well. They have just the right amount of char to them, and the meat around the collar bones were cooked and super moist! The amebi was fresh and tasty, however if I were to go there again, I would request they cook the head a tad bit longer so it's extra crispy! The uni is hit or miss. Last time we went, our friends got the uni and it wasn't great, but by the time we ordered ours, it was magnificent. If you get the seafood salad, I would skip the creamy dressing because it was just too heavy on the mayo. Otherwise, nigiri was on point. Can't really comment too much on the other appetizers, but in all, everyone had a great time and everyone really enjoyed the food. It's probably one of the few places in Vegas where you feel like a winner after leaving!  Oh, if you're driving here during dinner rush, parking is pretty limited. I remember one of the two times we've been here, it was like a line of cars waiting for people to leave (it reminded me undergrad in the parking lots at the beginning of each semester). If you're staying near the strip, I would just take a cab or uber it. It's like 7-10 minutes east of Bally hotel.

8iYGLQldpXCCAlBa2IlXEg.text: As someone who doesn't like "real" sushi, as in I like my food cooked. This place was the pits. Very small selection of non-raw rolls. It seemed like all they offered was california roll with this and california rioll with that.  I was very disappointed in the selection and it is really cramped in there. It was ok, but I have definately had much better

6qHvTiBMOr5GvfNVuFtSVg.text: I literally used to hate sushi, and I thought I always would, until one day my cousin decided to force me to try this and let me tell you I am a sushi lover now. Favorite roll has got to be "No Name" amazing flavor and totally worth the cost. Totally recommend this place to any sushi haters lol. Everyone there is also very nice!

5MRzgRyP9ewnKwFIrNsiRA.text: Yum!  Went here for my birthday and the place was PACKED.  Good sign.  We were seated right away because we agreed to eat at the bar, and our server quickly brought drinks and an appetizer (fried mussels...delicious).  The chef who was making our food was attentive, though he did seem to forget my husband most of the time!  Ha!  He would ask me what I wanted next, and I would tell him.  My husband would be on the cusp of telling him his order and the dude would turn around and make mine.  Poor husband.  But other than that, the food came quickly and it was all really, really good.  The seafood salad (spicy, of course) was my favorite thing.  Prices were totally reasonable--similar to other AYCE joints, maybe even a couple dollars cheaper.   I think it was $23.95 for dinner.  Service was somewhat slow, but only because they were packed to the gills with customers.  Overall, it was a great experience and we will definitely be returning!

_d3mZhnzbPEztCgmvN2hLA.text: The best AYCE sushi place I've been to. I think they can charge way more for what they serve here. One of the only few AYCE sushi restaurants that serve uni and raw shrimp sushi.

o9hCadbSZSjHVCbhy6f23w.text: Great place for all-you-can-eat sushi! Got the private booth with a couple friends and my girlfriend, totally worth it. Service is nice, food delivery could be faster, but when it come to fresh I guess that's why there's that small wait. But over all, Yama gets a 8 3/4 out of 10 from me.

icqDb3hhhOhLUIAhFW39wA.text: Yama Sushi is a decent establishment the sushi is excellent the service is fast and efficient and above all polite the prices are a little on the higher side but still well worth what you get. Overall it was a very enjoyable experience restaurant was clean and tidy and staff look to be clean and tidy as well. I would happily recommend there all you can eat sushi deal unless you only plan on getting one roll or so. The one flaw that I have for this restaurant would be the Yakitori well good Yakitori is usually a very nice compliment to good sushi the Yakitori at Yama is regrettably subpar. I would advise just going straight for the sushi and ignore the appetizer section all together. That being said despite that as I've already stated the sushi is excellent fresh well-prepared band delicious the portions are adequately sized for the price and I do indeed plan to make trips back here when I am able

1gv5ePPVHvUl2hqrhvzf2Q.text: Before a business meeting at a local bar, my best friend and I decided to have a lunch date at a new sushi joint to help nurse our hangovers.  I did a little research on my Yelp app and came across this place.  People seemed to really like the place, so I was curious to check it out as well.    I've been to this strip mall many times.  For Albertson's, for the nail salon (eyebrow wax), for Chase bank.  It's a cool area, full of businesses.  It's located on Flamingo and Maryland Pkwy.  Some close businesses that I frequent:  Buffalo Exchange, The Garage, Seafood City, Target, etc.  It's a great neighborhood.  I enter the location and I'm super surprised to find a large venue.  A very small hostess area, but the place has a couple of rooms attached to the big dining area.  We were taken to the room on the right side of the restaurant.  Super cute!  The focal point is the sushi bar.  There's a background montage of flowers, all lit up.  The recess lighting that shines on the bar and cloth picture panels makes for a very enlightening focus.  I really liked it!  The small two top tables were separated with a little Japanese folding curtain to create a more intimate setting for me and my lunch date.   As in all sushi joints, I always get the AYCE (All You Can Eat) special.  Since we can after 3pm, we had to pay the dinner price of $23.95.  I also have some very strong feelings and practices when it comes to AYCE.  I always stick to the side dishes, appetizers and nigiri so I can get more for my buck.  Here's what I got, grouped based on my preferences:  Things I liked:  Yellowtail nigiri (fresh and less of a fish flavor), Miso soup (perfect for monsoon weather), seaweed salad (lovely taste of the ocean), hamachi kama (collar of the fish, grilled, full of marbleized meat and served with a soy dipping sauce), deep fried mussels (tempura battered and soo good!) and as an exception, the Yama Roll (Tempura shrimp roll with eel, shrimp, avocado layered on top.  Sooo flavorful)  Thinks I didn't like:  Gyoza (it was nicely fried, however the filling was not as good as I've tried.  More filling than meat, it seemed), Chicken Teriyaki skewers (tomatoes, onions and white meat chicken.  Not as good as other sushi joints.  The chicken was a bit dry) and the BBQ Ribs (marbleized and flavorful but I prefer more of a grilled rib.  There were not grill marks and it just seemed a bit rubbery)  The great thing is that it all still great.  I would definitely be back for more servings of the Hamachi Kama.  I don't often find myself in this area, but when I do, I at least know there's a great sushi joint!

XvQjmfLqvTO581_ne0C_8A.text: Great service and fresh delicious sushi ! Sat by the bar and talked to some of the sushi chefs. I will be back once I get my craving again.

KruSTMmP8EnIn3qjYPXZ4A.text: I was in Vegas last week with my favorite sushi buddy, so I turned to my handy-dandy Yelp App to find the best sushi in town. That's how I came across Yama Sushi which has made to order AYCE sushi!!....   So we hop in a cab and head over. It is off the strip, but I think that's what made it so great. Yama Sushi is an obvious favorite of the locals and was very reasonably priced. For $23 each, we both got two rolls each, three different appetizers, sashimi,  and ice cream. We were definitely stuffed.   Next time I need a sushi fix in Vegas, I will definitely return to Yama Sushi!! You can't find anything like this on the strip....

oWyFiX5N2FQwS2TFuKCL7w.text: The food was good, but the fact that I had to wait 30 min to get a seat, 30 min for sushi, and 30 minutes for wasabi totally ruined the experience. This was one of the worst and slowest customer services I've had.

P2mClS6oy-DMrtAsstoYDQ.text: Such bad customer service . I asked for a miso soup about 5 times and never received it although I was sitting at the bar , I couldn't even get a fill on my drink . I never don't leave a tip but today they pushed it . A nice man behind the counter showed his concern for the servers bad customer service and got my sister the Mochi she wanted so the only thing I appreciated about this lunch was that .

KB-1lC62enxC0ruc9C6x5A.text: Last night my family and I came to have AYCE. Everything was awesome. I couldn't tell you what rolls we had cause I tried some many different ones but it was great. The spicy tuna was spicy, the albacore sashimi was bomb, the service was good and the price was right. We will be back.

M7p2rHh-0t4I6ucAQv8qyg.text: Overall, great place to go off strip for sushi as long as you arent expecting Michelin star quality food.    Fish is fresh, and often times cut right in front of you if you sit at the sushi bar!    Always a stop for me when in vegas :)

qoNDD_gsqroxsxciBItUJQ.text: Awesome experience coming here.   Our waiter was very attentive,  and quite informative.  He recommended us get the Wet Dream and by far it was our favorite roll of the night.  We were pleasantly surprised when we found everything (including appetizers and desserts) were included in the all you can eat.  There are so many choices. So my husband and i decided to start a list (kept on the phone) off all the rolls we got and our personal ratings on them.  We will be going here again, most definitely.

i7BvEvstgx3X0bya6TqGyw.text: If you have a large party, do not come here. You will have to wait at least an hour to be seated because they won't hold smaller tables to combine.  Any  tables that are open will be used to seat the small parties that come in, so there will never be enough space for you, regardless of how long you wait. The sushi is good, but the service is awful, and they won't even be nice to you about the seating situation.

qvqU8Kvx5nfpLIBgc_h1pg.text: Went 3 times in a month.. The Service is very good and the food was so GOOD! Wet Dream & Ellen are my 2 favorite ones...    will come back foosho!!

PsTn9CodoWWG3FggJP5Xzg.text: This is the only Sushi joint that is able to give my mouth multiple orgasm explosions! LOL  Waiting time could be up to 45 minutes long but they are totally worth it, I always choose to get the AYCE and go with the half plates so that I am able to sample multiple sushi rolls at a time. But my all time favorite has to be the man whore.  Their hot Sake goes great with the meal along with some hot green tea. Every time I leave they keep me wanting more! I've never had a problem with any of the staff members, they're always very friendly and joke around with you. Service and food here never disappoint me.

N5NuFHMsIjR7-bGFErSy6A.text: In a strip mall so look for it! I love this place. Great all you can eat specials! Amazing sushi! My favorite is the Wet Dream. Staff is friendly, too.

8SgAG9WFmMzMNTNDx6N8Nw.text: Very cool AYCE Sushi place only a few blocks away from the strip. Friendly service, lots of delicious rolls, appetizers and sushi pieces for an amazing low price. Always end up going here with family when I'm in town.

anS0a0tD9YFcgwVqFjrwwQ.text: i have been coming to this place for about 5 years now.  Simply the best! it will definitely exceed your expectations for the price you pay!   it gets busy at about 5pm to 8pm, so if you have a large party  ( i would say 3+) , get there early. The place is small and probably occupies about 50 people in the building at the same time (if that)  this is an AYCE (all-you-can-eat) sushi place $20 for lunch and $24 for dinner. They tell you there's a time limite, but honestly, I have been coming here for years and never had a time limit. You can order anything on the menu with no limits!    What I love about this place? You can order half rolls! Perfect for someone who wants to try new rolls or if you're feeling adventurous for the day and want to try different things! And the rolls are not full of rice to fill you up,. They are perfect small sushi cut pieces.   P.S. Order what you can eat,preferably half rolls for those who likes to try out new things. Don't waste food, there are plenty of others who cannot afford to even buy rice! Just Sayin..

Kjs6lIl3XD8LRYLImXDHgA.text: Great service , wasn't necessary to ask for refill on my drink , server on point ,  the place is well communicated, good environment and respectful employees, I was sat at the bar , the guy was fast well prepare and just an awesome dinner, obviously I'll be back soon  THANK YOU YAMA SUSHI !

mIm5VLdwCyQ9q3ki1CUc6g.text: Hands down, favorite Sushi place in Vegas! I bring everyone here and will not go anywhere else! On my Birthday they were very accommodating with a large group and even played the birthday song for the WHOLE place to hear! My favorite rolls are the No Name, Harry Potter, and Wet Dream. I absolutely love this place and cannot wait to go back!

JHi4VEJNxDzbsc1gFeh6lA.text: I died and went to Heaven. Okay not literally of course. But my stomach did. Blew up like a balloon because I wanted the AYCE.  I was so impressive with the quality and the service. They servers were attentive and nice. I noticed because they would refill my water everytime it hit the bottom of the glass.  The sushi quality was great!! I was so happy to finally eat something good in Vegas because for the past few days, I was disappointed. Glad I've tried this place and I would definitely be coming back again!  I love the mochi ice cream. I had it twice, and my sushi was so mouth-watering. The rollers were extremely good as well. I love how you can half-order so you can try everything without overstuffing yourself. Damn my stomach hurt though cause I wanted to everything on that menu.  You will be seeing me again, for sure!

0O9hUYt0t1eWQdIVl5iasA.text: Excellent value for the price for the all u can eat sushi. The menu is very extensive and includes sushi and lots of appetizer like edamame, miso soup and pot sticker. The rolls are big but the ratio between rice and fish portions is adequate. Their specialty roll will have between 7 and 8 pieces with the end portions being larger Overall a good deal for all u can eat.

J7s12Mg8ypQBIyp6_ybpow.text: Did someone say AYCE Fresh Sushi? Sign Me up right now! This Spot is amazing if you love fresh sushi. You have the ability to order any style of sushi roll From the menu all under the AYCE menu price! A group of us sat at the sushi bar and watched the head Chef make some incredible rolls. If you are vegas this is a must hit.

po9ehgtd05jKHfW8QvhzSw.text: The food here is great.  Unfortunately, we found a little friend coming down from the wall to greet us before we left.  Yup, it was a roach!

mXyozgLunmOmyQDyH7j5pw.text: amazing amazing food!!!!!!!! It may be a little hole in the wall but the food is so worth it!!!!!! They have all you can eat menu, you pay $20 a person and. An order as much as you want as long as it is from that menu. If not you can still order what you want!

OzbjXDFG4Whl-qsZEzs7lg.text: The AYCE is an amazingly great deal! Definitely one of the best I've had because all specialty rolls are part of the deal. The Man Whore was awesome. Some old reviews said the service wasn't great, but I went two nights in a row and had great service at the bar and at a table.   The muscles are yummy too!

pFdWCITPBKGIvgb6c3zPKA.text: Busy place, but lots of choices and overall good. If you are looking for a place to eat sushi that is not fancy, but good and you don't want to spend a fortune....come here. Fast service,  if you do all you can eat you will not leave hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mocha ice cream, Chocolate and mango.

SrAOv8JelQwBmbQblba8sw.text: Once you found the sushi place there's no need to keep searching; Yama sushi is the best.   Took my sister out for sushi for her birthday and could not be more satisfied with everything.   The sushi rolls were delicious, and the service was great.  And on top of everything being great, they were kind enough to come out and sing happy birthday to my sister, which surprised us, both.  We will, most definitely, be returning!

ZTCqTmkwR1iNZJUmSB96Mg.text: Looking for a good AYCE sushi spot in Vegas? Look no further! Yama is definitely mine & BF's go-to. Fresh fish, great service, & only $22/$25 per person?! What more can you ask for? Sure, there might be a wait esp during peak hours- but you'll be glad you waited! Out of the several handful times I've gone here, they've disappointed.. Hmm.. Never :)

0CYMXPTNSCiIp9D8xFQFng.text: Wow, a sushi bonanza! Delicious, really quality fish, rice and the service was excellent and the sushi chefs were incredible. It became my main go to sushi place forever....

OwGdQVvTbir0JO-rhVYc4w.text: First of all, sushi should NOT be all you can eat. This place used to be decent but honestly it has gone downhill. The place is a TOURIST TRAP. It should be suspicious when you order sushi and the waiter turns around and it's already ready. The quality of the rolls is poor, sushi rolls crumble when you pick them up with your chopsticks. Sushi chefs in the back are chugging corona beer and are sloppy. The place is dirty and if you go there when the sun goes down you risk getting shot or getting approached by a bum. Go here if you're fat and you wanna eat as much as you can for a set price but go off the strip if you can help it!

AgHPPvQgkSxa4Tu6TLd86w.text: Bon!!!!!! Where did he go????? He took care of us for the past two years. We live in LA, Vegas is our second home and we look forward to Bon. He's a great sushi chef. It's just not the same without him. If anyone knows where I can find him please let me know!  So so so sad. .....

poPfK34FPX08_Wc1gK428Q.text: I would rate it 0 stars if I could. If you're okay with delicious food and horrible service then this is your place. The food Is delicious, however the service is the worst I have ever experienced. We waited 45 minutes for our order, one of the waiters came and asked if we were ready for our check. Apparently the waiter that took our order gave it to another waiter and he never put it in. This is an all you can eat option place, and after the first order our party was asked if we were ready for our check. I will never come back here again because the service was just unforgivable.

z2VNyomIIzoJr7WZCz4kOQ.text: Another sucessfull night eating at yama sushi! Cant say enough bout the service from the guys making the food to the servers they do such a great job given the space and amount of people there one of the reasons we continue to come back again & again!  There sushi rolls are as good as any you will find on the Strip without breaking ur wallet. The O harry roll and the seafood salad (spicy) are a must have when coming here. The tempura is excellent too just thinking bout it makes me wanna come back tonite lol

5FALCH5wOscOuxhhtbJJAg.text: Best freakin sushi ever! They also have excellent service & know how to get rid of a hangover.

KURtK6MOtyKFjsCOUfyepA.text: The sushi has very naughty and creative names. Good all u can eat price for dinner $23.99 . You can order anything on the menu. We order Sake and it did take a little while for it to come but very worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a4dxk--daQyLfURMtG1v1g.text: Love love love this place and can't believe I haven't wrote a review until now! I've been a very loyal customer for 3 years now and Paow has been my sushi chef every time! The staff treats us like VIP because of course how frequent we eat there. But ever since the beginning we've always been treated great! When we first started coming we had to wait 30-50 mins for the sushi bar but now we always get seated right away just because we earned our keep I suppose. But it was always worth the wait in the past!!!  We hardly ever order anything because Paow already knows what we like and even makes us special little creations just for us! It pays off staying loyal to your sushi spot and this place has been amazing! We do however miss Moo and Holly(servers), they moved back to their origins. But we still love the staff! Oh and do the AYCE sushi! I highly recommend the seafood salad! Omnomnom!!!! The Yama roll is great and I love their white tuna, garlic tuna and unagi! Delish!!!!!

Wb3QpDaCXjzbSGqVFZzkbw.text: When they say premium all you can eat sushi, the focus is on premium.  24 bucks gets you anything on their menu and all of it you want. The staff is very polite and very fast.  They specialize in fantastic rolls although their nigiri sushi and kitchen items are equally amazing. Lunch is 20 bucks and a few things aren't available, but it's no less delicious than dinner.  I recommend this as a Vegas must. Yes, I went again today and may go again before leaving town.  3 cheers for Yama! They rock!

9Fe9gD1zZJOphDYhvC2lww.text: Guess what Yelp... I'm Back! I've chosen Yama Sushi to be my first comeback post, mainly because I ate there last night and I realized I never wrote a review for it! There's many different factors that play into the 4 star rating I decided to give Yama.   First off, the service is particularly fast, but does have it's low points. On multiple occasions, I've put in an order and it never comes out. I either have to cancel it, or remind the staff about it before I end up getting my yummy food. If you read my reviews, you'll know that service is a very big part of how I decide my ratings.   Secondly, the two main reasons I come to Yama over other sushi places is because of the smoked salmon nigiri and the wet dream roll. I still remember the first time I tried the smoked salmon nigiri.. It melted perfectly in my mouth. Thinking about it now is making my mouth water. The wet dream also has a similar effect on me. It is a unique combinator of flavors and ingredients that leaves you fighting for the last piece. You don't know how many times I've contemplated ordering my own..  The last thing I want to talk about is the quality of the food. Each time I've come to Yama, I feel like the quality of the food was different each time. On some days it looked like they put more emphasis on the presentation and use of ingredients, while other days left me disappointed. Last night in particular, I wasn't too impressed with any of the food I ordered besides the wet dream.   Yama is a great sushi place in Vegas. If you've never tried any other sushi places in Vegas, be sure to try this one first. While I would come here again, I feel like it's time for me to move on to something new.

kogaLn09J-dW4O5C09vRsQ.text: Colleagues and acquaintances have urged me to try this place and always mention how great the AYCE deal is.  We had lunch here today and ordered that for the three of us.    The menu has a nice selection and the decor is pretty modern, especially considering the neighborhood.  Our service was great, and they utilized 3 different people for drink refills, bussing, and ordering.  Here's the problem:  I've always wondered how a place with quality fish can turn a profit charging ~$14/roll on speciality rolls, when AYCE costs mid $20's.  The answer: use tons of rice!  Everything was prepared nicely and held together well. The quality seemed to be top notch.  Their spicy special-sauces had good flavor profiles and had a nice kick. However, each piece of sushi had about a penny's girth worth of fish (think half inch), but each piece was normal sized (about a 50 cent piece.). I've eaten in dozens of sushi joints, and I've never had so much rice packed into each bite.  Is this standard on a la carte items or only AYCE?  I don't have the answer.

RseFAgeauejSFpYkgvf__g.text: No complaints at all. They set us up, right at the bar and we waited maybe 2-3 minutes on most rolls. The place was packed but the staff made sure that no one's table was neglected. The sushi itself was maybe "4 Star" worthy but overall it was a great experience.  Great value.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Akp2Amo8TFBl74fIs0lYiw.text: I've been to this sushi restaurant many times throughout the years, and it used to be a favorite. However, when a co-worker and I went last week, I was disappointed with the quality of the fish. The spicy tuna was dense and dark, and none of the nigiri I ordered was fresh (red snapper tasted like it was about to turn). I'll stick with the location on Spring Mountain, or perhaps try the new one on the strip.

lKpjdEAzXvr-xdtC3hJtjQ.text: I've been to this AYCE venue a couple of times. I was thoroughly satisfied both times. However, my latest trip was the eyeopening event.  Yama Sushi is quire popular, considering it's not too far from the strip, its cheap and its good. My first time here I came for a late lunch. The service was good, exactly what I expected since it was not all that busy. Nothing I had was bad or tasted stale...always a plus. ;-)  The latest visit was for dinner. At roughly around 7 PM, It was packed. People sitting inside, lined up out the door, more folks waiting outside. Then, some more people popping in and out picking up their orders to go...plenty of traffic.   Since I was running solo, I opted to sit at the bar...seemed like the fastest way to get a seat...bingo! That worked out well. I proceeded to order from the chefs behind the bar. I had the pleasure of ordering from Evil Man...YUP! You read that right! That's exactly what his name tag said...he is also some sort of supervisor and spoke Spanish to a few of his coworkers. This guy is good! Fast, efficient and effective! He never missed a beat. There were 7 people sitting around me, he was able to get all of their orders and also made other orders from the tables...bravo!  Never felt like I was being ignored or my food took too long. What a blessing for an AYCE Sushi spot! Needless to say, I'll be back.

6OMm5zaBkWT0WPUaJGtvVA.text: Came here with a friend because this is one of his favorite places in Vegas. For $23, there is an AYCE option, and that's exactly what we came for.  The restaurant itself is fairly large and has a lot of seats, and decor is nothing special. Service was attentive (good about refilling waters, coming by to check on you/ask for more orders), though I wouldn't say friendly, and you aren't assigned an individual server.   If you come here, it's for the food. EVERYTHING on the menu is included in the AYCE, which is amazing! The menu has a ton of appetizers, rolls, and more (even dessert). I opted for hamachi kama (yellowtail cheek) and agedashi tofu for starters, then proceeded to eat several rolls.   I think the names of their special rolls are hilarious, and have never seen a place with so many humorous names. By the way, it's not advertised but you can order half-orders of any of their rolls! Perfect if you want to try many different rolls like I did. The rolls also come out fairly quick, which is good because you have a two-hour time limit.   The sushi itself was decent. Not the best quality ever, but very good and for AYCE this place is a bargain! I highly recommend coming here if you are craving a lot of sushi!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q5wIkZF7WlS_jDn-VnPqzQ.text: On top of everything the employees are always so kind and friendly making my experience so much better. (Peep their funny name tags)   My favorite items continues to be the Fried mussels, man whore, and wet dream.  I didn't try as much this time because my 5 & 3 year old were my date that didn't help eat very much. The AYCE for lunch is $20.95 and half that price for children 3-6.  I did get a plate of teriyaki and white rice for my younger one instead of paying ayce for him. He got 1 shrimp tempura while he waited for his food. I felt bad telling him to wait. Since there is no sharing with non AYCE patrons. They didn't mind it.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Oi0DVfVfOZ--xZeLFu4TaQ.text: AYCE Sushi, say what????!   Yum yum yum. This place is like hole in the wall restaurant. Its in a corner of the shopping center & is kind of tiny.  We got there around 3 pm and it wasnt too busy.  We got our drink orders in right away and got to order our first round.  We tried so many different rolls I dont even remember them.  I suggest this for people who have an appetite because they do come very long! WARNING: if u do not finish your food they charge extra like most AYCE. At the end lf the meal you are offered dessert either ice cream lr mochi ice cream.  We did the ice cream.  It tasted like its from baskin robins.  I could not even walk or even drive home after eating here! My tummy was so full.  But decent price for bomb food!

pIisu2SXAJc3ZM9jdypSxg.text: Went last night on a date for the all you can eat and it was sooo amazing. Two pages of sushi to choose from and it was just sooo good. Definitely going to come back :)

mAzYSS_n7oxD2Js8D0kAQA.text: I used to love this place.. but last night myself and some friends came in and two of us got the worst stomach problems. I won't go into detail but it was definitely food poisoning! I think it was from the poke or mixed poke salad because those are two items we ate that no one else did! I just think the establishment and customers should be aware. :(

fo48_cjt1NYfqMnOZjdr2Q.text: It was a decent all-you-can-eat. I mean there's a certain handicap you have to give to a restaurant that serves fish in the desert... but theirs just isn't the best quality. They also put wasabi on their nigiri rice before putting the fish on it - which is a big no-no in my sushi book. The menu is decently sized, but not large. Service was good, not great. Location is a little sketch but that's not their fault. Solid 3/5. Not the best in Vegas but not the worst.

Vd66o7OQBwimiTPmPy-L8w.text: Decided to try this place out because I'm new the neighborhood & it's close. The service is quick, but the middle age hostess kept trying to tell me what I was gonna eat... first pushing the all you can eat meal, suggesting meals for 2 etc. maybe she thinks I'm too skinny and she's trying to fatten me up lol. Then she got snappy with me when I asked for sashimi. She made some kind of comment about sashimi being the same thing sushi. I can't eat rice so I insisted I don't want sushi, I want sashimi. She snapped saying I just explained it to you. Take a look at the photo I attached. Does it not say sushi, not sashimi? Anyway, I'll be in the neighborhood at least 12 months so the next time I want sashimi, I'll do some investigating here and find some place else. If I want attitude from a stern middle aged woman, I'll go back to catholic school. The other staff were friendly. Honestly she alone is the reason for 3 stars. If it weren't for the other staff, this would be a 1 Star review.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Does this say sushi or sashimi?

j0E7UnUZEgHT8nTTFAXAHA.text: The price is very reasonable  I'm not sure if it's just today but the fish seemed a little small on the nigiri The quality was good, it was on the fresh side  I liked the mixed poki salad they had on the appetizers

oUKaCiJ3LBSE47hJJ9yXhQ.text: I would rate this place definite 5 stars. As a vegas local this is my go to spot for some fresh delicious sushi. The service is fast and great as well. They usually get all their fish in fresh. Never had a problem here and will continue to come as it is my #1 place in vegas with some great pricing for ayce too.

PSxD9S6P1X5AhP0JQzAz0w.text: Very mediocre sushi. I can find better quality at my local Wholefoods in LA... Came here for a quick bite and the restaurant was fairly packed for a Friday. My husband and I were seated right away around 9:20pm at the bar. We weren't hungry enough to do all you can eat so opted for a la carte, and thank God for that.  After the first few orders I was over it and wanted to leave. We ordered: Miso soup-came out cold, not even warm Scallop sushi-not fresh garlic tuna sushi-bad quality tuna drowned in ponzu sauce  seaweed salad-didn't taste fresh so didn't finish it yellow tail collar-came out last when we order it first. 1 star for the collar because how can you go wrong with fried fish Palm job handroll- lol $12 not worth it!!! We couldn't order it half size. It was basically soy paper with imitation crab meat drowned in spicy mayo and other sauces)   Service is so slow. Sushi men aren't even Japanese and we're talking in Spanish amongst each other. Worst bar sitting experience. We love talking/drinking with the sushi men which is why we always sit at the bar. Not coming back. Do not waste your time and Money

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decent Hamchi collar

HfmMAaGRl5dxbIFSGus5Pw.text: This place is great! I heard a lot of Vegas' buffet, and my friends and I came here for the Asian buffets. I was really impressed.   There were a couple things on the menu that were a limit to one order per person. Those are a good indicator of how good the dish is. Just order those and you can't go wrong. We ordered a whole bunch of appetizers and we were really impressed with them. Some of the sushi rolls have names that match with the Vegas style, which was hilarious.  Here are a couple items that I recommend:   The Giant Clam mix poki salad soft shell crab no name roll be mine volcano roll  The price is super cheap. Dinner and lunch are only 3 dollars difference which is super rare. If I live in Vegas, I'll come here all the time. I wish we have something like this in the bay area.

pSoV4BImQZeu48heb_q3dA.text: Friend brought me here a last week and love the big wall, told me it changes as the seasons go. Fast service, friendly and love there rolls. Plan on going more, hungry for some now while talking about it.

Z7aYz5nLV86KpNPC1GmQ2g.text: This is a great place to go for lunch! The price is reasonable for AYCE sushi and the portions are not skimpy. Most places seem to scrape a small bit of fish over too much rice, but not here! The sushi is done right. We had our own chef making everything fresh to order. The menu was big and had lots of specialty rolls, which are included in the AYCE price. It is a few miles off the strip, but definitely worth the drive.

Ps5AglCcZszdvyzMZDTv0g.text: Think the fact that we've gone there 4 times within 3 weeks says a lot. Sit at the bar watch your sushi being made it's amazing experience their all you can eat is well worth the cost for lunch and dinner cause you are definitely eating more than $20.95 (lunch) or 23.95 (dinner) worth of seafood.

TXZKBLY-RIRMgCVUjHhcWg.text: I came here on a recommendation from a friend who knows the area pretty well. It's not in the safest part of town, from what it looks like. It's in a small strip mall next to Albertson's. We came across some bums, perverts (who hit on our girls), and a guy outside playing the guitar, holding a sign that said "f*** you pay me." If you can look passed all that this sushi spot is worth the trip.      I'm giving this place a four star only because of the accommodations. It had a hard time accommodating our party of nine. We waited for 90 MINUTES before we were sat down at our table. The place is really tiny, so they tried to separate our party into two groups. If we would had agreed to split the group, the wait would have been about 70 minutes.        Now for the food part,.... it was scrumptious!! I can't say they were the best rolls ever, but we did finish every single roll. We left no stone unturned! Every roll that came to the table was perfectly displayed and tasted delicious. We ordered "wet dream," "happy ending," "man whore," and a bunch of others. The baked muscles were also on point!       My advise to you is, if your coming for dinner expect this place to have an extended wait. There is not much room to sit and wait inside, so during the winter make sure to bring a warm jacket.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry mochi ice cream was delicious. Different from what I&#39;m use to.
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Man whore dish! Good stuff along with everything else.

yBf8Gtldk-GsfpDxm7sYFg.text: Sushi was fresh and clean.  Gyoza was excellent.  Service was good.  Wish they had a few other options for tuna.

EZhd0_r8Dqm5srDjokhH6A.text: This is truly my favorite sushi place in Las Vegas. The service is always amazing. I've been coming here for years now and it never disappoints. The sushi roll names are unique and the vibes are awesome. Arrive morning time for better pricing. But it's all you can everything in the menu no exclusions!!

TywxQA8jZZ4enfFqjFMd6A.text: Yama Sushi - An AYCE restaurant approximately $25 a person. People give them 4 solid stars on yelp yet the service is fair so is the food. Their rolls are awesome and huge yet contains a large amount of rice which is their trick to make you feel full. However, I think the food worth the money because you can't complain about sushi. I personally give this restaurant 3.5/5 because service isn't what I expected.

9uk70qsqajRIFpibAjTC1g.text: Never ever go this place!!!  The service was very bad. We're 7people so they already include tip.  But their service was very bad and slow and even rude.  They forgot about our order but they did not even say sorry.  They need to train servers well.

S-CI_YYruAV21ZxauxxX0w.text: I wanted to like this place, I really did, but here's why I didn't.  The rolls I had were smothered in what I call flare (sauces, mayo, garnish, etc.) The nigiri was sloppy and also has flair Way too many people here that wandered over from the strip However, $25 all you can eat? (awesome) You better believe I ate myself stupid!  The mochi ice cream kicks a$$!

SZMZKKtXFwQpA1oKPeYwuw.text: Always amazing!! What sets Yama Sushi apart from other sushi restaurants,  is the rice, its always so light and fluffy, its cooked so perfectly it highlights the fish. The fish is so fresh and they always have new fun specials.   Go for the all you can eat, its worth it. Usually a 15-20 minute wait, but again, worth it.

NZAGJrOEcJUwaXZEWc8YjQ.text: Love love the #7 roll!! Apart from the 25mins wait during dinner peak, we truly enjoy the selections they have here.

yaXxYJK3jQi2rvR0xPizCQ.text: Who would think a good sushi place would be located here? Talk about a good find!  We went during lunch hour and found it comfortably busy (i.e. we wouldn't be ignored, and the presence of others was reassuring). The decor is really cute as well.  We had all you can eat and ordered: vegas style roll, tiger roll, spicy tuna roll, tuna sushi, yellowtail sushi, miso soup, and two kinds of ice cream. Green tea is my favorite kind, but bf branched out and got red bean which was yummy! Everything was delicious and we left full and happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7gD43IaQGTKjwvEQjFyl4g.text: I really wanted to like this place because other people swear by it, but all you can eat sushi is a bit suspicious when there's so much spicy tuna and crazy sauces on the menu ... I really wonder about the quality of the fish here.  It's easy to hide not-so-great fish in spiciness and funky sauces. And the couple of rolls that were supposed to have fresh fish instead of the typical spicy tuna mush -- The fish really lacked any flavor.  It wasn't rancid, but it definitely wasn't the freshest fish.  The rolls were fun but not fantastic -- There's nothing here that makes me say "Holy sashimi, I HAVE to go back there again!"  The price for all you can eat was pretty cheap, but I'd rather throw down a few extra $$$ and get some real quality fish.

Vnot-i08rgCpZ2n_fYw2eA.text: One of the better All You Can Ear places in Vegas.  (Sushi 21 is hard to beat).  The rolls are deliciously interesting.  But if you're a pure sushi eater, stay away from the baked rolls.  The waitresses are polite and come by often.  I enjoyed my experience here.  Come on your birthday, if you dare!

-rJ5MsVZdbrgFMeDZKrZ4w.text: Had a great experience. Accommodated our party of eight with no problem and were seated right at our reservation time. We did the all-you-can-eat deal and tried a bunch of different items off of the menu. Everything was awesome. The Wet Dream and One Minute Man were amazing. The staff was on point too and took great care of us. I'll definitely go back here next time I'm in Vegas.

i7CHxmv3LRc-FOOfuZzCig.text: My love took me there for our Valentine's Day dinner during Valentine's Day weekend.  It was ridiculously busy, I almost wanna say more than usual, but we only waited about 15 minutes.  Our servers and additional staff was very attentive, we waited on average of 1-3 minutes for each of our rolls to come out.  For the I'm Turning Japanese roll it took a little longer because the yama yama is baked but it was our last roll so we didn't mind.  For $23 a person for AYCE it was more than worthwhile!  We had nine rolls, I think my favorite would be I'm Turning Japanese, or Son of a Beach.  We also had some Unagi which was very delicious and the pieces were big.  Each roll were in good proportions, none of that overfilled with rice crap.  I won't lie it was saucy, but we both prefer saucy so it didn't bother me.  The mango mochi ice cream was a little too cold but once it chilled it was good, but not as good as the red bean ice cream.  We will be back!

e1nyVyR3LE30c-cF90edmg.text: Recently tried Yama Sushi for the first time during a visit to Las Vegas. I used the mobile version of Yelp to find the place, but still had a bit of trouble since it's part of an outdoor shopping center with several establishments and the buildings are far back from the street. If you're looking for this place, look for the shopping center with the Albertsons on Flamingo and Maryland and you'll find this place.  Interior of the restaurant is small, but very clean. Tables are close together, but the sushi bar was packed so I sat at a table. There is a laminated menu with the special rolls, and a paper menu that your server will bring with the more standard fare. AYCE with tax is just shy of $23.00. A fantastic deal.  I was very pleased to see that half-orders were available for all rolls, even the special ones. This meant that since I was the only one eating sushi in my party, I was able to try several rolls. While I tried to pick rolls, I had the Albacore sushi (just ok) and the Salmon sushi (pretty good!). Both were served with large pieces of fish and just enough rice. I don't think I'd get the Albacore again, there was something about the texture I didn't like.  First up were the "Man Whore" rolls: Spicy salmon roll baked w/ a mixture of spicy tuna and cream cheese on top and served with spicy mayo and eel sauce. These were just okay. The baked topping was dry, possibly over-baked? Not sure. So, the Man Whore wasn't fantastic, but it wasn't awful, either.  Next were the "Yama Crunch": Tempura shrimp and crabmeat roll with a crunch layer on top. These were pretty tasty. They were served with a sweet sauce which was pretty good.  KAI Roll: Eel, cream cheese, avocado and spicy tuna roll w/ spicy tuna and avocado outside. Again, there was a sauce served with these rolls that was pretty good. I would have gladly had more of these and skipped the Man Whore rolls.  Last, but not least, the "Wet Dream". OMG. Delicious. These are a California roll baked with cream cheese and shrimp on top with a sweet yam sauce and eel sauce. Did I say DELICIOUS? These were the perfect end to the meal.  Service was fine. The place was VERY busy, but I barely would finish a plate of 4 pieces and the server would come around and ask if I wanted something else. It's also very noisy, but that's okay as long as the person next to you doesn't have an annoying celphone ring that goes off ever 2 minutes or so. Ahem.  I would definitely go here again if I'm with non-sushi diners. Otherwise, I'm still a fan of Sushi on Trop .. for now.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wet Dream (cali roll baked w/cream cheese &amp; shrimp on top w/swet yam sauce and eel sauce)

04g3aQp7Us4i3pZr-ligGQ.text: This is our AYCE sushi spot whenever we're in Vegas. Decent quality, good service, especially with the size of the groups we bring in. They really do keep it coming, and AYCE includes all sorts of specialty rolls, or endless nigiri if that's your thing. Comes with dessert too!!

nD0oU0V15A1NHVwDq-48OA.text: Yama Sushi you're seriously slipp'n . We have always loved you in the past but you failed us today. Why oh why? Seafood salad was wrong, really really wrong. What happened to the wonderful flavor? We had to ask for our order of Hamachi kama twice!! Why oh why? Why???

YI5Dlz3nppIe6fXeq6FBBg.text: Great service, great food! I come here often and have never been disappointed. They have a good variety of specialty rolls and good quality for an all you can eat spot.

XTtGhn37ViioqRL8W77KUw.text: By far one of the best sushi resturants in Vegas. The all you can eat is diffently worth it. The manhore roll is awsome , and the Harry Potter is so refreshing.

FSKEZnQ142JzzEHwB0Ogvg.text: I love coming here! I try to restrain myself to once a month.  The Palm Job is the best, I always order it first! the place is small inside but they manage to squeeze everyone in. Yama crunch and Turning Japanese ar e two of my favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

11yjvDuZvxF8DU3Ekbio9A.text: After having Oyishi sushi on Wednesday, I decided to truly compare the two highly rated AYCE sushi joints.   First of all, the restaurant is a bit small and crowded.  So try to plan ahead and make reservations or you might get stuck waiting in line for about 30 min or so.  The food was very fresh and tasty.  We started off with soft-shell crab, agedashi tofu, and a i love salmon roll.  The softshell crab was mediocre, i wasnt a big fan of the type of batter they used to fry the crab.  The agedashi tofu was small deep fried tofu in the normal agedashi broth, mediocre as well.  The ilove salmon roll was pretty much a philly roll but loaded with an excess amount of cream cheese.  Next up we ordered a mountain of nigiri from salmon, halibut, garlic tuna, uni, sweet shrimp, yellow tail and many more.  All were very very fresh and delicious.  Comparing quality to oyshi id say they are on the same level if not better.    There were 2 key items that made yama rise over oyshi, 1.) hamachi kama and 2.) unlimited mochi.  The hamachi kama was grilled to perfection and had a lot of flavor.  Unlimited mochi speaks for itself.  Overall i definitely recommend Yama, if you dont mind the drive down to flamingo and maryland.

i_I9E08XC3Yyg05OfuWpPg.text: I visited Yama Sushi for the first time on Saturday, with a group. This place is SUPER busy- there was a line out the door from the time I arrived until the time I left.  It is very small and cozy, but certainly bustling.  We tried a variety of dishes, both rolls, sashimi, even Korean BBQ and everything was fresh and delicious.  I especially enjoyed the Wet Dream roll, but I don't think there was anything I didn't like.  Service was quick and efficient and the food just kept coming! It was a great value, as well- $23.95 for all you can eat sushi? Unbelievable!  I will definitely return-it is worth the wait.

5w1x2g01yYFJnnq2y7dvqQ.text: My Favorite Sushi Place in Las Vegas!!!... I go here any chance I get, I live on the opposite side of town,  but it is definitely worth the trip!!... they're always busy, so prep for a lil wait!!!... but if you like sushi it's worth the wait!!!...

gyr2PA-LjFih1ahdyVb51w.text: This place.... Yes! Go if you like sushi go! Come hungry. The all you can eat is a steal, it includes soup and desert. All the rolls are made quickly and extremely friendly staff.

92bUIWc81X0C20WWkUB6AA.text: The last time I ate at an all you can eat sushi place was over a decade ago  and I was very disappointed! Since  then I stay away from them until yesterday! My friend  wanted to celebrate her birthday here and have all you can eat sushi's ! Let me just say I was incredibly impressed! The service was great! The sushi was good! The rolls were tasty! They were very accommodating to our party of 8 and allowed us to make a reservation and bring in our own dessert! I also brought my own champagne and they charged a corkage fee. I do feel that sushi is fresher at a non all you eat place but I will definitely be back !

GxNEtqoP0zUSYyB5c_GXkQ.text: Okay. This place is awesome!!!! All you can eat for $20.95 lunch time..  And it's not only all you can eat sushi, there's other appetizers too! The quality of the food is 5 stars, the environment is 5 stars and the waitstaff is 5 stars. They give so much sushi in one order!!!  I definitely recommend this place  for any occasion or celebration.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P4x9D-cL45sq9N9ssOPQlQ.text: HECK YES. This place is everything you want and need in an AYCE sushi joint. $21 for a weekend lunch, and the menu is vast. VAST.   Service is very friendly and quite fast. There is pretty much every type of roll you can think of. I loved the rainbow rolls and tempura rolls. They even have poke and seafood salads. The nigiri is delicious, and they do not load up on rice on any of the sushi like some other AYCE places do. They also offer uni!   Everything we had was good quality by AYCE standards. The only thing to stay away from is the raw scallops - these taste like nothing and I suspect are some sort of imitation scallop.   This will definitely be my go to place in Vegas from now on!!

dRld8p4UXkooEqVjjRb2cA.text: Yama sushi is a very simplistic and very customer friendly. Their customer service is decent, and the food is well prepared and presented. The ingredients taste fresh for the most part and the environment is nice and comfortable. The employees need better customer service but the price is just right. Most of the rolls are amazing and there are different rolls for different preferences. Overall it's a very good sushi place to take your family and enjoy some good Japanese lasagna.

vBbRbZNHscfg3xvkSxxdfg.text: Overall great sushi spot past 10pm. I went about 45 minutes before closing & didn't feel rushed.  Sitting at the bar, the California roll was make extremely fast!  Next was the yobo baked roll & then the spicy salmon roll. The spicy salmon was pretty spicy but just enough to enjoy. I didn't get the AYCE.  The music being played was top 40 radio. I usually enjoy a place with a little more selective playlist.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yobo!

O1Zr8N-90d5hCQL_Di9UUw.text: I'd have to say this sushi joint is very disappointing.  Raw fish should always be cold! It was almost like room temp. Service wasn't that great.  Definitely will not come here again.

mCZV_V5YIS_QmKDSD4Re9A.text: Hands down the best sushi we have ever had.  We ordered: -trust me baby: amazing  - volcano roll: light  - wet dream: super delicious  - Yama crunch: yummy  - happy rainbow: happily delicious  - fish and chips: too much sauce but if you love the sauce it's super good  - son of beach: my least favorite but my husband loved it  Customer service was very good. " evil man" and "sexy Mexican" were very sweet.  All you can eat includes tea and one appetizer. Definitely worth it  Wellbe coming back again soon

B75WDHOCzE_i9PCo6Eip4Q.text: This was my first time at this AYCE sushi place and it was legit!!  All of their sashimi was fresh and really tender.  It's a small setting which makes it more intimate but they have a few other locations in Las Vegas as well.    The staff wear funny name tags, like our server's name tag said "Filipino Mafia" and the guy who filled our water, his name tag said "Don't Remember". This created really fun and entertaining dinner conversations.  Not to mention the names of some of their sushi rolls. (See photo).  This lets me know that they have a pretty good sense of humor while serving great tasting delicious food.    I will try their other locations the next time I'm in Vegas.  Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Read the names of their sushi rolls

MXk62hpSzOl4PHpoqBWmQg.text: So I fell into the "Yelp Hype" with Yama Sushi.  Pros: The wait staff was great, very friendly, and always checking on us. We didn't have to wait long to get drink refills and they addressed us as "ma'am/sir" the whole time. The Price is pretty good for AYCE sushi, its a little less then average by a couple dollars which was nice.   The place was clean, its not in the greatest neighborhood so the strip mall is a little shady but Yama Sushi was 4.5/5 for cleanliness and a 3/5 for decor.   Some cuts tasted fresh, others didn't. I know this changes daily but the salmon the day I went wasn't too great but the tuna and yellowtail were perfect.   Cons: EVERYTHING is super saucy! Either Panzu or spicy mayo! The nigiri was drenched in panzu sauce (I ordered 5 different cuts and 3/5 were swimming in panzu). It was hard to taste the fish itself. I can see why some people who like "sushi" would come here, they mask most of the fish taste so all you taste is sauce. If you're a purest when it comes to sushi, stay away... This place is designed for the "Yeah I love sushi" for Instagram type of person. If that's your thing, you'll love it here.   Another weird thing we noticed but it went away fast was the place had a weird smell. Nothing crazy but when we walked in it was pretty bad.   Overall I took off 3 stars because the main attraction (THE SUSHI) wasn't great. I'm sure the owners or the marketing team stay on top of their Yelp game with all these reviews but I didn't care for this place. I don't plan on going back. Go check it out for yourself (that's what I did) but if you're here for the weekend, don't waste a night out here, there are other places much more superior.

CkDtFz5TyZIuYSMn5LkRsQ.text: ALL YOU CAN EAT (AYSO) review only.  I was on my way to Makino Chaya's but a friend suggested this place. YAMA SUSHI is my new favorite AYSO sushi spot here in LV.   Food: Excellent. So many choices! -and the names of the dishes are funny and unexpected... especially from a Japanese place. I love it.  See posted photos from other viewers.   Price: Extremely reasonable for the AYSO.  $25 for dinner is really good for the all different options you get.   Staff: AMAZING, quick and super nice. --I'm referring to all 7 of them tho kept coming to the table to either fill up my water or asked if I would I needed anything.  Suggestion:  *Do a half order for your items (specialty rolls) so  you don't waste food + save room to try more items. *Don't fill up on water.  *You must eat everything (including rice the item comes with) or you will be charged. *be ready to order and clear a path for them to place your items when it arrives. -Also, stack the items neatly to a corner that's easily accessible for the waiter to retrieve. This is all just common sense & courtesy, but we live in a world of idiots who just can't figure it out.   I don't give places 5 stars very often. Everywhere I go its usually a 4 star average... but I'm definitely coming back here because of the price and quality in food AND service.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VPkqpxGRW8TNi8MH2W1ShQ.text: If I can give a perfect 10 stars, it will go to Yama sushi for sure.  This place is Absolutely our favorite sushi restaurant. We never get tire of coming to enjoy the top quality sushi here.   Not only sushi is fresh, environment is clean, staffs are fast and friendly. Most importantly, you get your money back by eating all kinds of sushi, grill fishes, sushi hand rolls, etc...No other restaurant can beat their price at all.  For folks who haven't tried this restaurant, try it out and enjoy the best in town.  Strongly recommended this All You Can Eat Sushi restaurant.

All you can eat !!! Gahhhhhh sooooo good everything there's nothing I don't recommend! All in all great experience!

I23-d3mBUmC5ml9S3oiZkQ.text: All you can eat sushi restaurant minutes from the strip.  We heard wonderful things about this place so we gave it a shot on a Thursday night. It was very busy but we managed to get seated right away.  I chose the all you can eat option which is well worth the price. It allows you to explore the menu without the cost. I like the half roll option so I can taste more rolls. Appetizers and dessert is included in the all you can eat option.  Our waitress checked in on us frequently and was very friendly.

d2dSJQMAX9BtyGJk7QM0fw.text: So we were aiming to go to another all you can eat sushi place and that other place was packed! So our group decided to try out yama.   There wasnt much of a wait and got seated immediately. There were 6 of us too! So we got seated in this little area that seemed like it's reserved for parties but we were in there with another group of 4. Small space but no biggie.   Our server's name was Casanova haha, I believe they used cute nicknames. The other nickname I saw was sweet land. Casanova was a cutie though (anywayyy--lol handing out compliments like candy here). We got waters all around and it came out immediately (A+).   We all opted for all you can eat. We got our first few orders in. They have quite a selection of sushis and the funniest name. They have one called the Harry Potter and some other naught ones too that I wont be typing out here lol but they're very "vegas-like".   The food came out fast and consistently. I really enjoyed all the rolls that I ordered. I got several appetizers as well. Some notable ones were the Uni, Soft shell crab, and tokoyaki. I got the tuna poki salad but it was really spicy and there was barely any seaweed salad in there.   We got mochi ice cream for our dessert and they were actually soft and not hard haha.   I'd like to say that I'd keep yama sushi as an option for all you can eat sushi. I enjoyed it and would come back :)

Oec8n3O9nbRAyptb38mdHA.text: This is my favorite sushi place ever, PERIODT! I'm still new to writing reviews so that's why I haven't written about this place yet but my family has actually been going to this restaurant for over 10 years and counting. I was in elementary school when I first tried this place (before they remodeled and opened it up bigger), and now I'm in college. Crazy right? The service is also so good here and the servers are the sweetest. I remember coming here on a holiday once a few years ago and they gave us t-shirts! Now to the food. I don't need a menu to order. Hands down no name and turning japanese will ALWAYS be on the table. Superman is great if I'm feeling cream cheese. As for the appetizers, spicy seafood salad is THE BEST. Most sushi places don't serve this at lunch but Yama does. You really do get the best bang for your buck and it's pretty cheap compared to other places. Agedashi tofu, soft shell crab, baked and fried mussels, and hamachi kama never fail to make it to our order. I didn't even like tofu for the longest time but I would always eat the agedashi tofu. I really recommend trying the tempura UDON!! I have udon at every ayce place I can and no place beats Yama. The broth is so savory and the flavor is crazy I could eat their udon all day. I haven't found any ayce place that beats Yama and I'm sure you won't be disappointed if you try it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. actual heaven

eAd1dhETTm_By87Oe3byzg.text: Place is outright disgusting. Should of learned my lesson the first time. Probably good for someone that never did ayce or never had sushi before. Have no clues how this place has good reviews.

BxXJAQuDWbZnKQ7zLvkQIw.text: I enjoyed Yama Sushi, my cousin introduced me to this place. There are three locations, however, the prices at this location are fairly cheaper for Happy Hour.  I enjoyed the service and the food, it tasted fresh and the portion of each plate was appropriate.  It wasn't too overwhelming nor was there too little of something.  It was a good size and left room to continuously eat and use the Happy Hour to it's full advantage.  However, it lost a star because our food was misplaced and given to another table. As a result, in the beginning we had to wait a little longer.

XCCalxOsjL0LnJDRHRiv2g.text: This place was amazing!  Great place to go if you arrive to airport starving.  It's just a 5-10 minute drive away.  $20 before tax and tip for lunch buys you all you can eat. Even the uni and ikura were unlimited.  Often these are limited to one order at other places.  Usually the rolls are my go to, but the individual pieces allow you to pace yourself better.  The guy was one of the fastest sushi guys I've ever seen.

3td3MKuG2JtvSNxCyg5nzw.text: I never go back to the location at Flamingo, the Indonesia chef he where glasses, he never give me a good roll,very bad service on his part, I order no name he dint put the avocado and the crab, I order #7 he dint put the crab n the crunch, I order garlic tuna, he hand me the tuna, no garlic,I never will go to that location, they said the one in Spring Mountain is the best

736YCTZhRC9pNHliaKPmLg.text: This place has Absolutely became one of my favorite sushi spots, Supervisor Mama Mia was so kind and her hospitality was so sincere. I'm so glad we came here to celebrate my birthday. One thing that makes the food 10x better is the customer service-and this exceeded my expectations. Food-10 out of 10.... Hospitality 10 out of 10. Thank you, Yama Sushi for a great experience!

YrBf8-eCgACSG-Mwjb98ZA.text: One of the best reasonably priced sushi places I've been to in Vegas! A couple college buddies of mine brought me here for the first time several months ago, and ever since I've been hooked!  The quality of the sushi is excellent! While many of the meal item names are a little cheesy and racy (one minute man, hand job, wet dream!), there are some very interesting dishes that not only taste delicious, but also Yama Sushi goes to the length to make their dishes look like you're eating at a high scale sushi bar.   The times they have went have been very busy, but typically we wait no longer than 15 minutes each time to be sat. Service is friendly, quick, and the best part is that the service is organized and the waitresses are very sharp with remembering bulk orders.  Love, love, love! This has to be my new bread and butter sushi bar to go on a regular basis. :)

HR1cJliNj3ab4veritf_Sg.text: Best Sushi I have had so far.  I crave it often and would be willing to take a drive to Vegas just to eat here.  Great value and great quality.  The last time we went the wait was 1.5 hr but totally worth it.

2I7JL7DltRr3DvLOUhSU8Q.text: Awesome place! And it is really affordable, specially for me since I spend my billpaying money on hair and clothes... You can choose the all you can eat for $20 but its not a buffet you sit on the sushi bar and order directly from Mr Sushi Man. The people are friendly and very attentitve. The guys not so much on the hot side, but they are nice for sure! It is really delicious, try it out!

_PoeOBPd5MeoMEYgMN25-A.text: So, so good. A friend and I had heard good things and stopped by, and we are both sooo glad we did!  AYCE for like $25 for dinner, but it includes everything on the menu!! And they serve half-rolls!! And if you and the party with whom you are dining all order AYCE, you can share!!  I was in heaven.  My friend and I sampled basically everything and were not turned off by a single dish.  The mochi was a perfect ending, too, and several flavours including mango and strawberry.  I keep trying to find reasons to end up on this side of town during their hours!  The place is tucked away in a strip mall and just says SUSHI but don't let that trick you, go stuff yourself.

kld5tQh9Dl7sWZcIf-FWNA.text: I thought it was average, mainly because of the price.  ayce sushi is hard to give a bad review unless the quality is just horrible.  I hated the fact that they only allow one order per person on certain items, like the Uni.  also, like other ayce sushi places they require you to eat the rice that comes with your piece you order, so there is no sashimi, and you cant just eat the meat and ask for more orders.  But for value I don't think you can beat it.

Uduisc5H43O0q185tl0bDA.text: I have been going to Yama sushi for over two years now and I love it! The sushi is excellent along with the friendly staff that works there. You HAVE to try the seafood salad, sun of the beach roll, and the wet dream roll. I have no complaints about this place and it is definitely worth the price. Thank you Yama!

lfOxFwq7YIYkfKAZmFQX7Q.text: The only place in town I like to eat sushi! The prices are amazing, especially to offer all you can eat. Have been going here for years. It's always busy so I try to go when they first open in the morning. They recently expanded into the place next door to make room to seat more people. Every roll is delicious. I always get the Dragon roll and Superman roll, along with salmon and finish with the green tea ice cream.

F6Mwm09sbkVMjRLvWMCUGg.text: In celebration of Saturday night, I tried THREE new places. First stop was Yama Sushi, as we were headed over to the east side and knew this was one place Yelpers love for AYCE sushi.   One piece of advice: if you are a small party, do not be tempted by the cozy little side room. Sit at the sushi bar. I decided to take one of the two tables in the little side room, and the table next to us was loud, which may make me sound like a prude, but they were blasting their own private dining soundtrack through a telephone. The sound was worse than a late 70s clock radio. It was a truly odd and rather unpleasant experience. I hope this is not a new trend.  The actual restaurant atmosphere was warm and full of energy. The place was slammed, without being chaotic, and the centerpiece of the room was a trippy-flower mural behind the sushi bar. The mural is composed of large panels of brightly colored photographs of poppies. (At least, I think they are poppies.) It reminded me of the scene in the Wizard of Oz when Dorothy and crew become intoxicated by the field of flowers-- the "deadly poppy field."  But, there is nothing deadly about Yama, unless you can overdose on solid sushi. AYCE dinner is $22.95 and includes a decent variety. Yama gets bonus points for not over-ricing the rolls and for allowing you to order half rolls. (For what it's worth, I really liked their sushi rice; it was perfectly sticky and a bit sweet.) They also offer everything in a hand roll option, which brought intense delight to my boy. Shrimp tempura and eel hand rolls were arriving at the table by the tray full. I don't think they have the most creative rolls in town, but what they do have is done well.  Of course speed of service is very important at an AYCE establishment, and at Yama, it was speedy and sweet. Every server that came by our table had a warm smile, and they were all eager to bring more sushi to our tummy.  I will definitely return. (You will find me at the sushi bar avoiding the awkward room of too close dining.)

JEWiDI-J43tbLz-PdKfxGA.text: Yama Sushi is your typical AYCE sushi joint. They have a large number of rolls available, although they mostly taste the same except for some texture differences. If you're hungry for sushi and want a bargain, try this place out.

KZdnNb1osCVlc4P9hYbSSg.text: Live about 25 minuets away and I wasn't disappointed!! It was so good!! We went around 6 and the place was poppin!! I like the environment and the staff and food was good.. don't be fooled by the outside it looks sketchy but worth the 25 dollars!!

VYjotMFYAvLiqwpzZbXW2Q.text: I love YAMA! Great sushi spot and so happy that I've now moved closer to the location. I absolutely love their seafood salad. Great AYCE menu. The wait can be quite a turn off but if you go with a party of two or solo the seating is timeless. I haven't gone to the location and it be empty....there's a wait if you go when they open or right before they close. The staff is friendly and the food is great. What more can you ask for??

9TPZ2iAyKTgBAgdU4TNkDA.text: Love love LOVE this place. Incredible sushi, great service for a cheap price.  The Wet Dream Roll is quite possibly the best roll I've ever had. Mouthwatering bliss.

AD5i78q8H28kaD8gTSJddg.text: DO NOT ORDER THE SWEET SHRIMP. The seafood salad is banging though. I always use the left over sauce for dipping.

OvPptv633bMl4GmgMNDRgQ.text: First off i have to say, i was never really into raw fish; my sushi included california. Thats all.  After coming to this place I've try many different kinds of fish and other sea creatures! which all were very DEEEELLLISHHH! All you can eat is Very cheap! Wait time can sometimes be long but well worth the price of how great the food is! also sakebombs are not badly priced. I normally spend about $50-60 dollars here on sundays nights. We got in about 10 3/4th sized sake bombs!  Pretty good / strong buzz! The rice in our stomach kept us from being TOO drunk! We plan on going to this place every other Sunday or at least once a month!  Very good place to go!

GKTwbyfhrmSwSXNVUaGNDg.text: I love this place, the service is always friendly and everything is fresh.  And unlike a lot of sushi places in town the place is always packed no matter what time of day.  We usually sit at the bar so there isn't a wait but if you have to wait its well worth the time.  And do yourself a favor and get the "No Name" roll its soooo yummy!!!!

n015mJPo2N1PiR5ebzlN5g.text: Delish! I had an awesome experience here at this all you can eat sushi restaurant. I enjoyed myself here and ate a gazillion rolls. The service was great.. They kept checking on us to see if we wanted more to eat. I had to hide the menu because they kept coming over thinking we wanted more!
