The sushi roll names were catchy: Man whore, superman, wet dream, strip tease. You get the idea. Only in vegas!   I especially liked the wet dream. CA ROLL baked with cream cheese and topped with shrimp.   I also liked the TNT. Oh gawd! Delicious. Spicy tuna. jalapeno.. could have used more cream cheese but it was good. Because it was fried, the tuna had a new texture.. but it was awesome!!!  Go here with a big appetite!! I'm serious. Don't eat the whole day. Oh.. and bring your strechy pants because I wore skinny jeans.. and well, you get the picture! LOL.   Las Vegas, you've done well with your all you can eat sushi joints. The one here in San Jose, CA has nothing on you!

tfrXNcrP7Cl5QymFcRCI7w.text: 5 words ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI. No name sushi is a must try! AYCE is not limited to the sushi you can have just about anything from that menu. The food is delicious a must eat in Vegas come hungry and you will leave happy.

SaE_OOiW_QacZtCjt9FGRA.text: Wow, Yama sushi certainly has changed since I was last here.  A couple years ago I used to go to Yama Sushi at least once a week, but since moving away from Vegas I have only been able to make it here about once a year or so. The other night I saw a side of Yama I had never seen before.   After reading recent reviews on Yelp I realized that Yama is fairly popular and busy now so we opted to go early about 4pm. Even at 4pm (on a Friday night) it was packed and only got more and more crowded as the night went on. For as crowded as they were I have to say that the service was fairly decent. It took 10-15 minutes for someone to get to us to take our initial order, but after that it was pretty smooth.  If you sit at the sushi bar you can give your order directly to the sushi chef, but if you sit at a table, like we did, the server will come around and ask what you want. You can order as many round as you like if you are ordering AYCE, which it seemed most people were. Things came out one-at-a-time which I liked as opposed to all arriving at once and they didnt take long at all, especially for how busy they were. As I said before I am still amazed at the quality of the sushi here for AYCE.  Again we ordered the seafood salad which is such a crazy deal to be included in AYCE. Basically it is a plate of sashimi chunks (ours was salmon, tuna and albacore) mixed with some hot sauce (you can choose none or mild as well) and placed on a bed of daikon. Thats it. Awesome.  Overall the sushi was of very good quality and the service was fine. Personally I dont care to eat in a VERY crowded environment with lots of loud people around, so Yama has been slightly tarnished in my book, but otherwise it is a great deal.

9-YWVG4mjD6JMYw3vRmMqw.text: Maybe I had a bad day here. I always enjoy Yama everytime I come to Vegas but the last visit has made me never want to come back here ever again. Don't get me wrong, the food here is great and you can't beat $20 for all you can eat  for lunch. Came here with two other friends on our first day in Vegas.   We were really excited to have our friends try this place since I always rave about it so much. We started off with two orders of palm jobs and a few cut rolls. During the course of our meal, we also ordered the Hamachi Kama which is yellow tail collar. What came out from the kitchen was not that at all. The fish was dry and tasteless. My friend who also works at a japanese restaurant pointed it out that it was in fact not the collar cut that they had given us but in fact the part of the tail which explained why the fish was so dry. Other than that everything else was really good. Absolutely loved the spicy seafood salad! Make sure you try at least one and remember limit one per person!   Definitely make good use of it and try everything. I love how Yama lets you order a half roll instead of a full giving you more options to try a little bit of everything.  But like I said food was great, however service was utterly terrible. The hispanic looking girl we had serve us must've had a really bad day. From the moment she came to our table to the end of our meal she never failed to have a frown on her face. I can put up with bad service or slow servers, but this girl was flat out rude. We had a really sweet asian girl help us for most of our meal hence the 2 stars since our server was rarely ever at our table to help us. Towards the end of our meal we ordered ice cream to finish off. Our b*tchy waitress also happen to be the one who brought it out. She barely made it to our table before she tossed the bowls at us and walked away. I was so appalled that I literally grabbed for the check and took back our tip and left her with merely change. She didn't even have the decency to place the bowl on the table but rather yet threw it at us like we were dogs.   Overall: *1 star for the amazing food *1 star for the sweet asian server *Management should really look into retraining the server we had

0RiRYweqyg8vRXBufoBlOg.text: I actually walked out of this place feeling pretty criminal, as I ate WAY more than twenty three bucks worth of sushi. I've mentioned in previous reviews that I'm teaching my teenaged brother all the important gourmet things in life, so he doesn't grow up an uncultured twat. All you can eat sushi is a pretty awesome way to let him go nuts on different sushi without fear, especially now that he can use chopsticks without looking like a doofus.   The food: well, it's not Katsu of Chicago, but what the fuck is, you know what I'm saying? The rolls are good but not astoundingly creative, the fish was fresh, the price was right. "Sun on the Beach", labeled 'best', was indeed best of the rolls I had - it was appropriately kicky. The roll with the squid in it was also good, as the squid was well and fresh.  In addition to the rolls, I had the giant clam and octopus - octopus was a bit chewy but within reason. Giant clam was lovely. I topped this off with red bean ice cream, which was the perfect end to my meal.  Service: waitress very efficient, didn't notice any hassling about time limit or how much I was ordering. She kept the water refreshed like it was her life's work. Sushi chefs typically brusk. It's not like you pay them to be friendly, you pay them to roll and slice as fast as possible.  My teenaged brother was very impressed, and for the price we will probably be trying to hit this place regularly. Can't beat a steal.

fGLRTPReLq46SFEHwweNWA.text: AYCE Nigiri, sashimi, rolls, appetizers, desserts... seriously?! It's real people. They even have UNI. And SOFT SHELLED CRAB.  We ate until we were ready to EXPLODE. Fish quality was good, not spectacular. They ran out of uni, so I was bummed, but the dishes were ordered made up for it.  The seafood salad - not creamy - was a great start. Chunks of salmon, tuna, snapper dressed with a very addictive rice wine vinaigrette and shredded turnip.  Mackeral was good. I love it despite its oily fishiness. It's one of my favorite textures to eat.  Service was fast and friendly. I would definitely recommend this place to groups because you can share and eat a crapton of different items.  The restaurant is small and fills up really fast, but we were seated within 5 minutes.

WQhm0q_PixdTyiPE-7nkRA.text: Yama has the biggest portions for the most reasonable price. As a frequent sushi eater I can't eat anywhere else without this type of satisfactory. All you can eat is a major plus and I love their wet dream, (baked roll). It's right off the strip so it's good for tourists too!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WN_KAFksllbm2blRGA81zw.text: Food was decent, love the soft shell crabs. A lot of their special wasn't available since it is Labor Day weekend. Service was superb , can't complaint  Price was decent for a tourist town , would go back when visit again

1qUelQOvXb4XiyioUF0F-Q.text: Forget the pricey buffets at the big name hotels. Come to Yama Sushi for the best buffet deal in town. It's only $21 for lunch and $23 for dinner for AYCE sushi. Unlike most AYCE sushi joints, Yama offers uni, hamachi kama, sweet shrimp, etc. (limit 1 plate per person for most). There's almost never a wait, and the sushi quality is decent for what you're paying.   There's several items that I always get. The uni is a coin flip, but I've had pretty good tastings recently. I like the sweet shrimp, but I'm not a fan of the fried variety that accompanies it. The hamachi kama is huge and is sure to fill you up. My favorite roll to order is the wet dream, which comes as a baked cali roll with shrimp, cream cheese, and finished with sweet yam sauce. I always end with an order of white tuna nigiri (buttery goodness).   If you don't like rice, start with the seafood salad, which is a poor man's chirashi bowl. Skip the soft shell crab, which is too fried for my liking. Lastly, save room for dessert as you can order ice cream mochi and two scoops of ice cream. The mango mochi is fantastic and I'm a big fan of the green tea and plum ice creams.

uYd6SDpiiw60OhxxKv5dxA.text: Not the best AYCE sushi based on quality, service, ambiance, location, and flavor.  Most of the rolls (including nigiri) were a little too spicy. The service was slow which was expected on a busy Saturday night. There was repeated inaccurate sushi orders. The price is cheaper than some others (goyemon, etc). The location is shady and parking is scarce.  *update We had a birthday celebration for a friend and...they brought the birthday 'cake' to the wrong table after lowering the lights and playing birthday music

TSHcPmBxkm_G2VA4gyR3DA.text: This is a gem of the place if you're like me and you hate going to begas for business.    A very short cab ride from the strip, away from the glitz and over produced everything in a little mall is a pack sushi place with an all you can eat menu (don't order too much, it'll cost extra)   In short, this place is excellent.  The fact that it is very affordable with a wonderful selection is just an added bonus.  We'd been tipped off to this place by a cab driver and that was the best thing about my week long stay.

ctKBs4b8XEFrLxhs7aVZpw.text: It was a day like most days. Here we were with our friends, enjoying the great sushi at Yama. Suddenly, it struck us that something was missing. There we were with no music playing as the silence struck us. An overwhelming feeling of disappointment swept over our group as we lost all desire to have a good time. Our night was ruined. I will never again eat here.

FcLImnIbD5dmsNg1FaDygw.text: Great sushi, Sun of the Beach was the best, but don't get the triple chili spicy sushi if you don't wanna visit the restroom often, it was too spicy. The sushi here is very fancy with porno names and many ingredients. Years ago I could finish 5-6 plates of buffet, but now i can barely do 4 plates. Don't eat too much or you will be charged for each plate you don't finish. If you finish half of a plate you'll be charged for half of that plate and you can take it home in a to-go box. I recommend simple sushi, with less ingredients, if you don't wanna get too full.

pJQaeF4-iBlya91W7zQksQ.text: If the waitress wasn't as good as she was id rate this place a bit lower. But other than good staff the restraunts extremely busy, extremely cramped and extremely loud. The sushi itself wasn't anything special. I dinned here with 5 other guests and we shared our sushi as we all have different taste. Each one was alright nothing special. All I know is that you could probably find better sushi elsewhere.  But other than all that it's pretty lively here. It's clean, food arrives fast, the staffs friendly, and what should be warm is warm. All you can eat with anything on the menu except the desserts apparently.

4DhiNDpRMQTUudcDxMYUow.text: The food is outstanding. A must try.  All is good so good.  Try the Seafood Salad its bad ass.  And a good pick!!!!!   Try the wet dream. It hot too!!!!

MLthn3Bznevj_EePs3v96Q.text: In the land of the AYCE buffet, why not an AYCE sushi joint?  I must admit, this was not my first choice, but I was with a big group, and this was the consensus spot.  For about $25, I was stuffed with what was actually decent sushi and tasty rolls.  No, you are not going to get sashimi, and the fish quality is middle of the road, but it is not bad.  There are also some cooked items, like salmon collar, which are really tasty.  I can't make any specific recommendations, since I don't recall the names of the things we had, but nothing came out that I shied away from (except the uni, which I don't eat even at the really good places).

ImAOoukEsZZc80gWJJfzWw.text: Went there for lunch.  Very good.  Staff was nice.  They have all the standard sushi offerings, plus a bunch of creative specialties.  Lunch is around $20 all you can eat.  No buffet, pretty much just order whatever you want off the menu.  Good with 3-4 people, everyone shares, try a lot of things that way.

Hb7bb7Q4P04x2TDcSGUijw.text: We love this place. Its a must stop when we are visiting. We use to live in Las Vegas but now reside in Portland Oregon where they don't have AYCE.. say whhhaaaattt. I know CRAZY. but that what makes visiting this restaurant even better. This visit was on a Sunday night with 7 other people. A Full restaurant at that. but they service is always great, it was good this time.. we had a couple dishes we didn't order placed on our table. Then we noticed one that had been on our table for about 20 minutes and the waitress took it and gave it to the table behind us.!! WHAT?! now that was just terrible (what if we sneezed on it, which we didn't ) but not okay with any of us. The price for AYCE dinner is $24.95 I believe. Staff is all friendly. The Restaurant is clean. Always a line out the door/people waiting outside for a table. Good sign right?! I would say if you like sushi this is a place to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w0WfUKLf5TwoezVDCaxx9w.text: Man oh man .... Hangry much?! This is the place for ayce sushi .... well for me at least  ..... very creative names for the food with taste to match ..... Awesomeness in my book ....  Beware though ..... call to see how long the line is ..... other than that keep on grubbin!!!!

qbOYLMzV3Aw3mTkIikXiTg.text: It's around 22$ all u can eat!! The Nigiri and roll options for me are a better choice then the special rolls since they have less sauces and 'extras' that's just takes away the simplicity and tastes of what's good about sushi! Fantastic value, great service and great sushi! Would come back

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NtGxL4ecH91Q9E0qDEzb2w.text: This place is fantastic! There was a little wait in the beginning because the place was packed but nevertheless, my friend and I were seated almost right away. We both order different kinds of sushi and the sushi we liked the most "Special Yobo Roll." It was AMAZING! It felt like it melted on the top of your tongue. Defiantly recommend trying!  I'd highly recommend this place to anyone and will be back again very soon :-)

oYgrx7feGVwNG-WBFtVaSA.text: AYCE sushi for $25. As good as can be expected.  We started with the seafood salad prepared spicy which was our favorite dish. There's a heaping portion of cubed and sliced sashimi of tuna, yellowtail, and salmon. The spicy sauce was slightly tart and did not overpower the fish.   We also had some sashimi, Harry potter roll, hamachi kama, wet dream roll, and the soft shell crab appetizer (which was overlooked).   You can have one mochi and two icecreams per person with the all you can eat. We enjoyed a chocolate mochi, vanilla mochi, and a plum ice cream.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow tail nigiri and tuna nigiri nice fresh fish but too much rice
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California Roll

CsfSwWBPP6pV7Oy6rqGlUw.text: This is a good all you can eat place! Everything on the menu can be ordered. Here are some of the items we ordered -   hamachi (yellow tail) collar - it's my first time eating this and it's pretty good. It's grilled and a huge piece!   Soft shell crab - just ok. Too breaded for my taste.  Sashimi salad - sooo good! Must order!   Seaweed salad - very flavorful for a salad   Fried mussels, Baked mussels and tempura - very good  All items are good portions and their rolls are all pretty good as well.

A5X0P0R7uwXgMXicwL4zxA.text: Don't know what the hype is about this place. Thin slices of fish and packed with rice.

U_FPeu_CPpb6vlYmhZ-evg.text: Always a gamble trying different AYCE sushi places.  Since this one was highly recommended by a friend, we decided to give it a go!  As a positive, I noticed the service was very fast and efficient...food orders came out quickly, orders were taken, drinks refilled, etc.  But the quality and cuts were not very impressive.  And they added a very sweet ponzu to a lot of the nigiri...distracting actually.  Perhaps to hide the quality of fish?  The ahi / tuna nigiri I was served was actually embarrassing...I didn't even take a photo of it LOL.  Just a really rough cut, poor coloring, and did not taste fresh even during a fully-packed night.  The amaebi was not cut/butterflied like all others I've had before, so it was a bit chewy and didn't melt in your mouth.  The uni was also runny in consistency.  Besides the sake / salmon, I didn't really taste anything "fresh" in my opinion.  I just wasn't impressed with anything here....but I found plenty to be underwhelmed.   Good luck!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Little Foodie ate up his Amaebi....Fried Shrimp Heads!
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amaebi. Sorry, not the best pic, but you can see they do not butterfly the tails here :(
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi Kama...very different sizes served. They were cooked well and were good.

-RE70wxlXgLBV7ld3FnU1w.text: This place is awesome!! We both got the all-you-can-eat and if you come hungry, it's definitely worth it. I had all different sorts of sushi from the menu and they all tasted great. The sushi chefs were very friendly too. There was also much ordering of their teriyaki chicken, which was very tender and had a freshly made taste to it. The variety of items on the AYCE plan was definitely satisfactory, as was the quality. I will definitely go back here again! They also have normal sit-down dining with a variety of Japanese dishes.

9TCXR9sdy6LcurAYdb-GaA.text: I enjoy coming here for the AYCE they have many options to choose from. For a reasonable price! Sushi is delicious. Wet dream being my favorite! Place is a bit squishy don't really have much privacy. But it's totally worth it! Service is great too. In a very bad area but like I said totally worth it! Thanks Yama sushi!!!

xnhHM_hxp-Wmz0kgnwzx0w.text: Love the all you can eat. Reasonably priced and a wide variety to choose from.  My favorite is the Sea food Salad...but sadly you can only order one in the all you can eat meal.

p7__wRkNcxC7tQjOyzwteA.text: I love this place!!!!! The rolls are fabulous and the appetizers are to die for. I always get the short ribs and seriously we go to town on the appetizer last time we order 12 orders for 5 people! Service is good only down side is there always so many people the place is packed all day all night so wait time could be anywhere 15 min to 60 min. But damn I'll wait!!!!!

JaFC7QqCT2u1T4HorI_78g.text: Yummmmmm Love their sushi. I have gone here a few times its always good food.  The place is close to the Vegas strip so it is always busy.  It also is close to UNLV. The place is in a small shopping plaza atmosphere it is ok casual at best. The staff is always friendly. Took a large group of friends once had a great time. Their signature roll is the best on the menu.

pgjf2bR7eIew7CNglVIGXg.text: Wet Dream, Man Whore, Kiss the Ass...  No I'm not talking about another Vegas strip club adventure, but the best all you can eat sushi in LV for the money.  These are the names of some of the creative and more popular rolls in case you were wondering.  Premium Sushi. All You Can Eat. Great Deal!  Atmosphere: Yama Sushi is located off the strip and hidden next to a CVS within an Albertson's parking lot.  This secret gem is one of the places that I visit whenever I'm in town and I'm always sure to bring along my friends...and so far all have given the thumbs up!  The restaurant is small, but depending on what time you arrive finding a seat is not a problem.  The decor is what you expect, nothing more and nothing less.  Staff: Very friendly and attentive.  Sushi is served quick and fast.  Appetizers are also made to order and delivered in a timely manner.  The sushi chef's are all well trained.  Jun the manager is the man!  I highly recommend sitting at the bar in front of him and asking for him to surprise you with his tasty secret treats.  Food: Let me say this again...the sushi is premium.  Not the crap you find at other chain sushi spots like Niko Niko.  This is why you gotta love Vegas and the daily drops of the freshest of the fresh fish from around the world.  The AYCE menu consists of everything from appetizers, salads, soup, sushi, handrolls, cut rolls, and dessert.  Yes you can get as much red bean, green tea ice cream or mango mochi as you want!  All the appetizers are yummy.  I especially like the bbq ribs, the soft shell crab, and the hamachi kama.  These alone give you your money's worth!  I've been to this place many many times over the last 5 years and my favorite sushi is the "Sexy Salmon" just like a normal salmon sushi, but with a thin slice of lemon, jalapeno, and ponzu sauce.    **Tip 1: If you don't want to fill yourself too fast try ask for a 1/2 order of the rolls instead.  This gives you about 4 pieces of the roll rather than 8.  **Tip 2: If you feel adventurous or enjoy a good handroll ask for one of their specialty rolls, but as a handroll i.e. the TNT roll as a handroll.  If you're there and sit by the bar try to find my business card...hint it's the only bright red one with a thumbprint on it.

GbpBp0Zx67_6bIgyFqTVoA.text: From the East Coast - in town for work - staying on the strip but armed with a rental car for a few days. They had AYCE - but we opted for ordering four rolls - all great stuff - sitting amongst regular local folks - it was nice to feel like you were at home and not get gouged because you are in Las Vegas. Would recommend that anyone who comes to town take the rental car/bus/taxi to this place and enjoy a great meal!!!

t0utK_LP13i7zxryiV24Vw.text: This is a good spot to go if you are hungry. AYCE sushi! And they have specialty rolls you can order too. We didn't think we were going to eat so much so we didn't do the AYCE but we should have because our bill came out to more than what it would have been if we paid the AYCE. We will definetly be back next time we are in town.

LGHSWhFwPjL8JfXsGykAUw.text: 6 words--- great all you can eat sushi!  They have a regular menu also but the ayce sushi is sooooo good and it's great quality.  Can't say enough I stop here every time I'm in town.

0S63X2tOmfxZ7BGQFSLO5g.text: I recently went to Las Vegas to celebrate Thanksgiving for a change of pace. My sister lives just outside of the strip, and as we joked about how to properly expand our stomachs for Thursday's impending feast, she raved about Yama Sushi.   I've never been to an all you can eat Sushi place with such high quality rolls. The food was great, brought out to the table as it was made. The service was wonderful, and again, the food was great. I think I took care of 35 pieces before I called uncle. Uncle was impressed. Somehow I saved room for dessert, and the interesting ice cream flavors were a nice contrast to the pounds of raw fish and rice I had eaten.   I vow to return each time I'm in Sin City to indulge in the sin of gluttony. Sweet, delicious, gluttony.

avI-WNvLtvpBZgtTWBC5PA.text: Went here on a Monday night and it was packed.  Host brought me a beer while I waited for a table.  This place is great.  $23 for all you can eat for 2 hours!!!  Clean, well-staffed and super fresh sushi.  Service was excellent and the sushi arrived fast.  Worth the trip off the Strip if you are hungry for sushi.

UvMlCpNAF-Hzw7DwLhJC4Q.text: Reasonably Priced...great selection  The Staff is highly efficient and the orders are delivered fast!  Whenever we're in Vegas, YAMA is the place to go...  We tend to spend the $$$ for the Wicked Spoons and Bachannals but YAMA Sushi really tends to be the best value.

83sI3oklfuUGAwkAcdQJkQ.text: I love this place! All you can eat for $20!!! You won't be able to beat that in Las Vegas. Everytime I am in town I hit this place up. The sushi is fresh, it's not cheap california based rolls or nasty rice. I'm telling you, if you like sushi, you will fall in love with this place. They offer all the premium sushi as well at no extra charge. It's the only place I will eat uni at since it's normally pricey. The fish has a nice a consistency to it as well. I suggest trying the seafood salad,it's all sashimi with a spicy ponzu dipping sauce. They also include dessert in the all you can eat price.  The establishment is extremely clean and the staff is amazing! From the moment you walk in you are greeted and seated almost immediately. As soon as you are seated a waitress will come by and take your orders for beverages. We always had full beverages, we didn't have to sit around waiting for someone to come by and ask if we were ok. If you want excellent service, this place is impressive.   I can't wait until my birthday since it will be the next time I get to eat some sushi there. Soemthing to look forward to in an otherwise expensive Las Vegas.

E7gP2CAL4yjYs21NMoAQ-A.text: Best Sushi in Vegas. Always fresh always crowded. Be ready to wait for table for at least 30 minutes.

E00w9xgBddqG99-Nqz0XhA.text: I LOOVE Yama Sushi. Everytime I go to Vegas, I have to have it!!! I loove their wet dream roll the best!!! But everything else is sooo good and fresh.   Service is also great here!!!   I say ditch the buffets on the strip and go to Yama sushi where it is affordable and all you can eat and DEFINITELY worth your money!!!!! mmmmmmmmmm

z4lByFJbMWJtPwwZJrtj0g.text: All-you-can-eat Sushi...what a concept!! This place was awesome. Went there for the first time last week. Other than the long wait for seats Yama Sushi is great. Do the All-you-can-eat (roughly $25/person dinner)...the sushi is freshly made when you order. A lot of custom sushi rolls with creative names like "one minute man" and "man whore." Go in a group and order as many rolls as you want because you can all share. They say they'll charge you if you don't finish everything but I don't think they really do.   Highly recommend this place!

c_M_AjtXUfA6ac9WJx2NIA.text: Best sushi experience of my life. Delicious sushi at $20 for all you can eat (lunch), including EVERYTHING on the menu (premium rolls, appetizers etc etc).  Wait staff checked in very regularly during our meal and were always around to take our next order and take plates away. Amazing service. We gave a 30% tip, which I've only ever done once or twice before.

WvcOAVyHnzilFxCAbPsoeg.text: Referred here by a local examiner - Awesome service - great food and fresh sushi!   Could tell it was a hit when we walked up to a strip mall next to an Albertson's and there was a line out the door - 30-40 min wait!      A True diamond in the rough!    Perfectly cut sushi - super fresh and a great atmosphere!    A+ in my book!

pQM81wEmiR6qUQSyxc2-QA.text: Delicious sushi, fast service and reasonable price for all you can eat. The Sun of the Beach roll was amazing, as well as the seafood and seaweed salads.

rE5wnmDM3cQY90WcrBhbeA.text: Rice was not sushi rice, not a huge selection of rolls.  The cuts of fish were very generous which I did like, but the rice killed the thrill of the nigiri.  23 bucks for dinner is a good price but for 4 bucks more I would rather go elsewhere.  Small, but clean, and quick service took it from two stars to 3.  Very friendly staff and attentive, could see issues if going at a prime time hour due to size of restaraunt.

Sd7RRzTqmbk-6qF87aVAaw.text: The place was highly recommended by several repeat customers.  Non-pretentious, strip mall location but the sushi was well enjoyed by all in our party of 6.  We each ordered the all-you-can-eat and shared our selections with each other.  It was a great sushi experience in a casual, comfortable setting.  The only negatives I can think of are that the location is too small, they definitely need more space, and they were really busy, which caused a mix up of our returning change...first I got too little and then I got too much.  But all of that was minor considering the awesome sushi we had. Only improvement I would suggest is to add more room cause they definitely have people waiting to be seated!

ICDZOZqlUNJRt5U1Mthclg.text: My reason for giving this place 2 stars is the incredibly slow service. Every roll we ordered took about a half an hour or more to be received by our party.  We even waited 45 mins for a California roll.   The sushi it self was nothing spectacular. Everything is covered in mayo that has little to no flavor. 15$ for regular rolls. It makes me miss the place I go to back home. Sorry guys.  My opinion to you guys is to speed up the service. The building isn't even fully booked and the service was still slow.

l3x91IKEvCAjy0_rEuGzPw.text: Ask any sushi aficionado who has been in Las Vegas for at least one week where the best rolls may be had and the answer is always Yama Sushi.  Located in one of the city's lower-class areas, this strip-mall inhabitant does serve some of the best, freshest and most innovative fare in the genre.  Another of those AYCE places - All You Can Eat - Yama offers its own take on both the traditional , read: Sea Urchin, California Roll, etc. and the new and/or unconventional, such as rolls with provocative name like Happy Ending and Minute Man.  Crunch is the newest element to pervade American sushi, and it is in great supply here, with Panko doing its best to supply the umami.  With individual prices up to $16.95 per roll, even a finicky diner may almost eat a couple of hundred dollars worth of good food for a lunch price of $22.05, with tax.  I enjoyed my favorite, Ikura, a.k.a. Salmon Roe, with the addition of a raw quail egg slithering atop.  The large, ruby pearls burst a refreshing brininess which complimented the unctuousness of the tiny egg.  Other winning rolls are pretty much anything listed, though my palate leans toward the spicy and sauced versions.  Special items allow one per customer, and are marked accordingly.  These include a nicely fried soft shell crab and Salmon Hama, or Cheek of Salmon, a veritable slab of barely cooked salmon meat which could be a nice, small meal in itself, with a bowl of the salty Miso soup and a seaweed salad.  Service can be a bit like a roller coaster, sometimes right on target, other times perfunctory.  And, as with many Asian eateries in this country, their website is, to put it mildly, a disaster.   But you are not going to the restaurant for their web skills, right?  As with any AYCE locale, sushi or otherwise, arrive hungry and do not rush.  Also, pay attention to the menu's various disclaimers and warnings, including one advising diners to eat ALL their rice, lest they be charged for ala carte dining.  A bit harsh, but these creations are not average, buffet-style chunks of rice with a rumor of fish.  They are full-bodied and flavorful, so... eat it and enjoy!

hbL92FSI-K3KCYmAuevXBw.text: After hearing that there is no good sushi in Las Vegas due to a lack of ... Oceans ... I decided to venture out into the desert wilderness a 5 min drive down flamingo road from Caesers Palace to the restaurant.  The place was bustling with patrons, waiting in every available seat and standing inside and outside waiting for a table.  Obviously, this place was well known and popular.  A good sign indeed.  I went inside and was miraculously seated at the bar without any wait (birthday luck I guess).  I embarked on the best all you can eat (ayce) sushi experience ever.  Fresh fish, balanced proportion of rice to fish (an ayce rarity) and the most expedient and friendly sushi chefs.  I tried the Yama roll and something with soy paper, soft shell crab, scallop and crunchies that melted in my mouth. Let's not forget the 4 orders of mouth wattering albacore, my two handrolls, and a reorder of the Yama roll as a handroll.  When it was all done I even got mochi ice cream and regular ice cream.  Ayce + dessert in the desert was a rare bonus.  For $23 bucks for dinner, I will be coming back here everytime I come to Vegas.  The service staff were so unbelievably attentive and nice; going above and beyond.   This place deserves 6 stars.  I'm going to dream about these rolls now; don't go anywhere else, this is the real deal.  YamaZing!

rz5A8AcJ7dohTbAYXNAaXw.text: Holy cow, this place is always awesome! The best rolls in my opinion  -sun of a beach -no name roll -strip tease -wet dreams They're all amazing though and for appetizers I extremely suggest  -bbq ribs -spicy seafood salad -garlic tuna -shrimp tempura  You barely ever have to wait to order more sushi when you're already seated, the wait to be seated is a little sucky but only on weekends! Totally worth the wait and the service is on top and super appreciated!

ngF6H-AKUCmRPXJlhJuqXQ.text: I'm from the east coast where there's not such thing as all you can eat sushi so I was ecstatic to go to this place. I went on a Friday night and there was a 50 minute wait to get seated. They do not take reservations so I could not have called in advance.  When we finally got seated, the ordering began. Our waiter was very helpful and knowledgeable about the menu. I quickly ordered all the rolls I've scoped down on the internet based on reviews here. The rolls looked delectable and the taste was good for the first few bites. After I wharfed down a roll though, the fun wore off and I realized the sushi was good but not THAT good. What I did not like was every roll was drizzled with a sweet mayonnaise or eel sauce. There was hardly a roll we ordered that did not contain some form of cloying rich sauce. For our final roll (as we were reaching our intake limit), we asked our waiter if there was a roll that was lighter and not drenched in sauces. He recommended the happy ending roll. This was a light salmon roll topped with sliced lemons and scallions..pretty light and refreshing.  There were plenty of other options on the all you can eat menu other than sushi. One dish I thoroughly enjoyed and got seconds and thirds of were the green shell mussels. I forgot what it was called but there were only 2 mussel dishes and one was battered. I'm talking about the non-battered cheaper mussel item. The desserts were also very good. I especially recommend the red bean ice cream!  I'm giving this place 4 stars because I'm sure there are better all you can eat sushi places out there that do not load their rolls with so much sauce, I couldn't even taste the fish in the rolls anymore.

0rZoBqCGnY22BYp3tUllEg.text: ..I have ordered sweet shrimp,uni and seafood saladI think the raw foods aren't fresh enough to eat..The sushi chef is very  friendly,Sever was great and busters did great work...

1lVZyOkk7Zc1v2lKJ5bapA.text: Was introduced to this place about two weeks ago and have been thee twice! Really think the sushi is great and the service is pretty good.  The first time for dinner there was a good amount of people and the wait could be long. The location is good but the restaurant itself is kind of small.  Lunch is great Prices are good! Suggest an all you can eat!

2Pxg10_YKUu1UEMKl2OVgg.text: To me yama sushi is the best ayce and its a lot affordable compared to others ayce I don't mind the wait tried the halibut sushi the happy rainbow and no name you cannot be dissapointed if you love sushi you'll understand what I mean

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ellin roll superman and dance in the sheet delicious

oyfA05C3qU7wD8wev-tP2A.text: Great place! I went there with my girlfriend to "all you can eat" dinner. The staff was great, especially Jose the sushi man! great sushi, cozy place, fast service and great price.  definitely will go there again soon!

VzoI8N2nhcbl-yYscAsIoQ.text: Always great!!  Super fresh and for some reason the water is sooo good lol.  I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White tuna, garlic tuna and scallop nigiri.

GY6jA9mMtoXWE_ace5qqag.text: The quality of this place has gone down the drain. Each time i come here they never have the sweet shrimp and yet its still listed on their menu. Also there are no such thing as white tuna. It is actually a fish called escolar and they are required to disclose this on their menu. They don't. Google Escolar and you will see how harmful this fish is by consuming it. Services are slow on purpose and the all fishes are not fresh. Yuck!

HLWRTSgKGezlBcQwViWGQA.text: The food is excellent but the sushi chef is rude. Victor is giving of really bad vibes. It's as if he is trying to make me feel uncomfortable. I really enjoy the food and every other time I can't here I really enjoyed it, but because of the way I'm being treated I will find a new sushi place to frequent. It's a real shame.  Tldr: Victor has a horrible attitude, thus I week find a new sushi place.

Q7WFaeymkKFmw7OuDDS4xA.text: Yelper Elnino F. and I came for noms and left disappointed.   APPETIZERS- Soft Shell Crab- big, good and very crisp panko breading. Sashimi Salad- spicy and tangy. very generously big portion of mixed fish- mostly tuna, salmon though Saba- grilled saba was pretty decent  ROLLS-  No Name- recommended and popular. I ordered a half and the guy gave me a whole roll. I wouldn't have minded if it was good, but it was sauce flavor and not much else. It had just one piece of tempura surrounded by too much rice,soy paper, thin slice of fish outside and a lot of sweet sauce, mayo and crunchies. There wasn't a marriage of flavor here with the ingredients- just sauce and rice.   I dared to get no more rolls but tried a few pieces of Elnino's and the rolls were just about the sauce. All rolls are cali, spicy tuna, tempura based or mayo scallop and I was hoping for more fish based rolls.   NIGIRI-  Yellowtail- it was okay and not as fresh/flavorful as I hoped Albacore- this was seriously fucking disgusting. It was mushy and fell apart in my mouth. WTF? I've had some mediocre pieces in AYCE but this fish was seriously mishandled in defrosting to get such a bad mouth feel. Mackerel-  This was fine and good so I ordered a bunch of this. Salmon- this was alright as far as salmon goes.  Eel- good, but that's pretty standard eel from a package so how can you screw up?  They slice the fish big, but the rice was also big. It wasn't proportional ratios of rice to fish on most orders.  I do not like that everything was presliced as that also affects the texture of fish if it isn't used right away. The rice was warm as it should, but too warm that some of the more delicate fish become warm with it and doesn't make for the optimal flavor or mouthfeel of what nigiri is- firm,cool fish marrying with a lightly warm, fluffy rice.   Service was decent. The servers were on the refills of drinks and our server was nice and made suggestions at the beginning to let us know that's popular. We were checked on and asked several times if they can put any appetizer orders. The sushi men were busy but orders came out in a reasonable amount of time. A few things were forgotten, but probably good since the rice was filling and I was ordering like I would at any other joint. One thing that bothered me as we were sitting and waiting on our first order, I was talking to Elnino about my favorite sushi spot and the sushi guy chimed in how it  is no good and defended how theirs is way better. That bothered me as they weren't asked to be in the convo and most importantly it didn't deliver competitively on the freshness and fair rice ratio.   I was thinking hard about the rating, but this is definitely a place I won't return to. The albacore was the worst I've ever had and I can't shake off how unappetizing it was to continue after that piece. I like to have variety but I was put off and stuck to mackerel as it was the only thing I knew was good.   I had this on my "Must Try" based on some rave reviews from Yelper friends but I looked back and I see that most of those were from over a year ago. Something must have changed. Yes the price people keep talking about, but seriously $22.95 isn't really that much of a price discount from most $26.95 places that for the $4 are much better. This place was packed but it was mostly roll type people and college kids. There isn't a good AYCE nearby as competition either.   I'm with Anna S.- don't believe the hype!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Albacore, Mackerel, Yellowtail- too much rice

V_zCVx0p229F4mFrcAjwdA.text: This is my go to sushi spot when at work or near UNLV. They have an awesome assortment of rolls and sauces are very good. My favorite things to order are the seafood salad at mild spiciness, wet dream roll, one minute man stuffed shrimp and Harry potter roll. Everything has great flavor and the fish if fresh.  Only downside is the servers and if you are with someone who is not doing all you can eat the staff glares at you to make sure you are not sharing. Come on don't make me feel like I am a child... We won't share!!!!

D7cdcSWZh9YfRW1yv5vdjA.text: Luck would have it that this place is right behind the bank I go to after office meetings on Thursday nights. I never gave it a chance because looking at it from the bank all I saw was a big red sign that said SUSHI. That and it's location on the east side was a red flag to me.   Finally, about a month ago I finished my meetings and I was so hungry I didn't care about previous red flags. When I got close enough I saw that this was THE Yama Sushi I've heard about from so many people. Definitely made me happier walking in to try it out.   It was packed but I was solo so I didn't wait long for a seat at the bar. Compared to other AYCE spots I found the menu very intriguing from the start because of the sexually themed rolls. I base my review of AYCE sushi places based on the quality of the sushi since I don't get a lot of rolls. My favorite place (I won't name it) still has better quality sushi but the quality here is very good and the portions are massive! The sushi they laid across the rice was probably 3 times the size of my favorite place. To wrap up my night there I had to order the Manwhore roll. The presentation was amazing and the roll was great too! To top it off the service was great! Even though I was at the bar every single server asked me if I needed anything. Sometimes I can't even get a refill of water sitting at the bar at other places.   Don't let the east side location deter you. Definitely check this place out if you haven't. I'll be working this place into my Thursday sushi rotation for sure!

-uphuFwBPX1Ahy1TEcImTA.text: AYCE sushi off the strip. With tax and tip came out to $25/person for lunch. No wait even though we came on a Saturday at lunch hour. If you have AYCE at home, feel free to skip. Nothing out of the ordinary that we can't get in LA.  What I did like is that you can actually order half rolls, so the bf and I were able to sample a greater variety than we would at home. Pretty much every roll we ate was very good. Spicy dishes are actually pretty spicy though.  All sushi came with a lot of rice though, especially the sashimi. And on that note, the sashimi was just okay and didn't seem super fresh.  Special one order per person items: hamachi kama (baked hamachi - tender and juicy, a little too fishy for my taste but the bf loved it), sweet shrimp, seafood salad (sashimi pieces over raddish), giant clam sashimi (meh didn't know what to expect).  In the end, perhaps I'm spoiled in LA, but I can probably get about the same at home for less $$.

PAwQms5zGCXTK2BnRO9IkA.text: 8.14.11: This place is the ish. I liked every order that I had. You must check out their seafood Salad. The dressing was different and amazingly good. We also ordered the "who's your daddy roll" , a bunch of sushi pieces like the yellowtail, salmon, tuna, garlic tuna, and hand rolls like the spicy tuna. There was nothing fishy about their food and their service was Great. Our server Isha was so nice and attentive. She was actually the one who gave so many great recommendations.   I really enjoyed my meal and I don't say that alot especially when its AYCE.  It was suprisingly good and the portions were very friendly. So eat up and try to hit up this spot. 20.95 for lunch and 23.95 for dinner.   Worth the stop!

8uIb7Vvnr6TU9IGyyiJNvA.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE.  I wish we had a Yama Sushi where I'm stationed in GA, however each time I am TDY to Nellis AFB I visit Yama at least once.  The most recent visit was only a few months ago.  I usually go solo, as such it's easy for me to find a singleton seat at the bar--right in front of the sushi construction artists.  Other people have complained about not getting seated right away, or not getting their food in a timely manner.  I would say that as long as the faults weren't too egregious, this is to be expected with such a popular busy little restaurant. Me personally on a past visit here I was crammed at the end of the bar near the oven which serves up the cooked sushi, and while it was far from ideal seating-wise, I can appreciate that this restaurant tries to find as much seating as possible--maybe to a fault but certainly didn't ruin the experience. The food served up has, for me, always been a wonderful experience.  The sushi cuts are consistently good, I haven't found the rice too bland, too dry, or too overbearing, and there's LOTS of "special roll" choices for those that purchase the AYCE plan.  Yama Sushi incorporates a lot of sauce, but imho they're not too heavy-handed with it.  I usually get the 'Man Whore', 'No Name', 'Wet Dream', 'Happy Ending', and 'Oh Dam Harry' but do not forget about the appetizers and salads; if you like spicy sushi, then you MUST try the 'Seafood Salad' which is basically a spicy sashimi salad with a hint of garlic and a lot of awesomeness--you'll thank me if you do.  Again from my experience you could try most of their abundant special roll selections and come away satisfied. I was here once with a buddy who couldn't finish the last 2 pieces of his roll, this usually generates an additional fee.  However the older lady waitress just laughed at him (which was funny in and of itself) and let him off scot-free without paying extra.  Yeah it's only a little thing, but it meant something to us. Bottom line: I might have had better quality sushi elsewhere, had better served sushi presentations elsewhere, or cheaper sushi elsewhere, however dollar for dollar Yama Sushi is by far my fav place for sushi ANYWHERE.

e7HlRrHC5R8HcimEQKQcZg.text: My boyfriend and I have been going here for years. Unfortunately, the quality of their food has drastically declined. The waiters are still attentive and pleasant but one of the actual sushi chefs could work on his attitude. While ordering food here, he cut me off and said that is good enough for now and moved on to the next customer. The rice on the roll was hard. I'm positive he was aware of it as well since it would've been impossible for him not to feel the old, hard rice while making the roll. We're not going back to this place. We now go to Doh sushi. It's way bigger and the quality of the food is way better than Yama's.

RUhA83NebNq9zogpQiUcgw.text: I try to go to Yama Sushi whenever I get a chance to have sushi dates with my best friends. The service is excellent! Doesn't matter if someone isn't ur immediate server, if they are near u, they will ask if u need anything. I love that! The only downfall is that it's so busy on some nights, that there is a long wait period to get seated. It doesn't affect my review tho! I've been to many different sushi places, but this has to be my favorite. From the amazing rolls, to the service, to the atmosphere, this place gets 2 thumbs up from me. My only suggestion is possibly moving the location somewhere else or even expanding business to other areas. Too many instances where there's some crazy person outside yelling obscenities. Haha. Keep up the good work, Yama Sushi! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Random sushi rolls!! Delicious!!

8subVqlMpEk66yx1JPUwSA.text: A "must eat" staple when I go to Vegas.  Never disappoints.  I've had: Sesame Chicken, Green Mussels, Soft Shell Crab, Philadelphia Roll, Shrimp Tempura Roll, Salmon Roll, Red Clam roll (so pretty), Giant Clam Roll, Yellowtail Roll, & Seawood Salad from what I can remember.  I know there's more, but I'll have to update when I remember.  When I went this visit, sounded like "No Name" was a popular roll, but I was too full to order anything else.  I have yet to find anything that I don't like...  My only gripe is that its a little squishy... small place.  I've never had to wait more than 5 mins, but it is really popular, so Im positive there is a wait during busy times.

6tO2yVGdzM7mBHfD9SmyTA.text: I like this place - always crowed and always good food. Prices are fair and food quality is great! Tasty and great service.

NimwO8MaEQdwwSyuj957xw.text: It's just off the strip in a little strip mall. AYCE sushi in Vegas isn't as common as Reno. Decently priced, tasty and SUPER fast service (sat at the bar). Will come back!

eyqIxQl9_ZJvspKNT5_8fw.text: I tired to eat here based on the reviews. We got here at 6:45 and told it would take 45 mins. It's now 8:35 and we still have not been seated so I left.

d8S7xoIrVHCQOSQV97TBGg.text: My favorite sushi place. Love the "Kiss the Ass" roll. Service is kind of meh, but sushi restaurants have never been known for their service in my opinion.

cAIFez_uAaNkeFr_saoxfw.text: Nice little AYCE sushi place with slightly better than average rolls and nigiri.  The service was good and the sushi came out promptly even though the place was busy.  It isnt a place I would go out of my way for to get dinner.  However, I would stop by again for lunch if I am nearby and craving sushi.

9_HwTpGydHG7YjqL4dHZxw.text: We ate here coz one of our friends invited us...alot of people eating thats for sure but my also its because we went sunday night. Food im not so thrill about. The only one I enjoyed is hamacchi kama (grilled fish). Lots of flavor on it. Givin it a star for the great costumer service food wise not so much! .

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Fmch8SnTtbb-xxMMwd8skQ.text: This is our go to restaurant for all you can eat sushi when we are in Vegas, and even if we're just passing through town. The variety of sushi available will satisfy just about anyone's taste buds and appetite. Our absolute favorite is the seafood salad, though. The medley of seafood and spicy seaweed will keep you coming back for more.

Wu4EYjS6Jku3m66gvpkecQ.text: Yama Sushi was love at first bite for me :D   It is very similar to the typical AYCE sushi joint, Miso Soup, Cucumber salad, FRESH and DELICIOUS rolls from Catapillar to WET DREAM to soft shell crab.   The service was quick, the servers were polite, and great about helping you choose tasty delights.  Everytime I come here, its PACKED! so expect a 20-45 (or longer) wait to be seated. And another thing to consider is the size- yes most sushi places are small but considering the volume of people coming in and out- you'd think they'd opt for more space. I dont mind waiting because the food is totally worth it!  AYCE Lunch special $21.99+, Dinner special $24.99+

7HfXkrfWqFC1DjL49Nrz-g.text: My boyfriend and I came here last summer and I just never got around to reviewing it. We are major sushi lovers (mostly rolls) so when we saw the reviews for this AYCE sushi place we were so excited! Our expectations were pretty high going in to it, but we were disappointed. The rolls did not taste fresh at all! After the first roll, I kept ordering just to get my money's worth and hopefully I would end up liking one but that did not happen. If you REALLY know good sushi and how fresh fish should taste then don't go here!

adwjg1GaZT8Gl0TaqA6CHQ.text: Love this place! Definitely my favorite sushi spot in Vegas! And you can't beat the $23.99 all you can eat dinner! I definitely recommend the seafood salad, no name roll, and wet dream roll just to name a few. I come here often and the service is always speedy and the food is always excellent! They even convinced a friend of mine who doesn't like raw fish to try some sushi with cooked shrimp or crab! I'll be back for sure!

VEIcrhydfXsJJdYGDiPHJA.text: All-you-can-eat lunch?!?!  Yum!  Located in a shady strip center on Maryland Parkway & Tropicana, your first thought is "why the hell would I get sushi from this place?!"  UM hello- cause it's good!  Their menu includes items with some crazy and kinda tongue & cheek names which makes it fun for ordering.  The first time I went with a group of people from my office and the place was PACKED at like noon on a Tuesday.  We ordered all kinds of stuff- all of it delicious!  Wish I could remember which ones I LOVED, ah well, I'll update the next time I go!  Save room for mochi.  The strawberry is the best, but the vanilla is gross.  Hopefully I will be able to try the ice cream next time.  I took a co-worker who was in town to Yama and she really enjoyed the sushi too!  This will be my go-to place when I want something that isn't going to break the bank.  Remember- the place is constantly busy!

csoazYYz3CjSlTWNBTM6HA.text: OOOOOMMMMMMGGGGGG!!!!!!!!  Found this place looking through Yelp for AYCE Sushi here in Vegas. Decided to come here based on the number of reviews and high ratings.   There were three in our party. We didn't have a wait. The menu notes charging for wasted food and a max time to sit and eat. All normal notices for AYCE places.  Let me highlight our experience: 1.  The freshest sushi ever had 2.  Sushi cuts of fish were a good size 3.  The rolls were normal size and you get 8 pieces 4. AYCE appetizers were not small servings 5.  Cooked food was very good 6.  Desserts were absolutely delicious the best tasting green tea and red bean ice cream we ever had. Not one ice crystal to be found. The best tasting chocolate mochi ever had  7.  At least six (6) sushi chefs at the bar 8.  In addition to the servers they have many other staff serving food, refilling beverages and bussing tables.  This resulted in never asking for refills, someone always checking in to see if you wanted to order more and the table being cleared regularly instead of dishes pilling up.   Measures: 1.  Quality of food - 10 2.  Quantity for value - 10 AYCE 3.  Service experience - 10 4.  Overall Cleanliness - 8 5.  Service 10 Overall value 9.6 = 5 stars  We were here yesterday for dinner, see review above for that experience and again for dinner. Our wait wasn't too long maybe 20 mins. My review of tonight experience of Yama Sushi was exactly the same as last nights.   Definitely coming back and telling friends and family

5n8i9_nlBP5h7c08W6W7MQ.text: There were 13 of us. This sushi place accomodated all of us and put us in a seperate room that had a table big enough for all of us. Even when we were still waiting for the rest of our group, they had reserved the table for us. All of us had All You Can Eat, must I say it is worth it. This place is very efficient, you order, a few minutes later yimou'd be eating some of the best rolls and appetixers you'd ever have. Our servers were Andrea and Ingrid, then an Asian lady with a #1 tag on her uniform. They were all nice and friendly. I definitely recommend this place, specially to sushi lovers and to people who likes to eat out with groups of friends!

SIl5dfautUFcYcY5jg905g.text: Wow! This place is AMAZING!! I love every roll I had! $24 for an all you can eat SUSHI dinner?!?! YES PLEASE! You HAVE to try the Be Mine Roll. I'm obsessed.

x7fCYL_bmyZ57hNtz1q6Xg.text: Worst ayce sushi I ever had - from rice, soy sauce, to fish. Most likely will never come back.

4PbIAu2WkrTTdCKHxXRoEw.text: I travel to vegas every month and always come here. Sushi is fresh and the service is awesome!

2xAsP86mmZm0H29TTNIXMA.text: Totally worth a visit.  This is the best AYCE sushi restaurant in Las Vegas!    For a relatively cheap price, you get good quality sushi.  They even have Uni here (one order per person).  We really liked the salmon nigiri here.  They do put a lot of rice in their nigiri though.  :(  Service:  Service was okay.  I can't say they were friendly or even nice...but they were efficient.  They don't give you a piece of paper to mark your orders like other AYCE sushi places.  You just tell them what you want.  It's a smart system because it prevents over-ordering.  The food comes out really quickly.   Ambience:  Decent.  Nothing special.  All the sushi chefs were wearing mouth and nose guards which increases cleanliness (huge plus here!!).    Location:  Located in a strip mall near the strip.  Plenty of parking!  My new favorite AYCE sushi place in Las Vegas!!  I can't wait to come back!

a7bCDw_X1V7EpqCZYPoZdw.text: A sushi buffet in vegas? As my account reads : sushi buffets are my place of business. So we had to go check it out.  Most of the things were good. I mean there was basically a sashimi poke, and that was amazing, i forgot what it was called.  Some baked rolls were sort of ... odd. But all in all, it was good and I would come back.

QHBEIqIcIQfahOtbXbW-mg.text: Every time I visit Vegas I have to come here. It's that good that I have to make my way from The Stripe. AYCE sushi usually doesn't sound good or appetizing (aka bad fish and way too much imitation crab) but this place sets the bar high for AYCE sushi; and the price is cheaper than any buffet. It's $23.99 for dinner and it's all the sushi, maki and nigiri your heart desires. They do have some rules: you have to eat all the rice and not just the fish because there's an extra charge. Also, any leftovers will have an extra charge too. The quality of the fish is good and fresh. The size of the sushi is decent too and they aren't overstuffed. All of the rolls here have a Vegas theme. One of my favorite rolls here is The Who's your Daddy (watch out for the spicy oil on it), Spicy Sexy Roll (I like spice), tako nigiri (cuz AYCE octopus is amazing).   !!!

nJ27c-piNI8w_vY7-xx9kw.text: I use to live across the street from this place and it was definately my go to spot for great sushi. Every time I'm in town, I make sure to stop by to get my sushi fix. The staff here is very quick and efficient with lots of variety on their menu. The rolls here are bite size and the fish is always fresh. Must try!

5e_kP6lduv9KiV9POlGVAA.text: We were pleasantly surprised how good this was! The Nigiri Sushis were fresh and portion sizes were big. They also had plenty to of fish to chose from, not the limited ones such as tuna and salmon. They have mackerel, squid, octopus, and clam just to name a few. Next the rolls!  OMG!  I lost count how many rolls they have. My favorite is the no name sushi.  But leave room to try them all.  Location is also good.  Plenty of parking and a  minutes from the strip. I will definitely come back to this place for all you can eat sushi in Vegas.

1jMpyDgE4Er27kZnt7mCIQ.text: So glad I found this place. My family loves sushi and this place is reasonably priced. We enjoyed the AYCE dinner. The staff was very friendly and attentive. This will definitely be our new go to place for sushi.

NSt1SLjP1IlgT8VEi0Pp_g.text: Great place! Amazing food... Their $20 all you can eat is the best!   You can't go wrong here... a must!

j19kx4y7IyohLkx6uAXGvQ.text: VERY good ROLLS! I dont recommend the sashimi but the rolls are very good. Sashimi seems.... Fake... frozen... Not fresh.. I had a crab sashimi and it was definetly frozen, it was formed as a log. Which was extremely wierd to me.  AYCE is very good on the price as well. Not bad on prices. I played around $54 for 2 around 630pm.   CUSTOMER SERVICE: the host and manager were Amazing! The waitress not so much but it was understandable. It was definetly packed inside.

2o3uVLWloR40vh77y8b6Yw.text: I've officially stopped coming here since the quality has gone down. The Sushi chefs aren't up to par at worst. The food is below standard for any good or ok sushi restaurant.  I took s a friend in hopes it was better than the last time and we didn't want to drive or go to Sakana since they are almost just as bad as Yama Sushi.   The fish is hella low grade, no flavor with too much rice. I'm unsure where the Chefs receive their training but please stop making bad sushi!!! It's a disservice to those that appreciate the art of sushi.

Wv_i0c79gnL0qksg-gDoiQ.text: All you can eat sushi? Yes please! It cost only $23 for dinner. The entire menu they gave you is part of the buffet. The only thing that isn't part of the ayce is if you ask for sashimi. The wait time isn't that bad. We came on Monday night for dinner and the wait time is only 30 mins.   I would totally recommend getting the nigiri And some of the apps. The rolls are good, but I don't think it's really worth it. The most favorite thing to get is the soft shell crab, the salmon nigiri and the edamame. The fish here isn't sushi grade, but it's still delicious enough to enjoy.   The staff here are super friendly, but for some reason they don't seem to offer the best service ever. My table had four people. Two people kept having their glass of water filled while two isn't getting anything. I was one of the two that kept getting water refilled. My friend asked the waitress for water. When she came she filled my glass and not my friend. She got fed up and when she saw my glass getting filled she asked for water.   I would totally recommend coming here cause I love sushi and it is cheap.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QodaCN8FGYouRwwAoJPNnQ.text: It's alright. It gives you value for your money, but the quality was a little questionable. I had another AYCE sushi place with much better sushi (was a few dollars more). I figured why not try it and felt a little jipped after spending a meal here.  There are limits to some of the offerings but they weren't great. Even for AYCE standards. I felt like these were the last of the last cuts.

TpBBn4QonNqX2zQWOitv_g.text: Great deal!  A couple orders of California Roll took a while       They were out of uni.  Will have to come back for it next time.  The waitresses were quick and attentive.  Would recommend!

HjRbDAsfgycnC1rIWU1pGw.text: Not my first time. Typical eat all you can place. Only problem I have .... The sushi rice is too much in comparison to the fish....  It's okay but I know of a better place... Good for first timers...

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet shrimp with deep fried head and mackerel plus white tuna
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon roe, surf clam, giant clam....

uTd4g8mfpCoyGBHc55yp0Q.text: I have been coming here for many years and I can't believe I did not write a review. I come to Las Vegas at least twice per year and come to Yama Sushi every single visit. I only eat seafood and Las Vegas buffets are total shit now so this place is one of the few that still serves THE BEST FOOD in town. Service is incredibly fast. I have no idea how they do it. I have been to many sushi bars and there is some wait but not in this place. It is quick, very quick. But the mot important thing is that food is ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!!!! Baked Green mussels is my favorite. Saba and white tuna is my favorite too. Salmon skin hand roll and eel hand roll are incredible. By the time I try all the sushi on the menu (just don't order sea urchin) I have no more room in my belly for the rolls. I am sure they are very delicious too. For some reason I always overeat here. There must be the reason though.

fGdHdOgLq4YIW3v6ETVIBA.text: I'm new to sushi. I know - shocking! And I have to say that after eating a "no-name" roll from this place, it is my new craving! My hubby and I did the AYCE and everything we ordered was fresh and delicious - from the miso soup to the gyoza to the hand rolls. I would say the special rolls were plentiful and sized just right without being overly obnoxious for eating. The service is excellent in that they are very friendly and attentive without making you feel rushed. The restaurant itself is very clean and the dining environment is cozy with plenty of room to sit and spread those elbows while trying to use chopsticks without looking like a fool. I can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NxKje5oRYuouq5GDkb2MRA.text: I used to love eating here, but now that I have a kidney transplant there are a lot of things I love to eat here that I can't have anymore like raw fish. So there's not much choices I can eat here. However, this place is a great place for AYCE!! I just don't eat here as much as I want to. :(

k--F1CeasvFZevuuQoC0IQ.text: This is definitely a great place to bring family and friends when they're in Vegas. The sushi selection is very good prices are extremely fair and the place is got a definite positive vibe.

mth4Osjl9kSz6ITy6eZLDw.text: I loveeeeee this place. Everything is delicious and the staff is friendly. They have a wide variety of choices and it all tastes really fresh. This is the best sushi place I have found in Vegas.

dMZPWRXisdLTfMFOubah9w.text: If you're looking for a hidden gem... this is definitely the place. Sushi was amazing, service was good, prices are very reasonable, and I honestly can't wait to go back. My only complaint/suggestion would be for the plate presentations to be a little better, and I wish they were in a better neighborhood.

jfAWvTR3NZpnGaSakiew8g.text: A good sushi place for AYCE. The establishment looks like a hole in a wall kind, but it seems very popular with the locals. The wait staffs are fast on taking in orders and orders comes up on a pretty decent time. It helps you pace your self. They have tons of variety to choose from the menu. The fish to rice ratio is not too bad. I would come back again to this place when I am craving for an AYCE sushi when in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UBcyNLK02lOya64eE4i93A.text: Ok, we are from TN, and we do NOT have all you can eat sushi anywhere, except maybe a hibachi/Chinese/crappy buffet where the fish is days old. SO, this is a new concept for us, and a delightful one. My husband and I were like, whaaaa? $24 for all you can order/eat sushi rolls AND appetizers AND dessert? For reals? He added it up, and we had ordered around $85-90 of food for $48 for two of us.   It IS off the strip a ways, so do not try to walk there. Uber, taxi, whatever, it's still worth it imo. However, don't be scared if your driver turns down weird, dark streets. This place is in a strip mall, and looks very non-descript. My husband was like, are you sure? And I was like, yeah, Yelpers said so. And then, he was like, all smiles. We were in sushi heaven, and I had a big "I told ya so."   As far as what to get, idk. We were so overwhelmed, I'm not sure what we ordered :) but it was all good. Except the Trust Me, Baby roll. (I couldn't trust it). It seemed like Mexican sushi to me, with weird red hot sauce on it. Um, no.   We were stuffed, so just one mochi for each--mango for him, chocolate (um, the BOMB) for me. So, a long story is ending now. We plan to go back before our stay in Vegas ends...yeah, it's like that.  Update: so we did return! However, there are 2 locations, one off Flamingo Rd (weird layout) and one sort of northwest-ish (sorry dk address). The second one had a better, brighter atmosphere. However the servers there had a'tude, it seemed. U judge. Both good

NS9OCBE9TlEK7ORMux5MPA.text: This place reminded me of my favorite sushi restaurant in VA. My husband and I did the "All you can eat" deal. We had the whole menu to choose from. However, there were certain items on the menu we could only order once. The bad thing is that my mom, my dad and I had the runs later that night and my sister threw up, and my daughter told me that one of the staff had not washed her hands after using the restroom. The staff were friendly and welcoming. Had this place been more sanitary and didn't get us sick, we'd given this place 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vbdx5hc2q5TU8p2A3iaDxg.text: All you can eat for $25 bucks at Yama Sushi?  Are you kidding?  Nope, and it's a great value and good sushi, too, with some inventive rolls.  It may not be Nobu quality sushi fish, but hey, it's also not $100 bucks either.  I just had to try it.    Staff was great and attentive.  The place could use a refresh/clean - decor felt a little tired but whatever, it had character!  Overall, go in with modest expectations, you'll be impressed and walk about with money left in your wallet, too,

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CpEfFTTrVySX2H067cmt9g.text: Yama is a great place for AYCE sushi if you're in this area. The location is pretty small so theres usually a wait. I prefer to sit at the bar area as some of the tables are extremely cramped together. Some dont mind but it's a little frustrating for me. They have these thin paper foldable paper walls?? Between each table but you're so close to others all you can do is overhear their loud conversations.   They offer half rolls which is great for those that dont eat a lot or want to try a something new. However if you dont eat all of your sushi they add an additional charge which is kinda ridiculous to me but hey that's why you order a half roll I guess.   Customer service is pretty good. Sushi chefs are nice! I do recommend trying the dragon roll. Its phenomenal.

xkKaXwNfgHFyueBdAJVvxA.text: I have been here before and was not impressed but I though I would give it another try...... sorry to report it has not changed my view the service is not bad ..... but the quality of food is just up to par ...... there are so many other places to eat sushi..... the hype does not deliver .....  Hopefully this place can step up the food quality  There is always hope lol

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5b_r4fj3c6jRKXyUa-LNBg.text: Mediocre food quality at best.  You get what you pay for. I would not recommend besides good service.

hWtAQUodnpzWsc2YseijxQ.text: Our go to sushi place while in Vegas. This AYCE establishment has a vast amount of items that will cover all of your sushi needs. We typically get ikura (salmon roe) w/quail egg nigiri as our main orders. Then we'll get the mixed fish salad which has a variety of sashimi pieces mixed with a sauce of creamy, mild or spicy sauce on top a bed of shredded daikon. Take note, some items can be ordered only one per person such as ama ebi nigiri, hamachi and salmon kama, uni nigiri, palm roll.   If you like sushi and great customer service, this is a great go to if you're just visiting or a local. The food is fresh and made to order. You won't be disappointed. Thumbs up and fist bumps!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped shrimp &amp; Takoyaki (Fried octopus balls)
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vkLBSTqicF068Fgw1w2xAA.text: After giving it a lot of thought I decided to give this place three stars. The sushi was decent quality and the rolls are pretty good but the place doesn't look super clean and everything is drenched in Ponzu sauce. I don't know I like Ponzi sauce but for everything to taste the same way because of the sauce was kind of annoying. The staff is pretty friendly and for all you can eat it's decent price pretty much standard. I don't know the vibe was off for me and the sushi was was just meh

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WV-O3RLt4mS3djCuTvMINA.text: I go to Yama Sushi every time I visit Las Vegas for the AYCE. I ordered some albacore and ama ebi, as well as the no name roll, crazy roll, oh dam!! harry roll, and two scoops of green tea ice cream. It was pretty worth it for the $21 (lunch price). I enjoyed everything except the ama ebi and the crazy roll, just because I'm not a fan of deep fried foods. The service was surprisingly good, so I would come to this location again.  P.S. just make sure you keep track of what you've ordered because we did not receive all the rolls we ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy roll
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh dam!! Harry roll
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BDkYM5_RaCdXPXuNnr_dmw.text: The thing about eating in Vegas is that one could be eating too much rich, decadent food and ending up craving lighter, simpler, yet tasty fares.  I am really glad that I found Yama sushi because it seems to have decent reviews. I wasn't feeling particularly hungry so I ordered some nigiri including yellowtail, ikura (salmon roe), tamago and uni (sea urchin).  I wouldn't say that the sushi is top-notch or anything but the fish tasted fresh and the service was quite decent. I am also very happy to know that there's a reasonable sushi restaurant close to most of the hotels.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Packaged nigiri
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nigiri - yellowtail, ikura (salmon roe), tamago (egg cake) and uni (sea urchin)

VqIqSfxIKTBIXpRqWmgIMw.text: I wanted to like this place, but unfortunately, I won't be coming back. I initially wanted to go to another AYCE sushi restaurant, but they were closed. Sooo I found this place instead. What lured me in was the price which was only $20 for AYCE lunch.   When I first walked in, I noticed this restaurant had tables that were placed closely together. Some tables were big enough for a party of 4, but had a divider in the middle. Not the place to go to for private conversations.  My experience with service was below average. There were plenty of staff working the day I went, but I understand that some people are hosts, runners, servers, etc. and may not be able to help out in certain areas of the restaurant. As a girl was coming up to my table to refill water, I kindly asked for her to find the server to order more food (at this point, we had already been waiting). We did not see another server for another 15 minutes.  As for the food, it was not fresh.. we ended up going home with a really bad stomach ache. There's not really much to say after that.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sOJCOdOwczMbim8p30-bUQ.text: By recommendation from a friend who has been here before, but a long time ago, we decided to try Yama Sushi while we were on our Vegas vacation trip. This place has the AYCE option but it is a very different method of AYCE. There is no list where you mark what you want to order each round; instead, the servers take down your order "little at a time" [as recommended on the menu]. Basically you order 2-3 item each time your server comes to you and if they don't you need to keep flagging them down. Our server even got upset when another server took one of our orders. ooohhk?... Now, all this really this doesn't make sense if the restaurant is busy, I can't imagine how much of a chaos it would be. Luckily we came during early lunch when it wasn't too bad right at opening.   I love sushi and every time I do AYCE sushi, I go for mainly nigiri rather than any of the rolls. Getting BANG for the buck, if you know what I mean! The only roll I would get is the spider roll and although it was small, it was good because it wasn't filled with filler imitation crab like in other sushi places. I'd give them that. For the nigiri, I ordered the uni (wasn't fresh) and sweet shrimp (cold like it had been pre-prepped) on top of my regular tuna, ikura, masago, and eel. Tuna wasn't that fresh either but the eel was good so we ordered quite a few to share. My boyfriend got a few rolls and nigiri but one thing he noted was the saba was good.  Overall, I don't think we'll be coming back especially if there are so many other options in Vegas. AYCE sushi joints in California are all relatively the same with marking your order for each round on the slip of paper. It just honestly makes more sense and I really have no idea why Yama Sushi does it this way.

SSJXCPSsFDCZmQJZiwfXaQ.text: Best sushi place ever!!!!!!  Literally the only sushi bar we go to. The staff is extremely welcoming and a professional. We've been coming for about 11 years and it they always remember us. It makes you feel really nice. The food is very delicious. I have never been disappointed. I would recommend the firecracker, the new name, the wet dream, the sun on the beach, barbecue ribs, Edemame, Actually scratch that I would recommend everything!!!!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KtoSpZbEo9GoLawsY9sgqQ.text: Decided to check this place out again since I didn't feel like driving to Chinatown for the better quality ayce. My first time here had no complaints. This time the quality of the fish and sushi is so bad you couldn't pay me to eat here.  Also no variety on the premium dishes.

hMoLKf8QDUgXS2z0rdLhgg.text: This place is decent. The actual building feels a bit run down. The table my party was sat at had almost no room. There was another table behind one of the chairs that prevented me from sitting right there. I had to sit more in the middle of the table, but with a 4 top, that meant one person was sitting on the edge super close to the next table.   As for the food, it was good. It's near the college, so if you're in the area and want some sushi, it's worth it. If you don't live in the area, then I wouldn't recommend making the drive.   The service was ok. We did have to keep asking for refills, and we got a roll we didn't order (which was still good), and had to ask for one of the items they forgot about.  TL;DR food is 4 stars, location and decor 2 stars.

J1UwlosCoHFOjd-gcPoT6w.text: Las Vegas, NV  ALL YOU CAN EAT Great Japanese food, sushi, fried soft shell crab, Hamachi Kama, Unagi, salmon, grilled Mackerel, Dragon rolls. What I really enjoyed is the ordering process, just ask the staff to get you more, no worries for cross contamination and fighting to get the last piece at other buffets.
