jye8BdvFxT01s0-EhdxYxA.text: Best sushi ever.  My bf and I are heading to UNLV in the Fall from Hawaii! Sushi is our thing, we probably eat it everyday back home.  We came here before touring the UNLV.  Best sushi ever is all I have to say

Y172ISB-gT0brcJ1wLWDSw.text: This is my favorite place to go for all you can eat sushi. The portion sizes are just right, service is great and since they expanded, you don't feel squished. Highly recommend Man Whore and Wet Dream.

FlnYCngpI8v0zPFRyXh7og.text: I'm not new to this location I've eaten there many times but I have not been there in a few years service was good but I feel the quality of food has gone down. there are plenty of other sushi all you can eat with better fresh tasting fish. I also didn't feel that location was very clean just my personal opinion.

15oFdm-B0EKpOnwzoJmc7w.text: First time dining here and the food was amazing!  Did the all you can eat sushi option and I did not regret it. All of the sushi was absolutely delicious and was extremely filling. My only complaint was that it took a little while to come out but given that it was a Friday night it is to be expected.  Highly recommend!

NNBv05TXdDitIKmZRhYOHA.text: Food was good but took 40 minutes for them to just bring out one thing... that's way too long for any sushi place. Plus the hostess was super snobby and the waiters barely gave any attention . They got our order wrongs as well...

hSoLxkK1NxwvSQDvHTKCgA.text: My husband and I have been going to Yama for almost 10 years. We started out at the Flamingo location but prefer this location (more room). Yama is BY FAR the best sushi place we have eaten at. we continue to try new places and always end up back at Yama. Nothing will satisfy our sushi craving like Yama.  Suggestions: son of a beach, wet dream, harry potter roll

1I9MDQyVFgh8MzAbJfcb4w.text: Chef Maynor is amazing !! I dont know if I am spelling his name right but amazing service and the best sushis I ate in Vegas !! Must eat spot

jbbNB2PxaCRGA8_CzoV9AA.text: I didn't expect so much of Yama but Yama was so good!! Of course, it's not best quality or best sushi but for the price, it's still a good deal :)) I like they offer free hot ( not so hot! which I like) green tea and you can order anything from the menu even during lunch time. The waitresses are nice and attentive enough for an ayce place. I wish they had an  ayce dessert menu as well as sushi tho!  I'll come back again soon!!

9_uaBeQroonDUASsRPMMiw.text: This use to be really tasty spot to eat before they had some problems and now they have good costumer service but there rolls dont taste as fresh as they use too same with there nigiri .

0beZMUK2IntPH1-cQzSAsQ.text: Wow! Just wow. We went here for the all you can eat special and everything was outstanding. The servers were so friendly and attentive. They came back to check on us several times and asked if we would like to continue ordering more. The fish was very fresh and tasty. The all you can eat price is less than what some other places charge that aren't even as good. I'm a big fan of this place, and I intend to come back every time I'm in Vegas!

C_o5VnRJSA1rCLoc6WTL-w.text: After reading all of the positive Yelp! reviews we decided to try Yama Sushi. It is located in a strip mall in one of the seedier neighborhoods in town and looks like a hole in the wall from the outside. Once you walk through their doors the magic begins! It's not fancy but it is comfortable and at four on a weekday afternoon they were at least 75% full.  We were greeted and seated almost immediately at a table for two that was comfortable. There was plenty of space between us and the closest table to us. The establishment is clean and there is a very pleasant odor wafting from the kitchen and the sushi bar.  Our server was very attentive and the food arrived very quickly. We were told to take our time. To eat a little at a time. We were not rushed at all.  It isn't necessary for me to list all of the dishes that we tried because they were all excellent and they are well covered by the 1700 or so other positive reviews. I will say that the Seafood Salad was spectacular! Huge chunks of tuna, salmon, shrimp and other seafood delicacies mixed with some vegetables in the most amazing dressing I have tasted in a very long time. We ordered the dish medium spicy. We ordered a second one with no spice and it wasn't the same. It contained the same ingredients but without the spice it just was not the same.  The rolls that we ordered were magnificent. Large regular sized orders of deliciousness and not the two or three pieces that you might get in other AYCE establishments.   I find it amazing that Yama Sushi can stay in business serving all you can eat great food at such great prices but I'm glad it Des. Dinner for two with two bottles of hot sake was under $60 plus tip. We plan on becoming regulars.

Y623PtBVfIWQHfa8zTj1qQ.text: I am an avid sushi eater and it was a good experience for my first time. What sold me was the servers. I have to say they were super nice and accommodating. I would go back for that, but I do live a bit far from here. Not my favorite place in town and the AYCE is more expensive than other places at $28 per person. The AYCE does not include Sashimi. They can use a renovation. I noticed their hostess podium was falling apart and nobody should have broken bar stools in the women's bathroom stall.

ewKNYgBzmZPPHarIXzve9A.text: The wife and I continued our quest to get our fill of sushi before we had to return to the food purgatory of Dayton, Ohio.  We went back to one of favorite AYCE sushi joints, Yama Sushi, for an early lunch on Wednesday ($20.99/person).  Unlike other AYCE sushi places for lunch, Yama Sushi seems to have the largest selection of AYCE items and also offering both grilled Hamachi and Salmon collar, uni, geoduck, and sweet shrimp, albeit limited to one serving per person.  Their tasty seafood salad and mixed seafood poke both offer generous amounts of fresh seafood.  As with any AYCE sushi restaurant, your mileage may vary with regards to quality of food and timeliness of service depending the time of day you're there.  We tend to get there early in the lunch service, beating the lunch rush and getting the fish, presumably, at its freshest.  Yama Sushi joins Sushi House Goyemon at the top of my list of my favorite AYCE sushi places in town.  If you love sushi like I do, Yama Sushi continues to be a good spot to get your fill at a very fair price.

Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed Seafood Poké

K_wA1s0v-zAiusDvjjVcyw.text: Yuck.  everything here is bad. Do not eat here. Service and food match each other as both absolutely horrible. Ama ebi and Uni were old.

3dJx8RJMXh8r2RIBp48Hog.text: We thought this restaurant would be a safe choice because it has decent Yelp reviews. That didn't turn out to be then case.   My BF ordered AYCE and it took forever for his orders to come. He ordered one of his favorite rolls, the caterpillar roll. The avocado was not fresh and the unagi was thin and had a sour taste to it. Even his unagi sushi tasted sour. He didn't want to finish it, but had to since there's a charge for unfinished food with the AYCE option.   Not going back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

13h-B7dOe3Y-ya1EMxECNA.text: I love this place. Great sushi, great value, excellent service. Friendly staff. Left full, satisfied, and planning my next Vegas trip just so I can come back for more!

Md8j8EpQSqCao-vEcCQK9g.text: The waitress is rude. I have already told them that we are going by 4 people and 5 people so that they can separate the billings and stuff. But they acted like we are a party of 9 instead of that of 2 tables. It is such a problem when i have my guest and we are splitting bills. Plus my guest even said that she gives an attitude towards us.

1U0K461srn9qYkRD7sBjNQ.text: It's family tradition to go there and we can never ever get sick of it.  It's a small place but worth squeezing in.  Everything I've had is great there.  Our favorite is the Ellen roll and palm job.  Their ice cream could be better tho especially the green tea.  Save the calories on sushi and forget the ice cream.  Yama has us forever

WNwx0VT7Ok4jRC8rdO-Tqw.text: I am against giving a good review to a restaurant because it's cheap, not because it's genuinely good.  This place really disappointed us when it comes to food quality and taste.  This was a fall-back plan after we were unable to change our reservations at Sushi Neko.  Should have gotten the hint when we were able to make same day dinner reservations for a party of 20 on a Sunday night.   The rice on every sushi roll was mushy. The uni, the sweet shrimp were not fresh. I mean, visibly not fresh. You can see it in the color.  The other dishes and rolls are meh.  The people making the rolls and dishes are not Japanese and I'm not sure if they even know how these dishes should taste.  The only decent 2 things were the soft shell crab appetiser and maybe the salmon nigiri because of the fish to rice ratio. All other stuff is mediocre at best.   This place gets 2 stars because they allowed some of us to do AYCE and the kiddies a la carte.  This usually don't happen. The other star is for the good customer service. One waitress even went out to the parking lot chasing us down to return a scarf we left behind.

88hE1LDi_zGYYXFxm6DEag.text: Fresh and delicious! I finally popped my Yama cherry. Lot's of friends have been raving about Yama's all you can eat offerings and I never got around to trying it. UNTIL NOW! Definitely a fan. I loved the seafood salad and the No Name roll. There were plenty of things we tried and enjoyed but those two stood out the most. Alcohol is available. Service was fast, space is limited and with influx of foot traffic you may end up waiting for a table. My friend arrived first so I was lucky enough to skip the waiting part :)

cawXomD_MKKVCLkxgZYG_g.text: Super quick service and you cannot go wrong with the selection. A little pricey but it's expected for all you can eat. Definitely a recommended sushi place in town.

pD1msC0WBlbGBeTAxx5oJg.text: Best sushi place in Vegas!  Definitely recommend this place... but make sure to make reservations if it is a Friday, Saturday or Sunday night.

LaesMujhnoG4CJzADNeCww.text: Visited Yama Sushi on Valentines Day to have a low key dinner with my girl cousins to catch up. I had heard how Yama was great from them and decided to give them a try. I will have to say probably not the best time to visit this place but I did.   The restaurant is a clean and pretty big. They had four sushi chefs when I was there I figured that it would be enough. I know being valentines day it was going to be busy but it was just not enough to be overwhelmed like that.    The sushi chef kept skipping us! At first I thought maybe because I was hungry and ready for more. But then my party started to notice too. He took two new clients orders first two times before he got to ask one of our party if they were ready and then seemed to forget about our order PERIOD! The busboy staff where GREAT! They were very attentive and friendly. I have always had great service from sitting at a sushi bar not so much here.   At one point the chef lightly bumped into the mini sushi fridges where they store the fish and the roll just completely unraveled and spilled over to us. He even stated that it wasn't him bumping into the area so much as the roll not being made right. I was actually amazed he said that out loud because I was thinking it. We ordered three "Palm Jobs" three times and waited more than 30 minutes for it and he forgot about it all three times.  I gave up on my order and only one of us patiently waited again ONLY  after she got up and went over to him since he had already switched position to the other part of sushi bar ! I was over it.  I really want to say I would be back to give them a second chance but freshness and flavor were off as well. Something I did see was that a lot of their fish is  PRE-SLICED!  I haven't  seen that in a sushi bar  and thought It was off....   I did learn how to order everything sexy style which is with Avocado, jalapeno, and thin slice of lemon and a lemon sauce that I wish was Yuzu sauce.   I will stick with my regular sushi spot.

b_6G8wxfo1AtcXUKNs1HbA.text: I came here to celebrate my mothers bday and I must say it wasnt bad. First of all the wait to be seated was pretty long 45 mins,but I was expecting since I heard it was one of the best sushi places in town. As soon as we were seated, our server went over the "instructions" on how AYCE works...hmmm I guess.   The actual sushi was sooo delish! I had so much that I lost count after the second plate. Our server was as attentive as she could be since it was a pretty busy night.   Im not a patient person, so the long wait makes this 4 stars.... but still a must go. I WILL DEFINATELY GO BACK!

frXOrHLw-1nZ6GgktWUz1Q.text: The 5 stars is for the food quality.  This is an awesome neighborhood sushi bar that is much better than some of the expensive places on the strip.  The atmosphere is nice, more of a family style setting.  Great all you can eat option.

eozz5gc_SWitOqDz4qq3Fg.text: Me and my friend had seen this place on Yelp and had decided to go for dinner. When we got there it was very busy, but we waited less than 10 minutes and got a seat at the bar. We got the all you can eat and the service was very efficient and fast (espically for how busy they were). Our server was very sweet and funny and kept our waters refilled continuously. She even recommended us a great appetizer (the seafood salad is a must if you like raw fish). The sushi rolls were fantastic and tasted fresh. For the price that you pay for the all you can eat on top of the service we received and the quality of the sushi, this place was fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rGwWzH8QQo3OrPrK84BOkw.text: Had dinner last nite on a Sunday for 5 and it wasn't that bad of a wait. They quoted 30 min but we got a table after 15 min or so. The place gets pretty busy so prepare to wait a bit.  We all decided on the all u can eat deal for $23.99 & am glad we did. We started off with apps like seaweed salad, fried mussels and tempura. All were very good! Then we got into the specialty rolls. They were all very good and they came out pretty fast. After ordering 8-9 rolls with a ton more apps we were done. Nice they had free hot green tea too. To top it off they have dessert with the din. I got the red bean ice cream & mango mochi. I was in frickin in heaven and my belly was happy.  I would def come back again. Just make sure u come with an empty stomach if u come here. Let's just say I slept really f'ing gooood last nite. #foodcoma

DoPkAHCBah6V-bFPT3H_tg.text: The sushi was fine, but after last night's experience, I refuse to ever go back. Here are the reasons:  1. A Fire Hazard: Even though the restaurant has recently expanded, it's still the size of an igloo.   2. Speaking of cold, the service matches just that. I told the hostess (Cynthia) that it will be a party of five for Angelina. She called me "Angelica" three times. The third time, she did it on purpose only because she knew I was pissed off and tired of correcting her.  3. Our waitress would not allow me to share one small piece of sushi with my friend who wanted to try it. The waitress said it was not permitted because my friend wasn't getting all-you-can-eat. If I want to share my food with a friend, I will share my food! I've never ran into that ridiculous rule at any of the MANY sushi joints I've ever been to.   4. Watch Your Car, Watch Your Back, Watch Your Belongings: Yama isn't exactly in the type of neighborhood where you can easily sit back and relax. Especially while waiting outside during long waits. There was this one shady dude in particular, who was flying by on a bike outside. He was screaming profanities to NO ONE in particular at the top of his lungs. He had no phone and no blue tooth on him either. Which brings me to my next two points, don't do drugs and there will be shady idiots.  5. How Long Can You Wait Before You Hit Boiling Point? Again, that place is too small, that's why you will always have to suffer the long wait times. On top of it, battling the children they have for hostesses, and then to follow, the rude waitress.   Everybody seems to be a genius when it comes to knowing the difference between good sushi and bad sushi. Unfortunately, everybody that goes to Yama, seems to have a hard time noticing the difference between good service, bad service and the obvious fact that you can go somewhere else cleaner, BIGGER, providing a much smaller wait time and still providing great sushi. Take that as a warning and a good tip, sushi lovers.  In regards to going to Yama Sushi, if you still decide to volunteer as tribute, may the sushi forever be in your favor. Because everything else there may not be.  Good luck!

r406QGmTJt4RjtAaydV8EA.text: After months of nonstop babbling from fellow yelper Nelson S. raving how Yama has the best AYCE sushi in Vegas, so good that I would have an "orgasm." Well, no orgasm. I can finally shut him up.  Highlights on the menu: Deep fried muscles (never had that before. It was yummy), Sashimi salad spicy (mix of tuna and salmon with special sauce), Striptease roll (most expensive), and Manwhore (spicy).   I ordered the "Harry Potter" roll, and let me tell you, it does not even come close to the name of it ha ha. It looked so plain and tasted plain. There were other rolls that Nelson ordered like Dragon roll and I forgot the other name, but it was not good either. Too bad for him he had to eat it all by himself since I for sure wasn't going to help.   I was going to give Yama 3 stars, but gave extra credit because the Customer Service was top notch. The staff were friendly, attentive, and helpful. We never had to wait a long time to get seated, to get our drink refills, and to get our orders. Thats a big plus for me. And for UNLIMITED MOCHI?! Kudos.  Would I come back to Yama? Perhaps. Nelson S. would have to drag me to go again.

hfjouf9tSx6IgCKTnQKu0w.text: Wait, what? $25 all you can eat nigiri,  specialty rolls (except sashimi)? !  And this includes Toro (fatty tuna)?! Come on. .. how much sake are the chefs swiggin at this joint? But wait,  it's True. .. and the quality is quite good - the volume of food they go through doesn't allow time for spoilage.  A gem of a find off the strip. Uh oh...did I just let out a local secret? Well, now you better get there early to grab a seat,  cuz they're always busy

V8wfXPagjlGueKbVI1jGgg.text: They have horrible customer service. They said wait time was 30 minutes we ended up waiting for about an hour. We got seated and it took the waiter 15-20 minutes to notice us and take our order. Once we ordered the food was good but I just wanted a little side of sauce and I had to ask 5 times for them to finally give it to me. They also messed up our check and once I asked them about it then said they'll take care of it and they didn't do anything about it so I had to complain once again. Customer service here is awful and it just seems like they don't care. I'll probably never come back again.

pUHdu4E4543lMl1LJD66zQ.text: I have been to this place 3 times and it never disappoints.  The food is always excellent and fresh! We even drive 25 minutes across town to eat here when I have 2 sushi restaurants right next to my community.  The only negative I have to this visit would be they charged for a chicken teriyaki order I made for my 2 year old daughter. Most places let kids that young eat for free.

rzYLxLGTsuU6hmxJmXqmmQ.text: Instead of recommending one roll over another, I will simply tell you what my wife and I order repeatedly when we visit the place.  Keep in mind that that we have been coming to this place for about 10 years probably at least 2-3 times a month (we are locals), so we tried pretty much every thing on the menu. I also try to schedule all my business lunches at this place.   First of all - come in hungry, try to sit at the bar and order all you can eat. Order no more than half the roll so you try more. Start off with seafood salad (just a bit spicy).  Go ahead and order wet dream (full roll) - it will take a while to prepare.  I take mine with sliced jalapenos to bring out the flavor.  In the meantime ask to try: Son of a beach, no name, happy ending, striptease, one minute man, ask for chef's own creation - they will hook you up if you continue to praise them.  Also place an order of baked mussels with the waiter. If you are new to sushi try salmon roll, I love salmon roll, or simply California roll.  Don't forget to tip both - your waiter and the chef who prepared the food.  They will remember you and take care of you next time. Expect some wait time during high traffic hours (like Friday or Saturday night or weekend lunch.  Do expect the place to be crowded . Still - highly recommended.

A8QGbW50dQceQisEhwwi_g.text: Good value but sushi just so-so. We went for lunch.  The price was high for lunch but it wasn't too crowded like for dinner. Start with the seafood salad.

qrm8VxD05qyXY9WNm_06WA.text: My dad n I have been eating here for years! If you want amazing rolls, great sushi/ sashimi, and great service this is the place for you. We love all the way in anthem still travel to have sushi here. Expect a wait... They expanded a couple years ago and there still isn't enough room, worth the wait!!

xf8Qi20MbOoPiVs1RYOoJw.text: I've been going to Yama for a few years. I've tried every sushi place that has been highly recommended and I ALWAYS go back to Yama. They're rolls Are amazing. My favorite is the Happy Ending. It's a salmon roll with a slice of lemon on top and it's heaven in your mouth. Sometimes we have a wait but it's need been too long. The all you can eat price is super cheap for the quality of food. I love this place. Do it!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Ending

Jx1MadrVO8VojO_WxI4Iag.text: First, they told us the wait was going to be half an hour. It only took like 15 mins. They are fast! The staff is really friendly. The food came out super fast except for the chicken teriyaki. The rolls have kinky names ;) and they taste good too! I also got the seafood salad and that was BOMB.com. It had big chunks of salmon and tuna. It was perf that the wait time was shortened and the food came out fast because my girl and I still had to get ready to hit the club and we were going to be late! Like always.

2OJ9Kf2PvT3xxCUcjRuffw.text: The first thing that I do when I'm planning a trip is to sniff out the local sushi restaurants. Where to stay, where to shop and what to see all come later.   Las Vegas certainly has no shortage of sushi bars, there are four or five on one section of the Strip alone! But, everyone has already heard of Nobu and I wasn't planning on walking through eight miles of Caesar's Palace just to try the place frequented by many a celeb in L.A.   I searched through the highest-rated sushi places on Yelp, and Yama was in the top 5. I now know why. Located just two miles away from the Vegas Strip, a discreet building with nothing but SUSHI adorned at the top of the marquee, sits this lovely little slice of heaven.   I've eaten sushi all over this country, but this was my first experience with an "All You Can Eat" menu. It took some adjustment, but once I got into the swing of it, I didn't want to leave. The menu is diverse, and depending on what time of day you visit, has different items up for bid. I ate at dinner, and the first major surprise was that I was seated immediately after I walked in the door, despite it being 6:15 on a Friday evening. Boom! I wanted to go full Beyonce and do the "Single Ladies" dance right at the bar.  The AYCE menu offered basically any sort of American-made sushi that one could want: Nigiri, Sashimi, Hand Rolls, Cut Rolls, Deluxe Rolls, Baked Rolls and so on. You have to get the chef's attention and shout your order (every seat in the place was taken) but the food is prepared quickly. The menu advises you to start slow, otherwise you'll burn yourself out. I started small: Tuna nigiri, Uni and Salmon skin. All were handed to me quickly, and the Uni...you guys. The Uni.   Since I was dining alone (the rest of my party were catching Donny and Marie at the Flamingo) I wanted to converse with people at the bar. The seating is tight, which I'm sure is to accommodate as many people as possible, and it makes for great conversation with the locals who frequent this place. If you don't like to chat with your neighbors, however, you might want to wait for a table.   The price almost felt criminal. I ate probably $60 worth of sushi for a dinner price of $25. That includes drink and dessert! (The mochi was great.) The staff was very attentive, and I never had to ask for a water refill.  All in all, I have no qualms with my experience at Yama Sushi. I'll be back in Vegas this summer to see Mariah Carey, and Yama will be on my schedule.

7nF4mueteU_O7jw3nzTr7w.text: My favorite sushi house and only just down the street Gotta have those man whore's and the palm job is to die for.  I love coming down here with my friends and family. I always refer them to here when ever I can.

6sb9DuTz6A6HIhWZC2zyng.text: My cousin told us to eat here and it was amazing! Very good sushi and they are quick at getting it out to you. Definitely recommend!

lXJtMmLvlGl3WspmuOHO6g.text: As an ayce this place has pros and cons! We went during lunch during the week, sat at the bar and it was very fast and good service. The problem with sitting by the bar is you can see the tempura just sitting under a lamp not fresh and they pack you in on those stools, not a lot of freedom.  The rolls were good but not as much selection as I had hoped. The ayce does come with appetizers and nigiri. We got garlic tuna which was good and light. The cucumber salad was kind of bland. The seafood salad was great with radish noodles and I got to choose my fish- I did tuna and salmon. The chunks of tuna were great but we think the salmon is farm raised therefore more fatty as I could barely eat it. The good part was is you could choose your spice level so the spicy was perfect. The oh dam!! Harry!!! ( I think that's the name) roll was good and spicy, nice and not too heavy.  Overall a good experience and I would go back but my search for an ayce place I just crave continues... Found a sushi place but not ayce... So more sushi for me it is!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood salad! Spicy!

LPEzjCqRo6Xh3upgCbuu0A.text: BEST selection of rolls out of the five AYCE sushi places I've been to in Vegas so far.  I hate when sushi restaurants have a roll menu that has 5 different ingredients in diff combos, but this place is far from mundane.  Along with the variety of rolls, they come with colorful names as well...  The restaurant is a little tight on space but we got a few seats at the bar instead, and it was a packed Thursday night.  Great customer service - the chef behind the sushi bar was fun and made our sushi really quickly considering how busy the place was.

vzgN2Zc0sBRvacV7E3Vx6A.text: Worst food poisoning from this place. Should have known something was up when skimpy portions of salmon came out. Too many Ayce spots in Las Vegas, go elsewhere.

nk4Wuo67T8Q3d1S6smqnOw.text: Yama sushi is the best sushi restaurant in Las Vegas in my opinion. They are all you can eat but before you write them off for that they actually have good quality fish unlike most all you can eat places. They finally opened the the extension because on busy nights the wait can be loooong so I would definitely be prepared to wait on any given Friday or Saturday.

QJlVPx2tz6BwT2GrpMjuRw.text: I came here with some friends and the wait took forever. The price doesn't match the quality of the sushi and the service was not good at all. One of the employees were very rude to us and the sushi was mostly cucumber. If you want nice clean service then don't come here.

_nUdPIxKKbwKPpene1Gwdw.text: Im up in Vegas jus for a few days for a birthday and I found this through yelp. I am definitely suprised at how good the quality was. I went for dinner ($23.99)  and they had a pretty good amount of choices. But I really liked how the rolls were not as big as regular rolls so I can try more rolls. The seafood salad is definitely a must try.
