NYSSogqcN6EJu_1XwyLL9A.text: If you are looking for a friendly, nice, fast service place do not go here! Went yesterday with a party of 6, and as soon as we sat down the menus they gave us were all crusty and sticky, which we thought was pretty gross. As we were ordering food, they took forever to give us our food, I understood they were busy, but the one waiter we had didn't even come to check up on us or anything. All the waiters we had, they just gave us attitude. And with slow service? But to top it off, at the end of our dinner, we got our check and they automatically charged us 18% for tip because we were a party of 6 or bigger. For a restaurant that does that, they don't have employees that value customer service anymore because they feel like they can take forever and not give you proper service. Why? Because no matter how long they take or how bad customer service is, they will still get here 18% tip. Save your money and go some place else.

Ns6gLHyeG__yHKfWHwZPyg.text: Shit was hella bomb, got the all you can eat. Homegirl shlummped  finally found a good spot in Las Vegas! Deff recommend!

lgLeTwituM07MWxMqJ92mA.text: When in Las Vegas, a buffet is a must. However, if you want to have some quality sushi away from the hustle and bustle of the strip, you should definitely check out their AYCE sushi. I'd rate the quality a 7/10. Better than your average AYCE sushi place.  They have a pretty extensible menu with everything from nigiri to much fancier specialty rolls with some interesting names like "wet dream", "son of a beach", and "man whore". To start off, I ordered a few of their nigiri. The seafood was fresh (except for one of the clams I had that had was a bit too fishy for me) and expertly prepared. Each nigiri order comes with 2 pieces. For most options, you're able to order it multiple times. Though for a few of the more expensive seafood, only one order per customer.  One thing to definitely remember and is stated on their menu is to remember to eat all your food AND not just eat the fish and leave the rice. Wasting isn't cool, so you should either make sure you're able to eat all your food or order a half order of the rolls. You'll be charged for any significant amount left overs.  Parking was free and plentiful. Would definitely recommend anyone to try here, but don't set your expectations too high. It is an AYCE after all.

_r_xAy592OFhcnO6DZLYvw.text: In town visiting family and they took me here since I have nothing like this back home. It was great. Service was kinda slow but that kind of stuff doesn't bother me. Food was great. No complaints, definitely recommend.

UjH68D03ZKvet97r4jMTqA.text: This was our 8th or 9th time at Yama. Unfortunately  the quality of the rolls and sushi is not the same anymore. We left very disapointed

KviTYgGYWUH9Cwm83QoROQ.text: You get what you pay for when it comes to sushi.  If you are looking for below average quality fish for cheap, this is the perfect place.  If you want high quality fish, keep looking.  What bugs me the most is not the quality of the fish, but the quality of the rice. I think I can make better sushi rice at home than the chefs at this joint.  The service is fine, kind of busy for a Monday night but I didn't have to wait too long for the food.  I think the all you can eat dinner price at $23.95 is reasonable given the quality.  I probably won't come back again, but it was worth a try.

P4Ae7Papq5oZtdeUXiBIKg.text: This place is not so consistent whenever we go there.. Don't get me wrong this is one of my favorite sushi places but sometimes the wait is long, awkward crowded space, occasionally waiters will mess up orders..  But the food is a plus! AYCE! Can't go wrong with ordering Salmon Kama, Sun of the Beach Roll, Wet Dream Roll, Salmon Skin Hand Roll, and much more!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kama Night!
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wet Dream (top right), Sweet Shrimp (middle), Sun of the Beach (bottom)

7uTeEmtEGq8i7m0ETGOAUw.text: AYCE sushi lunch for $20!! Located in the same plaza as the Albertsons off the strip, we came on a Sunday and it wasn't too crowded. The salmon was pretty good and not fishy or stringy. They have a lot of variety and dessert and appetizers are included in the ayce as well. The seating was a little tight for our party of 7 and gratuity is included for parties of 6 or more.  Overall, we left feeling full and happy. Would definitely come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon!!

v-9v0BYj3d7YaHC7e487vQ.text: Just visiting Vegas and this was my first AYCE sushi experience here, took the recommendation from "yelp" and wasn't disappointed.  There were good and bad points:  The place is busy and really loud. But that just means that it's popular and better food turnover so that's a plus.  The selection is massive, and the originality on the rolls was superb. My only complaint on the rolls is that all the "fancy" specialty rolls were a bit spicy for me so I couldn't enjoy them.  But they are huge portions so you won't leave hungry.  Along with rolls I had Nigiri,  the #1 reason I eat sushi is for nigiri.  Unfortunately I wasn't as impressed with these..  Sure they were very large pieces, but the flavor was lacking and the Saba was very dry.  Which is my favorite.  The fish seemed subpar for what I'm used too at a sushi AYCE.  I like the salmon to melt in my mouth, this I had to chew..    Anyways,  25$ was well worth it so I was pleased..

GMkgQRsLgKMuL8dTxmdZOA.text: Awesome AYCE sushi joint in Las Vegas. Variety of appetizers, sushi and rolls to choose from. You can even order half rolls. Place is small and cramped. Didn't have to wait too long to be seated for lunch. About $25/person.. You'll def get your money's worth - I did! - check out my pics and you'll see I ate enough sushi to last me a few days :) Great customer service. I'd definitely go back.   Pros: Best value for sushi and nice selection of rolls. Quality doesn't suffer. Ample parking.   Cons: Tight, cramped seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dSBOL1mERf6SOswDY4stYA.text: There was a time back in the day (of faster metabolisms) where a place like this would have been my dream. Their AYCE terms are quite generous: $23.95 for dinner (2 hr limit) where you can order off practically the whole menu (certain higher-ticket items are just one order per customer), dessert included. This is a rundown of what I had:  GOOD: salmon sushi (fresh and generously portioned), eel sushi (well-prepared without too much sauce), seafood salad (a sashimi salad--large chunks of fish, good dressing), broiled yellowtail collar (good), some kind of spicy something roll (if you like rolls you're in luck!), free dessert (can't go wrong with ice cream!), friendly and fast service.  MEH: their sushi rice overall (I know not to expect good sushi rice at these kinds of places and this was no exception), uni and scallop sushi (since this is a higher-ticket item you're entitled to only one order, but honestly, who'd want another lackluster quality order?), sweet shrimp (shrimp was ok but not butterflied and put on rice and the deep-fried head was a monstrously breaded and fried travesty).  I'm definitely at that point where I'd rather have a little something really good rather than a lot of something just OK. That said, if you're looking for a sushi bargain in the desert, this could be a worthwhile stop.  STEPH JUDGEMENT: Good if you want a LOT of OK sushi, especially rolls.

OXTRemV0UVY-QhoPLUl8pA.text: I just dined here tonight with my husband, daughter and 2 friends and I have to say the sushi here is very good. Pretty fresh sushi and delicious appetizers. The service was on point and our food came out pretty quick. Only thing I didn't like about this place was how run down it was. All the way to the bathroom the floors were quite slippery and it just is sore for the eye. I would eat here again, great AYCE.

Fr0XMYgV8xD-Lo8iHF1iIg.text: Good sushi and a reasonable price. The stuff is very attentive and friendly. I will definitely be coming back here again.

_xHDyI0glpRb_0fgCJa-ug.text: Always a go to. Sushi is always fresh and customer service is friendly and fast. We always order the AYCE and the waiters bring out your desired roll very quickly. It's easy to over order due to the many menu options so I suggest ordering after you finish your current plate to determine if you can eat more or not. If you go to Yama please try their Wet Dream & Man Whore! It is soooo good! Overall you will not be disappointed in this place! Don't let the exterior fool you!

5PMgqVFZn5fNtVMzAYp-6w.text: Found this place on yelp while visiting Vegas with the hubby.  Love that they offer all you can eat.  Which is what we did because it was worth the $.    Customer service was awesome!  Would definitely go there again when I visit Vegas again =)

4Hbuin-y7t9ifc2BnUU1fw.text: Sushi is great! Service is awesome. Definitely recommend the "snow in Vegas" roll.

oFyFaxgeIcUEJz-ZC8w6Tg.text: When I think of "all you can eat" and "sushi," I know it's too good to be True - but this place delivers! A friend of mine who lives in the area took me here and I will surely be going every time I visit sin city. They don't scale down the portions or quality at all. Vibe was great with a lot of people inside. Custom rolls with catchy names were also delicious! I am definitely a fan of Yama.

sCaS6yQ0aTy9Fwvt0ESbHA.text: Great sushi!! It's AYCE for $23. Includes sushi, appetizers, and dessert.  The food is delicious, and comes out quickly. Service is fast and attentive. They're always checking to see if you're ready to place your next order. Don't order to much though, there's a fee for leftovers.  Don't be afraid to order a half roll if you're not sure.  I love the Yama Crunch and the Dancing in the Sheets rolls!  The dining room is small and cramped and this place looks kinda shady from the outside,  but don't worry about it!  For dessert, go with the mochi ice cream- it's a little ball of heaven! They have chocolate, vanilla, strawberry, and mango.

nz62EkqK4F4jGhqBhGc9OA.text: I've been to many ayce sushi places and am never impressed but Yama sushi has compelled me to write a glowing review. Service was great, the price is unbeatable at $24 a person, and the quality is impressive.  The seafood salad was amazing just on its own ( we ordered 2)!  We ordered 2 orders of uni (comes in 2 pieces per order), 2 orders of sweet shrimp (only comes with 1 piece per order), white tuna (my first time having this, it has a milky like consistency which I enjoyed), 2 orders soft shell crab (so good, light and crispy), miso soup, salmon kama (wanted hamachi but they ran out), quail eggs, 2 mochi ice creams (strawberry and mango...each order is 1 piece which they cut in half, perfect for sharing). We also got a large hot sake and a Kirin and our total was $66 for 2 people. I think that's a great deal and although I left a few chunks here and there they didn't charge me so that's great. (I always worry that I have to completely clear my plates at ayce). I will be back for sure.

JdEeiSycoTipa8b0ohlAYA.text: pretty good sushi.  i always get nervous when they say they will charge you for uneaten sushi though.  hahaha

1zxx-7KmstHLArKEz9ynEw.text: Great prices and service! While I've had better, for Vegas it was absolutely a deal for the quality of food. I'd come back in a heartbeat. Basically anything on the menu is a part of the AYCE so we had appetizers and desserts included... amazing. I was never really impressed with Japanese spots on the strip but Yama makes me long for sushi, just off the strip by a mile or two. Tip: ask for a side of tobiko and order more only after finishing your first batch, don't worry they're fast.

-iqSq6Bc1Jv2X2IeJD98YA.text: This place really pisses me off.  Being in the food service industry in vegas for over ten yen years I find the plates here offensive.  In an attempt to defer their food cost. All the sushi you order has a ridiculous amount of rice on it so as to fill you up fast.  You incur more cost if you don't eat all your  rice at all you can eat restaurants. Fine. Charge me more up front.  I come to sushi ,to eat fish. I mentioned the abundance of rice on my sushi to my server. Her suggestion was. "Order off the appetizer menu". That's cute. There's almost no fish on that menu.  Two hands way down.

GLlNHDwP7T6-qTx9PZd_zQ.text: Solid AYCE sushi.  Great price and good quality.  Salmon kama was very tasty.  Unagi was flavorless though.  Mochi ice cream for dessert is a good way to end the meal.  Not the best sushi but a great value.  I do wish they had more seating.

Nhbjg79PGYl2n0a0iTroxQ.text: My favorite spot in vegas. Extremely fresh salmon and tuna, generous portions, AYCE. Price is right

UxB2pxPbsn0QkgaNUbOW_A.text: went here for some all you can eat sushi.  maybe its because i have been to really Really REALLY good sushi places that this one just has fallen short.  minus 1 star for the service. it was just not that great at all.  i understand the place was busy, but forgetting 3 of our orders...after reminding the server about it a few times...not great in my book.    minus star 2.  i also understand we are ordering from the all you can eat menu and they have the policy you order it you have to eat it or you may have to pay for the left overs.  but come on..when a roll is not  stated its baked and comes out that way...they should make an exception.  well...one of my friends order a specialty roll.  it did not mention it was baked. it just said hot.  well...my friend told the waiter this isn't what he thought it was and asked if he can get something else...waiter said no.  so from this...when you see a specialty roll just double check when it says hot.  because apparently hot means hot as in spicy and it can also mean baked.  all depends on the roll.  maybe possibly will go back.  the food was actually decent.  again not the greatest sushi i have ever had.  but it was at least fresh.

et2DgCKr2LaOg--OzRHYmA.text: Food is excellent for the price (all u can eat), (ordered every uncooked roll and some with tempura) friendly staff, all you can eat is limited to 3 orders per person, until you're ready for more. This place seems to be korean owned. Which is cool too. Ordered several pairs of yellowtail nigiri. The sashimi tasted fresh.

G86Jnu5_Dz8ZlxYw6SFkWw.text: I went to Yama last week with friends to have 'all you can eat'. I'd like a lot for the price. One of my friends said the sushi was old, but for me it was fine! One thing that suck is that you can order ONE thing at a time (what is ok when sharing in a party of friends). Overall: decent all u can eat sushi for a moderate price. Service is average.

2AZXyk6BO8XrbqNOPfK1UQ.text: Couldn't have asked for a better experience.  Bon was our chef and he was Amazing!  The all you can eat deal is the best... especially if you can put away the sushi.  Like most other reviews say, the place is small, busy and crowded.  That being said, we never waited more than a couple of minutes for the sushi we asked for.

vkQc9gVyja5jOqsMwy4Hqw.text: Another amazing gorge fest of all you can eat sushi!! Love this place. Our server was great..the food just kept on coming out. Water was never empty. Good times! Can't wait til next time..

HdILOC8shOsHxdmTry_4IA.text: Ok ... So I have to start by saying, I once LOVED Yama. The seafood salad was to die for! I will never be back and would advice other to not go as well, unless they re-locate. I was at lunch with a friend and we noticed the fish was a little off, but didn't think much of it. We finished our lunch and had just paid when we noticed something run across the sushi bar. I just shook it off as if I was seeing things until I saw another cockroach run to meet is buddy!

sfJZOdjSPgBr6QPgC4YjHQ.text: We were visiting Las Vegas and I came across this place on Yelp. We had a party of 10 for lunch on a Saturday and this AYCE place did not disappoint us!  There was a small room on the side that fit our group perfectly. The quality of the fish was very good. Maybe not as good as a top tier sushi bar but far better than anything at a buffet or most other AYCE places that we've tried in Southern California. The seafood salad was especially good and reminded us of a good "poke bowl".  We tried the Salmon, Tuna, Albacore, Snapper and Yellowtail sushi in addition to just about every roll on the menu. All of the sushi and most of the rolls were very good.  The No Name roll was probably our favorite roll.  The mussel appetizer and mochi desert were a very nice touch and helped round out the meal.  Most of our group like spicy food and many of the rolls were unexpectedly spicy but I can see where that might turn off some people. $20.95 may be expensive for a typical lunch, but considering the appetite of our group and how much sushi we finished off I would consider this a pretty good deal. As mentioned by many others, the service was very good and fast with the waitress giving us a couple of nice recommendations.  The only drawback is that I can't come back for lunch until the next time I'm in town!  I can't wait to hit this place again on my next sojourn to Sin City!

nHdEgdE6FR2kBSssSzCKvA.text: I went there last night with my girlfriend and I have to say i was surprised. I have to agree with someone's review about "hole in the wall" from the outside you would not expect much, but once your inside the place is packed for dinner and they have all you can eat for around 23$. The Sushi was delicious and fresh. The service was fast and very friendly, its a little tight in there seating wise but well worth it.

aGtK4aTXELgtS6Lp9xpiNA.text: There is no point to have sushi anywhere else in Vegas.  $20-23 buys you quality all you can eat sushi.  You really can't beat that.  Most of the rolls are good.  Just tell them to take it easy on the sauce's they tend to pour on.  Sit at the bar, the service is much better and order half rolls for variety.

KpSewNATSj65MLFrve3z4g.text: I love this place! Its funny to read a review of some people who complained that they have been charge because they left rice, its clearly said on menu that you pay for rice if you leave it. You have to eat it all. Come on price are good for the quality. Rolls apear within a minute after order!

80U_-n0YTC4qIZ4UcYnjbA.text: I really like this place. $21 for A Y C E! I can easily eat over a $100 worth of sushi here. The sushi is above average and service is friendly and speedy.  I highly recommend !   This place is kinda small though and it gets packed and busy , but worth the wait.

yFpUQDddujmAOyS3TVQYAA.text: Quick service with great sushi. Defiantely worth the 23$ for all you can eat bc I eat that twice over normally.

V81vY6WrJJBhJYGP3UF77Q.text: Ate at Yama sushi today. They were wonderful in accommodating our large party. I had their lunch AYCE. It was a little pricey for lunch, but they had sashimi (Seafood salad). It came with pieces of tuna, salmon, hamachi, and octopus + sauce on the side. Their rolls were pretty good. A little too saucey for my taste. Their "No Name" roll was good as well as the Man Whore and One Minute Man.   I would definitely eat there again. It gets a little busy around noon so I would suggest going after 1 for lunch.

M2w8JI-D2LIHuS6SfjAbqg.text: The AYCE sushi here is the best in Las Vegas. When I go there with a plus one, I usually leave feeling super full, happy, and out like $70 MAX. It is so incredibly worth it that you'll want to make plans for your next outing to Yama.   Son of the Beach, the roll, rocks my socks. It's delicious. So delicious, even, that if you live far away, you need to drive there just for that. I do, and I'm a ways out. Not only that, but the place itself is cool, too. It's kinda cramped on the busier days, but it doesn't detract from it one bit. The waitresses were super nice, quick, friendly, and helpful when I asked my really lame questions. The sushi chefs were also super nice and friendly, and they provided a ton of suggestions when I told them what I was kinda looking for.   Seriously, I'm hungry now just because of writing this review. I'll see you at Yama.

UKmVDI6u9DR17bB5tZWLeg.text: Good prices all around.  The area is a little dicey. Well worth the trip!! The sushi was right one point!! Swing by this gem.

3vpP7cQ1V2ioRzCcp3Qw6g.text: Oh my gosh, what can I say that hasn't been said yet? This is a pretty ridiculous deal, and I'm so glad we made this our dinner stop during our one night in Vegas. I haven't been to Vegas in over a decade, and I definitely had my king's pick of your typical "Vegas buffets." However, I opted for this one after reading all the enthusiastic reviews. I'm guessing everyone else reads Yelp, too, because the place was pretty packed for a Tuesday night...at 6:00. We didn't relent, however, and whiled away 30 minutes shopping at the TJ Maxx nearby.   The place is tiny, as most reviewers have said, and the atmosphere friendly. We also were served by the most opinionated, cheeriest server ever. She was like a super happy Christmas elf hopped up on caffeine (got a mental image yet?), as she recommended us a bunch of speciality rolls, as well as how we should pace ourselves (i.e. get a half roll to try, then whole if you really like it, since they charge for leftovers). She seemed really knowledgeable, so we took most of her advice, and really glad we did! Some of our favorites include: Sun of the Beach, Wet Dreams, Superman, and the Untitled one (I think it's #24?). I also tried the fish by itself and got the garlic tuna, which was fresh and sprite. Even the side dishes were delicious, including the miso soup. This is one of the few AYCE places that I really felt I was getting a delicious, well-crafted bang for my buck.

4UnIj6KsTh9nd0Yg_G5hjA.text: I have been to Yama a few times. I have to honestly say I was not impressed. Besides the extremely small seating areas, the food is not of a good quality. Compared to other sushi places in town i would not consider yama to even be in the top 5. The service is horrible, the wait time is horrible, and the wait for your actual food is crazy! All of the times ive gone to yama i have sat at the bar which is no faster than sitting at a table or waiting outside for that matter. Not my cup of tea.

Wtmymxa29A3seYhYMlAvLg.text: This has got to be the best AYCE sushi place hands down; and I can't find one of comparison in Cali maybe except Sudachi in San Fran(no AYCE though).

cnkYBCiQesJuyX07UfIv6g.text: Another AYCE sushi! Be prepared to wait for a table wait to order and wait for your check. Food pretty good not the greatest but good. At lest the food came out in a timely manner. All the sushi was fresh. The uni was awesome!  Have to say worth the  wait!

0QQbk8RDaUYqSwJixqyZqA.text: Great service and the all-you-can-eat menu is diverse and plentiful. Most of the sushi is good quality, but the more unique fish and seafood wasn't as fresh and was served frozen. The scallops that I had were so frozen and flavorless I questioned whether it was  actually scallop.

gVz3eVeR2XAfoYIwEsz22w.text: This place never disappoints!  We always make a stop here on our Vegas trips, and it's just a short cab ride from the strip.    Rule #1, come early because there's always a line (especially if you have a big party). Rule #2, order a lot on your first round because it's hard to get them to let you order more afterwards. Rule #3, eat fast so that they will clear your plates and keep them coming.  They don't make your other items if your table is still full of food for obvious reasons.  All you can eat along with the great quality is hard to find.  They even have Uni and hamachi kama.  So come here and enjoy stuffing your face for less than 30 dollars out the door.

vYsnk2OdleP9MscfnJ3DUQ.text: Everything was absolutely delicious! I give it 4 stars because my mother and I had to wait 35 minutes to be seated but definitely worth it!

y4DFO8I5hrL5tFICXeM0GQ.text: If you want to throw down all you can eat sushi, this is a good spot. They have all the standards with a quite few specialty rolls. There are times at dinner there is a long wait. Its not 5 star worthy, but for the money it's good.

mSlM_RsmAWJvin-980-6hA.text: Bad service and bad food! As soon as I walked in I noticed there were flies flying around throughout the restaurant. Our waitress got our orders wrong! And then when I couldn't finish the bad sushi she told me I had to eat it!! Are you kidding?! I am not about to be force fed bad sushi!! Anyway, bad service, bad food, and they weren't very clean. Never going there again.

FE5IFf_w2l0Hn-1mWoY3Ew.text: Best Sushi in town...All you can eat for 20 bucks is the best deal u can ever find..and that includes almost everything in the menu not just sushi. My record : 48 piece Can you beat that?

LfleM6xypN1TuHs2v3-o2g.text: This place always packed for the price no the food it was reasonable. Place small too tied. Service above average. Whoever love sushi this is a place to come for the price

zViblmjnqXyAMWDwIZVvLA.text: First time here today, heard good reviews from friends and of course yelp. It was just me and a friend around 1pm for AYCE and there was no wait at all. We were quickly seated and drinks were brought out and a waiter there to take our order. We literally just spoke out loud about what we wanted to try and he said half rolls were good for trying things out. in a jiffy, appetizers and some rolls were brought out. of course, being a huge harry potter fan, that had to be the first roll i tried. it wasn't much, but it was still delicious. Overall, my favorite roll was Dancing in the Sheets. I just love the panko breading sprinkled on top and the perfectly fried squid in the center of it.   I've tried other sushi places off the strip and not many of them literally mean AYCE. Some will not include desserts, appetizers, drinks, but Yama did! eat your brains out people!

thTdDorqMpGSlU4eZuQxzg.text: Pretty awesome. First time in Vegas and did a little research and this hidden gem is awesome. The wait was about 30 min but so worth it. Must go to place if you are in the area. The all you can eat Sushi is very good. You can have anything on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6rv6Na78jhGoyR1KElxpPA.text: Being from Washington, we have no shortage of good sushi restaurants, so it was a pleasant surprise to find a GOOD sushi restaurant here that was not insanely expensive. Others at $18 a roll?  Methinks not.    Now - on to Yama.  We were greeted by courteous staff who kept coming back to check on us, refill our waters and bring us more beer and hot tea.  Our chef was Jun.  AMAZING!  He prepared a spicy salad with octopus and tuna that really hit the spot!  Next - the rolls.  Wow.  All I have to say is wow.  You can't help but giggle as you say, "I'd like a Man Whore and Sex on the Beach, please."  The rolls are as sinfully delicous as any roll can be.  They were prepared quickly and efficiently with very fresh ingredients.     I WILL be back.  I am coming back in a couple of months and this will be one of my first stops.

jLw6LCXX8Qd-6_zsGbIs5Q.text: Went here on a whim with a friend after catching a buzz at a nearby bar. Glad I did, it was packed but still got a table in 15 minutes. Sushi kept coming at me like a pack of zombies and sushi was fresher than Will Smith!

a8LNbjcx2IX9aXwfUvBZrA.text: I know it's unfair to rate a place by it's business, but when the plae can't run nicely when it's busy.. Then I think it's fair.  I love Yama sushi! As far as rolls, it's my favorite AYCE sushi in the city, Kaya is second.  I love their special rolls: strip tease and wet dream are my favorites.  Also love the seafood salad which is raw fish slices in a spicy dressing.  Their servers always seem annoyed which is fair.  I only took the star off for their limited waiting area, not having something I wanted in stock, and for their disgruntled enployeees.  Tip is to definitely go around opening for an early lunch!   Less busy with little to no wait.  Also a plus is their Desserts are all you can eat. At least my servers always give it to me.. Hmm I'll put the star back :]

YNYcnhbeAOTZEn9s02-Udg.text: Love this restaurant! Stumbled upon it back in 2008 when I was waiting for a friend who was also flying in for the weekend. I try to come here when I'm in town. Try: Strip Tease roll, Oh Dam Harry roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U9w8_zxUu7xs-_507y0z9w.text: If you are a sushi pig like I an, this place is the spot for you! For 25 bucks, you can do the all you can eat sushi option. Honestly, it's not the best sushi I have had personally, but it is still pretty good for what you pay for. I really like the names of the sushi, very adult-oriented. The rolls are made fresh and they come out quickly. Their service is great, never an empty water glass. Any hungry sushi lover should hit this place up. Sushi snobs may want to take a pass on this. Be warned, thus place is pretty popular and there may be a wait!

sJ4POc_o-Wop-V1tDUM6Ig.text: LOVE. IT. HERE.  Yes, ok, it's pretty busy, but we go for late lunch and we can always sit right down.  Sitting at the bar is fun too, because the chefs will through some great stuff at you that you don't even order!    I like that you can just order whatever.  There are so many amazing rolls - it's neat to experiment with them!  The seaweed salad is phenomenal - I could eat that all day!    The staff was great - they picked up a plate from me and some sauce spilled on my dress, 3 staff members, including the owner came over and scrubbed my dress clean - it was quite cute actually.    If you are looking for a fun place to eat, you want VARIETY, and you want good sushi - this is the place to go.  We go every time we are in town!!

QZ3TI0GrjIVrJxBA7t_pYg.text: Love it here service is fast friendly great food a little small but it is so worth it I totally recommend it

vWR2SYRy_BwNxsOO0WcQ6A.text: The only place my husband want to go for sushi since trying it 3 years ago everything is so yummy and fresh

cLiXk4WczAPtT5RD5ZqyfQ.text: I came here with a buddy from the navy cause he wanted to try it out. he kept saying it was authentic sushi due to reviews but hey heres what I think.  Theres only one place I have tried with authentic sushi that ships their fish from japan but ill save that for another review.   Here at yama the food is good. They make lots of different rolls and when you order something else besides rolls its probably a wrap thats similar to rolls.  inside out roll.    If youre here, you have to order the seafood salad and the "palmjob" or handjob something like that =p. These are the only two items that stick out in my mind that I now its good...so try those! Our recent visit was not a good experience because they were closing. And when theyre closing, they also close the kitchen forcing everyone else to order so much. We ended up ordering so much also that we had to pay extra; but on the positive note we got to take the rest of the rolls home lol.  My advice to anyone that would like to try it out is to make sure you order those 2items I mentioned above and also be there before they close.

RwZcfcDFbE0-ml8-Zw7m0A.text: Must try the Seafood Salad it's more like sashimi tons of it! I had the spicy and it was perfect not to hot. The half roll orders are great if you like to sample.

SGh72FzjCpnkgkPYd9xyMQ.text: This place is possibly Vegas' best kept secret. Their sushi is amazing and original, making the fact that its all you can eat a huge bonus and pleasant surprise.  Service here is always fast and efficient, but they definitely run a tight ship and if you eat close to closing time they'll make you feel rushed and unimportant.  Overall a strong experience both times, and the value makes this a can't miss.

U-5Th-Y3cs0_Wc683CeVpA.text: If ur looking for an inexpensive alternative for buffet in d strip, All u can eat is super worth it!!  :) service here is really good as well :)

tPjpz5IV3w2FPLt_K4LClA.text: Great sushi and at a great price for all-you-can-eat. Occasionally the drink service can be slow at the tables.

QxkXzxNJ3biRhu1Kwkf9aQ.text: We saw the reviews on Yelp, thanks fellow yelpers, we got lucky on Friday @ 8pm and hit a lull with only a 20 min wait...while we sat the mobs arrived and by the time we were seated at the sushi bar the wait had ballooned to 45 min.  Lots of beautiful rolls, make sure to have the 'unknown roll special #24' (one of the items you are allowed to only order ONE of from the all-you-can-eat menu.)  This place swarms, half a dozen sushi chefs somehow deftly work behind the glass sushi displays, another half dozen waiters reconnoiter the narrow-as-you-can-get aisles in a restaurant about the size of your average living room. If you're claustrophobic you might take a pass on this place.  The fish slices were generous and fresh; waiters failed to notice empty tea/water glasses but quickly took care of it if waived down.  The sweet shrimp (raw shrimp + deep fried shrimp head - another "you can only have one" item) was just ok as the shrimp had been fried significantly earlier.  You can order ala carte, or get the AYCE for $23.95. After tax, tip and any drink besides water you'll be over the $30/person $$ rating here.  I'd go back here, yep a fan. Glad to find good reasonably priced sushi in Vegas.  btw...the line was still well out the door by the time we left @ 9:30!

NZQ2ypLVVHuubEC7HFtnjw.text: I know it's an ayce sushi joint and not to expect amazing sushi but I thought the fish wasn't as good as the other ayce places in Vegas. It was packed when I went and the tables are a little too close to each other. I felt we were eating with the party next to us. They were nice and friendly and we ended up talking to them anyway but usually, I like my space at restaurants.  Despite their so-so sushi, their hot foods were pretty good especially their deep fried mussels and hamachi kama. I would come back for that.   Service wavered between good and ok. We were greeted and seated right away but at times, I was wondering where the server was to put in our extra orders.  I think I'll just stick to the ayce sushi joints in my hood, SW Vegas.

9QLiL8bYMjf4MjBODCuKHA.text: Always get great service from everyone. Love the Seafood Salad and the No Name Roll. Our go to sushi place

ugogJmbpl3LdK0A4skO6yA.text: They have a huge selection of sushi! My friends and I shared a few different rolls and everything we tried was awesome. I am definitely going back for the $25 "all you can eat" to try more. It does get busy, so most likely you will have a wait time but it is totally worth it!

04b1q0H0wRbVad072Zzc6g.text: I never wanted to go back here but seeing as my girlfriend wanted to try it, I gave in. I must admit the food was much better this time, but my menu was covered in grease and every time I wanted more water I had to ask. And then she brings me my bill before asking if i'd like anything else. The food was so much better that I was going to improve my rating by two stars and give them four stars but due to the poor service they only get three. nH7kFZvYYj_4henzgV2Ciw.text: This is always one of my go to restaurants when visiting Las Vegas! Not only is the environment always upbeat and lively but the employees are also the same way. We had the all you can eat option which had an endless amount of options to choose from. Our waiter was Moo, and he gave us a great experience. He recommended so many different options to us and brought out what he thought we would like based on our personalities. We were not disappointed whatsoever. Then, the sushi chefs would also give us their recommendations and again we were extremely impressed and satisfied. The food is delicious and extremely fresh! Enjoy your visit!!

8rm8tH_-hlYiiY7QONlbOQ.text: Hands down the best Sushi I've ever had.. All you can eat, great service, and we didn't have to wait more than 15 mins.. Suggestion; eat at the Sushi bar..

I wasn't much of a sushi lover until I was introduced to it by my girlfriend and I was immediately hooked. Anyone who wants to try or is thinking about trying sushi, I highly recommend this location.

GkSn_EWD9Qzno_k8lki0bA.text: we were told by a good friend that this was the best sushi spot in vegas. after dining here im now questioning our friendship. sushi was average at best. not very flavorful. of course i didnt expect the freshest fish in the middle of the desert but this was just an avergage sushi bar. i will say, the customer service was awesome. but if youre looking to satify that sushi craving while in vegas, look elsewhere.

SRjsKj_B0swde1e5MXtVOw.text: The best ever sushi ayce in the world :") costumer sever great.   Whether because of perceived healthfulness, its clean flavor, or just owing to greater availability, raw fish has stayed hot. And Long Island has benefitted from the rush of new restaurants that specialize in it. Sushi may not be as omnipresent as pizza and pasta, but the communities without a place to sample the uncooked taste of the ocean...  I love this place foreal

ieUHyUf-VhaBGZq5zJ24Tg.text: Great selection of sushi, really enjoy the seafood salad. After eating the fish and stuff use the juice for dipping shrimp tempura and other rolls.

GxL5sDaB0rGlqGaRIteY7w.text: Very good selection, tasty and fresh food, I enjoyed my meal and I feel that the all you can eat is a bargain if you are hungry.  Service is very very fast and attentive.  However, it is a bargain hunters restaurant.  I think of sushi dinner as an opportunity to savor, relax, and enjoy.  The hurried pace of it all left me feeling gluttonous and sort of thinking, 'what just happened' instead of 'wow, a meal to remember' .  But I would go back for sure...

U7NV-EWgQ3tU-K8d1lMbNQ.text: If you love sushi Yama is the place to go. Fast service friendly employees just an overall excellent experience

m7i_W2AgSDaW64AhioSMAw.text: YAMA!!! I used to live in Vegas before Yama was around. Too bad. I only get to go now when visiting. Before our poker game we meet and get the all you can eat. The Sashimi salad is great. So much fish!  You need to wear your stretchy pants to this place because you will eat more than your belly allows. Get ready for a fun evening, great service and excellent sushi.

BXoV_FK1idVSzuLoKQ2gRg.text: Food was good ^ ^ Fish was very big ( Rice also very big (_) ( this is AYCE place so I won't compare with somewhere charge way more like real japanese sushi restaurant )   Restaurant was very busy .... So I was thinking I should go to different place ... Cuz when restaurant is real busy , We have to wait long time for everything , or Bad service But actually Service was great ,very fast but they didn't feel us hurry up to eat and leave ! It was good

2a8yadDB7GN32x9zARmx1A.text: A couple of years ago, a friend of mine told me that this place has the best sushi and the freshest fish. Why the heck did it take me so long to finally try it?  Simply put, Yama Sushi is awesome. You wouldn't know it from the outside. It's in a typical Vegas strip mall near the corner of Flamingo and Maryland. Walk inside and it just automatically feels like you're in for a treat. The decor seems very traditional Japanese. It looked crowded, but we were seated immediately.  So how's the sushi? Amazing. It definitely lived up to expectations. We tried not to go too crazy, but I think we incurred some decent damage.  * Miso Soup * Edamame * Seaweed Salad * Seafood Salad * Soft-Shell Crab * Salmon Kama * Unagi * Ikura with Quail Egg * Yama Roll * Roger Roger Roll * Soft-Shell Crab Roll * Dancing In The Sheet Roll * Mochi (Strawberry, Mango, and Chocolate)  A definite must-order is the Seafood Salad (limit one per person). It's basically a plate of sashimi stirring in some mild or spicy dressing. I know of no other AYCE menu that offers sashimi. Pretty much everything we ordered was delicious. The only thing I won't order again is the Soft-Shell Crab appetizer. Breaded in Panko and deep-fried, it's just a little too oily and unnecessary. I'll stick with the sushi and salads next time.  I'm not sure if we got lucky, but the service is incredibly fast. Since we were only an hour out from closing time, we started marking things on our paper menu as soon as we sat down. I went out to get my camera from the car, and as soon as I got back, it seemed like items just kept coming at a rapid pace. Fortunately, I eat at a rapid pace!  By the way, at $22.95 for dinner, this is one of the cheaper AYCE sushi spots. Not by much, but it's worth mentioning.  I've said before that I'm really not that picky when it comes to sushi. Lately, I've been holding back on my five star ratings. Yama Sushi deserves a five. With fast service, delicious and fresh offerings, and a very competitive price, it just does the AYCE thing right.

20CJHNs0RiQopY9yI_9aeQ.text: Good all you can eat sushi while we were visiting. Price was good for all you can eat and the wait staff was friendly but felt like we were pushed out after the 2nd order after maybe 25 minutes and our orders weren't large - soups, 1 salad, a few half orders of Sushi so wasn't like we were over eating. We got the check and they were taking everything from our table while we were eating and our 3rd sushi item was being delivered.

KjWz5hJhUmqOTzCnkFdZ_A.text: Loved it! If you're in Las Vegas and ready for a big meal you should really try this place out! All you can eat and well ONLY 23$ for dinner. The service was amazing! Drink refills didn't even need to be asked for she was already one step ahead The chiefs were so nice if you sit at the bar. ( look at their name tags) really funny. Also gave me samples of some sushi because I was scared to try new things. " shrimp lover " is my favorite! Thank you for a good experience!

RYENZcW-XuhddWG5VHbNlg.text: I'm giving this place one star because of the cockroach crawling across the sushi bar. Before that, service was fast and friendly. They did apologize and told us they wouldn't charge us. Sushi was OK but the cockroach disgusted us.

FC_1ItYMwZQzuvqNKYUbtg.text: It is all you can eat and I swear to god there was nothing that i didn't like. Expect a 30 min wait but it is so worth it ! Highly recommend!

NkMygHJaCf-RfDXjPviP2A.text: Still my favorite place in town for AYCE. Another 5 star review, 4 years later. My last review, was just about spicy tuna, laaame.   Lunch $21.95, and Dinner $24.95. I have honestly never had a wait... even on a Friday or Saturday evening... So maybe I'm lucky, or maybe I come at irregular dinner hours (6pm... isn't so irregular) Don't worry yourself over a wait. As for feeling like a cramped sardine, yes you will be jam packed into this place. Ask for a table on the new side to the right of the bar if it is open, much more spacious.   Here's how to do it at Yama: Get a table, yes a table. I feel I get better and more efficient service at a table (waiters have notepads so you can stack your orders, while a chef only has his memory). My water is always filled to the top, sometimes I will ask them not to, and don't get alcohol unless you want to compromise your stomach's capacity for food;)   Next step is nigiri, (you come to a sushi restaurant, no cooked food here, skip the boring appetizers!) 2 pieces come with one order. If you're feeling it you can go for the seafood salad (sashimi in a ponzu type sauce, you get what I think is the left over cuts), this is a hit or miss with me. It's good, but I definitely don't come here just for that. What you must have is garlic tuna and the yellow tail.   After nigiri comes rolls. Number 7- "sun of a beach" is a must! A MUST. Hits every sensation and taste: hot, cold, crunchy, sweet, spicy. Yes its smothered in sauce, which "snobs" seem to dislike, but just get it. I am also a big fan of "wet dream," its baked so it takes a little while for it to come out, and has a healthy dosage of cream cheese. Keep note, if you're feeling full but want to continue to try, you can order a half roll.  And to top it off, no matter how full you are, dessert is a must. Mango or strawberry mochi will soothe the heat of your wasabi, and creates a great end cap to the meal. Enjoy!

ysQvHu0brzHNGfK34-tbDw.text: Two of use ate there on a Monday night (buy 1 hot saki get 1 free on Monday).  The sushi was really good, quick service and overall a nice experience.  The all you can eat is a great deal...around $24 per person.   This place is off the strip so plan on driving or taking uber.

q_igHcdI7ZCs8OGX347cLg.text: 2 words: Sea Urchin. It tasted so GOOOOOOD!  I've been to other AYCE sushi places, and this is probably the best I've had so far. The texture of the Uni is soft and creamy and the portion of the sea urchin is much larger than those in other restaurants.  The specialty rolls had hilarious names such as "Happy Ending" and "Man Whore," and they all tasted good. Depending on your preferences in rolls, there will always be something in the menu that will suit your palate.  Another highlight of this place is the dessert. Come on now, who doesn't NOT like mochi ice cream?   For those of you who are acting adventurous, I HIGHLY recommend the plum ice cream. Although the ice cream comes in different flavors such as green tea...nothing beats plum ice cream. It may seem different at first, but once you try it -- you are going to want another serving. It's sweet and leaves a better aftertaste in your mouth that far surpasses that of green tea ice cream, imo. :)  The next time I go to Vegas, I am definitely coming here again.

tYC7FwrbDJLOf_tNE95pkg.text: Sushi eaters listen up -  don't listen to reviews that say the sushi here is delicious/fresh/the best they've ever had. Ok? Those people are obviously mid-westerners or teenagers or something. Listen to me I'm pushing 30, I grew up in San Francisco, recently moved to vegas, grew up in family-owned restaurant for 25 years. DO NOT expect the sushi here to be "very good", yeah? the cold food is totally acceptable though and probably won't make you sick. The hot food is definitely alright. For a buffet, it is good.  Anyway, If the end of the meal (meaning dessert) wasn't so horribly disappointing I would have felt pretty good about my experience here.  We went for the dinner buffet. They have good hot food. For being a sit down buffet the rolls and sushi is average buffet quality, not a whole heck of a lot of flavor.  The amount of time it takes for them to come to take your order, the time it takes for them to make and deliver, and the table space makes it so that you can't overeat to the point of sickness.   weekday dinner is $24/pp (not including tax or tip), includes hot green tea, other drinks not included.   The desserts choices SUCK (ice cream or mochi, thats it). As in green tea ice cream that has literally no green tea flavor in it. Beware, the plum ice cream IS bubble gum ice cream with frozen plums in it - gross - is that what plum ice cream is supposed to taste like? Chocolate mochi was good but you're only allowed one mochi per person!!  Their desserts pissed me off.  If the owner cares to read this, which I don't think they do since this place is obviously really busy and probably has no need to change anything, if dessert is too expensive for you guys can you at least do some like creamy goji soup, or pudding, or just better quality ice cream please? Even cookies will do!  If you had good desserts you might get a 5-star from me, for sure a solid 4.

z1DYlG_yo09_-jiviVS0yg.text: Great sushi... When you walk in it has that nice sushi spot, whole in the wall vibe... But Customer service was absolutely terrible. Couldn't hardly get our waitress' attention. The refill lady would just walk away even when directly speaking to her. The only time they were punctual was dropping of the bill. 3 separate people came by in a rush to pick that up!!! "Any change"... I replied no.. No "thank you, thanks for coming, nothing", just turned her back like she was annoyed... Oh you're welcome for that 20% you definitely did NOT deserve... But at least the rolls were delicious!!!!

ywOEv8yd3zxgX6ihCyxfAQ.text: I thought the sushi was ok. Some of my fish was a little less buttery and tender like I would have preferred. The rolls were ok but the tempura they leave under a heat lamp so it doesn't taste as fresh as it could be.   I don't know if I would choose this sushi place over the several options around. But for a cheap and convenient all you can eat place it's a decent choice.

GTxqEgtr1JZd8odTkE705Q.text: **** 2.5 stars ****  I feel somewhat obligated to point out right away that this place is somewhere that should be reserved primarily for locals, or more accurately those with cars here, because while you might be able to find a cabbie to bring you here getting one to take you home will likely be an ordeal, in our case about an hour wait with nothing really nearby. Yes, it is $23 for AYCE sushi for dinner, but there were multiple times throughout the meal that I found myself wondering "why am I eating this in the middle of the desert?" Freshness is definitely suspect here...  For the price alone this place obviously garners some well deserved attention. It's amazing that you can sit here for 2 hours during dinner, ordering as much as you can possibly fit in, and walk away paying about $30 after tax and tip. There are some items with restricted limits of one per customer, such as the uni, hamachi kama, and a few of the rolls, but my experience with those items was that you should probably skip them anyway. Stick to the rolls with the overt (re: corny) sexual references in the titles, since they're drowned in enough sauces to make the lack of fresh fish not so noticeable.  After waiting about 45 minutes for a table (with a brief trip to Albertson's on the corner for some 40's to sip on while we passed the time) we all began with some miso soup which was actually quite nice, and seeing as how we were about halfway into the "burned out" stage of our trip it was a refreshing interlude. Tea was served on the side in mugs so searing hot that none of my dining companions were able to lift the glasses. The little lady who dropped it off must have fingers that are numb to it at this point. We all ordered just one roll each initially, just to get an idea of the portion sizes and see what items they do best. I started with the Snow In Vegas, a spicy crab, spicy tuna, and avocado roll with red snapper, eel sauce, and sweet yam sauce on top. I ordered this based on the multiple mentions here and it was my favorite item of the evening, for sure.  The next round I was forced to play into their awkward sexual inferences and ask my waitress for a Palm Job, which unfortunately isn't as alluring as it sounds, since the spicy soft-shell crab and scallop wrapped in soy paper with a "crunch" just feels a bit grainy, and, to use their analogy, limp. The flavors were nice, but texturally it's an amateur job, certainly not high class. I went for the hamachi kama (fish collarbone) as a brief respite from the rolls, to some shock from my less adventurous onlookers. It was cooked mostly alright, but definitely a bit dry, and the dipping sauce on the side tasted almost exclusively of soy sauce. Eating really dry, flaky kama with chopsticks is quite a pain in the ass to be honest, so stay away from this item even if it's one of your favorite indulgences, as it is mine.  Even though I was nowhere near full everyone else was pretty much ready to go at this point, not quite up to the gastrointestinal challenges I regularly put myself through. So, I foolishly wrapped up the meal with what essentially equated to most of my negative impression, an order each of giant clam and uni (sea urchin). The giant clam was essentially just thin strips of rubber and the uni looked more like children's toothpaste than anything edible from the sea. My instinct told me not to consume these items, but I of course ignored it, and luckily I didn't get sick. The taste of each was awful, along with the texture, and only amplified when a few weeks later I had exemplary versions of both as part of the omakase menu at Sushi Ota in San Diego, perhaps the freshest I've ever eaten.  After wrapping up the meal we asked the hostess to call us a taxi van while we knocked out our dessert items. Nearly 45 minutes of waiting outside later I decided to just phone another cab company myself and they showed up within the next 15 minutes or so. I'm not really knocking Yama for being located where they are, since we are the ones who chose to go there, but you should be aware of the difficulty you'll have getting back if you don't have your own reliable mode of transportation.

Wtj6bGc6-qEhg0nXM1M9PA.text: Love this place! Great service and very fast. Amazing selection, and always delicious!

v7Zhcd_RMWGC4OV7l0fhbw.text: This is probably my favorite AYCE sushi place I've visited.  Buried in a strip mall off the beaten path, getting to this hole in the wall will require some planning, but it's worth it.  Instead of a buffet, servers come take your orders table side and return after you finish off each round.  This means that the sushi is as fresh as possible as it is isn't sitting out under a lamp.  As far as the food itself goes the unagi, softshell crab, shrimp tempura, and yellowtail kama are great for those who prefer cooked items.  For sushi lovers the salmon and yellowtail were my personal favorite.  Normally with these types of places there's way more rice than fish however the ratio here favors fish much more.   However if you're looking for sashami the closest thing you'll get is the seafood salad which reminds me of a spicy poke of tuna, salmon, and yellowtail.

AoTa5n8slbagPrFn5M2U5w.text: This was the first AYCE sushi place my BF took me too when I first moved to Vegas. So we've been going here for 3 years! I never get tired of it! If you're going to eat at least 2 rolls, get the all you can eat option!

However there is one thing that bugs me. The SERVICE!! It's a 3 at best. I dk what their problem is. They can never get it together. QuAp9HB1DLjTiJYl9y5FuA.text: I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. If you do eat watch what you eat. I will never be coming here again. I found hair in my food twice. First time was in gyoza we ate one and the second one bit into it and the food was in the gyoza. The waiter or manger who ever we talk to didn't do anything about it. All she said was "sorry okay, would you like another one?" That's all. The second time I found it in one of the rolls. Before I was about to eat it I noticed a hair in the sushi. And I told the waiter we found hair again and we weren't going to pay. That was twice within 10 mins. We left because I was going to pay for food that had hair. They sent 4 workers out to my car and forced us to pay. I will never come here again. It ridiculous that they didn't acknowledge the fact that there was hair in the food and they forced me to pay.

Im3BBjRPKhCTKGWNtAvx3A.text: Would most definitely return here. Definitely thought the all you can eat was such a great deal! The Wet Dream was definitely one of my favorites. Service was great, and all employees were very attentive, and super helpful when it came to recommendations.

XgEhdViDJFFVAqwvDFVoHg.text: Boy was I a one minute man while having my happy ending after the strip tease. Nooooo! I'm not talking about Crazy Horse III. Sheeesh, thats another review. Haha.  What I'm talking about are the signature sushi rolls @ one of my fave AYCE sushi restaurants, Yama. That's just 3 of many different style of sushi rolls offered here. Love this place, and yes they are always busy, so when you come know your stuff. Learned the hard way 5 years ago when ordering taco thinking it was a japanese style crunch roll, and it ended up being an octapus salad, so yes know your stuff.   Customer service is always good, friendly staff, but because of it being so busy, they tend to forget about you at times, so maybe more friendly staff to move things along more smoothly may work.  Ambience is just right, with their expansion it evens it out a lil.  If you do happen to have a large group, they do have an area with LCD tv that can seat up to about 10-15 people. In there you get your own server, but I believe you may have to call to reserve this room.  At only $22, you can get your hands on all your favorite sashimi style, hand rolled, cut rolls and appetizers. All your favorite assortments of fish including yellow tail, salmon, tuna, uni, albacore, and white tuna. Always fresh here with a good rice to fish ratio. You are limited to some of their rolls or sashimi to 2 per person, like the sweet shrimp with fried heads or seafood salad, but when ordered with a group, well satisfying.   Overall, a great experience for that sushi craving without having to dig deep in your pockets. Come hungry, and for those busy days, come patient. Otherwise, get your sushi on at Yama.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yama.. Dancing in the street.
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yama.. Strip tease

c_ZLEiLz_mREx0PA_j02NQ.text: I love this place!! Tried it for the first time this past weekend and it was awesome! My friends and I did the AYCE lunch and tried their nigiri, a roll, BBQ ribs, agedashi tofu, green mussels, tempura, and their ice cream/Mochi ice cream dessert. All of the fish was really fresh and none of it was stringy and the BBQ ribs were AMAZING! I kept ordering those every time we placed and order! The agedashi tofu was good but needed a little more sauce in my opinion but the green mussels and shrimp tempura were on point! Last but not least, the Mochi ice cream - YUM!! Most AYCE sushi places don't include dessert in the menu so we were really excited for those and the Mochi tasted super fresh too! I would definitely recommend Yama if you're in Vegas and love sushi! I'm coming back soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super fresh nigiri!!

lN-hHjmZjv86UbYupFswqg.text: Came here because it was highly recommended and was kind of disappointed due to the amount of rice they put in each piece of nigiri and the service. I usually don't sit at the bar but we were starving after our Hoover Dam tour so we asked for first available seats. We sat in the smaller back room and the experience at the bar was kind of awkward. The sushi chef took a while to take our orders, and we didn't feel very comfortable listing off a bunch of rolls. He was super busy making other rolls as well. Servers would drop off order sheets and he would work on them for the tables and when he was done he would just say NEXT! to us, letting us know he was ready for our order. It took a while to get our sushi from him but the appetizers we ordered from the waitresses came out fairly quickly.   - They have bbq ribs here, which is like korean bbq ribs cut into three pieces.  - Green mussels took a while to come out, but were also good.  - We ordered a bunch of salmon and white tuna nigiri, and the chef put a bunch of sauce on top which made the rice fall apart and the fish taste kind of sour. Finally we requested them without the sauce since we weren't a huge fan.  - The albacore nigiri was great though. Rolls were also good, but I felt the fish & rice ratio here isn't as good as Sakana.  - Eel nigiri sauce wasn't very flavorful, but the eel was good! The seaweed wrapped around it made it super chewy though.  - Man whore roll was good but spicy!  Don't sit at the bar, try the bbq ribs, and order half rolls so you can try a little bit of everything!!

U5LL4j6gqu-qAbsyOuhxeg.text: Based on the quality of the fish, I'll rate this 2.  I ordered the sashimi salad with the sauce on the side because the sauce overpowers everything.  Without the sauce, the fish had no taste.  The quality and freshness are not there.

Ga2Mqb97a1qY1YCzzSYzBg.text: I absolutely enjoy the food and the atmosphere.   I come from California and my kids recommended me to try this place. I decided to eat here and enjoy this wonderful sushi restaurant with my grandkids. The food is exceptional and very reasonable prices for the amount of food we had.  I absolutely recommend the all you can eat sushi it was amazing.  I do recommend ordering one lunch platter to share for the little ones (6/7years old).  Everything was exceptional from food to customer service.   I will be back next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AQP6IO4M4J9zzKObPVWjiQ.text: Strip Tease, Dancing in the Sheet, One Minute Man, Wet Dream...those are just a few of the sushi roll names at Yama Sushi and no I didn't make those up just now.  They have a ton of specialty rolls with very suggestive and risque names that are both amusing and very tasty!  The price per person is for all you can eat.  Less than $30 a person for all you can eat sushi is a steal in my opinion-fresh fish isn't cheap!  Their portions are pretty generous too so your money will definitely go a long way at Yama Sushi.    I was warned about the long wait time before dining at Yama because they get really busy but luckily we arrived before the rush.  We were seated immediately but when we left the restaurant, there were people waiting outside to get seated.  The food tasted pretty fresh and it was delicious-the creative sushi roll names did not disappoint one bit.  We had the pleasure of being served by Moo who was very friendly and quite entertaining.  He was quick to bring our drinks and kept the refills coming and never failed to make us laugh by making little jokes here and there.  He needs a raise for his wit, that's for sure.   Overall, I grade Yama Sushi and A for price/value, food, customer service, location and parking.  They're located off the Las Vegas Strip in a small shopping center with ample parking.  If you're looking for a good all you can eat sushi joint and need a break from the busy Strip and gambling, I recommend giving Yama Sushi a try!

0mj_LPGu6ATup4k5BhbV0w.text: Simply amazing. I have had sushi all over the country but this is by far the best sushi I have ever had. Talk about bang for your buck. You get all you can eat sushi and soup for only $30.   The service was great. This restaurant is off is the Vegas strip but don't let that stop you from venturing out to taste some of this amazing food. The servers will bring you half rolls if you would like to sample more of a variety.   I left Yama with my belly full and my pockets fat. I wish I could say the same for the strip. Lol.

pNzKdmhD9EWpBAmXZcG-Qw.text: Pretty decent, Make sure you go when it's not lunch or dinner time. They will kick you out if you are finished eating. If you don't eat all your food they will charge you for it which is a good way to cut down on wastefulness.

Everyone works together, there is a great sense of unity, and did I mention it's the best Sushi I have ever had? Get the spicy seafood salad!!!

unCxOBQL5mQTH_I9wwme_g.text: on this visit to vegas, we stayed off the strip and ate at local places with great yelp reviews. came here for their all you can eat menu. i gotta say we got our moneys worth. we tried a variety of dishes; from sashimi, nigiri, poke salad, hamachi cama, their popular rolls, and so on. everything was delicious and the service was friendly and attentive. came here on a weekend at 3pm, and the place was packed. must be a popular spot. left full and satisfied.

IFEg_5CNh1v-ohw64D1Vug.text: I'm not sure why this place has as high of a rating as it does. Compared to other AYCE sushi places I've visited, the quality and selection just isn't as good.   We tried a few appetizers. The Ribs and dumplings were fine. But the teriyaki chicken was terrible. It looked like a filet that had been microwaved and then covered in a sauce. This piece of meat didn't look like it had seen a sautee pan.   As far as selection, it was fine. I think our favorites were Strip Tease, Fish & Chips and I enjoyed a basic avocado Roll.   The service was slow, which made ordering frustrating. We probably won't be back.

Y6He-SoKG0CwYNjGQLggeA.text: went here for the AYCE sushi buffet.  this is one of those buffet were you order from the menu and better eat it all before ordering more...  order all the  big ticket items first..  soft shell crab, hamachi kama, large clam nigiri, uni, fresh shrimp...  everything was good..    i think i prefer this over the big buffet as the sushi is made to order instead of sitting on the buffet table.  for sushi buffet.  had tons of nigiri, it was good that they don't stuff it with tons of rice as well..  had hamachi, white tuna, unagi, salmon, salmon egg, and perhaps a couple other nigiri.  one spider handroll and a yama roll  crunch.  too much!  so full afterwards...  i think this is the type of buffet i would rather do...    it was as listed on the menu,  ~$25 for the buffet, had a beer add tip and tax it was around $40  but thinking about it, if it wasnt AYCE, i could have just had the hamachi kama with a bowl of rice and be good to go... gluttony is bad!

LIkCufuZOS4ykkdvTl5trA.text: Always a good Sushi outing there. When the craving hits, Yama it is! They have my absolute favorite spicy rolls (TNT, You da Man, No Name) and I enjoy trying other things too. Don't forget the mochi ice cream. Very good price for AYCE Sushi in comparison to other places / other cities. So I can definitely recommend this location!

G2Fh2QiI4vy1IF38Qrt8-w.text: Tried to get the whole crew over for sushi.... The place is packed so make a reservation if more than 6.  All you can eat sushi is the most popular and the best to get.  It takes some time to digest the sushi menu as it is extensive.  Tough job to decide what to grind first!  The combo bentos are average and tend to come out semi-cold.  A couple of us ordered combos and the tempura was cold and the beef "steak" was more like Teri-meat sticks you get on the side with saimin(thin and over marinated).  The best non-sushi is the Beef Sukiyaki - wow, lots of stuff and very tasty(pic). Great place for groups to grind on sushi and beers(good selection of Nihon beers).

rtgiiz7Q5eIJ3oAZbWvLMg.text: Overall: No fluff sushi spot  Ambience: Low key, casual lunch restaurant for family and friends  Menu: The lunch all you can eat is $20.95 and dinner is $23.95. Lunch ends at 3pm, so get here at 2:30 to pay the lunch price. All you can eat includes Appetizers, Speciality Rolls, Hand rolls. Their rules are simple - order 1 at a time, don't eat just the fish and leave rice, don't share rolls, and no left overs. We had their One Night at Yama, You the Man too, Who's your Daddy, Spicy Sexy Roll, Man Whore, and one more roll. All of them were super delicious. They do give you a ton of rice with sushi.  Drinks: The menu offers soda, water, beer, wine, and sake.  Service: We felt well attended the whole time we were here. Good service!

XBbQjXaLg5_uwOYAEnQw1A.text: I loooove sushi. My boyfriend calls me a bit of a food snob since I work as a private chef... but I just appreciate quality food. The sushi here was amazing for the price. AYCE usually makes me a little nervous but I'm telling you - this place is awesome. The albacore sushi melted in our mouths. The rolls were delicious. I even had uni sushi which i normally won't eat away from home in SoCal. We sat at the sushi bar and the sushi chefs were friendly and knowledgeable. Everything was so good. I'll definitely come back!!!

j3fH7VQyWrta2Fd1W5Kgaw.text: I only came here because my friends were meeting here. The location isn't the most convenient for me. But from what I remember, this place used to have pretty decent food and service.  However, this time was a bummer. The food actually wasn't too bad (not as good as my usual spot) but the service was terrible. We kept having to remind the server to bring us wasabi because she kept forgetting. We waited for some dishes that took about 30 mins later to arrive, only after following up with them.   I'd probably give their other location a try. Would I come back to this location? Probably not.

T_IdpV0hVfn2RbAD-iPx3Q.text: Not a fancy establishment,  casual attire, and off the strip. With that said, the food was great! Food is made to order for AYCE, not buffet style. Ordered mostly nigiri selections. The freshness of the fish was surprising since they're in the middles of the dessert.  If you can, eat at the bar. Sushi chefs are very attentive and kind, and FAST.   I'd move here just for this restaurant alone. I can't wait for you guys to experience this place

y1abqgvZE8XpZ6HLXFrX0A.text: My husband and I came here to celebrate his birthday with some AYCE sushi dinner.  This place was recommended to me by a few friends, and I'll admit I was a little hesitant when we showed up around 5 or 6 pm on a Friday and saw it was relatively empty. That being said, it seems we actually came at the perfect time because it started to get packed around 7 or 8 pm.  I honestly can't remember what rolls we ordered, but they were absolutely delicious. I really liked that their menu had different symbols next to each item, it made it easy to order. We ordered two rolls at a time, which I found was a good strategy so that the table didn't get full with too many plates. The service was efficient. As soon as we finished one roll, a new one arrived.  It's not the best sushi I've ever had in my life, but it's definitely one of the top sushi places I've come across in Vegas. It's a great price and you're getting quality fish.   It can get pretty loud when it's busy, so I wouldn't recommend this spot if you're looking for something a bit more intimate. But it's a great place if you're craving sushi and you don't want to break the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eZk3lmE8qUTa_hLHYX29aQ.text: Super fast service and super yummy sushi, I definitely recommend the All You Can Eat if you're a sushi lover like myself. I love the atmosphere of the restaurant too. My friend and I come here every 2 weeks and we can't get enough!   Must haves rolls are: Wet dream  Japoneses Lasagna  Snow White  Burn your A**  One minute man   And not a roll but I love their gyozas

iJGBOWm2U9iT2NeYBOobPw.text: All I can eat sushi for $24 and it's not all rice. The only things that's not all you can eat are the higher end food but they at lease give you one free each person. Hamachi Kama, soft shell crab , uni and high end clam. The sushi isn't top quality fish and the rice isn't very good sushi rice but can't complain for $24. The service is pretty good too. It is definitely a great place for large groups , hungry with big appetite, and fast descent sushi for a cheap price. Would I come back! Heck yeah!

Iol8Xlexn2B88W5dtK5zwA.text: At just over $21 for lunch, Yama is a good option for lunch if you're looking to get a nice variety of sushi and other Japanese dishes. Service is really friendly and attentive but unfortunately the sushi rice was a let down.   Sushi rice is pretty much the foundation and you come to not expect the absolute best at an AYCE spot but I just found the rice to be dry and lacking seasoning. Still, the menu is pretty extensive even for lunch and you will have a nice variety of dishes to choose from. Think sashimi and poke salads, deep fried soft shell crab and tempura shrimp, and of course lots of nigiri sushi and rolls including uni. Extra props that they are able to do half rolls so you get to try more.   Again, the staff are just absolutely lovely and honestly looked dissapointed when I declined the offer for dessert. I think there are better AYCE places close by like Sushi Way but Yama is still decent choice especially for the price at lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GSMsyV11yc-2OAQujCqfRw.text: We entered, we're acknowledged, asked if we wanted table or bar. I said table because I like my little 4 cornered-world, but ended up at the bar anyway because a table would have been a 15min wait. No thanks. Besides, the bar was full but we scored the end. I need my corners. Lol.   Sushi chef quickly acknowledged us and to let him know whenever we are ready he is. The way he moved told me he clearly is used to the busy pace. My Filipino counterparts, I do mean pace with a p. Hahahha.   Waitress and bus person were pretty quick about cleaning off our tables, refilling our water in a timely matter, and checking if we were all right without overly doing it. I can't stand when they overly cater. However, I can't say the same for the guy next to us because I swear he sat down and under a 1 minute 3 different people asked either what he would like to drink or if anyone came by to take his drink order. The first time he had to tell the waitress could he have a moment because he literally just sat down, literally. Proof experiences will vary.  AYCE pricing is pretty comparable to other AYCES. If you are a tourist staying along the strip looking for sushi, this place would surely pop up as your closest and best bet. Which is probably how they got all these reviews.   As for me, sushi wise....I wasn't impressed especially with such a rating in mind. I was simple this night...just wanted the hamachi kama (collar), garlic tuna, spicy ahi roll, and salmon skin roll.   My hamachi was wonderful! Moist and tender and did not need to dip it in the sauce it came with neither did I want to squirt the lemon it also was garnished with over it. My salmon skin roll was exactly that....thankfully, though salmon skin was not stale and chewy because I've certainly had my share of experiences of that happening.   The garlic tuna was great, but, I wish the chef didn't go overboard with the sauce causing my rice to break up leaving grains of it all over my plate. The spicy tuna was my least favorite and normally I like to order it whenever I try a new spot at because I feel like it's pretty basic. Easier to judge. Probably the 2nd worse spicy tuna I've eaten. Why?  While I understand spicy tuna is spicy....this was overly spicy. All I could taste was spice and lemon. I've never tasted lemon in my spicy tuna rolls. I ordered 2 orders of this so the spice was starting to get to me and the lemon juice they've squirted in was taking a toll on my stomach and taste buds. My husband thought I was being a little dramatic, so he started digging or shall I say helping me to conquer these rolls and he was able to realize that I was not wrong.   Oh, as for the hubs. Pretty disappointed in his uni. And if you read my reviews...the husband is almost never disappointed in food let alone uni!!! Speaks volume people, volume...lol.  We weren't able to stay as long as we normally do, but we did opt for dessert. I can't tell you what their green tea ice cream tasted like because it never came. We waited and waited...and I just go to the point that I wasn't going to waste my time asking nor wait any longer. I mean, I do have a clear idea of what green tea ice cream tastes like so wasn't a big deal. Kind of.   If you are staying or living nearby, I'd recommend them as a solid ayce. They are busy so embrace yourself in having to wait especially if you have a larger party. If you are a local, trust me...you aren't missing out on anything that your go-to sushi ayce can't so for you.  I do recommend NOT bringing in a stroller. If you need to, pray they aren't busy or plan to go to another place that is sure to accommodate your stroller(s).  Prices as of May 11, 2017... Lunch: 20.95 Dinner: 23.95 2-6 years of age half price. 7+ full price.  Hype meter...5 stars.   Enjoy!

venDubm6hAsBZN61o6mZgw.text: First time there, and it was great!! Food was delicious. Service was great and soda was crispy and good! Definitely my new sushi spot!

Zt_VPOHxE06jA4Yur3Yf5A.text: This is my ALL TIME FAVORITE SUSHI restaurant in all of Las Vegas/Henderson. There is not a single bad thing I can say about this place.   My favorite things to eat there are the, Spicy Seafood Salad, Harry Potter, Man Whore, Japanese Lasagna, "Sexy" Garlic Tuna. If you order something Sexy style it comes with a slice of avocado, lemon wedge and jalapeno  on it, AMAZING!!!!   I've never had anything bad here. Service is always great, food is always amazing and the price is so reasonable it's ridiculous.   If there is anyone that is looking for great sushi  this is the place to come. I'm promise you that you won't be disappointed with the price and you definitely won't leave hungry.

M0eNvaoMF8ftB1zSb3__lg.text: I have been coming here for two years now and I have come to realize that the service has become worse and worse by the visit. I am currently sitting here eating and I have waited for a wet dream for the last half hour. My glass is empty and still no one to come. I am disappointed that me and my wife  won't be coming here anymore after 2 consecutive years as our every other Friday treat. Coming from a platinum review member of google(23k followers)!

QO1V8NzbNaZ58q0pncK40w.text: Never really thought about eating off the strip when we're in Vegas.  This time, however, we were there for six days and eating on the strip all those days would have made us broke.    A friend had recommended coming to Yama.  OMG, what a great idea!  Tried it out was not disappointed.  For all the sushi, nigiri and dessert that you eat here, it's so worth the 20 something odd bucks that you pay per person.  Forget eating some fancy schmancy sushi on the strip at those uber expensive restaurants in the hotels...come to this place!    The waiters were super nice and were very attentive.  We ordered so much food from their regular menu and their special menu, it was retarded.  We stuffed our faces like people who have never eaten before.   To follow, we had mochi and green tea ice cream...all you can eat!  That in itself was a plus.  I love chocolate mochi!    On the next trip to Vegas, we'll defnitely be making a pit stop here, for sure!    PS, be sure to read the fine print before you order loads of food though.  I think if you order certain things and don't finish it, they will charge you or something.  We had a couple pieces left of the rolls that we ordered and they were OK with it.  I think so long as you don't leave half a roll, then you are good to go!   Enjoy!

rYut3_T2jSUOBt4jJitidQ.text: So horrible! My parents and I ordered all you can eat for $24.99 per person. Since it is AYCE sushi, we didn't expect too much, but still quality of sushi was beyond bad. My mom loved halibut so we ordered it but we could tell whatever we got wasn't halibut. Their raw shrimp was slimy and grainy I had to spit out and return the rest. You get what you pay for.. Maybe we are used to LA quality sushi or maybe we expected too much. We were very disappointed...,

zXhyRQ2SXP_Pa2KAcHUAng.text: I'm from Cali.. but my family are regulars here, and was raving about how good this place is.  My first impression, this spot is super squished..especially for a large party and small children. There was very little table space.. not to mention walking space. Was not comfortable at all.  But if you don't mind bumping shoulders with strangers while eating your sushi, then to each his/her own.  Oh ya, the sushi was OK.

dXqCrdV71do0ow8bBFcR1A.text: Ahhh Yama sushi! There's plenty of fish in the sea and after all the sushi restaurant searching in my hometown i've finally found you!
