Yelp may not be a dating site but it sure connected me to you! ;) i love you for 3 reasons! A. I can afford you! You're a cheap date in so many ways! You offer me not only quality but also quantity! Let's face it we all need quality relationships but A LOT of it. B.) you're delicious!  Im not one to usually order rolls at a sushi restaurants but you have many rolls i'd well i'd roll with. Your NO NAME ROLL tickles me in all the right taste buds! Finally C. I love that you offer so many tasty appetizers to excite me before the rest of the goodness comes out. It may be safe to call those appetizers foreplay. ;) You offer HAMACHI KAMA! My fav, most places make you pay extra so i thank you for that. All in all i see this relationship going places and that we're going to make it!  although i do wish u weren't so busy sometimes! I constantly have to wait for you in a line but you're worth it and at the end of the day, There's no drama for my mama either, only YaMA for my mama. see you soon my love!

LCKigjzQeM1j0_jCji1Sdw.text: I freaking love this place. I am pretty sure I've never eaten sushi for MORE than my money's worth til I got here. It's AYCE sushi for $23 and you can order 3 rolls at a time (which is MORE THAN ENOUGH after about 2 rounds... especially if you go with a huge group and share everything). This restaurant seems to love me because it has nearly all of its roll with my favorite, SPICY TUNA. Many of the rolls kind of tasted the same, but I loved the Mad Dragon, Happy Ending, Snow in Vegas (or something like that).. and basically everything with spicy tuna, crab (not artificial crab!), eel, and/or avocado... YUM. I would go back again and again if I could :(. PLEASE GO TO YAMA SUSHI! They even include dessert in the flat price, with varieties of mochi and ice cream.. Drooooooollllll....  Needless to say, everything was fresh and incredibly delicious.

lb88BiDs6O7Cy4kyY-skJw.text: Stopped in today for lunch, still my favorite spot for all you can eat sushi.   Today we sat at the bar and even though the place was packed at 2 pm, service was on point. Our sushi came out quickly, drinks stayed filled and empty plates were removed promptly.   Yama never disappoints

3FBjsEGB4bTiKjkeJxHpAA.text: Let me just say this- my first trip to Vegas we visited Yama Sushi TWICE, and my last trip we came as well. I can't get enough!! I'm from the Bay Area, CA and we have a lot of great Japanese restaurants out here, however in the middle of a desert is where I have had the best sushi. The All You Can Eat is no joke- I was expecting some cheaper, average rolls but the entire menu is up for grabs. The fish is so fresh it just melts in your mouth. I absolutely love the menu with the semi-dirty names! It was awesome getting extra rolls given to us by the sushi chefs alongside the amazing rolls and sushi we ordered. It was a great way to experience more fish I have not yet tried. Order the bean sprout salad- I HATE bean sprouts but I couldn't get enough! Come during lunch time when it isn't as busy. I'm telling you, if you don't come here, you're Vegas trip is not complete!!

PVuVZ23_w8KldEiVT6uqLw.text: This has become my favorite sushi spot in Vdgas. Took the family for dinner did AYCE for $25 (about) per person. The Superman roll was my favorite as well as the Yobo roll (off menu gotta ask for it). The service was great and the staff was really friendly and attentive. It was a wonderful experience for the fam. & we seriously ate way too much... But it was worth it. Yum!

VmicwLTv5qfYbkkurMcaxw.text: This place is GREAT!! My wife and I found it by accident on a trip to Vegas. We stopped at the grovery store in the same strip mall and then saw this sushi joint around lunchtime and decided to give it a shot. We had the AYCE lunch which was an amazing deal. It included specialty rolls, desserts and appetizers. The service was great too. We sat at the bar and the chef was very attentive and we rarely had an empty plate in fron of us. Bottom line, if you're in Vegas and want a better deal then you can find on the strip this is the place to go.

WJr1_xOk-UrgPeZRl_ak4A.text: This place ROCKS! Everything is GREAT! Nice Atmosphere Stays open later than most places during a week night!

xUjByEFm3-9J2OZZIJfJNQ.text: First visit n discovered A real good sushi joint. My cous said its usually packed wit a lot of people but well worth the wait to get in. Had all u can eat sushi, the menu had so much to choose from n erything I ordered was delicious n fresh, gotta try the seafood salad. Real good service n the sushi chefs were expert sushi creators. The place is not that big but the sushi is big n fresh in flavors. The food didn't last that long to take pictures because it was that good! Yama sushi is a must try!

IZNsL1apuwmFhgKyC_C2UQ.text: It was a horrible service experience. The food was great, I am going to be completely honest. But the service was beyond horrible. It took 30 minutes to get ONE PIECE OF LEMON!!! I had to ask three times to get the lemon. The third time was when I finally had enough and asked if I was ever going to get the lemon. The response that I got was snobby and with little care. We also ordered two appetizers and they actually got to the table like two minutes before the lemon. We were also seated before the two couples next to us. Both of them received the rolls that they ordered before us. We ordered some of the same rolls as them. One couple arrived thirty minutes after us and still received their rolls before us. All I ordered to start off was Wet Dream and Son of a Beach. And it still took over thirty minutes to get them. The servers seemed annoyed every time I mentioned where my rolls were. This was hands down the worst service I have ever received in any restaurant. I was beyond mad when I left the place. Extremely disappointed by this place!!!!

uSZr75oixUNSWK4A9RYhhA.text: Fantastic value, Broad selection, Quality ingredients, Attentive staff. This place sets the bar for AYCE Sushi.

i_3NhmpED_6JEuVU_k-_3w.text: Teeny tiny, but worth the wait! The fish is always fresh at this place, and they have a great selection of specialty rolls. The all-you-can-eat is a decent price, and includes the most AMAZING seafood salad. I could eat that stuff all day! Would give 5 stars if they included at least some sashimi in AYCE and/or improved their selection. There is always a line outside, and it's a bit cramped, but only because all the locals know how awesome it is.

BVJg_7wQe5M7a6NqKXvGaA.text: Staff are very nice to their patrons. But the last time I was there, my experience was not worth remembering. I got yelled by this old sushi chef.  He usually works on the right side of the sushi bar near the entrance. He scolded me for ordering too fast. I'm like "Sir, you work at an all-you-can-eat place and my fat-butt won't tolerate your tone" After that, I had to back-off a lil bit knowing that I can't continue talking trash to an old man making my dinner.  Knowing it's only an isolated incident, this won't even stop me from going there. All I have to do next time is asked to be seated on the left-most side of the sushi bar.  PS  I was about to give them 2 stars but their Seafood Salad is the BOMB!

cnZoPcOXD7UeHNzOJddwgQ.text: The East side of the vegas strip is not known for its Sushi but Yama sushi is absolutely a hidden gem. Amazing All You Can Eat menu and has become one of my top sushi restaurants in all of vegas

Z00lZ-fT2o4Vq3lDKO8nnw.text: I'm not exactly sure why.. but I've been craving sushi A LOT lately. This is only of any importance because I used to despise sushi. Just anybody suggesting it would result in a dirty look from me. So when a group of old friends invited me to Yama Sushi, I was actually looking forward to it.  There was about a 35 minute wait before we got seated (only 10 minutes for me & another friend because we were super late meeting up with the rest of the group. hehe.) Anyway, this was a surprise to me because it was a Thursday night. I would only expect this on a weekend; a good indication though, mind you.  The inside is pretty small. It was cramped, actually. The tables are separated by mini room dividers. I didn't mind this at all because I wasn't there to be close & intimate with anybody.. but the table next to us might have appreciated more separation from our group. We were pretty rowdy. Lol. The servers barely had any maneuvering room. I'm sure they've knocked a few people in the back of the heads before.   As any person with any bit of common sense would do, we all got the AYCE. At $23.99 for dinner, I'd say this is a pretty good deal! They had a pretty big menu. I was especially delighted when I saw BBQ ribs on the appetizers section. (I love ribs!) These were short ribs served on shredded cabbage. I probably had about 4 orders of these. So yummy! I like the fatty kind, which to me has the best flavor. They had those, along with the lean ones as well. You just get a random combo in one plate. Now on to the sushi.. honestly, I don't even really remember what we ordered. All I know was that I enjoyed 99% of it. The one that stood out to me is the No Name (#24). I remember enjoying that one the most. Everything seemed really fresh. I was looking at the ingredients and I noticed "Crunch" was used in many of the rolls.. and whatever it was, I liked it. I also tried the quail egg one. I was so excited. I grew up eating quail egg & I absolutely love it. But I wasn't told that it was gonna be raw.. maybe that's what the server meant when she stated, "Oh we have an adventurer here." I looked at it, tried it, and let's just say that it ended up balled up in napkin.  Service was great. Up until we were left waiting for our server to check up on us again so we could order some more, only to have another server tell us that she left. Weird.. no one even bothered to let us know. Well the 2nd server ended up taking care of us at the end of the night and God bless her. She had to put up with one of our friends, who had an order of sushi left untouched. He was willing to pay a la carte for it, but she was nice enough to try and get it half off.. then ended up not charging him at all.   Overall, this place is great. I would definitely come back and recommend it as well. Btw, don't forget your desserts! Mango & chocolate mochi ice cream and red bean ice cream! Yum!

xll4MGf4h0gJE2AmQAFgDg.text: Best AYCE sushi in Las Vegas! I have been to so many places and nowhere offers a better AYCE! This is the only place that I can eat sashimi because the fish is so fresh. You have to try the seafood salad, it's so delicious! My only complaint, is that they need a bigger restaurant. Other than that this place is close to perfection for service, food quality, and pricing!

EhCRfbheeNakpoZxpEAgFw.text: Whenever I go to LV I thought of this place. Reasonable price; food is good and freshly made for a guest. AYCE place of sushi, I like the fact that every order is made for a guest rather than picking out from the counter; this prevents from developing food botulism, safest way! And it stops a guest when he/she is full already. In particular, I like fish!

uq4l2InN3NYr7uLFQBMWeg.text: Small, intimate and loud, it's no wonder Yama Sushi was brimming with people on a late Saturday night. To bypass the traffic, my friend and I decided to reject the tables and plopped at the busy bar. The food was quick and portion size was generous, but the execution of the rolls left me with that "oh god, I need to run ten miles and eat only broccoli for the rest of the week" type feeling. The sushi rolls are blanketed with vile spicy mayo and sweet eel sauce; which is too bad because the rolls were nicely done. I did my best to scrape out the greasy mayo, but my efforts seemed futile. By the end, relics of mayo and rice can be seen on the plate. Not to be rude in front of sushi masters, I gulped those mayo bites down with the help of green tea. At least the spicy taste stayed intact. My friend's nigiri was fresh and proved that fish is better simple. By the end of the meal, my body was filled with jealousy when I saw patron's sashimi salad with a slaw of radishes. Damn. Curse my wandering eyes for skipping the salad section.  For $22.95, this AYCE is one of the best deals in town. Servers were on point: checked in moderate intervals, refilled drinks, and handed out check without any rush. I just wish the sushi gurus were more pleasant in the beginning, but were great overall. I'll probably be back again to dabble in other rolls and salads. And request easy on the sauce.

ofLGpNCfQaugK8R0-zx4GQ.text: Yama sushi is my all time favorite sushi restaraunt in Vegas! The fish is always fresh, but it is the chefs that makes the experience memorable. word of advice... get there early because the line is out the door!

gDEAfAWFq83rdq6GMVn_IA.text: Any time I want sushi, Yama is the place to go.  The rolls are excellent, the all you can eat is definitely worth the price with tonkatsu, hamachi kama, and other awesome dishes as appetizers included in all you can eat, plus whatever rolls they offer.  They also have ice cream and mochi to help end the meal proper.  So good!

spB3rNEjtd3nk7mS1X5mHA.text: Yama's a good neighborhood place for sushi.  Like others have said, it's not the best bet for the best sushi, but if all you're looking for is to go out and chow down on an all-you-can-eat special and you're nearby, there's really no better choice.  It's definitely better than Sushi on Trop for both sushi and other dishes like bentos and the like.  Their salmon teriyaki here is great.    The service is always quick and friendly, and if you become a regular they treat you like one.  It's not in the best strip mall ever built, but it makes the quality a little bit of a surprise.  Recommended if you're in the area.

_b3VYTmdWvcPerkXI7lcwg.text: pretty good deal for an all you can eat sushi restaurant.  quality of the seafood was very fresh.

Vj6mJDqDvw9XtjXR3mZ_rg.text: Each time my wife suggests that we come here, I am conflicted due to previous experiences. Let me start by saying that this is one of the best sushi restaurants in Vegas in terms of the food quality and taste. The problem is that their service is one of the worst in town. Today's visit is unlike other recent ones: good food and horrible service. The waiting staff and the management seem to rest on the laurels of the restaurant's food. It's annoying; but our reasons for coming here are likely no different than those patrons standing in line for the Soup Nazi.

C-yeLnymqo7cOIBm0OshTw.text: Great service, great food. Lines can get long and the area is a little sketchy looking. Really nice inside the restaurant though

15VUrrRGsYMyTScVdxyUEQ.text: This use to be the only place I would go for sushi. The costumer service is horrible but I still kept going back because of the food... well let me just say that after trying other sushi places out. this sushi place isn't at all that good. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone especially after the horrible food poisoning I go last time I had it.

BYYNxXV5BVGvr8mLdALpHw.text: The seafood salad is amazing!  The sushi I thought was 'meh'.  While the names of the special rolls sound interesting, the taste was pretty mediocre.  I'd come back for the seafood salad in a heartbeat though!

oIkU9zdhgoSywn7J0Hc-cw.text: Best sushi place in Vegas..fresh sushi...creative menu and friendly staff. The wait can be long..try the lunch buffet

wvs9TzJC--zA-2zxeMiE_A.text: If you want the best sushi, friendly service, but can wait up to 45 mins to be seated, this is place to be. This place always has a wait, but it's well worth it. We go here at least once or twice a month for the AYCE. Only thing is I wish the place was a little bigger, but other than that, I'll keep coming back.

3srL02fqQO-OGYit051ljQ.text: This place is busy, but worth the wait.  Not many sushi places in this part of town, maybe something for the college kids at nearby UNLV.  Safe location for those out of towners who are wondering..  Great food.  Try the seafood salad--a lot of sashimi in a spicy sauce.  Mochi for dessert.  Great rolls. 5 minutes from the strip.

v6VTfZFTc7TEE1YJDn809A.text: It's always hard to pick a sushi restaurant in an unfamiliar city. Thank you Yelp again! Yama Sushi is just as advertised in the reviews. Great sushi. Very reasonable prices. Just realize this is not fine dining--more of a sushi cafeteria. But, if you are looking for great sushi for a reasonable price just off the Strip Yama Sushi is your place!

KQgYOgAmR9WXRaAVIBqKbA.text: Received a very warm welcome in this place. The service is awesome and the food is wonderful! Tables are partitioned by removable paper walls, it reminds me of Kungfu Panda's "dorm." See for yourself. The bar's looking hot too :)

1yUF70IvHjFHORiC97iaAQ.text: so me and the husband went to dinner on a week day night. we got to yama sushi and there was a 20 min wait. my husband wanted to bail and not wait but after hearing such good things i told him we were staying and i didnt realize that the resturant is so small and packed but it was worth the wait.  let me just let u know that my husband is not a True sushi fan. so the first were mostly shrimp temp rolls but my friend had suggestioned the NO NAME roll and it was deliscious!!!  the dinner all u can eat is 23 dollars and the no name roll itself is almost 15 dollars so to me that was a steal and there is no time limit or anything im hooked!!!

M4Jp-js3Lx-uZIE43vnIOg.text: Great sushi for AYCE.  Service is usually average, once it was poor.  However we keep coming back for the food

Qe9hyIZDzMuggZwvOisexw.text: Tiny place and often has a wait. Service is not the best so when you finally get their attention tell them everything you may ever want. Food comes out quickly. Quality is pretty good. Casual sit down place. Parking lot is scary because of weirdos. If I were to think of the food alone I would give this place a better rating. Good price too.

JAvMvnSrP9eusAqy7_wTiA.text: I love love love Yama. I don't get to go out for dinner as much as I did in my pre-children days, but my partner and I make it a point to visit Yama every couple of months. Food always tastes fresh, albeit a little heavy on the mayo sauces sometimes. Service is generally very fast and friendly. Avoid going between 5pm and 8pm--you will have a loooooong wait. Otherwise, I love it.

Atdw3O8yuTCWFa2dU1kq_w.text: Coolest sushi experience of my life.  My sister-in-law had been talking about this place for days while we were down for Thanksgiving.  I was a little apprehensive about "sushi in Vegas", "sushi in a strip mall", and "all you can eat."    Needless to say, I was completely wrong.  Its an order as you go thing which ensures things are fresh.  I also like that it included nigiri. Another cool option was the 1/2 roll option.  That allowed us to try almost every roll on the menu.    This place has ruined me for other sushi restaurants. For around $25/person you can get over $75/person worth of sushi. And for the non-sushi eaters in your group the "buffet" comes with non-sushi food like BBQ ribs, soft shell crab, and teriyaki.

0uevcwwRSWwm-AWrf0Z8qQ.text: Great bang for the buck.. all you can eat fresh sushi and yummy rolls for less than $25. What could be better than that?

rreTJ6eE6XcHr6A1rO1swg.text: Okay so walking in, I expected so much out of this place. I've heard amazing things, and I'm sorry to say this is my first negative review on yelp because of how disappointed I am with Yama Sushi. When we got there the appetizers were amazing.  My boyfriend usually orders about 10 orders of sushi, no problem anywhere else we go. At Yama, he could only manage to order 5 because the service was so bad. Our sushi chef was rude, and very blunt. Not once did he greet us or smile, and he made us feel like we were just another number. He made the guys next to us feel welcome and smiled but when he would turn to us, he gave us another face. I just feel like you should make everyone feel welcome and appreciated, not just your regulars. Then when it came to dessert, I ordered a chocolate mochi. I received a mochi, that seemed like it had been cut with a knife someone else used prior to cut something spicy. So my mochi tasted like it had hot sauce on it. It was gross. That alone makes me question how unsanitary that place must be. All in all, the sushi was below mediocre. I've tasted better sushi almost anywhere else. Sorry to say, I won't be back. :/

jU1mJC8JL-EDga5vCtz_Aw.text: I haven't had a whole lot of sushi in Vegas but of the places I've been, Yama sushi was pretty good!  I had all-you-can eat for I think $20-something.  The service was quick and friendly.  The sushi was well-prepared and fresh.  I'd come again!

2HoDU7fd4XruXzC26TD-tg.text: Yama is great. I was a sushi mon fan but yama beats them hands down. I love all their specialty rolls and they satisfy my eel cravings. Their Misu soup is excellent and I have never had a bad experience there.

JmMJyt8u20wBL7mF15dkwQ.text: Okay, here is my problem with this place - The waitress's are pushy & the wait can be insane.   The last 2 times I have been there, I have had issues.   The first, it was just my boyfriend and I, we were doing the AYCE. Just like most sushi places that offer that, if you don't eat a majority on the plate, you have to pay for it. Okay, well we ordered some of our favorite rolls, like Sun of Beach and No Name. After we had a 3 rolls, we were still a bit hungry. The waitress said she suggested a particular roll. She brought it, but also brought this seafood salad. It was basically large chunks of meat in some sort of thin sauce. It was gross. I don't mind sashimi, but my boyfriend hates it. I only ate the pieces of tuna and shrimp before I couldn't stomach much more. The roll she brought us, was also so-so. So we finish the roll, and pretty much assume we are going to have to pay for this salad thing. In the meantime, she brings us ANOTHER roll. By then we told the waitress please no more, we are full, and we would not like to pay for these items. She was a bit taken back but was willing to not charge us for the other roll we did not ask for, and the seafood salad.   Second visit, we had a group of 6. It was a Saturday, so we knew the place would be packed. They don't take reservations, regardless of how many people are in your party. We got there, they told us 45 minutes. We waited outside with a bunch of other people, an hour went by, and still not called. In the meantime, one particular table was called on but they said the rest of their group had not shown up. So they put them ahead of us, instead of the back of my line. My opinion is, if your friends are an hour late (cause that's how long they were waiting) you should have to get in the back of the line with the rest of us. But anyhow, 2 hours went by, and by then we were becoming extremely annoyed. We took a cab there, so we figured to just wait it out. After 2 hours and 20 minutes, we got a table. The food was good and my friends were super excited about it since they've never been to an AYCE sushi joint.

hjbrxStOiXCD4LnpsrvYoA.text: This place is pretty small. I got full very fast because they give a full roll of sushi, I wish they didn't because I wanted to try the others. The service is good too, she was very nice, so that's a plus.

HeY7FURHCnppzC_-6c8lEg.text: Omg try the sun of the beach . And wet dream wow

mr0BZdGpBUvuiUBoAulLWg.text: Pretty decent AYCE sushi. A little crowded and there is always a wait but you definitely get your fish fix. Gotta get back here on my next visit.

yClKAJejXiX8nPwcFf0kSA.text: This restaurant specializes in rolls, which I like, because they are filling. This place is definitely a quantity over quality setup. The quality of the fish was not bad, but you can definitely get fresher stuff at a more traditional place. My favorite roll was the rainbow roll with big pieces of tuna, salmon, avacado and shrimp.  The thing that sold me about this place was that it has an all you can eat option. You can order as many rolls as you want for around $23. That means that since most rolls cost in the $10 range, if you eat two rolls, you basically get your money's worth. Between my friends and I, we had eight rolls.   It certainly is not the best sushi quality in the world, but for the price, it can't be beat!

iciukku9xd3RoM8QrGmGaA.text: Overly crowded like other reviewers have said. We were seated promptly anyway and the food came even quicker. Everything we ordered was good. I'd definitely go back and recommend this place as well.

e4JHHA0r7C1dY4Fi5FvS7Q.text: Fantastic place and fantastic value.  Also, everything is very FRESH.  A bit skimpy on the roe but other than that, a must-visit when you're in Vegas!

JuPw1YQ7p-vZlevALNjdWg.text: The people who work here are completely incompetent. They managed to overcharge our bill by $500. Then act like it was no big deal. The service is AWFUL. Will never go there again.

wiSuIyORQekz62mr16UCAg.text: Been going here for years all you can eat at the top of line sushi and are the chefs here fast the service is great

v4ytmS2lj5rpDjdO7N5sVQ.text: I used to love this place, but over time the service has gotten horrible.  I have waited for 2hrs and only placed one order...the 2nd order appeared be another long wait....I am writing this as a wait for my masago(been 40min). This is the third time I experience (back to back) extreme long waits when it's not "out of the ordinary" busy.  It's time for me to call it quites and look for a different place.

2qWMw7uFQjLDp_xICx0KSQ.text: This review is long overdue. Ive been here a few times before and its always been AMAZING! The cuts of fish on the nigiri are big and really fresh. White tuna was melt in your mouth kinda good. All the rolls are really tasty and they allow half orders! They have a really nice selection of appetizers and everything comes out super fast! (within 2 minutes, no lie!) All the servers are so attentive and nice.

5VDrdJt9LfXiSTsd6CqQAQ.text: Even though this restaurant is in an unassuming strip mall, it really turned out to be a fun and delicious place to eat. Their sushi is fresh and tasty and the employees are friendly and helpful. I liked how the sushi chefs knew little English but were eager to help and get us whatever we needed.   They have an all-you-can-eat deal for $19.95. I don't know if it's for lunch only or dinner as well. My friend and I quickly hit the $20 mark without going with the all-you-can-eat deal. The chef noticed and asked if we wanted to switch over to the all-you-can-eat deal. Nice of him to do that.   I had a few pieces of sushi (salmon, smoked salmon and tuna roll) along with sushi salad. It's a salad with strips of tuna, salmon, octopus and yellowtail mixed in with some bits of spring lettuce mix and a spicy mayonnaisey sauce. At $6.95, it's a bit expensive but good.   They have a long sushi bar and a bunch of tables all around. Nobody seems to be in a hurry here so relax and enjoy yourself. I have only been here for lunch so I don't know how it is for dinner.  This place is worth the drive if you need a rest from the crazy strip.

TZMfNtN2-NwgBzlVHrlMIg.text: Good deal on the all-you-can-eat where it's everything on the menu included, and make to order which is nice too.  Definitely a good deal if that's what you are looking for.  If you want really solid sushi then it's not the answer, although I suspect in LV that the solution would be really expensive.  c'est la vie.

qqtB8ejlvZhxA-oJHwc9rQ.text: It's not sushi from a 7-11 or Ralph's, but not quality like Hide or Nobu either, just your everyday run-of-the-mill strip mall sushi joint.  Stopped in here last Friday with a couple friends and had their AYCE deal, which for the price and selection is typical. We ordered four disappointing  orders of Hamachi among some appetizers and rolls. Avoid the fried chicken pieces appetizer - very fatty. The only thing that tasted exactly like I thought it would was the edamame and mochi - that's not saying much!

BR-qlocdggXfUuDYlT3eBA.text: I heart sushi. And I was craving it on my last trip to Vegas with the Pops.  He took me to Yama Sushi for the All You Can Eat deal and I told him I wasn't going to eat much..yeah that didn't happen. I'm pretty sure I had two rolls to myself (and you know it's alot of food considering the rolls are ginormous). I had eater's remorse from eating that much food..  Yama Sushi was muy bueno but my number one sushi place is on Olympic and Sawtelle called Daichan Kaiten Sushi..conveyor belt-style sushi. So yummy.

UwLc_c0G4_Pd4RVLQo37OQ.text: Previously my wife and i had been living in the town of Lancaster in California, while there we got addicted to an all-you-can-eat sushi bar called Big Tuna. Best place we have ever been, excellent sushi, excellent service, excellent ambiance. Since moving to Vegas though we have been searching and searching for a place that comes close to matching it, and while we have not yet found such a place we both agree Yama Sushi comes decently close.   The sushi is well made and comes to you fairly quickly. While we have been to some locations where the sushi comes back to us at room temperature (ick) the sushi here is still nice and cool. My personal favorite is the garlic tuna, while my wife's favorite is the baked green mussels. The rolls are all pretty good, we have yet to find one we didn't really enjoy, though I do suggest being careful with anything that has cream cheese because it can be overpowering. Oh! And it is all you can eat desserts as well! Love mochi? Get as much as you like!  Downsides? I hate it when you order a soda and they give you a can, especially at an all-you-can-eat place. I generally just stick with a water then. Also, sitting at the bar for any real length of time can be murder on your butt, but it is the best place to be for the all-you-can-eat sadly.   All in all this is the best place for sushi my wife and I have found in Vegas so far, and we have tried quite a few. Don't go towards closing hour and it should be a excellent experience!!

5ruLmnveRm3Q8t7iDuKhYg.text: Love this place.  Visiting Vegas for a while now and just came upon this place whole staying here for a month.  Great Sushi at great price.  The all you can eat is a great deal.  Have eaten at high end Sushi in Vegas but this is my new favorite.

Ew6oUZZDq0lu1BaFyu-ORw.text: This place was great. It's a small place so be prepared to wait for a table, but the food is fresh and the staff is nice. Once you're seated they're quick to bring drinks and take your order. I'm going to have to go back every time I'm in Vegas.

3xgq3LjQOcxaFJxi-SHhpw.text: Place was yummy. We were lucky to not have to wait at ALL. Staff was funny and helpful, Nice selection of sushi. I had never gone to an AYCE sushi place before and I think I might be spoiled now. For the price this place was great!

2PvxtwW5nxNHMhf_dPIS8Q.text: this place deserves their five starts! service is fast and efficient. the food is amazing. AYCE includes appetizers and desserts. highly recommend their salmon kama and the sweet shrimp

UVTCxGgI3T9r3s5ML4hVjg.text: My fave place for all you can eat sushi. I have gone to the expensive places before and had good sushi, but who wants that price tag. It takes a lot of sushi to fill me up and frankly I could never eat till I am full at a non ayce and pay the bill. Well I mean I could, but I wouldn't want to. Anyway, one of my fave items is the seafood salad. The way I discovered it was one time I went alone and sat at the bar and the chef asked me if he could make me something. I said sure, and I am given the most delicious seafood salad ever. Everytime I order it is different, I guess it depends on the chef who makes it. It never disappoints.   The staff is friendly and always comes back when we are almost done with our order to see if we are ready for the next round. My water glass is always full, I don't like to order soda because it fills me up too fast.   The must try rolls are Strip Tease, Son of the Beach and baby one more time. I also like the harry potter roll and their selection of nigiri is great. Smoked salmon is so tasty.   Next time you find yourself in Vegas and you are craving sushi, visit Yama, it is worth it.

ruNl7oyp-yVNpbNKHIqmXQ.text: Short and to the point.  Every sushi joint disappoints after eating at Yama Sushi.  Get the seafood salad, just thinking about it makes my mouth water!  Avoid late Fri. and Sat. night unless you wanna wait for an hour or so.

nRobABvu8-0E9kjTmz8Rzw.text: Service is fast and the food is great. The only thing that is different than most Vegas restaurants is the weird way the push people through. It's hard to explain but worth the experience

h7D5iJqyT0PYaMoE2fSTZA.text: Yama sushi is my favorite place for AYCE in town. The prices are perfect and the food is always amazing. I've tried different places, but this is definitely the place I keep coming back to. The specialty rolls are amazing and the seaweed salad is the way to start. Kind of bummed that they limited their mochi to one per person, but the food definitely compensates. Keep in mind that this place is always packed, so expect a wait. Kind of glad they expanded though.

Ij30DZvk883pY62ReVJytA.text: The best sushi place in town by far. Big serving. Best sushi. Good servers. Try the Ellen roll with soy wrap..hmm. Thick and good roll.

Gp1ZkHtvO6IJVirzw1p8Uw.text: I hate the service takes forever to be seated, a part of the store was dark but still okay to sit in and they wouldn't let us sit there so we waited an hour to get seated. They said they did it for customer satisfaction but ur service is already horrible.

d2sWWR9YVhJaIhlSSVi21A.text: Hands down, my favorite sushi spot in Vegas.   The staff is amazingly friendly (and, if you are a regular like me, always seem so happy to see your face again) and their all-you-can-eat option is a crazy, awesome deal. You can easily eat $50+ worth of sushi for only $23.  The atmosphere is so-so and the place gets really crowded, but the sushi...  I take all my out of town friends here. Why? Sun of the Beach. This is the GREATEST and most fantastically unusual sushi roll I've ever had. One bite and I was head over heels. I urge you to try it, but be warned - you may develop a rather serious habit. (I could stop if I wanted to.) Be sure to also try the sashimi salad. You'll definitely leave happy.

18bEsiaWk0Dh0eqYkj-Y9w.text: I don't like buffets, even in Vegas. But I have to admit, I love Yama Sushi:  + ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT GOOD QUALITY sushi  + WIDE SELECTION of sushi at AFFORDABLE PRICES  + TV, private area, and small bar area so you can sip on your sake while watching your favorite world series game  + UNLIMITED MOCHI ICE CREAM, if you don't feel bad asking for as much as you want (they don't really tell you this..)  Until my next Vegas trip!

NrvIrsv2DQzL5fT1sMVTDw.text: I'm only basing my review on the AYCE special.  Yama is definitely one of the dankest buffets in Vegas, including Wynn and Wicked Spoon.  Coming from LA, I consider myself somewhat of a sushi elitist.  Although the quality of the fish here is mediocre, the prices here are unbeatable in Vegas.  The AYCE also includes all hot foods including teriyakis and tempuras.  The only drawback here is that the service is extremeley slow on busy days (which pretty much means every day).  Be sure to try their uni, albacore, and sweet shrimp (although the uni and sweet shrimp are only included ONCE in the AYCE).  With the benefits and drawbacks, I would rate this place a solid 3 star.  PROTIP:  Be sure to try the seafood salad; a mixture of sashimi slices in ponzu sauce and sliced radish.

BQItrQVcEQhkRcFLeUiidg.text: Fast and friendly with a ridiculous selection of rolls.  Glad we went here instead of another Strip restaurant.

EoYzylNd-hUlVfK67yaPLg.text: This place is amazing. I ate AT LEAST $70 worth of sushi at any other restaurant for $22 here. Don't waste your time getting anything other then the all-you-can-eat option. The sushi is high quality too!   You would be stupid to pay $150 for moderately good sushi at Yellow Tail in the Bellagio if you could go to Yama and eat better for less. Unless of course you want to your date to think you're rolling in the cash by taking her to a restaurant in the Bellagio. Probably doesn't matter since you drove her there in your 02 Honda Civic. Stop being an idiot poser and take her to Yama.

I30H1XJWmZ_lZdMXuRORgg.text: I happened upon this restaurant by accident. I stopped in for a tempura shrimp roll & ended up getting the ALL U CAN EAT. You can't beat this deal. The fish is so FRESH and the VARIETY was more than I ever expected. You have to go. The staff is friendly & very attentive. I personally sit @ the Sushi Bar as opposed to a table. Your Sushi Master is right there @ your service & they make the greatest suggestions. The one price covers everything except your beverage & it truly ALL U CAN EAT.  If you want great sushi and more for your money......YAMA SUSHI is the place to sit back & enjoy the menu.

ZDDkRAcw9dnMVjx389Swcg.text: Absolutely, love this place. Unfortunately, word has gotten out in the last couple years.  Go early (11) in the middle (3) or late (after 9)

DTyWhj4A08-NsQOoWshEJQ.text: Holy sushi, Batman!!!   This place was awesome!!

PYQ5Qb1DtX-PPAkp0ToP3g.text: BEST ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI PLACE IN THE VEGAS AREA THAT I KNOW OF! Every time I'm in Las Vegas, I really try to hit this place up. It's good sushi (special rolls) yum, all for a fairly decent price!  NOTE: vacationers..It's not anywhere near the strip, maybe a $20 cab ride to and from the strip..make sure to get a taxi's number so they can pick you up once your done. ENJOY it's worth it! =)

_s_G-mEve5lXwczCzr3ZYw.text: Iv'e been here 4 times now. Good sushi, great price, decent service. Not many AYCE in Vegas. Will go back. I recommend the seafood salad.

cIW6toXnPJOVEA_xdAxlvg.text: GREAT sushi! I sat at the bar, chefs were very attentive and extremely friendly. Definitely plan on returning soon and with friends or family!

_GxvsSSfTfWuMY2MOqnKfQ.text: One of my favorite AYCE sushi in the valley.  The service is prompt and the food is delicious!! I'm never disappointed when I go unless they are sold out on what I would like. Depending ob what time you go especially during dinner add apx 30mins of wait time. They are always packed!

nSza128LHL5foIaNEdQkzg.text: I came here for the AYCE sushi and to spend an evening with friends. I ordered a bit of everything...from sushi to appetizers and dessert. The sushi I ordered was actually pretty good. Unlike other reviewers have mentioned, I did find my fish (at least this day) to be good. I also appreciated that they let us order half rolls. This gave me the opportunity to try a variety of different rolls. I also like that the menu has pictures of most of the rolls which makes it easier to visualize what you are getting.   The appetizers I ordered where just ok. The shrimp tempura was super oily and the sauce it came with was watery and flavorless. This is something I would def not order again. I did try the cucumber salad and chicken katsu and these items were ok. The cucumber salad was super simple but it cleaned the palette to try new flavors.   One thing I wish was a bit different is the way that the food is served. I was in a table with 6 other people and more than one order came in one plate. This meant that we had to move plates all over the table to get our rolls. It also lead to a lot of confusion since we weren't sure who ordered what and we had to guess the name of the roll. Multiple times we ended up eating someone else's order thinking it was ours.   I did like the fast service. Even though the place was super busy, the orders came quick. I had fun with my friends and ended up enjoying some saque.   This is not the place for an intimate date or a place to come with large groups. It is however a place to come and enjoy good sushi!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i1R4DUevku3mUJYbBFlAXw.text: I personally beleive that this AYCE place provides the best bang for your buck. Its a little small and can get crowded, but its worth it.   With smaller portions of rice with the nigiri sushi, you are able to enjoy more FISH before you find yourself stuffed. With most places, they have larger rice portions and smaller fish portions- Yama sushi does the opposite with smaller rice portions and slightly larger fish portions.   I also personally like the atmosphere, I like that its kind of a small place and it's got a traditional japanese interior design which is a nice touch. Occasionally they update the backdrop picture at the sushi bar to match the season.

z-_OkvcKe80kL_fKkigJbw.text: Best AYCE I've had. Rice portions on nigiri sushi is perfect so you don't get stuffed with rice. Fish tasted very good.

gSxCnV_srr1rXU2c0XJs8w.text: The food was pretty good. Service wasn't the best but we saw they were short staffed and so we remained patient.

TqDFk6MZHfEOaAdIP0q1Ig.text: I've been to this place a few times already (flamingo location) and I really liked it until recently. Today we got seated on a cramped spot near the cashier, our food took forever to get to us (it wasn't even busy), and after our first order it took forever for someone to come by our table to order again. Not only that, but in the middle of our meal we saw a small cockroach crawling to the wall beside our table. We instantly lost our appetite and couldn't finish our food because of that. They gave us a small discount because of that but it's still not worth it. We were even looking forward to having some good sushi but it was all ruined because of that cockroach :/ Now they lost good customers because of their lack of cleanliness and efficiency.

uR4Oks2nJ92YG07if_gZXQ.text: Literally the best sushi in the city. The people are nice and prompt. I suggest sitting at the bar and having a chat with the sushi guys while you eat.

4sdAUrSy-GTAfGeWdqwr_g.text: I love this place! Visiting from out of town and my daughter wanted sushi. This place was close and we're so happy we found it. We had the Mad Dragon and the Rainbow rolls. Both were incredible. I think the best rolls I've had. The flavor combinations are perfectly unexpected and oh so good. The rainbow roll had little sections of lemon that gave each bite a burst of bright tartness to compliment the ponzu. I only wish we could eat more! The Mad Dragon is the first spicy tuna we've had that is actually spicy. It's got sweet eel sauce to pair with the spice making it a joy to taste.   Also noteworthy is the excellent service. Every server is vested in your table. We never wanted for a refill, a smile, or divine sushi. The name-tags of servers are just funny. We had great giggles over 'don't remember'' The menu is filled with slightly provocative names...starting us out with a good laugh. The rolls themselves did not disappoint.  We will be back, even if we have to make the hour flight down!

KllFTrbjgrQd8Wc8aUdjkg.text: I don't understand where all the good reviews came from, a couple of locals recommended it so we thought we would try it not a good choice there was no flavor what so ever even the ginger wasn't good, definitely  a waste of money

mHy35Bsi0igjDWtLrtkkew.text: I love it here, the food comes out so quick! Everything is fresh and flavorful. It always gets busy here since it's a smaller restaurant but I usually don't have to wait too long. Some of my favorites here are the soft shell crab, hamachi kama, all the nigiri sushi, and the seafood salad. The only thing I would say is that tables are so close together that it's hard to get out/get into your seat. But other than, great food.

ue-L2K13R5mkOVmns3bYGw.text: I've been to MANY AYCE sushi spots in town, and dined at Yama a few times. From my experiences, it seems like I've had a better time when we dine in the back room to the right. The wait staff is pretty attentive, food comes out at a steady pace.  Yama also has a wide variety of menu items which is a plus, if someone in your party isn't in the mood for sushi/raw items. I'm more of a nigiri type person, so that's what I pretty much stick to, but a few of their side dishes are also worth getting.  This is one of the favorite AYCE spots among locals and can get very packed, so be prepared to wait if you plan on dining here. ALOHA!!!  Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu  3.75

RZVjUwk8vRdy_W3EiMR85g.text: Best sushi in town. The staff is fast and friendly. The wet dream and no name are the best rolls. Try to avoid the weekends for a really long wait. Week days aren't too busy. We've been going here for years and yeah they've had mishaps every once in a while but we always come back for the food and service. This place can easily become your go to for sushi.

Yb2wMEBhnilKy4V5jU8iSQ.text: Few years back this place was great, but now it seems very average.  The food and service is adequate but not nearly as fast or friendly like they were before.  I'd say for the price it's still decent.  The food and service overall has taken a dive.  Now they have another location.  I dislike that one too.  I can't say I'll come back to Yama.  The price and distance no longer peak my interest.  Just go the other better rated places.  I dislike how often places get 1 stars and 5 stars but in this instance, you're better off staying away from here.  This old property hasn't done much to keep it's standards and service up.  Nothing has changed the past few years, so the only reason it's still around is because people are too lazy to find other spots!  Just do a bit of Yelping and find brand new, cheaper, and better tasting sushi joints around the valley.  Don't be a casual sushi goer and getting your money taken.  There are so many other places and dishes that can be tried out for the same price!

Mn4lr-Dq9PZ2kvzHOrSIkg.text: Absolutely my favorite sushi place in Vegas. My favorites are the Happy Ending, No Name, Palm job, Snow in Vegas, Ellen roll, Hot n Juicy. AYCE is the way to go here. The dining area is small, but it is worth the wait.

HaAoW_Bk5uttEYkVE1RxUA.text: I love all you can eat sushi places!! This one is very yummy and $2 less than my usual spot. Their menu has a lot of options and the service is great. If you are familiar with all you can eat sushi places, this one is no different than the rest. It is also about 3 miles from the strip so is perfect!

6Ud6uvJDYCSvj0nWALq_wA.text: One of a hidden place because it's not closer to the city view, but if you go to Brands Mart, you'll find it.  Fresh food! Their poke is awesome, their sashimi is just delicious. The price is pretty affordable. My favorite is the sashimi deluxe. I love the sweet shrimp. Best part? They will fried the shrimp heads for you when you're done. Not much in the heads, but its fun, and who doesn't like a little extra? In average, each person would cost around $30 there. Not a bad deal at all.

PXJ9bmVDXRp7Zs5n_yJijA.text: I love it.This sushi was freshly made to order and there was a wide selection of traditional sushi as well as many imaginative rolls to choose from.

NusWleSKVABEbCw-bPyY5Q.text: Absolutely enjoyed this place yesterday! so yummy and they had my favorites one was caterpillar roll! our server was outstanding, so talkative and welcoming! will definitely come again

iCFn4AKPHCaNxiiDnXddWg.text: I found out that there are a number of other Yama Sushi locations so I am not sure if it was just this one that was underwhelming. I've had a number of AYCE sushi in Las Vegas but tried Yama Sushi based on Yelp reviews. There was a wait area is very small but the entire restaurant is also small. The restaurant is out dated and it does not look like they maintain it well. I overlooked this because you should never judge a book by its covers! Maybe I should have though. The service was terribly slow. They had one individual taking drink orders but you had to wait for another individual to take your sushi orders. I would advice ordering what you want because it took nearly 35 minutes before we could submit our next order. They do allow half orders for some items so be sure to ask! The sushi quality was okay. I ordered salmon nigiri and was afraid to order more and possibly get sick because the quality wasn't the best. Some of our rolls were never brought to us and when we would mention it, we were disregarded. They are good with clearing the tables for you, but it doesn't matter when they won't take your order so you can eat more! I would definitely not come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t come to Las Vegas without having AYCE sushi!

HZkgNo6TlxMDopL3FUorqA.text: By far the best All You Can Eat in the area - the fish is very fresh and well done. The staff is all very courteous and attentive with drinks, orders and clean up. This is definitely worth the wait (as there will be one) and there isn't a bad server there!   Try finding something comparable or better for $24.99 a setting - you can't!

clIq82X6nK7gMKzC86ibVQ.text: their vegan roll is ace! really tasty and satisfying. more vegan roll options here would be great, especially with all you can eat option

HfmXM5KtxMNoRosP0cHznQ.text: The all you can eat for the price is amazing! One of the best values in Vegas! Recommended! The sushi is good and it includes dim sum options as well!

HUiRthMf0rqKORgkWrMwLw.text: There is no "soul" on this sushi place.   Came here because of the 1,700 reviews.   Turned out to be a disappointment.   Cons:  Sushi rice is cold.   Uni tastes weird (I am an Uni lover)  The fish is meh.  Pros:  Quick service (dinner time)  2 kinds of ice cream per person

8_GK8lUnqhbB0RfCy6ARrg.text: I was skeptical about eating sushi at first. I had read terrible stories online about people getting parasites from raw fish.   But one of my good friends insisted on taking me here. I said sushi? Heck no I don't want to die! Eventually I gave in.. best decision I've ever made!   I've been to a couple of sushi restaurants ever since but none compare to Yama by far my favorite AYCE. My favorite rolls are baked/fried not a big fan of raw.   & of course the staff is always friendly, great service overall! If you're coming with a big party during lunch or dinner hours prepare for the wait.. which will definitely be worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Man Whore&#34; MY FAVORITE!

7UaTLikMxGy5-DHyg9l7Rw.text: Not taking anything away from other sushi places but I think this is the Best sushi place in town hands down. Family and I usually celebrate our birthdays there because they are always so classy. Not to mention you get your moneys worth with their all you can eat sushi deal.

aIOf5tfAlGgfWvGrHT4ieg.text: Went here for the All-You-Can-Eat sushi and it's generally not a bad AYCE sushi, but there are better options in Las Vegas.  I walked in on a Wednesday night and was surprised that it was crowded.  Sat at the bar and it really took forever to get an order in with the chef.  You can't ask the chef to make you things either because there are 4 other customers waiting for the same.  Since it took forever for orders to be taken, my stomach had more than enough time to settle in from the first handroll and I couldn't eat much.  Also a small gripe that the chef's ?friends? came in later and he made rolls for them first.  "hola chicas"  The handrolls were disappointing.  Compressed rice (or hard rice?) with a sliver of yellowtail.  Probably the worst I've seen in Nevada sushi places.  The other rolls have too much sauce on them.  If I have to recommend, get the "Seafood Salad" and I liked "Happy Ending"  Tea cups went empty.  Went to a CVS store next door to buy water after the meal.  Like I said, it's not a bad place.  Just after going to Goyemon, Jjanga, Sushi Pier... I don't see a reason to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar

fBKYWd4ADss4hWz8--FX7Q.text: Good AYCE sushi place. I've had better in town and sometimes a couple things they bring out are just a liiiiittle too fishy if you know what I mean.   Overall it's still a great place.

SZYThb0Q-AUuskD9dVHD_Q.text: Quality has unfortunately gone down here, but for an ayce, it's ok. I would just skip ayce altogether and go for quality instead if you're not a sushi noob. If you're new to it, this will be great to try new things!

86zvVuNKADt0zFUqR1fr3Q.text: We did the all you can eat lunch special and everything was phenomenal. I would recommend the baked green mussels and who's your daddy roll.  The wet dream roll was also delicious. The service was also great, we had several waitresses available to order throughout our meal and our waters were never close to empty.  If you are craving a lot of good sushi this is a great option and the price is right for all you can eat.

iUFnJO6seCcMgPKeZ6o7hg.text: Yama Sushi has 2 locations un Las Vegas, one closer to Hard Rock Casino and the other in Chinatown, both offer all-you-can-eat sushi for 20.95 (lunch) or 23.95 (dinner). Their menu is big, and as longer as you can fit in your stomach, keep ordering, their service is really fast! Make sure you order the items selected as "one per person", those are special items and they are worth to order! #vegas #sushi  Ps.: Chinatown location looks fancier than the other but both service and food are the same, if you are in a business or romantic occasion, go to Chinatown.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tmCJ46323i1YfSs6XqRj6g.text: I've been Yama numerous times and never really been a fan. It's been about 3 years since my last return until recently.   First off, the place grew in size. I think they rented out the place next door and connected it so now more people can be seated at one time. I remember it being to tight and compact. So that was a plus.   We ordered the spicy rolls and boy they were spicy. I really enjoyed the different rolls that were ordered but the rice was just too much. The fish portion did match the rice but I think there was way too much rice for me. The same goes with the nigiri. There was too much rice with it. I didn't think the fish was very fresh. It was very bland not much taste.   Worst part of the meal.. When I was eating my seafood salad (which by the way was a bunch of large cut up fish not much going for it but that) I found a fish bone! I have never in my life found a fish bone in my sushi until today. I just couldn't believe it.   Staff was nice and attentive. Food came out in a timely fashion but with many sushi joints in town I probably will NOT be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood salad
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Found a fish bone in my salmon!

7Y741nyJnnfGvpEi7s4cUg.text: My family and I live close to this restaurant and have been coming to this place since we moved to Vegas 11 years ago (or as long as I can remember since then)! I have to say, I absolutely love this sushi restaurant. It's my go-to when I haven't had a single bite all day and great for catching up with family and friends!  A couple perks about this place is first the price. I always come here for AYCE and they offer a lunch and dinner price. Lunch at $21 is nearly a steal and super easy to break even. Even the dinner at $26 is great for the added menu items! Another perk is that Yama Sushi offers military discount for those who provide a valid ID (I use my CAC). Great for knocking off a couple dollars off the AYCE price.  The food is SUPER delicious. I've been to other sushi restaurants around the city, and I always find myself returning to Yama Sushi. Even the sushi restaurant across the street can't compare! All their seafood is almost a fresh curation; a few of my favorites are the Wet Dream, Yo Sexy, and No Name!  Sometime in the last two years they did expand the size of their restaurant, so that they're able to cater to bigger crowd, and their service is usually spot on every time I visit.  Definitely recommend this place for first time visitors! I'd say it beats any sushi restaurant on the strip!

UJIyM9IPQ42KMs7CUBbIww.text: Went in for lunch on Saturday. Like usual it was busy but was sat down as soon as I arrived. I usually go with the same thing every time. Delicious every time I go to satisfy my sushi cravings. But the only thing I don't like is the wait for my order wait be over 15 min for a roll is ridiculous. But I'll keep going there for my sushi! And service is ok not excellent but short and simple.

AQkt0rVdK08vmqRxgB1e8g.text: I've gone to Yama for years.  Their sushi is delicious, and their rolls are creatively named, which is a fun touch.  I only give it four stars because we always end up waiting at least 30 minutes when we go.  They've expanded by adding a second room, and it appears that they are working on opening a larger location; hopefully this resolves the issue.  I love that they have an all you can eat option.  They have large rolls, and they all taste different.  A lot of places serve the exact same roll and just switch around the order of the ingredients.  At Yama, you get unique roll options.  Our favorites are the No Name roll, the Wet Dream, and the Yo Sexy.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wet dream
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No name roll

VLEboZ77obGrrjMW0DVxCw.text: Sushi!!! This place is always great when it comes to All You Can Eat, great price. Fast service and fresh sushi. It's always busy so be ready to wait in line if you come after 5pm. This is always my go to place, I come from SW just for sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8s4HovYe12b4AtO-IdZr2g.text: Excellent!!!!  Great service- Great Food- great environment - This will def be a regular spot for myself and my colleges.. Great job Yama Sushi On flamingo.  Hot Sake was Soothing, they had Eal, of course I had Eal with a qual egg. For desert Red Bean ice cream...  Oh the Miso Soup hit the spot...:-)

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot Sake
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great marketing!!
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Man whore roll

nK5z1pdvRlH6nepGOwNGcQ.text: I was so excited to come here because plenty of people had hyped it up for me on how good it was! I was sold when we walked up and the line was out the door! It must be... THAT GOOD! After waiting about 30 or so minutes we finally get to sit down and eat. Our server was really nice. He was very accommodating. There was another server, a lady, who was kind of odd. Let's get to the food! Everyone in my party decided to get the AYCE while I got the Chirashi Bowl. Maybe I am just super spoiled that I get in my hometown that theirs seemed, underwhelming. The tuna that my friend got wasn't even red, it was almost brown. How could a place this busy not have fresh fish. The food took forever and the wait for the AYCE was quite long and my friends and husband weren't very impressed as well. I was a little disappointed. Maybe it was just bad night?? They must have long lines for a a reason. I probably will be trying a different sushi place next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GBJmcZGEIyYOJIjxbHVSfA.text: Expected great things because of all the awesome Yelp reviews. Me and my friend were not impressed! Every sushi roll we ordered FELL APART. The rice was not fresh at all and the fillings/fish/meat would fall down from the roll. Service was also quite disorganized.  I am genuinely surprised that Yama Sushi has received so many rave reviews. If you like sushi that immediately breaks apart, go for it. But next time I visit Vegas, I'll pass.

9CcW9pkn7BqGH6hE0SligA.text: Best susi  in Vegas always fresh  and  delicious  the sushi  bar  seats are  the best the chef's  always  give you  stuff to try and are fun to talk to I live in California and work Vegas I miss this place when I am home

JDZbSRU2NGvy7L4H-L2nAw.text: Yama Sushi was recommended to me by a local Las Vegas resident many years ago when I was looking for a sushi spot. It is a tradition to visit Yama Sushi the minute I get to Las Vegas and the tradition continues. I have also recommended this place to friends who don't live in Las Vegas and every time they visit LV, they also make the first stop here. I love the food, the employees and the cozy atmosphere here. Can't wait to visit Yama Sushi soon!!!

1CjKcn19ldChD7ShGbPq4w.text: I love this place! I've been here several times and have never been disappointed. They did change the recipe for the seafood salad making it takes more like Mexican candy. It's gross! Everything else is delicious

Fq4Jfq4VP9ppjZ4kwNnxPw.text: We expected a 40 minute wait ( as told by the host) but got in sooner, which was a plus because there was plethora people waiting :) we sat at the bar, had not only fast, but excellent service. The servers at the bar ( Agus & German), made sure we were smiling while they joked with us, while preparing our delicious sushi -- definitely coming back :)

hE-VQGDdp7IQABaaljUDAQ.text: When you get a hankering for some sushi, you ultimately know it is going to be an expensive experience. However, there are some spots that offer an all you can eat (AYCE) experience that can runs the gamut of being good or downright terrible. While the service is a bit interesting and the ambiance somewhat confining, their well-made sushi rolls more than make up for its shortcomings and keep me coming back for more.  The menu certainly offers your normal menu that you would expect along with their special rolls that define a sushi establishment. The chef specials are amusingly named and certainly offer an array of flavors. The man whore roll was interesting with a spicy salmon, spicy tuna, and cream cheese and certainly a good starting point. The wet dream was alright but essentially a california roll, while the Son of the Beast was certainly a good offering of sweet and savory, spicy and mellow. The fresh fish was pretty good and well cut, while the rice was nicely rolled.  Service was reasonably attentive and water glasses rarely went empty while the sushi arrived in a nice progression and the wait wasn't too excessive. I'd suggest ordering more when you have a roll left on the table. It certainly was loud and a little rambunctious, but I think that was part of the charm.   Tables are rather close together so you might be overhearing the table next to you. Probably not a good idea to discuss a business merger or chat about the insider stock tips you got.   Plan to make reservations otherwise you might be in for a wait. We waited about 20 minutes for our table, which wasn't too excessive but we didn't go on a peak night either. You'll thank me for my suggestion when you wait in the 105 degree heat.   All in all, you definitely get a good value for your money and definitely one of the better options for affordable and good sushi.

RiddE2cq_SbGzXrVXrl2Xg.text: Very fresh sushi! Will definitely be back.  We had nigiri sushi which was great. From the rolls, we ordered the Yama crunch, sun of the beach, & happy rainbow and they were all delicious!

uSCgqQqlc05sCdSPo8xJKw.text: I have been trying different sushi places around town and Yama Sushi is the best I usually get the seafood salad but today I tried the tuna poke salad and now it might be my new favorite. Even the egg rolls are delicious here!! If you want sushi you want Yama !!

lgs6qSpkzKFoQaSPc8Jlew.text: Don't understand why they get 4 stars.  -Food quality is low -Taste is bad -Service is okay but they prepare food for a long time so get ready to wait and wait and wait.....Even not a busy day.... -Price is low but comparing to their quality... I would say it's not worth it  Sincere advice... Find other sushi restaurants or eat buffet on the main street!!

76L7gL9N2_8WeaiA4fRkyg.text: The sushi was good. Desert sushi can be suspect, but we went with friends on their recommendation and we did the all you can eat lunch ($20). Lots of fun rolls, and very pleasant service.  So why only two stars? A gnarly black hair found its way on to my husband's nigiri. Not even ON to, but under and almost around. He discreetly showed the waitress who took the plate away. So discreet that the other 5 of us didn't see it, hear about it, or notice while we finished what we were eating. But then, a manager ( I assume) came back and in very accusatorial tone said "I just don't know how this would happen." And then proceeded to describe the hair of the chefs and wait staff. She was kind of pushy about it. And this got the attention of the rest of our table and other tables. The one piece of nigiri had the hair looped under it and sticking up. My husband noticed it when he ate the first piece and the hair on he second piece moved into view as most of it was pinned under the rice. Disgusting.  It wouldn't have been a big deal, except the manager was rude about it. We don't know how it happened either lady, but it did and no we don't want it anymore.

q0eHfWaxKhuwbjGKSNU2SA.text: Rough start..had female servers who just didn't seem like they are happy working here..but as our orders started coming, they seemed at ease and became nicer. The male servers compensated for their unhappy attitudes. Overall, our experience turned out ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Disgusting! I hope there kitchen is cleaner.

SLDJE3hmDCOs0UfarXWcjg.text: Amazing food and amazing place.. Pauw the supervisor is amazing and sitting at the bar was the best experience. The food is great and the all you can eat deal is really worth the price..  We are from Boston and we are definitely coming back to Vegas and visiting this restaurant.. 5 stars all around

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green mussels ( baked). Delicious!!!

JejzMDYG83OT3gnWdmxS-w.text: Great service. They are super fast, unlike the all you can eat sushi places I'm used to. Everything was fresh and delicious. Will come again when I'm back in town

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

erV5a7tj28GKmAhViPJqlA.text: I was craving sushi badly and didn't even care if I had to go by myself to get it. So I hit up yelp, which OF COURSE, never fails me and found Yama Sushi. All of my friends had already been to it without inviting me (uh!) so I decided to see what all the fuss was about.  Loved. It.   I went in to a fairly empty restaurant and sat at the almost full bar. My only, only complaint is that this place is so unnecessarily noisy. I don't know if it's acoustics or rudeness, but it really needs to tone down. I sat next to two of the rudest people I believe I've ever sat near. They chewed with their mouth open, talked so loud that when I took a phone call my best friend said she'd call back when SHE could hear ME. Bad, bad.  Other than that, the service was spectacular and the sushi was delicious. I had some albacore (fresh!), a little edamame (a little overcooked), some fiery sushi, some soft shell crab, and rols, rolls, rolls. I loved it all! I really couldn't stop eating and I'm not one to gorge generally. This place made me! I swear!  The final bite was mango mochi. Yum-my. It was the perfect ending to a perfect meal.   I am definitely heading back to this AYCE soon!

Qv_eLdiDonj95MNFAKCxVQ.text: Avoid this place at all cost!!!  Only need to say one word...COCKROACH!  This place is disgusting. I want to give it no stars but you cant...  4 of us were sitting there and I saw a roach crawl by and then my buddy saw a big one and smashed it on the glass that the fish sits under.   GROSS!  If you want good sushi in vegas without the roaches go to SUSHI WAY.  Never had a bad experience there.

R10tvDdSXAAhahOVJEIWEQ.text: Awesome quality sushi!!  Chefs are very cool and are encouraging when ordering more rolls. All the servers we came into contact with were extremely friendly and down to earth! The price of all you can eat is very low considering the quality of sushi. I believe this is the best sushi place around!

1vv4V89TxaU8qv2yqhLjKg.text: It's small and not in the greatest part of town but the food is worth it! If you love unhealthy deep fried sushi rolls then you HAVE to get the Be mine! It's all about the Be Mine! Thank god for AYCE because I would eat like 10 Be Mine's if I could!

RBdLZ6eWu05M1cxdY4OuTQ.text: A real disappointment. If you know anything about sashimi/sushi, you will not like the quality of the food served here. I had high expectations walking in, based on raving reviews on yelp, but oh, my goodness... I really do not see how anybody could rate this place anything other than a one star.   Pros: none; no kidding.   Cons:  Ambience: cafeteria-looking set up with small tables crammed into a tiny space  Service: I had to grab a waitress after waiting 5 minutes with all these waiters and waitresses passing by our table without paying any attention. Then, after placing our first order, we find something else we want to order, but the waitress tells us that we have to wait until the first order comes out. Ummmmm.... We left 45 minutes after we sat down, and more than half of our "first order" had not come out. We were done waiting.    Food: Sorry, but it was unbearably horrible. They spice everything up, even white tuna, which is very telling of its freshness, or the lack thereof.  The uni was dark brown in color, and it tasted bitter, not sweet. Even salmon was mushy.  Rice is way too sticky and way too much.   I travel a lot, internationally. I have been to many, really, many different restaurants, some good and some bad. This, I would, without hesitation, call as one of the five worst restaurants I've ever been to in the last decade of my life.   Vegas has so many awesome restaurants. Save yourself a trip; go somewhere else. My family will go have dinner at another place in a bit.

iDgN02p2nB9DMFtvJSkNKQ.text: This is one of my favorite AYCE sushi places in Vegas.  My favorite twist they do is the 'sexy' versions of nigiri, which top the normal piece with thin slices of lemon, avocado, and jalapeno with a drop of sriracha.

dSm9WiJ-_jf1xrg9yXnllQ.text: I like this place so much...  The food is so good and sever have very nice service...number 7 make it in hand roll is the best sushi i never have.      Love this place! Would give it a 5star if service was a bit better. Usually go here once a month. You can't beat all you can eat sushi for $25. Food quality has always been great. Not once have we had something we didn't like.   Usually pretty busy. Always packed for lunch and dinner! It can get a bit noisy with all the people.

NFC5w9MaGlwYp4-cvsu5PQ.text: I've had both A-OK experiences at Yama and sub-par experiences at Yama. It really depends on the day and time that you go.  For me, there is one chef who seems to remember my friend and I, so we get a good meal whenever he is working. Bar sitting is a must here, you get much better service and it's not as cramped as the tables.  The fish is standard for AYCE. I usually just stick with nigiri, one of everything! I have been partial to the masago/quail egg combo as well.  For the price and location, Yama Sushi is alright. Don't go here during busy times though, the wait can be long and they want to rush you outta there.

lpgx8IRAl6iohvSVJPNm2g.text: Really good quality AYCE seafood/sushi! No complaints! YT collar, uni, 4 handrolls, seafood salad, sweet shrimp w/fried head, firecracker, deep fried muscles , palm job , bottle of soju & some mochi/ice cream. Hell of a deal!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood salad rock&#39;d!
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wfSUkyqsRpWGccM4qr2pPw.text: I must say I highly recommend this place. I am not a sushi eater AT ALL and once I told Paw (a worker here at Yama sushi) that he was not having it. After convincing me to get all you can eat sushi, he told me he would not steer me wrong and I must say he didn't. Of course I did not love everything he had me try but most of it was definitely a go. Each roll he has me try, he only made me half the roll since I was just "trying" them out. Once I tried the Yama Crunch, that was it! I was addicted! I now crave that roll lol. The service here is always great and I must say a big THANK YOU to Paw for always giving an awesome experience and opening up my taste buds to sushi !!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yama Crunch !!

gGN7BkHjV9ITk_b4PDlRUw.text: One of the worst all you can eat I have ever ate. The service was alright. But the food was not good at all. The Seafood sashimi salad was so unbearable; I barely finished half of it. All of the sushi rolls were thick with the amount of rice they use, and I could obviously see the rice was overcooked.

8IfXqYozjZT_tfy-ses4hg.text: I really enjoyed my experience here. I have never been to an AYCE sushi joint. This was a great introductory. My chef provided excellent service. I have a bit of a large appetite and literally ordered about one order of everything on the AYCE menu. Everything was great. This was my first time having sea urchin. However, that was the only bad thing is that I was only allotted one order of that delicious creature.

eHK3bwvwbekQrGhNda2orw.text: Great customer service, they were on it refilling my drinks and asking if I wanted to order anything. The food is delish. I love how u can order half rolls. Gotta get the seafood salad, soft shell crab and the fried mussels. The fish always taste great and fresh. Signature rolls are awesome. Order the sweet shrimp don't be afraid of the crispy shrimp head. Whenever I'm in town I always try to make it to this off the strip gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet shrimp with crispy shrimp head

TpoFWnf2mM0gA08CeOPtsA.text: Most amazing sushi place. You will never be thirsty or hungry, their service is always amazing. Their rolls have some of the biggest and best pieces of fish you will ever have. Sometimes there's a wait, but it's only because this place is that good. Oh, and you must get the seafood salad. It's life changing.

s7qYt8A8fdtj-BZUb8Mivw.text: This place is great. The AYCE sushi is very fresh and they do not put tons of rice with it, so you are not just filling up on rice.  They are also extremely attentive, always asking if you would like to order more. Some AYCE take their time to ask you for more orders so you can digest longer and get full without eating as much. Definitely will be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh sushi!  Not so much rice.

-jc_GCytiQpWBgs27OXXHg.text: This place was really amazing. It is one of those places where they make your sushi fresh and it's not just sitting on some plate. They are made to order and you can keep ordering as much as you want for as long as you want! Since there is no time limit, it makes the place amazing.   They have a ton of variety of sushi's that I am sure they made up themselves... or at least the names. Some are warm, some are soft, some are unique, and some are great! you can pretty much order what your heart desires and the service is really good! Cannot wait to go back :D

IsdmozFYsdp04NgUBbGCuQ.text: LOVE this place! Our favorite place for AYCE sushi!! Sit at the bar if you can, shorter wait on your order.   Super white fish n garlic tuna nigiri ! Harry Potter Roll! Dynamite Seafood salad(we ask for the cream sauce n the spicy sauce mixed) One Minute Man  Great service! Great food!

j8ScSldgll0FDdQ3QjQOhQ.text: Very good quality sushi and rolls! Service was friendly and the variety of appetizers and even dessert was amazing. Definitely recommend coming here.

hzPH_gGkUsigdzaxWniuBQ.text: Excellent AYCE sushi. I am a bit of a sushi snob and the choices here were great and they do not limit your choices  much at all. This is possibly the best AYCE I have had, and I have eaten at dozens of them here in Vegas, in California, AZ, Colorado, and Florida.  Seriously good. Start with the seafood salad and go deep from there. They even let you order Uni, and it was fresh and a decent portion. I will be back with hungry friends.

t7XvVh4m-_R3hX5keJppfg.text: Another mediocre sushi place.  It was pretty crowded when we went, so we had to split into two parties to make seating easlier.  Everything I had there was just... okay. I didn't really expect anything that great, since we were pretty far inland and in the Nevada desert.  You da ma too! (spicy tuna w/ salmon and spicy mayo) - underwhelming Salmon nigiri - not fresh Alaskan salmon roll - pretty skimpy  Points for having unusual (sometimes suggestive) names for special rolls.

-9d7hYMYlNcY0ok3gzn55w.text: My family and I were looking for another sushi  place beside sakana for our anniversary date. We decided to just try this place out since it has a good rating. We walked inside and sat at the sushi  bar. The waitress was really friendly. We were still looking and deciding what we are going to order from the menu and all of the sudden this guy (sushi  chief)  yelled order Now. He was rushing us and yelling order Now. He was not friendly at all and most of the chef was looking at us and smiling.  My husband said we just sat down and we needed to look at the menu. First time ever we tried this place and it would be the last. I would not even give a 1 star .

tx6_c0oFVamrF_jI7ypeeg.text: By far the best all you can eat sushi place! I love the sexy spicy roll because its super spicy and the lemon adds a nice zest to it! They have a better selection of interesting and unique rolls and are such a good price, even a couple bucks cheaper than other places. The service was good and very attentive. I can't wait to go back!

VVsJviBWUUbxgzQMGCqHdw.text: Best place so far to go for sushi. Fast and friendly staff. Place could use a bit of a makeover lol kinda dusty and needs a lift other then that food is soooo good ! We did all you can eat for $25 and the min we say we ordered a roll and received it with in 5 minutes! If you don't like something they'll take it back no problem and won't charge you . Super sweet staff there we will be returning for sushi !

tJtt1JkmvkmarPF8-Q1XNw.text: This place used to be really good years ago. The only good thing I have to say about it is that the waiter was very friendly and always checked up on us. The food was mediocre. Some things were really good and other things weren't as fresh. I had to send back some of the fish that smelled bad. They should also look into maybe hiring someone a little friendlier looking for the front. Beautiful girl but she looked extremely angry and was very short with me when I was trying to book a table. Maybe she was having a bad day but she shouldn't take it out on customers.

7WcvYtqBmJ2gSuGcDJ9i7A.text: Brief: Great fresh sushi, usually a wait, No Name roll!  One of my favorite sushi places in Vegas. YUM! There's such a variety and for those who don't like the extra sauces and papers there are more plain rolls that are just as tasty and fresh. If there's anything worth mentioning is about Yama is that the fish is always fresh!
