1goq-G1jk7nsUman2o7a3A.text: This is not only my favorite "locals" sushi place in Vegas, but anywhere. I am thrilled they opened up more seating because I did not like to wait so long. The food is always amazing -- the prices are great!  Recommend sending someone early to get your name in! And "All you can eat" is the only way to go!  Keep it a locals secret!

bCxMfvRShXe2EX8ZDOHafg.text: This is our favorite restaurant in Las Vegas! Me and my boyfriend dine in here every time we come to Vegas and it is always good! With only $22 you can try a variety of food which are very tasty, definitely worth it ! Rolls are really good! "One minute man" is our favorite! Service is good too the waiters are friendly they never keep you waiting too long. We went to the top rated buffet in Caesar Palace later the day, and still thought this place has better sushi rolls. Will definitely come back again!

InAO6rVEwl6sn1dwC-17Mg.text: This is my all-time FAVORITE AYCE Sushi joint in Las Vegas.  Wet Dream and Sun of a Beach will change your life and the seafood salad  will rock your socks off.   I recommend coming on weekdays as weekends will have you waiting about an hours for their seafood delight.  Everything on their menu is available for AYCE. You can also order half rolls (which I recommend) so you can see how truly delicious and fresh everything is.  I don't recommend groups or bringing a small child. It is a small, tight place.  Yama is super yummy. :)

fietNc0J-zsKvmPflIln_w.text: I go here with friends who eat here way too often (IMO). They know all the sushi chefs and have their favorite, Joon. He's the Bomb! And BTW... he likes to do Sake Bombs so buy him and yourself one. And if you're in a group... he does the Sake Bomb Domino.. totally KEWL!   Anyways... for AYCE... this is the place. I've not head a bad experience yet and have been here on all different days for dinner... been here about 12 times in the past 2 years.   My FAVE is the Sexy Salmon... meaty, salmon with a sliver of lemon and a small slice of avo and jalapeno. YUM! My mouth does a little dance. I usually get 2 orders just for me. :)   Another FAVE... "Belly"... I think this is Toro... anyways... it's a specialty and I think it's extra and it's not always available. But WOW! It melts in your mouth and is the BEST piece of fish ever! Ask for it... You'll see what I mean.   Their rolls are really good and can get a little crazy with the sauces so ask them to go light and it's not a problem.   Did I mention the Sexy Salmon? Oh yea... I did... I actually crave it sometimes... but as this is not a close place to get to for me... I have to wait til the friends can get together... Speaking of which... I better e-mail them and see what they are up to. :)

q2r0EQa6QEWr7omPj7ooZw.text: This place is amazing. Great price for all you can eat, and a great menu selection to go with it! Friendly staff, quick service, great food. What else could you ask for?! We are locals, but visiting or local, check this place out!

f9BmwxTwTZ8V_WVcobdLYQ.text: Went here for a dinner. We were in a rushed to get to a show and they were able to have us in and out in less than 40 min. Best sushi I have had. Very busy place ... I recommend making reservations ahead so you don't have to deal with a long wait. I recommend striptease, you the man too and the Hawaii rolls.

-7z2CRowEa7PhmeiWfVUPw.text: Love the innovative rolls!!! My favorites: Sun of the Beach and Happy Ending.  All you can eat and I will definitely eat here every time I'm in Vegas.  Just missed the line...

7rlaW8vPNqtHbQ3apnEpcA.text: YES YES YES! I am there at least once a week. I love all the rolls and how they are different and very fresh. You can find me at the bar having all you can eat sushi and leaving fat and happy.

J7bbO7NIj4Ro5Y-NV20BpA.text: Great place! Not the best part of Vegas, but not the worst either. Service was very good, attentive and friendly. For an AYCE sushi, food quality was way better than average. We had to wait about 15 minutes for a seat at the bar (4 of us), but I think we got lucky because when we left, there were quite a few people waiting. I will be back again.

trVXwycbltOcY_e8kCc25w.text: Yama is one of my favorite sushi place ever! Wish they had it in the Bayarea . Its cheap for a sushi buffet & they make it when u order it so its always fresh. Unlike the other sushi buffets where the sushi sits there for hours. Every time I go to Vegas I always hit up Yama.  I recommend the Wet Dream it literally melts in your mouth. Its hard to enjoy other sushi restaurants since I've eaten here. Best sushi ever!

5U6SJ2dXmiElOcmrtaOxYQ.text: There are better all you can eat places with real variety, and not just what ever is available. It seemed they were pushing the fish they needed to get rid of. The menu was repetitive with spicy tuna, spicy salmon, spicy scallop and tempura everything.  How about adding a variety of fish and shell fish, they dont have oysters, no uni, no fun.

qtc_7YQExTHNuFyAQGdI1g.text: My wife and I love sushi and we have trouble affording it sometimes, but this place has by far the best value for sushi we've come across and the quality doesn't suffer one bit. We'd eat here every day if we could afford it. I haven't had anything on their menu I didn't like yet, and it's all very fresh. If you love Sushi and you live in the las vegas you have to try this!! I would recommend all you can eat sushi for $25

7UG7tyi-aydnCYSLpOLluw.text: I've only eaten here once and it did not disappoint. Every spontaneous trip to Vegas will always deserve a visit to Yama Sushi. My boyfriend and I came here for their all-you-can-eat lunch. Almost everything on their lunch menu is offered for A.Y.C.E.!!!!!! It's about $20/person for lunch. We ordered almost $100 worth of rolls (because we are heffers) and only paid $40. Not to mention our 5 orders of appetizers and sashimi. Definitely an amazing deal in Vegas, just a little ways off the strip :).

w8bLYpeQ7ZPrRqHoGD2dkw.text: Wow ate here couple day ago! From LA so like sushi and picky! This place was fan-tas-tic! Price was right and fish was good! I've eaten all you can eat sushi in Cali and this was comparable if not better! Plan on goin again this week!

6bhKflpO8iIEtsX9U3dwEQ.text: It was my first time w/my sister and my cousin who highly recommended the place for AYCE Sushi.  Yummy sushi...name of the rolls are hilarious...and very friendly service.   Love love their salads, so fresh and so flavorful (Spicy Sashimi Salad).

UxK3VyBIOYt5ZIsfWSr_KQ.text: Yama sushi is delicious! This place is so small and looks pretty crappy from the outside, but the food is really good! The service is quick and the waitresses are really nice and accommodating. The sushi is really fresh and tasty. I guess my only complaint would be that I wished they had rice as a side dish on their menu. Other than that, I love this place and will be visiting a lot! I haven't tried the all you can eat, but I don't really see how that would be such a great deal... you would have to eat a lot of sushi for it to be worth it! but I see that a lot of people do it, so I'm guessing its good! I would recommend this place to anyone!

QettETC92BFn44t24U2rZg.text: like any other all you can eat sushi roll joint. nice people working there though. but have since found goyemon which is way more awesome.

iv-OpFET0GRQ1j4OAtl-LA.text: This use to be one of my favorite sushi places when I was stationed at Nellis. The best rolls were the firecracker, snow in Vegas and (my absolute favorite) happy ending. There is always great service and fresh fish. On the weekends there is always a wait, but it is totally worth it.

M73MYgUgpgLbhmgQZ1lPAA.text: So far the best ayce sushi place in vegas. this place is tiny so it gets packed really easily. luckily we were seated quick. service was great!!! our waiter always came back to us very quick to ask us what we wanted to try next. Sushi was fresh and the specialty rolls were awesome! To top it off it wasn't that expensive neither. I would def recommend to try this place out.

l1MzUcloh9PTf5PG9rxQTA.text: If you like lots of cream cheese and sauce this is the place for you. To be honest it was really difficult to taste the fish in any of these rolls. I have a preference for sashimi and traditional rolls without the silly names. The service was ok. I went for Lunch and this place gets really loud like a bar. This made it quite difficult for me to enjoy myself. I give it 3 stars because the rolls are decent but not the best.

kf64GQcl28eOQDeXzW5o3w.text: The search continues for quality AYCE sushi in Vegas, which shouldn't make sense when AYCE and sushi are in the same sentence.  Walking in on a Sunday evening around 9 pm, and the place is pretty packed.  With only four seats left at the sushi bar, we take two of them near the end.  The waitresses got us our beverage orders and bring out a little plate of cooked bean sprouts.  And then we started ordering with our sushi chef.  First attempt - uni.  The chef looks at us and says they are out.  Oh.  (I should have gone with my gut and just left then and there!)  * Seafood Salad - One order per person, and so we got one each.  Definitely generous with the cuts of fish - tuna and mackerel mostly on a bed of cucumbers and daikon radish with a spicy sauce.  * Amaebi - He asks us if we want the heads and we say yes, although we wonder if there's an extra charge for it.  Two pieces come out, no rice.  We don't complain about the lack of rice, but wonder why only two pieces when we did say two orders.  (This item is one of the "one order limit per person" and we know two pieces is usually one order.)  The heads are deep-fried, but not enough as I had to spit out some of it.  When we attempted to order our 2nd order of it later on, he gives us this look and says we are trying to order more than we are allowed.  We're confused at this point, and ask him if two pieces account for one order.  He says it does, for the 'other' amaebi.  He then pulls out this plate of these tiny sweet shrimp that I would have been insulted if I got.  So, since we chose to get the heads, we got the jumbo size one (regular size in every other sushi restaurant) and that means only ONE PIECE per person.  Oh.  We continue on with our nigiri choices:   * yellowtail, albacore, salmon, halibut, giant clam (one order limit) and ikura - We're confused when we get our fish because one of them is obviously tuna - it's bright pink and you just know and plus we didn't order that.  Later on when we ask for hamachi, thinking that it never came, it points out that he did give us hamachi already, it was the pink one he served us earlier.  Oh?  Hmmm... Also, there's too much rice for the size of fish cuts he gave us.  That's never a good thing.  And with the whole mix up of the amaebi and the lack of uni, he offers us 'hamachi belly'.  This is the all white version and yes, it's good.  But this is what I normally get when I order hamachi at a nice sushi restaurant.  So, I still don't know what their version of regular hamachi looks like!    From the appetizers, we got softshell crab (I wasn't particularly fond of their batter for this.), agedashi tofu (pretty good with an enjoyable batter), and hamachi kama.  One thing for certain was that things coming out of the kitchen were super hot, so watch your tongue!   We're not big on rolls, and perhaps this is also why we weren't as impressed.  They are known for their rolls as many yelpers mention, and since we didn't focus on their strengths, we weren't as pleased.  Their saving grace is that there's no limit on dessert!  Unlimited ice cream (green tea, red bean, and plum) and mochi ice cream (vanilla, strawberry, mango, and chocolate - although they were out of vanilla when I went).  Service - the waitresses do come often enough to clear dishes if you put them on the side, but don't bother if you leave them in front of you.  I did have to request more tea, so it just depends.  Our sushi chef wasn't the most personable, which set the tone for our dinner.  He was hollering at us from the start, and plus, I couldn't understand him either.  Like another yelper mentioned, we were the only other Asian people there (besides the staff), so if that makes a difference to you.  And it gets loud - as in you can hear the conversations of people from across the room - not sure if it's the people who are loud or the acoustics of the restaurant.  Yama Sushi is definitely one of the cheaper options for AYCE sushi (Lunch $19.95/pp or Dinner $22.95/pp) in Vegas, but we'd rather pay a few bucks more for a better experience.  We probably won't be back.  2.5 stars

Q9prPHkkrN3pRZepj8glyw.text: I freak out on fish that has a smell, I will never eat at Pumi or other sushi places run with Chinese food or Korean food on the menu, I'm very discriminating. Yama has all you can eat sushi, they go through a lot of fish, so it stays fresh. If they have a less than mild flavored fish it seems to go in the "Seafood Salad" and it is delicious! No Ankimo, so it's not perfect, but at this price, and the quality of food, and the friendly staff, it's as close to perfect as you can get. Jun is the new manager, and he runs a tight ship, keep up the great work guys!! I'm a customer for life thanks to their great restaurant (I eat here once a week and have mostly for the last year and a half) (special compliment to Agus, what a friendly, terrific chef!) p.s. it's in a terrible neighborhood, but it's worth running the gauntlet of riff raff to get in here. The only other criticism, they put too much mayonnaise on the rolls, so I've learned not to order most of them. Always recommended are the yellowtail, salmon, albacore ,and  garlic tuna nigiri, the spider roll and I enjoy the firecracker without the sauce on it. In fact, I bet all the rolls are great without sauce, I'll have to go try that today :-)

Za8qhs3_dMcrgXQY_ENrQQ.text: Uh huh it's Vegas, other than the booze, the partying scenes and good shopping, I am mostly here for the food. I found this place through a local and I could pretty much said it's love at first sight for an AYCE sushi. The seafood salad is really good. I dont know why they call it SEAFOOD salad and have all the raw sashimi on it with a really yummy sauce. IMO, it should be called "SASHIMI SALAD" ..okay it's same shiet..whatever! The soft shell crab hand roll is good, yellowtail collar and the NO NAME roll and the SUN OF THE BEACH are good too and yeah dessert is included, mochi ice cream baby! For $22/sushi buffet, I just cant wait to be back to Vegas again.

kHEbCB9XSYHcbk-q8nBdEQ.text: not much to say that hasn't been said.  $23 for ANYTHING and EVERYTHING you want!  great service, great choices.  DELISH seafood salad.  my friend and i went, we spent $46 between the two of us.  we figured out what we should have spent - get this - $117!  what a savings!  looooved it!!!  GO NOW!

TAVoIwgTlBjWwK8cSDNS-A.text: Best sushi and reasonable price for the "eat all you can sushi" deal.  Just didn't like the sushi chef we had that time.  We were sited in the sushi bar it seems that he is rushing us and yelling when we were ordering.  I will definitely go back there and bring some more business there.  Thanks!

rc07POf-fcNN_pAN4EZStw.text: Large Party Disaster -   We went there (13 of us) and were placed in the separate room they had off to the side (which is like 5x5, very, very, very, small). I do not suggest dining at this restaurant with any more than 8 people at most. The service was not very good at all - almost like they had never experienced a party this large. They had asked us all to move around once we were settled because not everyone was doing all-you-can eat. They basically told us straight forward that they didn't trust our seating arrangements because they thought we were going to share dishes - which was not True at all. All others that didn't do all-you-can-eat ordered main dishes off of the main menu.   We were never given wasabi or ginger, and the waitress came back to us 10 minutes after the order was placed and told us she lost our order. We asked for pepper which never showed up. The service was very slow and at one point the waitress came over and blatently told us, "sorry, you are waiting longer." Wow.   The food was decent, wet dream roll was amazing. I also enjoyed the firecracker. Everyone else that I was with didn't rave about this. They would have rather gone to a restaurant that knew how to handle a larger party. Too many waitresses trying to handle our party.   A giant disaster as far as I am concerned. Take your business elsewhere for larger parties.

LPrCBtSksV_-J07YV-RaxQ.text: Why do I even bother eating sushi anywhere else in Vegas? I'm always disappointed because nothing compares to this place.   Their ingredients are fresh, the sushi roll combinations are unique, service is quick, and the AYCE is a great value.  I recommend the Seafood salad specifically, but you really can't go wrong with anything you order.

O2ivCOC_cWJqZi11lyofcg.text: All you can eat for $22 bucks at lunch.  Everything is pretty much A OK.  Lousy,ugly strip mall location,but it is Vegas after all.  If you are in town and want a great all you can eat sushi bar experience,this is the place.

O10uTXr37fh9VhVxPjinlA.text: I always enjoy my time at Yama. The sushi is always delicious to me, it doesn't taste frozen or dry or chewy. The soft shell crab is now a favorite and I get it every time I visit. The price is good, the service isn't always good but the food keeps it's stars :)

rsXE2Lp913zP6vbImVH8qA.text: Very good sushi, but customer service was terrible. Slow in the dining room on a Monday for lunch, but had to repeatedly flag down the waiter to get service. Server also got two roll requests completely wrong. Hopefully he was new, because food was quite good. Double salmon roll was delicious.

SlVA8NBdzq_jdRoNVdKeXg.text: Im definitely a fan of this place. I've had one bad experience here, but the rest have been okay or better.  The bad experience: it was a slow week day, there had to have been only 3 tables occupied.. And service was slow. unbelievably slow. They kept messing up our orders, they even forgot some of our orders.. seriously? how could you do that when you only had a few customers in the restaurant?   The good: On good days, they make our sushi pretty fast.. surprisingly. And they do try to be attentive with orders and requests.  They advertise on yelp that they take reservations... I dont know about that. Maybe if you were having a big party you could ask to reserve this little space they have near their entrance. I'm just guessing, I dont exactly know for sure because as far as I know, I asked if we could reserve a table when I first started going here and they informed me it was first come first serve.  Price.. It's decent. It's pretty much around the same price as other sushi places I've been at.  Service.. I'd rate it as average.  If I had to recommend a dish to try, I would recommend the sun of the beach. One of their most popular dishes. If you dont like salmon though, I'd skip on this.  I'd say if you're hungry and you want to eat right away dont come on their busy nights.. you know friday, saturday nights.. They get pretty packed. And you could be waiting for a really long time. If you're by yourself, you could probably get lucky and get squeezed in at the sushi bar... other than that, you have been warned.

VXyxlhHa3IiHgUi2Bp_xzg.text: Considering this is Vegas and it is the buffet capital of the world, I came into Yama Sushi with the bar set a little higher than usual.  We went with the AYCE dinner of course and I went straight to the good stuff on the menu. I was a little disappointed...  Only 1 uni per person... Only 1 soft shell crab per person...  *Sigh* Makes sense cause I would of dined on that the whole night. Oh well, I'll go with one of each then.   The waitress tells me that they are out of those items... WTF   So, I ended trying the salmon sashimi and mackerel sashimi along with a bunch of their rolls. The salmon was good, you can't really go wrong with that, but the mackerel was a little dry and not fatty at all.  If you are a fan of rolls with cream cheese or fried tempura then you will like Yama. But if you just like plain old fish then I will say no.  And don't let the door hit your ass on the way out... seriously, the floor is slippery as f*&k for some reason, so watch your step as you walk out.

RxZznir6w1qj5Gq0iMfWKw.text: As I am drafting this review, I have already been waiting 30 minutes for our order. The sushi is average (thus the 2 stars), but the sushi chefs need to get out their orders according to when they were placed.  Granted we did have a large party, our rolls still should not have taken 45+ minutes to prepare - mind you this was the same amount of time a table came AFTER us, ate, paid and left before our waiter even said something about our order. Obviously the chef was not placing the orders in chronological order, or he looked at our order of 3 rolls and 10 sushi nigiri and thought, "f*ck it" and then stuck it in a corner praying that it would go away. Either case - not cool.  The staff seemed apologetic enough, however they should have checked up on us sooner. When they did eventually check up on us they asked (with a puzzled look), "you still haven't gotten your sushi?"  Well, thank you, Captain Obvious.  Who else would have brought them to us and then quickly took our empty plates away? Definitely not the sushi chef.   Anyway, the sun of the beach roll was very good and in the end we ended up getting all our rolls, so I added an extra star for delayed effort.

YMItNC41v06fOe0FyxIviA.text: I'm really glad they expanded this restaurant as they could use the extra tables.  This IMHO is the best AYCE joint in the valley due to food quality, service, and pricing.  Their fish is undoubtedly fresh and their nigiri are easily on my top 3 best tasting ayce nigiri (goyemon and rainbow sushi being the other two).  The rolls are pretty good and I like that you can order half rolls.  They have my all time favorite ayce sushi bar appetizer of all time - the seafood salad.  The service I get is always friendly and acceptably prompt even on often busy days, and I'm never made to feel a glutton despite ordering as such.  All of these you get for a price less than most other ayce joints in vegas.

MRehqlZ-Vk0ZOOyhYkIYhg.text: Every time I come to Vegas I have to take a trip to Yama Sushi. I sit at the bar and do the AYCE Sushi. The old Korean guy behind the bar makes awesome sushi at your request and always encourages you to eat more. He'll also give you suggestions. (make sure to tip them well. they work hard!)  I can't pinpoint one type of roll I like. I pretty much like it all. Of course the salmon can't be compared to say the fresh salmon rolls in Vancouver BC but for non-LA and non-Vancouver this joint is awesome. Decently priced. Give it a shot and don't be scared by the crowd waiting outside to be seated.

PRqwX_dgvHyJ86SW0f14pA.text: Good sushi, good price, friendly and attentive service.  It's AYCE, but they make the sushi right when you order it.  It'll take a couple of minutes, but it's worth it. Definitely a great restaurant choice if you want to take a break from the strip.

lat05vAoZYDREZvnIBsifw.text: Ever had to sit at a sushi bar and not want to order sushi?  This is what happen to my sis and i as we encounter our very first hostile, sushi chef.    We came here on a busy Tues night and settled at the last available seating at the end of the bar next to a group of 6 in front of the chef. He briskly acknowledge us and instead of presenting the menu to us, he quickly dropped it with a snapping, release motion.  Just a step shy as if he were to chuck a dirty tampon at us.  My sis and I just looked at each other in appalled of what just occurred.  This was NOT a good start our meal.    By just observing the chef before we were able to give him our first order we could see clearly that he's distressed: From his body language, to pointing fingers at guests, slamming rice rolls, and even mistreating his knives.  It put us all at the sushi bar in an uncomfortable environment.  At one point we asked a server if she can put in an order for us through another chef, but she made it all the more awkward when she blurted out our order to our designated chef.  Please, lady, go super fail somewhere else.. . .  Towards the end of our meal as the restaurant was clearing up, our chef had finally captured himself as if just he made it through a black hole.  Strikingly he even made an effort to crack a joke, but under protest we were finished and already ordered our bottomless ice cream through a server. That's too bad because I was beginning to think we were growing on him.  The whole dinner was torture-some up until that point.  I rather rip ass inside an elevator full of strangers than go through that again.  I understand that everyone has a bad day, but he should've been more professional about it instead of taking it out on all of us. And since we received some pretty low grade sushi (the orders that were not lost in that shit storm) along with crappy service minus the lady that brought us our dessert, it left a sour taste to our mouth.  My sis and I vowed never to come back.  A smile will go a long way especially if the quality of your food is below standard. Thanks for our countless memories, Yama.  We had a long run, but i'll take my business elsewhere.

Beb9TNNlB6QIm37B1dkp8g.text: If it wasn't for the customer service is probably give this place just a star. the seating reminded me to oacked sardines. :( I was disappointed dish after dish, there was nothing to rave about except maybe one of the salads with sashimi? I think it was the poki? I can't really remember the name.of.it.. I thought that since people rated this place so highly it must be good, boy was I wrong. Sorry to say even though the customer service was superb, I wouldn't recommend this place because the food was just lacking in quality and freshness. And I know that its hard to expect that from a all.you can eat sushi place, thats hella far from the ocean. but there are joints like oyshi and goyemon that never seem to let me down.

DCNAfIByLo5JLEK94YeTKQ.text: My BF and I are looking for a sushi spot to eat cuz we are on this sushi kick and have been to 3 different places within a week.  So here we are, at Yama Sushi. We came here because of the reviews. Some are bad, but most are good to great. And what do I think? Well let me explain my rating process.  Place is definitely small. Chairs are brushed agains each other and people's backs. Elbow to elbow counter seating. 4 or some times 5 sushi chefs behind the sushi bar. I did liked the island beach back drop tho. 3 stars.   Service was good. Got our waters and orders fairly fast. Dirty dishes was taken right away. A lot of servers came and ask how we were doing and was able to order appetizers off of the AYCE menu quickly. So 5 stars for just services from our servers. But sushi chefs, I give 3 stars. No welcoming gestures, just heads down making sushi and when ordered they just gave a nod.  Okay here's the real deal. If you are a foodie of sushi, like me, you will probably rate their food as 2 stars. Fish is definitely not extremelyfresh, and all the pieces where all pre-cut so that they could pump them out like a factory machine. We ordered the seafood salad. Seems like a they just put together all the pieces of sashimi fish that didn't make the cut, tossed with a pokie like sauce (no spicy, mild, or spicy) over cucumber and shredded Daikon. Not a fan of that. Order yellowtail and white tuna sushi. It was mushy. Rice is overly vinegary. It's seems like everything had a sour note to it. Soft shell crab was good, the breading was surprising crispy. So 2 stars for the food.  So, how do i feel? I didn't like that at all. It seems like they value quantity over quality. I don't know if I can even call those guys behind the sushi bar, chefs. They are just cooks that knows how to make those 20 or something rolls on the menu.  And to be honest. I would pay almost double for food that can just blow my mind when it comes to sushi.

K5Ol79YMaMi0tHV1OJSneQ.text: One of the best all u can eat sushi spots in las vegas. Rolls are amazing, ladies are nice, more room now and overall awesome food! location sucks only downside

Xo4_x0_xKJi7Cbn_abeFYw.text: Orders are slow, tasting is good but not amazing and is so noisy, you need order all at time because is very slow .... Waitress forget the order .... i don't understand how have a four stars ....

rqtm_CGqVuFf7n7nEbF8vA.text: This place was recommended by a friend and I can see why she was adamant about eating in this place.  I've gone to a lot of AYCE sushi places but this is by far one of the most delicious ones compared to all all those I've eaten at.  We were lucky we went just right after it opened around 11AM so we didn't have to wait to be seated.  Food was freshly served and service was quick and friendly.  Price was about right for an all you can eat sushi place.  You can't go wrong with any order you choose!  Definitely recommended to all people who love sushi!

_Y5MXUyDPc1ftLoRNaBtMg.text: Not gonna write a whole lot here.  I'm sure you can see by the 400 other mostly 4 and 5 star reviews, this place is legit.  I go about 2-3 times a month when I am craving some eel and yellowtail.  Some of my favorite rolls are a double dragon (tempura eel, eel, avo), sun of the beach(shrimp temp, salmon, spicy mayo), turning japanese roll (just try it).   So basically yea, the price is the best, the food is amazing, and the service is great for a sushi restaurant that is as busy as this one is.

mdhQAbFO2wje378aTOVttg.text: The Wet Dream roll. That's really all I have to say. Ok so the all you can eat deal is excellent, plenty for the price, the spicy seafood salad and soft shell crab is fantastic. We enjoyed more rolls than I could count, and they do offer them in smaller portions so you can experience more of the menu. Strawberry mochi was delicious! Maybe we were there at the right time or it was just a good night but the fish tasted fresh and service was quick. However, they do lose one star because service is...I hate to say it...horrible, to the extent of nonexistent.  Very rushed, impersonal, and it did feel like they wanted us to hurry up, eat, and get out. Bummer when you're paying $25 a person. The only person who appeared to not hate their job was the busboy who was extremely friendly and helpful. But the sushi was excellent, and because of that I'll be back.

ejgKdjOCKTRqn3RQap0Qdg.text: The service was great and the food was excellent! I recommend trying this place for AYCE sushi. We tried Makino the night before and I like this place much better. It's a small restaurant so be a little patient when waiting for a table.

AQNue4iC11Ia1NG7dSg7-w.text: Best AYCE sushi in town.  I've been coming here for years.  It's very busy now, but with expanded rooms.  Very worth it.

4HqZNyB6c_ZcGEoqzcT0Ww.text: Favorite sushi spot in Vegas! The puns on their menu are just as enjoyable as their delicious and original sushi rolls.   Only cons are that it gets a little uncomfortable because the place is always so packed and small in size (despite their store expansion). And their waiting area is little to none, so it kinda sucks when its cold out and theres no room to wait inside. But I come for the food, and there are no complaints there!

wACFpsVTPg6izVc1q-Nn-Q.text: My favorite sushi place. I've lost count of how many times I come here but every time it's been great. Servers are fast and attentive and the sushi is fresh and delicious. Usually is a 30-45 minutes wait during busy hours but sometimes the wait it's less than that. I recommend it.

50rk6DUIr5WWEuMqkUW8wg.text: We were only in Vegas for a few hours and we were craving sushi. Yelpers recommended Yama so we decided to check it out (despite some of the negative reviews). When we got our order I was not disappointed.  The sushi rolls  were delicious and full of flavor! Miso soup and seaweed salad were on point too. Oh, and the house sake was smooth. They had a special, buy one get one free ... so we had to do the right thing and order the special  Thanks Yama

D2IB8i_E_ruCMc9CP6aIAw.text: For AYCE this is a great place.  Here are my favorites. Starters: barbecued ribs and the tempura are always a safe choice.  What I like about this place is you can do a half a roll and split it with your friend. All the rolls are excellent. The ones I really like are the no-name a man whore.   We also split a seafood salad with medium spice and it was just right. You can always ask for more salad.  Be sure to ask for the menu fish and chips. Dang that is really good and I hope they out it to the menu.  Services super on point, with waitresses and the sushi chefs always asking what they can do for you and give you.  The manager is always walking around and checking to see how everyone is doing and is helping bus tables. It's a well organized establishment and they really care about their service and their food quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is not on the menu but it is a very good role it is called fish and chips. It was recommended by the manager.

uSS8HP9PH8eIBPrdta8qpg.text: This is one of my favorite sushi  joints to go to. Fast and friendly service! Though I wish they'd expand the place so it doesn't feel as crowded inside. They're always packed for dinner time too and there's always a wait. Last time I went it was about a 50 minute wait (Friday night ~) Trust me, it's worth it though!!   Fish is always fresh and their green tea is yum. Sushi selection is huge and great, so you won't get bored.  AYCE!! Just keep eating!

W0QvaOE7-bfClxN2Sx0ygg.text: Good food, not so good service. Arrived about 8:30 on a Friday night, so wasn't surprised there was a 25-35 min wait to be seated. We were seated a little after 9:00pm. It was downhill from there. It took about 15 mins to get our drink order. We ordered AYCE and put in an order for about 4 rolls when our drinks arrived. At 9:45, we still had no food. Our server came back to ask us what we ordered - apparently the order needed to be put in again. An hour after we ordered, we finally got our first order and immediately ordered more knowing how long the first order took. Same thing - 20 mins later a different server came back to ask us what we ordered because the order was never put in. At that point we stated we didn't have another hour to wait for rolls to come out. That server said he could get some rolls out to us in 10 mins, which he did. He did his best to take care of us but it was too late at that point. We never got water refills in the over two hours we were there. We finally finished up after 11:00, without even ordering everything we wanted to because we ran out of time. Probably won't be back to this location.

xJECT3RdS26HCp0AakoFgA.text: I have experienced this sushi buffet twice and I enjoy myself and the settings very much. I ordered the shrimp tempura with the wet dream sushi roll. There is an employee with a name tag that says "DONT REMEMBER" not sure if it's her real name but she was not or original server but outshined the server who was .. so much so I didn't remember her name.. that would be my only negative..

4Ud62c3dvNAwG2PM1GuoWQ.text: The first time I came here my boyfriend asked if I wanted to go to sushi and told me it was all you can eat for $25. Coming from California I looked at him like he was crazy and said I don't think so... but we went and Yama sushi is awesome!   It is one of my two favorite sushi places in Vegas because 1) it's all you can eat, almost a must in Las Vegas 2) the service is pretty quick once you get seated and 3) they have soft shell crab as an appetizer. The wait can be long for Yama which is why I always put my name in and then go check how the wait at Sakana (right across the street in the target shopping center is) is. Once seated it's all you can eat for about $25/person, including nigiri, sushi rolls, appetizers and dessert. The drinks will run you about $5-10/each for sake/beer/etc.  A lot of people complain that you don't neccessarily have the same server the whole time, but I like that you have lots of people helping you - it means you get your food and drinks faster! My favorite appetizer is the soft shell crab appetizer and me and my boyfriend both love the double dragon roll. Usually I end up ordering a couple seaweed salads and then a lot of salmon and yellowtail nigiri.  You can't go wrong for the price!

-2kqgQKgaXiej52aJXNpSg.text: I found the his restaurant on Yelp because it has a good rating and all you can eat.   Food is so so. Not as good as we expected.   Fishes were not fresh and we got stomach upset afterward.    Waitress were nice

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can it sushi is not as good

tzKiwOlG2honCLPcalt7MA.text: Enjoyed our first time here.  Great service, reasonable AYCE pricing at $20.99 per person for lunch and $23.99 for dinner.   Great menu selection including uni, soft-shell crabs, mochi ice-cream, and more.  And they do bring you everything you order.  Nigiri had less rice than the fish which is how it should be.  All in all highly recommended if you're looking for sushi off the Vegas strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hDMQxS0YJzRrJSgGKZIImQ.text: Attention AYCE sushi lovers: Yama has a couple of unique rolls that make this place better than most. They also have "sashimi salad" which is a large portion of mixed sashimi with onion & a creamy sauce or a spicy vinegar sauce! Their lunch pricing for AYCE is around $20 & it even includes uni! Most places charge the dinner price for uni, but not this one. Service is pretty good too. Every time a server walks by, they ask if we need anything. Some could find it annoying, but I think it's great that they're being considerate as I usually add something to our order often. This place can get really busy & it has small awkward spacing for seating, so I would recommend coming right when it opens or around 2-6pm.

iXnpcbk6rGAbF44SynI56g.text: Overrated .. Many other places in town with better sushi options   eg. ( daisho, kaya, sakana, kaizen )   Maybe it was just the hype that this place is given & maybe because of that my expectations were too high .. Either way wasn't my favorite

vZ_J3oNx28tiJn-Aux2joA.text: Don't know how this place has almost 1700 reviews. Service was good. The environment was alright. The lights are so dim that I could barely see the menu. I had to turn on my phone brightness to look at the menu.  Review is based on food. Ordered appetizers shrimp tempura, Baked green mussels, deep fried mussels, and soft shell crab. Appetizers tasted like everywhere else so I don't mind. For sushi I ordered salmon, octopus, and tuna nigiri. Salmon is ok I can tolerate it. But the octopus and tuna was horrible. The color of tuna turned me off, it looked not fresh and tasted weird. Don't even get me started on the octopus. I ordered 3 orders of tako nigri and Hoooooollllly it was like chewing 5 gum. I get that octopus is chewy, but this was literally on another level. After about 2 minutes of chewing I would chase it down with water. It got to a point where I was tired of chewing and just put it in my mouth and swallowed with water. I couldn't order anymore sushi after that.

T1DQE9NEUK13pwM9nlRFSg.text: Way over rated. Service was so bad and the food was not that good. We got the "all you can eat" and they took so long between rolls that our appetite passed. The rolls are over stuffed with rice. This place used to be good but not anymore.  And how do you mess up miso??? Room Temperature!

KQU3924EPB2kZLvGWt7NeA.text: I couldn't have done better. All you can eat sushi, nigiri, full on menu. Had giant clam and uni. The rolls are fantastic.   Found me a place worthy of a compliment. Chefs are fast and friendly.   Will return when I am back in town.

KjocA5xU-I2tCF5lvpGvzw.text: Service was terrible, the sushi rolls tasted like they sat out all day. Then they charged us a 31 dollar tip for a table of 5. When we were speaking to the manager about this she was laughing in our faces very unprofessional. I am all for giving a decent tip when the service provided was excellent. The servers were rude and kept us waiting ( they were not super busy). Coming from someone who used to work in a restaurant this was unacceptable. I would not recommend this place to anyone. We were also told because we came in before 3 we got the lunch menu prices. When we got the bill we were charged dinner prices. Another excuse. Definitely not worth the money or the frustration. Very disappointed if I can give this negative stars I would.

EYGBemOtAQg0cFZLr3viMw.text: The Sushi was fantastic! One of those places that you want to go to every week/month/special celebration. All of the rolls, and I stress, ALL of the rolls are so good. I really enjoy their specialty rolls as well as their appetizers.   Do not forget that you can order half rolls. I normally order half orders of all my favorites and then go from there. Best appetizers include: the baked mussels, ribs, and the shrimp tambura! Best sushi rolls include: crazy roll, wet dream, son of a beach, and anything spicy! Enjoy the sushi! Love this place!  Also, waiting staff isn't too great, they were a little rude and slow. Finally, I ordered a Coke (fountain drink) and then later during my meal I wanted to switch to Sprite. They charged me an additional soda even though it's free refills, but the guy explained that changin flavors is an additional charge.

kQyyOB3BfgqnJRYB4otq0Q.text: Really wanted to like this place since it is conveniently close to campus and bigger than sakana, but we felt rushed and under attended. The food was okay.

QzgwDOpL9uLF2nBy42pAvQ.text: Free refills, all you can eat sushi and a dope ass staff and place son. Damn son. C'mon son. Damn son. I go here frequently son fire ass appitizers godly food.

7B671jAQMNRM2RxRnTpanQ.text: All you can eat is the way to go here.  Apps and specialty roles are awesome and fresh as usual.  What makes it a premier sushi spot is the fast service without being pushy.  Everyone we've taken here is now our friends and family's favorite sushi destination fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea food salad is a must as well!  Only one per person.
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sun of the Beach and Wet Dream are to die for...

MymSAknukMcLicb-yxjRVA.text: After seeing the reviews here on yelp I decided to try this place with 2 friends that also love sush, real sushi (nigiri).    First off they put way too much rice that you can't taste the fish. Next, they put too much sauce with certain fishes, so much it soaked the cup if rice that was under the little slice of fish. Then we ordered 3 hamachi Kama and after 45min of waiting they came out with 3 hamachi stumps!!! See photo also posted. They should have just told us they didn't have any, or maybe that's what they always serve as hamachi Kama.  Someone needs to show the cook what a Kama is!   For the 1 star, On the positive side, if you like California rolls and other rolls they cover with ponzu sauce, sriracha and mayonnaise this may be for you.  I'm just glad we didn't have to wait more than 5 min to get a seat because there happened to be an opening when we got there.

cs4iNCSYE2ZvqXWLU4FHqw.text: Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Yama Sushi.  There were a few things that I would change personally, but it is mainly tied into their popularity.  I am not a big fan of the location of the place, being that they are in somewhat of a dingy strip mall, but that did not take away from my experience there.  It is very chaotic in there, but there are worse problems to have - like people not coming.    The good:  The Sushi, of course.  There is a reason why this place is so highly rated and so popular.  I was very impressed with the quality of the rolls and the selection that is included with the all you can eat.  I have been to others in the valley that offer AYCE, but restrict a lot.  This place definitely does not.  - Get the Seafood Salad, which is chunks of sashimi and other delectables with some spicy mayo on it.  Very Very tasty.   I had 4 or 5 different samplings of rolls from the menu and off the top of my head, I am unable to remember what ones I got, but they were all good.  There were 4 of us at the table, and everybody thoroughly enjoyed their experience.   The not so good:  There isnt much to speak about in this area of the review.  Like i said above in the overall section:  Its chaotic, but there are worse problems to have.  I rate this place 5 Stars.  I would go back.... soon!

451m1jbZjCQm5Czwy9skmQ.text: One of the best AYCE Sushi places!  I highly recommend trying the seafood salad that consists of a variety of fresh, delicious sashimi. Mine was a bit spicy and it definitely gave it a kick! The sashimi overall was the best! The salmon was extremely fresh and tasty. The rolls are quite delicious as well. Some of the rolls were a bit heavy in sauce, mayo, and rice. If you're going to do it AYCE style, eating a bunch of these rolls after a while may make you feel a bit queasy and the taste won't be as great.   The price for AYCE dinner is about $23. Not too bad! The place is vibrant and lively, but way too crowded! There's barely enough elbow space. Go on a less busy day to beat the long wait and congested area. You also get mochi ice cream and regular green tea/red bean ice cream if you do it AYCE style. The vanilla and strawberry mochi is YUMMY.   Definitely a good sushi experience! (:

GjIHYy2FsK8tE5mjTxzdYg.text: We loved this place!   We came to Vegas for a convention  (go figure) and stayed at HGVC.  We ate in or room all week so we could splurge.  Boy did we luck out.   An all you can eat for around $25 worth desert and salads.   They had tempura for our youngest and the most amazing wait staff!  My husband loves to be surprised and they loved to keep him guessing.   The seafood salad was great as was the Wet Dream.  Our soups were great. ..not to salty Miso. Our sons loved Mochi ice cream.     The manager and owners all visited and were sincere in their desire to make this a great dinner out.  What started as a casual dinner on the way to the airport turned into a very special experience.   Overall,  our new favorite sushi.  We can't tell enough folks about this place.

Je6RZOveDuhBLjXHHa8C6A.text: I have had so many people tell me so many wonderful things about this place. I heard it  all...All You Can Eat, Best in LV, Hidden Gem...blah, blah blah.   We drove outsrlves over there in an attempt to see what everone was raving about. As per our instructions, we decided to go with the all you can eat option as my wife and I tend to eat quite a bit of sushi, The price seemed fair, and we started ordering. After just a few bites, I thought that the rolls lacked any pizzaz and tasted no better than the so-called sushi you can get at the local grocery store. I tried not to be negative so early on, and decided to order a few more items.   When my wife voiced her thoughts and had the same feeling that it all tased like grocery store sushi, i started to crack up! We eat sushi quite often and have no ploblem paying top dollar for quality, atmosphere, pizzaz and whatnot.   Do yourself and your stomach a huge favor, don't go here. There are so better places out there!

cPIbdjJUuxwKDbjsyuH7mw.text: Best sushi. All you can eat for the Price you pay is great. Every time I visit Vegas I go here to eat. Good and fresh quality sushi

n0Orc1hUK4IkakFS301jkA.text: Best AYCE sushi in Vegas! Highly recommend and we eat lots of sushi at home and everywhere we go we try somewhere new! The "palm job" and seaweed salad oh and the seafood salad and the mochi and green tea ice cream....YUMMY!!!

TM1xlXp8EbrYqjreunSpIg.text: If it wasn't for the excellent service, I would give a one-star. This place so far serves the worst sushi of my life. I was super excited to try this new place. What a disappointment! The fish was dry. The rice was soggy and sour. It feels like they don't use sushi rice or prepare it correctly. I have had a lot of sushi, either all you can eat or expensive a la carte. Go somewhere else!

khCwG7S7Gu9LfJRlffFS-A.text: My very favorite sushi place in Las Vegas.  Outstanding food.  Great staff.  We recommend this place to anyone that asks and have brought many friends here. You won't be disappointed!!!

cw4ryIxZ8bJPxvCszdrggA.text: (Based upon my dining experience 2 months ago)  This used to be one of my favorite go to spots for ayce sushi. Put it this way, I would travel from mountain's edge to enjoy this place. Although, last time I came here... The rice in the Nigiri had obese portions. I wish I had taken a pic to provide a visual.   I'm writing this review in hopes that this will reach the owners as constructive criticism. I understand you want us to get full quickly so we can leave, and put another paying customer's tushy in the seat... But be mindful that experiences like this leave bad tastes in your patron's mouth, and people like me will most likely choose another ayce sushi place in this saturated market.

qKG5LtUrveoZtXVT-D69tQ.text: Been coming here for years when I'm in town. They've in fact doubled their space to support the demand and from doing so well. Amazing sushi in generous portions.

KQOaPLXhWxKhc4x2tP-M2Q.text: Awkward....   Yes the sushi is yummy.  But I have never felt so stared at like a hawk.  Not everyone at our party-of-5 table ordered AYCE, just my sister and I.  So everytime our waitress passed our table, she'd look at us to check to make sure we weren't sharing our orders with the others.  I guess I can't blame them since a lot of ppl probably take advantage, but I've been to many other AYCE's where this has never been a problem.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qDWzfhol0aruAsIHAZxchA.text: I came here for my birthday because of the high reviews. Let me just say that this is the worse sushi place I've ate so far. The sushi wasn't fresh, the rice was cold and hard, some of the rolls were dry, bland and the sushi chef was rude. This place is somewhat clean and the wait wasn't that long, I rather spend more and wait longer at other sushi place like Sakana thats near by. After eating, my friends and I got a stomach ache. We will not come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaii Roll. Taste horrific. dry, and a odd taste.
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Nigiri, the salmon was soft, and the rice was somewhat hard.
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mad Dragon Roll, spicy yet a bit dry and flavorless.

U92lOBDDJ06CaneAvzkWpw.text: Been here twice already. They have good food but the service needs improvement. I would say I like the other branch better than this one. Because all of the server at Yama sushi 2 are very attentive.

IBBACdn7UA5tPTfIqossOw.text: AYCE spot that is whatevs. I felt the quality of fish was pretty bad and there was so many rules for the AYCE. It's probably never a good idea to eat sushi in the desert, so I would save your money and treat yourself to a better place.

8yhtwxD0fBRf4P_q_FVwEA.text: This is the best sushi in vegas IMO. Service was also good. Their menu has funny names for their sushi but don't let that fool you. This place is legit good!

2T1fksDgErj57zfhiWBctQ.text: A good portion of my student loans went to paying for sushi at Yama when I was in law school. This place was where I developed my love for sushi, so it has a special place in my heart. Notwithstanding my emotional attachment to Yama, I still feel that this is the best AYCE sushi in Las Vegas.  The restaurant is very cozy, as they have a small space to work with. It can get very busy, deservedly so because the sushi is amazing. If I had to recommend something to order, it would definitely be the seafood salad. You can only order one per sitting because it's one of the "special" items on the menu. Understandably so. If I had the ability to, I'd order only seafood salads and put Yama out of business. Also, if you get the seafood salad, order it spicy.

lNyBQTS3qUe7J-RuhkQAJA.text: Brief: good staff, fresh sushi, sun of the beach roll.  This place, like most popular sushi ayce restaurants, has a long wait.  It's worth the wait for the fresh uni and salmon.  The sushi chef that served us was awesome. He was able to prep all the sushi we asked for in a timely manner.  Also, I asked him which was his favorite roll.   He said the sun of the beach roll.  We ordered that and he filled it with fresh fish and extra eel.  Amazing.   Try this place out, I'm sure you'll like it!

psEA8CLCDw1xb_wtXUZ43g.text: Love this place. Don't let the location fool you. Located in a strip mall but it is possibly one of the best sushi places I've ever eaten. Even my son who is a California roll only kind of kid ventured out and loved the different types of sushi. I love the Dancing in the sheet, snow in Vegas and happy rainbow. I come here anytime I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The snow in Vegas and Happy Rainbow are excellent choices!

dqsXmHY_JUbuXND_CZ3awg.text: WARNING:   Do not eat here. They are either under new management or have a new chef but the sushi is terrible. I found this place on yelp and wanted to try something affordable off the strip. However, immediately upon my first couple of nigiri orders, the fish and rice tasted sour! My friends ate their dragon rolls and some other sushi but no one finished their order. Even the mochi green tea ice cream was not up to par. The color was yellow (weird) and the mochi surrounding the ice cream was hard and tasted stale. How can you eff up mochi ice cream?!. We were definitely being served spoiled fish, failing to mask it with tons of sauce. About an hour after we settled into our hotel room, ALL FOUR of us got sick.  In summary: servers extremely nice, food terrible.   I warned you!

TXS16iJXODtGQTpO6qIwdw.text: For my past 8 or so visits to Vegas (at least), I've hit Yama for either lunch or dinner.  Here are some of the pluses and tips:  -  Premium sushi!  Everything is fresh, delish, and AYCE.  -  Get 1/2 rolls to save room for variety.  You can always get another order if you like it (well, there's one or two items that are limit 1 pp).  -  Their custom rolls are all really good, and have funny names.  Don't be afraid to try them!  -  There's no time limit.  -  You can share everything you get with the rest of your party.  -  Appetizers like gyoza, seafood salad, dynamite, etc are ALL included too!  -  All desserts are also included (chocolate, vanilla, mango, strawberry mochi, and green tea ice cream)!  All in all, an excellent deal and experience for about $22pp (lunch) or $25pp (dinner), AYCE.  The only complaint my friend had one time was their very limited selection of sake.

9wOmiR3UQ0ll5N9UvvkXXg.text: I gave one star for the reasonable service. We were the first people to come in on Tuesday at 11 am.. we were really excited to come in as usually there is a long wait to get in. However when we got our appetizers they came in a tin foil bowl and was smothered in mayonnaise and not hot at all.. The scallops were over cooked as if they were from yesterday! That was just the beginning. The food came quickly and the fish was from yesterday also. Very disappointed in our experience at Yama sushi!!! We are really hoping to not get food poisoning from this place.. I will never return and I will make sure to never recommend this place to anyone I know.. we did leave food because it was inedible. My daughter almost threw it up! They did not charge us for it.. thank God! Eat at your own risk!

5xqf_B-K40aHOaMfDg3-Xg.text: Simple place, in a basic Vegas strip mall with a great AYCE menu.  I've always been told this place is a hot spot, a favorite and always busy, and it certainly lived up to it's reputation.   We were a group of 4 and amazingly walked in with no wait and were seated at a little table against the wall next to the bar.  Friendly staff, and excellent service. Next time I'd love to try the sitting at the sushi bar.

ZRfGFwUZBxHbJtvOqSnA0w.text: AVOIDING THIS PLACE AS MUCH AS YOU CAN DONT BE FOOLISH. I just had a dinner last night and their fishes are not fresh at all so in the morning I threw up and found out I'm food poisoning. All I threw up was albacore, scallop, and some tunas !

zJ-dnOnNgKNg2Ued-kv8hA.text: This was fantastic...great sushi, freshly made, great bargin.  Thank you to the cab driver for the recommendation.  Tom the owner even gave us a mug as they just celebrated their 16th anniversary.  Must go when back in Vegas...ps-go starving ;)

vr-bLr2olHYc5Qb92ZWxqQ.text: Went in and the place was packed.  That's a good sign.  After an acceptable wait (Sunday afternoon) got two places at the bar.  Talk about FAST service.  We would give the chef an order and bam, it was there in a few minutes.  The only things that took a bit longer were the gyoza and bbq ribs.  Sushi was good.  Best ever?  No, but you don't go to an all you can eat joint for the best sushi ever.  Above par?  Definitely.  Good assortment of rolls.  I like the half roll size, so you don't get stuck with something that sucks.  Strip Tease roll and 007 roll were great.  There was a Palm something or rather that I highly recommend as well.  As a plus (and some places don't do this) but you get Mochi included.  A perfect way to end the meal!

jWwUV_ptS8pbwiSqvWMPgg.text: I'm not sure if people in Vegas just have a poor sense of what "good sushi" tastes like but I am  surprised that this place has such positive reviews. Though sushi places in Vegas overall seem to have an odd trend of having good reviews but being terrible quality. Bottom line the fish quality does not taste great and the rolls aren't very well put together flavor-wise. Even for all you can eat which can be notoriously poor quality I expect more and better tastes. I could buy much better food for $23 so don't get sucked into the idea that since it's all you can eat it's worth the price. If I had to chose is say I liked the seafood salad and sun of a beach the most.

mE8UfEDHZzKBuTVmuMlA2w.text: Yama is a great off the strip place to visit for lunch. We normally drop in on our way up from the valley. I really like to sit at the sushi bar and banter with the chefs as they make whatever you like. The quality for the price is great, very nice white tuna, great mackerel - It isn't fine dining or what have you but the quality is there. I enjoy the seafood salad that they make and my better half likes some of their baked rolls.  They make one thing in particular that is out of this world, to me at least. Hamachi Kama is so good there. Not fried, just grilled like you don't want to know. One thing to note is that it gets really busy, really fast so sitting at the sushi bar as a couple is great.  Since May, they expanded and have a U shaped sushi bar and much more seating so it might be a bit better for wait times. It is all you can eat if you want it, and well worth it.

Y3xMOj2C81ZtD3MnSTDm5Q.text: My absolutely favorite sushi restaurant! I found out about this place a few years ago from my friend and have been going here ever since! I love how fresh the sushi is and how quickly I am served. The all you can eat option is bonus ;-) The downfall is that it's always busy and you have to wait (sometimes over an hour on the weekend ) but it's sooooo worth it!!!! They have also expanded the restaurant due to how popular it is in Vegas!!! Give it a go ;-)

xFFZMA0JiIgvQ5R4CXbJog.text: We are from LA and everytime we visit Las Vegas, this is our favorite place to eat!..rolls are amazing, the sauces are delicious and the seafood salad is our favorite. Everything is served fresh. The staff there make a great teamwork. Everyone is friendly. Definitely recommend this next time you visit Vegas.

Oyuj0oAFUe8hLRLuPYs1zg.text: Let me start out by stating that I have been to Yama Sushi 5 times and considered it a top sushi establishment in Las Vegas. That all changed within one visit.  My friend and I were seated at the bar around 11:30 am. There were maybe 10 people in the restaurant, very quite. Both doing "all you can eat," my friend and I ordered about 5 items with the sushi chef. Within 45 minutes, we got 2 out of the 5 items we ordered. I proceeded to ask the waitress if we could order some rolls from her and she said no, as the restaurant began to fill up and become very busy. 10 minutes later I complained to the waitress that we still didn't get the items we ordered almost an hour ago. After debating with her, she accepted the order. 5 minutes later the sushi chef shoved a roll in front of my face, demanding me to eat. I have never felt so disrespected in a food establishment in my entire life. Not to mention, the few rolls we did get, the sushi quality was horrific. A Goopey cream cheese, and mushy fish taste stayed in mouth the entire day.  Long story short, my friend and I battled with the waitress for her to comp our meal, since we were dissatisfied with the service and did not even get our food. Why should one pay for food they did not get? After debating with her yet again, she comes back to us and offers us 10 percent off, that's when I flipped my gasket and started to make a scene. My friend yelled at the sushi chef for treating us with disrespect, and I ensured that we would not leave the restaurant without any sort of comp. We got out of there splitting one all you can eat price, but they lost more than just $22.99. They lost two loyal customers and any recommendation to any Las Vegas sushi goers.   Yama is a total disaster, take my advice and save your money by doing ala carte at a quality restaurant.

Sg9TPsw-4EXJDMjRmG4Qow.text: I live in LA, but when I'm in Vegas I always visit this place. Great selection of sushi with clever names. One of the best AYCE places i have been to. It's a place for the locals. Prices are reasonable. I'm usually there during the week, but I hear the weekends are a long wait. The seafood salad is great if you like really spicy.

VjC803EJ0Nlv1AQDN15Vkw.text: This used to be my favorite spot until Friday. Sushi smell bad and tasted horrible. To top it off, roaches were on the sushi bar and fridge area. I almost lost it... I left and told them that is nasty and would never go back.

2kPHnNyXBhnyY967K3qhLA.text: I'm new to yelp, but I always hear how amazing this place is? I don't understand these reviews, I have been to this sushi place at least ten times, mainly because I like to eat all you can eat with friends. But every time I go its the same. Service is the worst, food takes forever.   The food Is ok, but if the service were to improve once I would be happy. I enjoy food, having my drink refilled before I'm done, and good service. That's all I ask for and never has the service been acceptable.

OyoQjiOzvhkA3FQBqWTdOQ.text: I have been going to Yama Sushi almost every month since 2007, but less often now in the last couple years due to it being busy most of the time and I 'd rather not wait a long time to just eat!  My last visit was a couple weeks ago and I was saddened by the excess amount of rice they put in their sushi.  I felt like I was struggling to finish each nigiri because there was so much rice in them.  Their fish to rice ratio was perfect to me before (the way sushi is suppose to be made) anytime I went.  After my last visit here, I decided that I'm not going to go back to my ex-favorite sushi place for awhile unless someone drags me here.

G-eeTVhoVaIl4Qqu3T4idA.text: This place is cheap , but for a few dollars more you can have MUCH better quality. This place is NOT good. If youre eating rolls, you can't tell what is inside, so youre fine. I only eat nigiri so I see the fish all too well. The first time I went here the tuna, which is usually a nice red color, was almost BROWN. I went another time to give them another chance, disappointed again. This is far from real Japanese food. It's honestly not worth going ever again, and have turned down invitations to come here from my friends. There's so many options in town, don't make this one of them.

72FMSz1CGllcZwlnv63Icw.text: Been there a number of times, almost every time I'm in Vegas, always left full and in a good mood.  Will be back a few weeks.

7EM-6m9QgvxSI_CI62yyEw.text: So dirty, super greasy menu. Dirty plates. Food was bad. Bad interior. Very bad overall experience. I'm just being honest.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty, greasy menu.
Photo of Yama Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty interior

MAK74PW68-bH_D-ToKCcOA.text: I met up here with my daughter and son in law. Sushi was good. I thought it was a bit expensive and drinks were not included Twenty-five dollars and they do bring everything out fresh. My only complaint was that we tried a few new things and there was an order of sushi that all of us did not like at all. Since we didn't finish it they decided to charge us full price for a for a four piece sampler. Totally not kewl. Service was ok nothing spectacular and we had to ask for refills several times for our drinks. Bathroom could use some cleaning up. The place was quite packed and seemed to be clean. I dont know if I will come back here or not ...

A_IE8ldx48h--C-14_zcsg.text: Everything we ordered here was just OK. Too much eel sauce on most of the rolls.  Two good things: 1. the price is very reasonable for AYCE and 2. the dessert - the plum ice cream and mochi were yummy!!!

2fV7dZU95SQwxd91xnLxkQ.text: I come to this place every time I'm in Vegas, often multiple times per trip. This could well be the best all you can eat sushi place I've ever been to.  Amazing variety for the price, and the tuna and salmon are always incredibly fresh and tasty.

6cw6CdqiQxs9BYvw1hSVnQ.text: best freakin sushi in vegas! great service at a good price for all-you-can-eat. i reccomend to everyone

1qUZSDM8WYFr-KOo0yIDSw.text: being from hawaii I am super picky about sushi.BEST SUSHI IN TOWN HANDS DOWN!

wfECZe0iX3_Gz4nr8bhDSg.text: We were visiting Las Vegas for the first time and wanted an AYCE sushi restaurant to go to one night. I searched the web (and Yelp!) and d died on Yama Sushi due to the write ups.  We arrive on a Tuesday night about 7:00 to a full restaurant, but we were the next to be seated so there wasn't really a line. The food was good (not great)  and the server didn't really explain how the AYCE worked so we had to ask multiple questions to find out what I think should have been explained clearly on the menu - or by the wait staff. We were full when we left and the price was right .... I don't really have an issue with the quality of the food for the price. Here's the reason for the 2 stars. The table that we were given was just inside the front door - for 4 people. This table DOES NOT belong in this space and looked like it was placed there only to get more customers into the store. My wife's chair (and others in our party) was bumped many times as the other customers and the wait staff tried to manuever around her. This is absolutely unacceptable. The guy who seats you looked like he had better things to do than to be serving customers and his attitude showed clearly in the way he treated the customers. Anyway, foods good, but I hope Yama Sushi reads this and remives that 4 top table from the front door.

v9r5y2iPwhCiyzAR1jjoSw.text: My friends & I went to Yama last night to celebrate my friends birthday, from the second we walked in the door the staff was rude. This is not the first time we have eaten here as a large group, in fact we drove across town to eat here, never again. First of all my friend ordered a diet coke the waitress who happened to be the assistant manager her name was Michelle brought a regular coke when she was told that it was suppose to be diet she said well I have to charge you again for another drink. So because you messed up we have to pay for 2 drinks? Wtf? We ordered our food and in the middle of our meal she comes in to tell us all 8 of us need to move onto one table because were taking to long and she needs the other table they sat us at...now you have a 2 hour limit which is fine but we still had 40mins left on our time when we told her that she gave attitude & acted like us being there was an inconvience. Also some of the food we ordered never made it to us before she said our time was up & guess what she added it to the bill! I will never go back to this place again!

7k-rdO-D8PwUU1vojTPXcw.text: price is good. the end. i stuff my face here all the time, who doesn't? its ayce. anyways, the rolls are good and the service is great. sushi comes out quick the wait staff are very friendly. it does get busy here, so i can understand if everything is not instant. for the rolls, to my preference there are lots of fill you up quick rolls. most of lots of rice with minimal content. there is this one roll i ordered which seemed like it but battered and baked, it was really good but that roll alone can probably fill you up. these are understandable though since it is an ayce, the owner has to make some money haha. no doubt though, definitely will come back

cjIlJKh3I3fMYmkyfY2Ynw.text: Great sushi place. Sushi chef Jun is awesome. I will definitely come back.

DZw9UsM47hRP-5cPiXuMEA.text: I had come to yama sushi about five other times and the food was always great for the price.  I recently went with 2 other girlfriends for a night out.  We all were turning 30 the same week so started with sake and beer.  The waitress service was not good but at the time we were in great conversation, it didnt really matter because we were having fun.  One of the gals we were with was a rookie in eating sushi so she she asked for those training chop sticks.  The third roll of sushi had already come and still no training chop sticks.  Mind you we had asked for edamame and it never came.  Still having a good time we FINALLY got the training sticks after asking and asking for them.  She brought 2 of them for the same girl which we thought was rude.  They were busy and we were into ourselves so we didnt think too much of it.  While the busperson was refilling our waters my girlfriend pulls a long hair that was fried in the shrimp out of her mouth. GROSS!!! after that nobody could stomach anything else and we asked for a manager.  The 2 waitresses kept giving us the run around and we waited a 20 min for someone to come over.  The poor girls were scared to call someone over.  We threatened to leave without paying because no one would come over.  One of them even tried to make us feel bad by telling us that she would get fired.  When the Chef came we told him what happened and he acted it wasnt True that the hair came out of  her mouth.  THE BUSPERSON WITNESSED IT!!!  Then he started blaming everyone.  We were so annoyed that we just wanted to leave now.  Can you belive the Jerk made us still pay for the food???  This wasnt a small hair people.  We should of just left when we were given the run around in talking to a manager.  Service Sucks all around!!!  Its too bad too cause the food was good the other times. P.S watch out for the roaches on the wall

Yt4mIWpzELCH4jodIcqINA.text: I contemplated punching my sister out when we rolled up to Yama, which looks like a run of the mill sushi joint placed in a nondescript shopping center off the beaten track of the Strip. She's a NYC transplant so I trusted her judgment of good, quality sushi but I was a little apprehensive when we drove up and saw degenerate/hobo looking types wearing cowboy hats and smoking cigarettes, standing outside of Sally's (or something or other) gaming spot, next to Yama. She swore it was delicious and convinced me to ignore everything else from the outside. The area is a little run down but don't be fooled, Yama is a total gem. The sushi is...just...so freakin' good! Super attentive waitstaff who are constantly running around to see what you need. Loved the salaciously named rolls like "One minute man" or "Sex on the beach" - so Vegas! My personal favorite is the Firecracker. I must admit, many rolls are slathered in sauces but that's how I like it. And, how on earth do you beat $23.99 for all you can eat sushi??!! Total yum. And rumor has it, Yama purchases their fish from the same wholesalers that Strip sushi restaurants use, and Yama is a fraction of what you would pay elsewhere. If you're in Vegas, and you love sushi, you must go (just ignore the cheesy, mismatched decor!).

iJeaaahNuS5MnYQcP1EcPA.text: Love this place it's sooo good....and the atmosphere is good! Price is not bad for all you can eat, plus the mochi ice cream they have is the best part!

3TM91QWPEjQEeGhlbAD5GA.text: i would say...lllllove it ! winner and the best sushi around in vegas!

7GYjs-znLGqK6EqlK8b3EQ.text: Yama Sushi is the spot! Right off of Flamingo and Maryland in the Albertsons parking lot. I used to live in Los Angeles and dream of the day when I would come to Vegas to eat sushi here. Now that I live right down the street I make as many visits here as my paycheck allows. The sushi is top notch and I love the rolls. The "Son of a Beach" roll is my favorite and I usually have one or two every visit. How can you beat the price and quality of the fish. The staff is always nice and wiling to get you what you want and not pushy at all. As a heavy AYCE sushi eater this is the place to go!

vmB9HHkZPC9TP4NwNNc-1A.text: This is one of the best Sushi restaurants I've tried.  The service and quality is outstanding.  I put this restaurant on the top things to do or see in Vegas.

TresfQYS40h71IEtfyd0vg.text: $20 all you can eat sushi. This place is away from the strip. Came here with a big group of friends (13 people) and they put our tables together and we were seated within couple mins. Their special rolls are the best. I like how you can order ANYTHING u want off their menu (appetizers, sushi, soups, desserts) since some place only have limited selection and you can order as many time as you want. Our group ordered so many rolls I don't even remember which rolls we got. We were so full we almost didn't finish but we made sure we did so they wouldn't charge us extra for not finishing (not sure if they do but most AYCE restaurants do charge for not finishing). I like how how you can order mochi ice cream as many times as you want (strawberry and chocolate mochi ice cream YUMMY!), I don't know any other AYCE sushi places that do that. The service was good especially for a big group like ours. If I'm ever craving AYCE sushi in Vegas, I'll make sure to come back here.

pu6Jd3KWM_OuV7QF5x3zkw.text: I read the review about getting sick here but I haven't gotten ill.  When i in vegas for business I usually try to stop here a few times.  Been coming here for years and it's getting crowded. They now have these new rolls with silly names like Man Whore and Happy Ending. When they first introduced it I had an older waitress that asked with a heavy accent 'would you like to try man whore or happy ending" I almost did a spit take "EXCUSE ME??!!"  I like that there is a lot more than sushi on the AYCE menu like tempura (you can order shrimp only) but my favs are soft shell crab and hamachi kama - onolicious.  One dish I would never order again is the yakitori - it was nasty. I was expecting grilled pieces of skewered chicken but their Korean interpretation is baked flat pieces of chicken that they cut into little squares and stick them on a skewer with muchrooms, green onion and white onion and it is baked just a little more and brought out luke warm, drenched in teri sauce. Mushroom tasted more raw than cooked. UPDATE Aug 2011 I'm going to downgrade my review to a 3 soon.  Last 3 visits which have been at lunch or early dinner they have not had hamachi kama which is disappointing since I also brought others with me and told them about that dish. I can see them running out if late during dinner but 3 times in a row is more a sign of them cutting corners. Quality of some items are going downhill too like the uni and dried pre made unagi that was inda dry.

DH6id9ciYlYUAhKWBaqnbw.text: this had got to be the worst sushi i have ever had..it was only mysel,f so i sit at the sushi bar.i decide to get the ayce..so the sushi dude(can't really call him a chef)just keeps making dishes for me without me ordering.i was just going to pace myself,but whatever,i figure he knows what is good..well i don't think there is  anything very good there.the only thing i actually ordered was the unagi and the dynamite.the unagi tasted like it was pre made..oh yeah, i also ordered a half  roll with unagi,cucumber and avocado which was ok.the sushi dude made me what is called a no name(half roll),which was probably the best out of everything i had.while i'm working on the dynamite and the no name,he hands me the seafood salad.(says it is really popular)well the texture of the fish was like it had been thawed and frozen, and then thawed again.yuck...i decided i was full(i couldn't stomach anymore)..the sushi guy tried to let me pay ala cart (which was nice of him once again)but the lady said that i ordered what would be more than if i ordered ala cart,even though the portions were made small for me(that's what the sushi guy said anyways).i was too tired too argue and i didnt want the sushi guy that meant well to get into trouble..so i paid..i just wanted some sushi that was close to me but you do get what you pay for i guess..but then again, i can pay the  same price for much better sushi in Hawaii..and Hawaii is not cheap by any means..i'm a small lady though and don't require a lot of food..knew i should have cooked for myself tonight.

Csk2obxqBH9PaNcAXOEp1Q.text: This place holds a special place in my heart! I have to say it was my first sushi restaurant that I have ever tried when I moved to Las Vegas not too long ago. I became friendly with the owner as I ate lunch there almost everyday for 2 weeks. It was everything I was looking for in NYC but could not find there. The price was just right and the food was always prepared quickly and served and presented wonderfully. It is my local spot for sushi whenever I have the craving. I have introduced many of my friends there and they have become just as loyal as I have. Jun is the manager and he is very popular with the repeat guests. I love their food and their service. It never changes and I love it whenever it is so packed that you have to wait to get a table or a bar seat. It has become almost like family to me and I will always continue to go and support their wonderful business. They cater to the people and it comes back to them 10 fold. Their basis is to serve quickly and politely. I never once had to ask to have my water refilled. The waitresses are all so very attentive and they deserve a hefty tip every time. For those not giving them a good review, give them another shot. They never disappointed me and I have been there over 30 different times.
